text: Love the location and vibe here. There is a great space to relax, meet up with friends or just enjoy some healthy food and drinks. I tried the Violet Wave. It was a great smoothie, however the prices are really high at $7.50. I've lived in many juice friendly cities that have organic fresh juices and smoothies and this is by far the most expensive place I've tried. I'm not sure my wallet can handle frequent visits but for a splurge once in awhile, I'll  definitely come back.

It was our first time, and we had NO IDEA that it was a "betta have a reservation" place! But, Deirdre, who we found out later was the manager, found us a table for FOUR! She, Kevin, & ALL the servers were FANTABULOUS!! We had SOO much fun pickin appetizers & drinks & the place was just buzzin with HAPPY! The food was AWESOME, even tho we'd never had many things on the menu, like Crispy Brussel Sprouts, Yellow Beet salad, & Pate'! The stuff we were used to like raw/fried/baked oysters, & crisped french baguette sliced was PERFECT! Oyster ACTUALLY tasted like OYSTERS...even the FRIED ones (they & the raw ones are part of Happy Hour fare, along with half priced cocktails & wine)! I kno this is LONG but it's worth EVERY WORD! I'd recommend this place to EVERYONE, from locals to tourists! THANK U guys for makin us feel SOO at home!

I guess I should be glad Brandon has a decent local bar and grill with decent food but dad gum it guys, could you at least act like you give a shit. Worst customer service ever. I keep going back because of the grouper sandwich but I suspect Shells sells them too so next time I get a craving I think I will give them a try. Stay tuned.

No, no, no, no.....just no. My friend and I ordered the fried oysters, seafood gumbo, crawfish pasta and the soft-shelled crab to share. We ate as much as we could, left the restaurant full and satisfied, but then spent the rest of the night sick. Very sick. Like stay-in-the-bathroom-for-hours sick. I am afraid that every time I think about fried seafood, I'll remember this experience and then promptly throw up. 

Other than the raging sickness that descended on our trip, the restaurant was just OK. Service was friendly but awkward (why did we have three servers?) and the food was good but nothing special. We certainly had better gumbo and seafood at other points in our trip (this was a pre-food poisoning opinion).

Best burger I've ever eaten...

I LOVE me a good burger and a good burger, in my definition, doesn't need to be all dressed up. It's all about the quality of meat and patty to bun ratio... And BBP nails it. From the simple crunch burger or gooey Sante Fe to onion rings and the fries, one can't go wrong!

So good!

I'm originally from Atlanta, GA and have eaten at Longhorn Steakhouses for years.  I was very excited when I found out that one was opening in Tucson even though it is 45 minutes from where I live.

So today I decided to try it out.  I went by myself for a late lunch (around 1:30).  Walked in a was immediately greeted but had to wait a few minutes because I didn't want to sit at the bar.  My server, Amanda, came over and asked for my drink order and I ordered water with extra lemon.  She brought it back shortly but with only one lemon slice and quickly disappeared before I could say anything.  A little later she came back for my food order and when I gave that to her I again asked for extra lemons. 

Then I went to the restroom and when I came back by table had been cleared - no water or silverware and wiped down.  Someone who worked there was near by and I told her that my table had been cleared.  She apologized and told me that my water was "right here".  Right here was a large, round table full of dirty glasses and silverware.  I just looked at her and she said "I'll go get you a new water".  While she was gone to get the water a hostess came up and asked me "did someone seat you here?".  I explained what happened and she said she just wanted to be sure since I didn't have a menu. 

When Amanda brought my salad to me I had to remind her (3rd time) that I was still waiting for my extra lemons.  Finally got them. 

While I was waiting for my food 3 people were seated in the booth next to me.  They had to wait for a server and when one finally came over to them they had questions.  The customers wanted to know about a sauce (not sure which one), the waiter starts to tell them what was in a sandwich.  When the customer said he wanted to know what was in the sauce and not the sandwich the waiter gave him a look of disgust and said "I'm telling you all I know",  looked at them again and then said "I'll be back to take your order" and walked off.  Amanda went to them sometime later and said that she would be their server because he became busy.  One of the other diners stated that she thought they might have scared him off and that he was snarly with them.  Amanda looked at them and said "you're not going to run me off, are you?"  I didn't think the either server was very nice to those diners.

Back to me, once my food arrived the fries were limp, very brown and lukewarm.  Flo's filet came out fine.  I ate my food and I think Amanda only checked back with me once.  Someone else (manager maybe, she didn't identify herself) came to clear the table and asked if I wanted a box for the fires that weren't good.  I told her no and that they weren't very good.  She apologized and asked if I'd like another side.  Hello - I'm through with my meal, offer me a desert or something but not another side.  Received the check shortly afterwards, paid and left.  BTW, the table with the dirty glasses and silverware that was next to me was dirty the whole time I was there.  There were two couples waiting to be seated even though there were empty tables.  I may give this Longhorn another try but more likely than not I'll go to Lil' Abners.

Began our weekend in town celebrating our engagement at this delightful Lebanese-cuisine hot spot in Fishtown. Attentive staff, great decor, ambiance and the food: amazing. Babaganoosh. Kebabs. Mmmmm. And the pitas? Wow. Puffy and thin as a wafer; so tasty we ate 3 between us. By-the-glass wine a little pricey, but all in all a good value meal. Once they figure out the parking situation in Fishtown, this restaurant (and every other eatery near there) will be heaving with custom, even more than now.

I have been coming to phamous cafe for over a year now and overall I can say they have good food and are pretty consistent. However, the past few experiences have been somewhat disappointing. The quality has not been consistent, the broth has been a bit oily and the last time I went the chicken was slimy and I got the feeling it was at least a few days old. All in all I would still recommend the restaurant to others but I wouldn't give them high expectations. The spring rolls are always great!!

With an entrance off the street and through the Kimpton's Hotel Monaco lobby, it's easy to find your way in.  A seat on the second floor gives a bit of a view towards Independence Hall.  Dark red weathered bricks and exposed rough looking wood beams lend an "old Philadelphia" air to the setting, but the food is purely modern.  

Corn and crab fried fritters get a bite from chipotle dipping sauce, but could use a bit less breaking, as the sweet corn and crab are a bit overpowered.  The BLT features Brie on brioche, with avocado optional for extra creaminess.  House green salad splits well if you're having apps and a lighter lunch.

Went to Culver's to try their burgers, I've heard so many raves about them. Maybe it's just me, but I don't get the smash burger fad. Ours were dry dry dry. Did I mention they were dry? I guess that's great for some but not me. Give me a juicy thick burger and I'll be happy. Not these hockey pucks.

After a long drive from North Carolina me and my six best friends decided to go to Arnolds for some southern comfort food. Greg didn't want to go but JB made him, because he is the boss of our friends. After a very short wait I tried the roast beef, with two sides. My sides were fried green tomatoes and mac 'n cheese. Every thing was amazing and all my friends were happy except for Greg. I love this place.
Always a quick win.  Good deals on soup/sandwich combos.  Great selection... though my wife always HATES when I sample pretty much all of them.  Hey, they offered! :-)

Whoa! If only I'd know this place was here sooner!! If you're staying near the airport this is the spot for easy but really delicious food! I ordered a harvest bowl, like a salad. Some guac, street corn, poblano queso, and the tres leches. There wasn't a thing I didn't love, SO yummy! I'm picky about fresh guac and this is as good as I make it at home! It was all so fresh and flavorful. Such a better option than driving all over Nashville!

Really, really good food at the deli and the bakery. That's where they seem to make all their money. You can't go wrong with a slice of pizza or any of the cold deli salads. The grocery part of the store is much less populated, and very expensive. But quite clean and organized! The one gripe I have about this place is the check out line. The place is always packed with people trying to buy lunch yet they seem to only have two check out lanes open. There's also no conveyor belt on which to set your groceries which congests the store even further. Lines form and people get agitated. This is enough of a reason for me to dread stopping in here when I have to pick something up quick!

We have been going for years after seeing it featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive In's, and Dash. They do brunch almost all day on Sunday and feature live blue grass music. The do bottomless mimosa for $12 and they a bunch of different types of juices, So many different, delicious options to get to eat! My favorites include the stoner and Chinese chicken salad. Everything is made fresh! They have a bunch of different side options including every flavor of hummus you can imagine. Definitely check this place out!!! I could see how people think it is insanitary, dogs are allowed inside. Service is a hit or miss
Went back since owner responded to my previous review.  Boba was great like before.  Tried grilled pork on rice noodle and it was good.  I do wish their sauce wasn't so watery.

I was staying at the Sheraton and was looking for a place within walking distance so I looked on Yelp and Chef Ron's popped up. 

The food was excellent. While I was eating Chef Ron himself came out and sad hi. I got the stuffed gumbo which is their mumbo gumbo with a piece of fried catfish on top. It was cajun perfect. For desert I got the bread pudding. It was to die for. If you ever go there make sure you finish your meal off with the bread pudding, you wont be dissapointed!

I have now come here twice and loved it. First time I split a French toast and and traditional eggs Benedict with my boyfriend. Both of us loved it. This time I just stopped for a mimosa and some mots sticks. Same server both times, she is very sweet and pleasant. 
Brought my dogs this time and the first thing that was brought out to me when I sat down was a dog bowl full of ice water. I am greatful for that.
Overall just a nice place to relax and enjoy your meal.
I would not recommend going here if you are in a super rush, but on the same note, if you are in a "rush" you should not be stopping at a restaurant to eat.

My family and I have been long time customers, but over the past year we've noticed a significant decrease in quality. At one time this was the best pizza in town. Not even close anymore. They've definitely sacrificed quality for quantity. And don't even think about placing a delivery order unless you want to wait 2 hours for a cold, soggy $25 medium-sized pizza. Okay option if you can dine in during the weekday, otherwise order elsewhere.

I love Wawa.  I got hooked on the one on New Jersey Ave in North Wildwood & it's been LOVE ever since.  

Wawas are clean, have great food & fast service.  They have ATMs, bathrooms & a lottery machine.  They all seem to do a lot of business and sometimes get a little crowded.  Since they are so busy, there are cars & people going in & out constantly. 

 Most of the smaller Wawas have small weird parking lots.  If I am going to one of these, I sometimes will park on the street further away, just to be free of the hassle.  

The larger Wawas that sell gas are also super busy.  One has to be extra careful and aware when moving about here.  I usually head to the back parking lot at this location if I am not buying gas.  It is a little less congested & more orderly back there.

Great Cuban food north of FL!

The camarones al ajillo (shrimp in garlic sauce) is wonderful - soak some of that delicious golden bread with the sauce and you'll be in heaven.

Fantastic ropa vieja, and the maduros are nice and sweet like they should be.

Friendly service, good beer list if a bit uninspired, but more than enough.

More than once I've found myself wanting to try a different place in New Hope but I pass by here and can't help myself.

Having stopped in for lunch, I want to update my previous review and offer the highest praise to their egg salad sandwich. With L/T on a rugged multigrain bread, it's hands down the best egg salad I've ever had. They have a nice style with every food item, nothing is taken for granted, just as they didn't do a routine egg salad. Yes, comes with the horse radishy potato salad, yum. Excellent coffee, semi-friendly baristas - what more could you want? As mentioned, I particularly like their potato salad, check it out, it comes with sandwiches but I believe you can also order it as a separate side order. Outdoor seating is a plus. Wifi and warm, quiet atmosphere (despite the many young kids that are brought in) make it not a bad place to get a little work done as well.
5 star based on the food solemnly . Otherwise the waiter sucked . The steak was amazing and juicy I didn't expect it to be so good . I couldn't have enough, everything was on point!
The space looks small but downstairs says otherwise! Got some crepes to start off my morning.

Service was excellent! The server answered all questions and was very polite. Never seemed frustrated or rushed. I ordered the pizza trying to be safe. She informed me about the spicy sausage that is also on the pizza. I was so glad she did because I cannot do spicy  she must have read my mind!   I loved the thin crust pizza. You could taste all the flavors plus the crust is delicious  

I was very very satisfied with my meal and will be back. Everyone in the group was happy!

FYI the individual pizza was enough for lunch and I was able to carry the rest home for dinner. 

The only downside was they don't have to go cups. I always take the rest of my soda to go.

Other than that it would be 5 stars!

Decided to stop here since we are visiting from Long Beach, CA. Service was amazing thanks to Ponce and our hostess Robriyion! We ordered the alligator and crawfish nachos and Rockefeller oysters ! We were told these were a must, but the whole menu is great! Would highly recommend, such a friendly atmosphere! Finishing up our visit with a Passion Punch!

Slightly better now with the new owners.  The lady at the register with the green/blue hair is the only polite one who works there. Everyone else needs to be trained/taught how to deal with the public. The health and beauty department is always about 90 degrees fahrenheit and I doubt that helps keep the products from spoiling/melting.

The last time I ate there, I was eating, when I suddenly heard the sound of nails being clipped. I looked over, and yep, the lady working at the cafe was standing right by the food trays, clipping her nails. When I told the owner bout it, he shrugged his shoulders and walked away to go back to stocking shelves. 

The cafe serves up flavorless slop and I cannot believe I gave it the benefit of the doubt on three occasions. I could not even eat most of it. (you are better off eating at Soy Cafe) The prepared food in the refrigerated section is okay, a hit or miss. I keep asking them where they moved their 'Awesome foods' brand items and they keep pointing at other foods that are clearly not the same brand. I tried the other brands and they are not as good as the Awesome Foods brand. I guess they no longer carry them. 

The juice bar attendants act as though I am torturing them when I place an order. No worries, there are LOTS of other juice bars in Philly, yes, even in my neighborhood (fish town)

Overall, their prices on most items are too high and I suspect that their employees are paid a low wage. I often see products on the shelves that are about to expire the next day and there is no discount on them. All of this is a recipe for going out of business.
I still go there to buy certain items, but do most of my shopping elsewhere.

Penn Herb Company is MUCH better, so is Whole Foods and several others.

yup! this place is legit. we ate here before a week long cruise. we ate here again about 9 days later. our server remembered us, asked about our cruise, and remembered how stressed we were the first time we ate there. food was amazing- everything is freshly prepared, service was perfect, and location was very convenient. love this place and highly recommend!

First time trying Burger Study while in town for a work trip. Casual setting to try some St Elmo's favorites. Service was great and quick for a large group during a busy lunch hour. Only downgrade was one order was messed up but, that wouldn't stop me from making another trip.

Waited in the drive thru line for 26 minutes and ended up having to drive off so I wouldn't be late for work. Awful. I was excited to live close to a Steak n Shake but after that experience, I am bummed that they would open up without having all their stuff figured out. I'd rather just drive to the one in Murfreesboro.

This is definitely one of the coolest, hippest places in Indy I've ever been. The outdoor seating was very beautiful and the overall ambiance of the place was hip and cool but also homey at the same time. The food was really really good. The bacon is more of a short rib and it was a highlight of my meal. Another thing that blew me out of the water was the biscuits. Wowza. Best biscuits ever. Period. 
The only reason I am not giving it a 5 was because of the unwillingness to take out a nonessential ingredient due to an allergy. The waffle is topped with pistachio butter, which I am allergic to, and when I asked for it on the side or not to be added they said they couldn't do it. I don't get why not. That was about the only disappointment.

Columbia needs a coffee house, but Mokka is NOT it.. The food is not good and expensive. I went a second time to get a coffee, now mind you it is maybe 4:30 on a Monday, I was told they were closed, period, no I'm sorry, nothing, some young girl that looked like she needed a shower was handling orders... Gross. I don't think I will be back, and it's walking distance from my house, very sad.

This was a great fund in downtown Indy.  My wife started with a glass from the their ample wine list and I explored their really cool bourbon selections. Now onto the rib eyes that had plenty of flavor and nice color.  If dining together, I suggest each person getting a different side as they don't do family style.  I asked for a wine recommendation to pair with the rib eye, expecting it would be the most expensive selection.. haha, the server suggested the zin.  It was fabulous.  We are generally 50/50 on having desert but based on the recommendation of the bread pudding we indulged.  Well worth the extra calories! The service was excellent and friendly.
The food was amazing and let's not talk about the margaritas! The service was good and a nice little spot to hang out near the beach....

Very very meh. 
 The interior of the place is cool looking but the food really sucks, too bad. The pretzels were fried but you can tell that they were microwaved as well. I ordered the sliders which were...meh. The bread was too thick for sliders. My wife ordered the berries and Gorgonzola salad with shrimp. She said that was very average at best and the shrimp weren't grilled but rather boiled or steamed and no seasoning whatsoever. We will not give this place a second chance.

Desperate for some coal fired pizza and was lucky to find Bricco! The two pizzas' crusts we ordered was just a tad bit over done for my liking (hence the 4stars) but tasted very good. Portions are great, the smaller size pizzas will be great for sharing and even the kids pizza is very generous. I loves the woodfired.wings and their ricotta fritters are worth coming back for really. The interious and service were great too! Definitely worth a visit this place.

Food is good. Or...was good. Tonight we went in for dinner. We've been to Eureka over 10 times, at least. The food is always good. Until tonight. My husband and I, taking advantage of their happy hour, ordered their nachos. We've had them before and they are yummy. But tonight, instead of cubed moist chicken they gave us soggy, shredded, crock-pot like chicken. Also, the nachos are supposed to come with beans. I counted the beans.......there were 7 total beans (I sent it back asking for more beans and my plate came back with MAYBE 12 beans). Flavor was lacking. My son ordered the corn dog pops. He loves their cheddar-IPA sauce. Our server did not tell us that the restaurant no longer made this sauce (despite us requesting two sides of it), and instead brought two sides of spicy mustard sauce (he's a little kid! What was the thinking there??). I have one other complaint that I have felt for awhile, that being that the service is T.E.R.R.I.B.L.E. Don't go in there expecting to get your drinks in a timely manner. You are lucky if you get them before your meal. And even more lucky if a server comes up to you to take your order at all.

I've made two trips to Brothers.  My first trip was to get a Po Boy because i heard they had the Previous owner's recipe (Patrick) and were still getting the bread from Leidenheimer's in New Orleans.  It is indeed the same Po Boy(which is by far the best poboy in Nashville), but I have to admit was a little disappointed to get a half for what I'm used to paying for a whole.  At least offer a whole for $20, I'd pay that for it.  My second trip was for a Burger, because when I was there the first time, the burgers did look fantastic.  I ordered a Jumpback Jack and my wife got the Fun Guy.  Both were excellent.  The combination of flavors on the Jumpback are about the best I've had in a long while.  While I've had some burgers at other places that I thought the actual meat was better (dry aged or wagyu).  The actual combination of toppings and meat really made it special.

POOR EXPERIENCE/NON-EXISTING SERVICE. We booked a reservation in advance on OpenTable and upon arriving was told my choice of seating was outside (64 degrees and windy) or at the sushi bar. There was an open table and I was told they were holding it for a reservation for 3 (which could have also been seated at the sushi bar.)   I was told a reservation only guarantees 'a seat' not a table and not even necessarily inside - crazy!

As a result, I do not anticipate returning or giving a favorable recommendation to try dining to this establishment.  With so many other great options in the Passyunk area there's no need to go here-- we dined at Noord close by which was our first choice anyway and it was fabulous!

Our first time headed to the livery! We had a reservation for 9pm and they sat us exactly at 9. The atmosphere was great, quiet enough to have a conversation at your table but still a great hip vibe. We ordered off the DevourIndy menu, getting a full 3 course meal for $20! For our first course we had chicken empanadas with guacamole, mushroom empanadas with jalapeño crema, and ceviche. We were very pleased to find the ceviche had shrimp in it, even though the menu did not state that. For our main course we ordered Paella. Our waitress did a great job of telling us that their Paella was a SPICY dish. And it was true to the warning, but amazing with all the different flavors and the fresh tastes. For dessert we had chocolate flan and churros, both great but it was a unanimous vote at our table for the churros in Carmel sauce. Overall it was an amazing experience with absolutely no complaints to be had!

My daughter made a reservation 3 weeks in advance and I clearly understand why, it's the best restaurant for service, wine selection, beer on tap, freshest ingredients and attention to detail detail and detail. 

Despite how busy they were we were never rushed and food suggestions were superb and the espresso service was the only problem, they didn't serve until I had my desserts and I wanted it with the desserts.

We chose the pre-fixe menu so it was so amazing to try 8 delicious appetizers. I really was full already but the main entrees were just as good. I've had better ribeye but I loved the Branzino with the red pepper paste. The olive oil garlic paste for the steak was amazing. 

The desserts are delicious and I can recall it was a melted cheese with rose water syrup but can't remember the name, it's intended for 2. Do order that. 

We had the top 5 mezzos but you must try the Fatteh, chickpeas in the brown butter with cashews  and almonds was my favorite. I also loved the other mezzas like samke nayyeh with raw yellow tail and fried kibbeh (because my husband wanted some meat)

I almost forgot to mention but I was impressed with the beer on tap called Kronenbourg Blanc (I can't drink wine) really nice fruity blend.
We decided to try somewhere new, we stopped and were pleasantly surprised, Excellent service , no issues with food, will return

After seeing their 'breakfast in a cup' online I just had to stop in.  It's a charming café/bar where locals and tourists converge for quick meals, a place to work on laptops, read or people watch.  The staff is very welcoming and easy to talk to.   
 
Breakfast in a cup is a disposable coffee cup with food layered inside grits, hash browns, sausage and gravy, eggs and bacon.  Since the grits are on the bottom it's very hot to hold, but it's really good.  After stopping there the first day of my trip I stopped here almost every day for coffee and/or breakfast in a cup.  The building was clean every day and the coffee station (utensils, sugar, milk, etc) was always stocked.  They have local artwork hanging on the wall above the coffee station.    The bathroom is in the back counter - the sign is slightly hidden.
Had a great meal there last night! Our server Patricia did a great job! Highly recommend this to anyone! Very good food and great service!

Food was so so nothing great for the price. I would recommend not eating here unless your stuck at the hotel. Paid about 20 bucks for a burger that was nothing special and left me running for the bathroom
With 3 tables full on a Thursday evening it took over an hour to get pancakes and eggs. I've never been to a worse IHOP
Love the food and the presentation. A little on the pricey side. Our waitress was excellent. Can't wait to go back!

Just a heads up guys, a few friends and I stopped in there today (4-23-15) for the happy hour special of $3 craft bottles and paid with my debit card. That was the good part, the bad part is if you use a debit card for your purchase they will put at $100 hold on your account. Yes, you read that right folks they will hold $100 of your money if you choose to pay by debit/credit and they do not notify you of this. So beware, and pay with cash if you plan on going. Oh, and the flat breads are slightly better then ellios pizza.

This food is awesome and both herbivores and carnivores will LOVE this place I guarantee it!  Make sure to try the sweet potato fries - they are so delicious!   Also, the banana whip makes an awesome, delicious and guilt free dessert!

I really enjoy this awesome donut place on magazine street, mostly because of their selections that have NOTHING to do with donuts! The sliders are delicious yet expensive. My favorite is fried chicken with pickled sweet jalepeño, sweet spicy slaw, and a fried piece of chicken skin to top it off! They also serve some fantastic coffee. They run different specials on sliders and donuts that change daily, so you never know what you are going to find when you walk in. They do have certain staple dishes (like the chicken and the burger sliders)

Eaters beware: the line on weekend mornings is about 30 people long, so make sure to call ahead so you can cut the entire line and get your stuff right away! 

This spot is cool, hip, progressive, and laid back. Make sure to head in if you're in the neighborhood.

Friendly staff, and actually quite knowledgeable about French pastries. Pastries have all been awesome and it smells great. My only nag is the coffee mugs are square shape with a big lip on them and it makes it hard to not drip when you have a sip. Looks cool it's just not that functional
Really good food and sweet treats.  Coffee was great.  Just be prepared to wait in line, a very long line.

I first found this spot by searching yelp for good places to study when I first moved to Philly. I cannot believe I have yet to write a review for it.

They have PLENTY of big tables (and lots of little ones) in the big main room and also some additional seating in a smaller adjoining room. The back patio is a nice place to hang if you don't need an outlet. The staff is super friendly and do a great job with any order!

The drinks are pretty good - my favorite being a vanilla dirty chai with almond milk. They also have a bottomless cup of coffee deal for $3 - perfect for an all hours study binge! The food is decent - nothing fancy, but it's fresh and they have gluten-free bread that they'll substitute for any bagel. I like the Rox out with your Lox Out (open face) sandwich and the Garden Griller, but I mostly just eat here when I'm pulling a long study session and don't want to go home in the middle. 

The music they play is pretty chill and usually my style, but you can easily put on headphones if you're feeling something else. 

It can get crowded sometimes and harder to find a big table, but something usually frees up eventually!

I would recommend it for studying, grabbing a coffee with a friend, or even a first date (I've eavesdropped on a some hilarious blind dates here).

We had a 30th birthday celebration at Luke's and they devinatley delivered! The food was great, the atmospher was great, and the waitress we had (Christin) was amazing!! Next time I'm in NOLA, I will make sure to go back! 
If you're looking for a nice place to eat, but also have fun - PLEASE go to Luke and ask for Christin to be your waitress!

I can't give this place a one star since it's still my kids' fav place. It's just the service... The past 3 times we have gone to this place the waiter/waitress skip us. They take orders and bring drinks to the tables that come after us. It seems like they have no sense of organization. Tonight I decided to talk to the manager and all she did was give me the excuse of them being too busy and having poor quality of workers.. Well, how about management, how about leaving poor excuses on the side and take care of the situation... If it happens once it's fine, but all the time with different employees... I don't know.. something isn't right.

This restaurant used to be good, but it has gone really really far downhill. The food tasted like they are serving semi-spoiled food that may have been cooked hours or days before. I actually feel physically ill and I think the health department should check this place out. My brothers food was dripping with orange grease, it was an omelet. I ordered the Toad in the Hole sandwich, which I used to love, and I had to take off the tomatoes and avocado. The tomatoes had white spots all over them and were yellow in the middle; they looked like they were maybe a day from being rotten, if not already. The avocado was covered in brown- grey spots. I honestly wanted to throw up after eating it. All in all, I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. I don't know how it has managed to stay in business this long, and it does not deserve to stay in business. Next time you want to eat out, go somewhere else instead.
The food was pretty bad.  Black bean taco salad was just that.  Canned black beans with almost nothing else.  Chili was made with really fatty beef.  Disappointing.
There were two of us. Ordered Chicken Makhani and Palak Paneer. Both dishes were excellent and reasonably priced. The service was also good. Nothing not to like. Will definitely be going back.

Not only delicious steaks, but excellent customer service. My wife had ordered Aussie fries and thought she was getting some doctored up fries with cheese. When regular plain fries were delivered, she mentioned it, but did not demand a replacement. After the more than courteous server Jordan inquired several times, my wife said it was her mistake and no problem. Minutes later, the manager Jessica arrived with an order of cheese fries. How unexpected and customer service oriented. Great gesture Jessica. You just earned a customer that usually goes to the Fishhawk location which is about the same distance. I had the Mouth watering Victoria filet and broiled lobster tail with a side baked potato and Caesar salad. All were cooked to perfection and would highly recommend. Happy hour till 7pm  is nice and the IPA on tap was earthy without a bitter after taste. The strawberry shortcake was scrumptious. Jordan was very upbeat and arrived at the table during the right times.

Rich City is the best Chinese food I've had in the area here!  Yes, being it's so good they do get very busy and I've learned over the years to figure in 45 minutes to an hour for them to deliver especially on rainy or inclement weather nights.  If other people love their food just like I do then yes, of course Rich City would get busy and that's a good thing if you ask me.  The food is always great and I love the steamed chicken with mixed vegetable and the sweet and sour chicken is amazing too!  Oh, and the pizza rolls are the best... It's worth the wait!
a gem! loved the café con chocolate as well as the chilaquiles when i went there for a sunday brunch. mad friendly staff and comfortable vibes

Great place to bring your friends from out of town. 

Super positive vibes. Great food. A little pricey, but the over all experience was quite nice. 

One of the best parts, especially considering it's winter, was that we had the ability to check our coats from our table. 

I would suggest sharing, mixing, and matching smaller dishes; you get to taste all the flavors while still filling that belly that so desperately growls.

Greek restaurant on the south side of Edmonton.  Nice decore feels like one of the restaurants we went to in Santorini. Low ceilings with Vines across the ceiling.  Food is expensive.  No bread or anything to munch on while waiting for your food unfortunately.  Drinks pricy. Individual lamb skewers were bland at $12 each!  Large portions for pistacho but not up to fine dining standards for $25. Many entrees were $35.   I found the wood chairs very uncomfortable with little padding.  I am slim but they didn't fit my derrière.  Nice outdoor patio.  Staff were very attentive and very polite.

I actually had to come here twice in order to their delicious shrimp poboys. The first time was around 11:30pm on a Saturday night, but they had ran out of bread for the night. We decided to try again the next day for lunch and was able to order a shrimp poboy.

It took them about 20-30 minutes to make 10 orders of shrimp poboys, but that meant it was a perfect time to grab a frozen irish coffee from the bar. 

The shrimp poboys reminded me of vietnamese sandwiches. Same type of bread with lots of veggies, but the key ingredient is the fresh shrimp. Every time I've had shrimp poboys, the shrimp has always been fried, but this time I was pleasantly surprised to see the shrimp without batter. 

The sandwich was quite delicious although quite expensive at $14.
I'm from NY and this is the best pizza I've ever had. Crust is great. Old school fresh ingredients. The way pizza should be. Fantastic!

So much YUM. I absolutely love to dine at Convivio (both locations, but the Carmel location is so close to my home, it's my favorite!). The pasta is homemade and so delicious. I tend not to eat a lot of pasta, but it is so darn good here, it isn't too be missed. Yet, I would say the same for the pizza.  It's so good.
My favorite dish is the Pasta Putenesca.  Highly recommend and not to be missed. Atmosphere is good. I wish the bar area was bigger.  It's always busy.

This was one of the first resturants ive tried in philadelphia.  One b/c i am asian and two b/c im a great fan of malaysian food.  I loved their food and i would consider it one of the most authentic asian place in philadelphia ( or at least to my taste and understanding).  I loved their roti canai, asam laksa, chicken and rice and prawn mee. I havent tired everything on the menu but im sure i would love everything.  =) great place to go to and not tooo expensive. true gem in philadelphia.

Hilton advertises trail rides at this resort. The trail rides were run by Pot a Gold adventures. More like Pot o Crap. 
We were charged $80 per person for a sunset trail ride. When we arrived as instructed at 4pm there  was only one woman there , she had her retainer out on the table, was eating pizza, and had a pack of cigarettes next to her food, and the staff for the ride wasn't even there yet. We waited almost 20 minutes.
The smell was overwhelming. The horses were filthy, to be honest. They were caked with dirt and feces and their manes were matted. 
Our ride started at 4:40 and ended at 5:15. The sun was directly overhead and it was no where close to sunset. So, basically were charged for an hour sunset ride that was about 35 minutes and not at sunset.the "sunset" ride was $20 more PER PERSON than the one hour trail ride. The manager I emailed said they can't have the horses out at sunset because they get spooked and also because they need to eat. Ummmm, fine, but then don't call it a sunset ride and charge more for it. They refused to refund the extra money they charged for the "sunset" ride, and were very rude about it. 
The horses were not well behaved and my husbands horse just walked off the trail to go back to the stable , the guide said he wanted to eat. The "trail", by the way, is a patch of grass and cacti next to the highway. It was awful. Not at all what was advertised. Will be reporting to BBB for false advertising by Hilton and Pot a Gold adventures.
Beautiful view from the balcony, attentive wait staff, and excellent food.  I had the cucumber salad and ricotta gnocchi with mushrooms.  Absolutely perfect.

What are some other reviewers talking about when suggesting that...  The portions are too small?  Truly insane.  We ordered the rabbit ragout and were shocked at how large the portion was for a "small plate".  The same goes for all the plates we ordered.  The cocktails were inventive...loved the seelbach and the dark and stormy although the amexica had a few too many bold flavors to work for me (drank it though didn't I?).   The chicken liver pâté was phenomenal!  Duck breast was cooked very well!  The mussels were quite tasty but a little lacking in salt for my taste.  Four solid stars. Looking forward to my next visit.

Amazing!!

The ambience and decoration are truly well done. The food from the bread to desert was amazing. We also had drinks which were amazing too. Would recommend the hamachi, beef duo and beet salad. The coconut tres leche desert was amazing! Great service too, our server took such good care of us!

The breakfast here was not anything too brag about, BUT I loved the atmosphere! I always come here to study and I would consider it to be better than B&N because it's so quiet there. I love the triple berry cake that they have. It is beyond words. The fruits on top tastes fresh and the cake itself is so moist. the only thing about Parrot Pete that I don't really like is the high prices. They a trip with those pricing!!

I went there with my family on a Groupon... if I hadn't had the discount, I would've been fuming.  Even with that, I would never go here again.  Similar to many other on here, we sat down to a partially-set table and waited 40+ minutes for mediocre to completely sub-par food.   They do not have chai (my favorite part of any Indian restaurant) and they waited until AFTER two of us had ordered lamb dishes to tell us that they did not have any lamb in the restaurant.  That sucks, but tell us that when we sit down so we don't waste time deciding which lamb dish to order!  My mom hates spicy food and ordered a mild chicken dish.  I love spicy and ordered a medium chicken dish.  We had to switch.  Hers made my eyes water and mine was bland.  The food itself was completely bizarre... none of it had any sauce.  Hers was a really dry biryani.  Mine was some kind of weird chicken sausage, which consisted of about 8 slices on a bed of iceberg lettuce.  Totally blah - I've had better Indian from a MALL.  Super disappointing and ridiculously overpriced for what you get.

When the oysters came they were small, but wow were they sweet and full of favor, good choice. The head cheese was excellent as was the seafood gumbo, then came the mussel. When they pick up the lid off the dish, there must have been 50 in there, or it seemed so. I could hardly finish the dish and what tastes. It was reasonable for what we got, but what a steal as far as flavor. A must do when in NO

Went back the next morning and "wow" what a completely different level of service!  First, the no-smile hostess was not working on the second day, but rather a very pleasant and happy person.  We were told the wait was about 20 minutes.  I thought impossible with the number of people waiting.  So, we walked down to CVS and came back in 20 minutes.  Our name had already been called, denoted with a question mark on the wait list page, and scratched out.  The happy hostess said she'd seat us next.  And she did.  And we got Lauren again!  And she recognized us!!!  We ordered and waited just a short while for our breakfast.  It was an amazing thing to watch the kitchen pump out meals for their guests.  They were awesome.  We got our food and once again it was delicious.  I love, love, love Another Broken Egg Cafe!  Visit here, eat here, enjoy life here.  5 stars all the way (as long as the no-smile, unhappy hostess isn't working).

Absolutely delicious food. Everything we've ordered has been incredible. The chicken 65 appetizer is a different taste than I'm used to having at an Indian food place, but it was outstanding. All the traditional dishes are very flavorful and can be made to suit your spice level. The service is friendly and attentive. Can't go wrong!

If you are looking for that completely nourished in the stomach and the heart feeling, try a bibimbop from Bab Cafe. The food is clean, delicious, and has all the nutrition you need! It's great for takeout, or hang out in the trendy restaurant! Make sure you stir it up more than you think you need to! And keep sipping that miso soup! It's such an amazing combination. And because there are so many options and combinations, the revisit value for this place is high. Vegan, vegetarian, and kosher people can eat here and have a great time with their friends without judgement!
This isn't your run of the mill BBQ joint, incredible selection of fresh meat and seafood. Do yourself a favor and try the filet mignon sandwich.

Instead of waiting 45 mins for a table at another fairly new bar in town across the street, I gave Ole Red a shot with only a 20 min wait.  Once my table was ready, I was told to walk across the room to the stairway and walk up a flight of stairs to be greeted by another hostess that would show me to my table.  The table they offered me was in the corner away from the live entertainment that was playing on the main stage downstairs.  I denied their table and found a spot at the bar on the same level that was not crowded.  I ordered a drink and sat back to relax to the sound of the band playing cover songs.  I thought the red tractor hanging upside down added a neat touch to the atmosphere inside the bar.  The drink I ordered was smooth and easy.  I just wished the band would have mixed it up with their own songs along with singing cover songs.
Not too good last night. Seaweed salad overly sweet and a tad old. Yakisoba had over cooked veggies.Sushi was terrific. Usually much better so I'll go for three stars in hopes it was a fluke.

We moved down here from New York and have been looking for a nice coffee shop in the area. After one year of no luck, we are so thrilled we finally have a nice cute coffee shop in town. What's even better is that the coffee is really good. The ice coffee is cold brewed (the owner should call it out by the way!) and the croissant is just great. At the end of the day, how can you beat great food at good price? The owner is very friendly and I love her risk taking entrepreneurial spirit and story. She also provides free wifi. I hope this place can eventually become those places where you can come in with your laptop and work for half an hour with a cup of great coffee. P.S. If you think her coffee is great, don't forget to tell her that! She took the effort to get coffee beans from Italy!

I was a little disappointing with Rippy's to say the least.  The atmosphere was amazing I love the open bar and the roof top dining. I think our mistake was coming here excepting  a nice sit down meal. Rippy's is great for after work drinks or a quick dinner, but if your coming in from out of town and want to enjoy a nice meal I would suggest another place. The plastic cups and Paper plates were a huge turnoff epically for the price we paid

The Food was ok we had the nachos with pulled chicken, I believe they would have been better if they weren't served Luke warm. I had the 1/2 rack of ribs, and usually I am not a fan of dry bbq or bbq where you have to apply your own sauce but these were good. The meat was tender and smokey and fell right off the bone. The sweet tea could have been better.  My overall opinion is that the food was tasty and the atmosphere great but that does not equal a good restaurant. I would def try if your in downtown Nashville its a def must experience. I personally would just get an appetizer and drinks.

Love, love, love McAllister's Deli.  The service is great, the managers are awesome.  My son loves eating here.  And I love that we get to have a good time over a huge plate of Nachos.  If you love Nachos and chili you will not be disappointed with the Ultimate Nachos, we sure aren't.  Only thing we don't like is that I no longer work in the area so we can't go as often as we would like.  But even with that said we manage to still frequent the place.  (Hey, when your pre-teen son offers to go to work with you during the summer break just so that they can have a chance to go to McAllister's Deli for lunch you know they are doing something right; plus it beats burgers and fries any day of the week.

Fried pickles were shitty! More like a big basket of fried breading and grease. The salad was simply lettuce on a plate with dressing. Service was fair at best. The kitchen appeared dirty from walking past on the way to the bathroom. Very loud place. Drove behind the place only to find a huge pile of trash and boxes out the back door and the door wide open for bugs to fly in while 3 kitchen guys were sitting outside smoking.  Not impressed don't waste your money!  Plenty of other options close by

I skipped breakfast in anticipation of eating a decent brunch at Valerio. Bad idea. Ordered the quiche at 12:45 PM and was told that even though they had just run out, they would have another ready to serve in 1 hour tops. I waited until 2:15 PM until I walked up to the counter to politely inquire about the status of my quiche, as I was starving. Got a cold look and a "Actually, it'll be 45 more minutes because we still have to cool it." Fine. Waited until 3. Still nothing. 
The weirdest part was that they had ALREADY charged my card for the quiche. Before I could ask for a refund so I could purchase something else, she rudely snapped "you can keep coming up to the counter if it makes you feel better, but I just can't cut the quiche right now." I was so shocked that I just said okay, honestly was a little frightened off. When it was finally made (2.5 hours later), it was essentially 4 bites of a veggie omelet with no crust. It would've been nice to hear a "sorry about the extended wait" instead of getting attitude. 
It's totally fine if it takes you 2-3 hours to make that. Just don't lie to your customers in order to get them to buy things. And don't be insanely rude about it?

Also worth noting - the wifi here doesn't work if there are lots of people

Yum! I had lunch here with some coworkers, and it was delicious. I'm a fan of the rolls, and the fried chicken was just right. The mashed potatoes were creamy and smooth, and the pineapple casserole was an unusual hit with me that reminded me of pineapple upside down cake. It served as dessert with its sweet taste.

While I had never heard of Barbara's, the atmosphere was interesting and homey. I felt like I was sitting down for a bite to eat at my grandmother's house. Service was friendly although not particularly fast, and photos of famous people who have visited line the wall behind the cash register. Actually, it sort of reminded me of the Loveless Cafe with better rolls.

Fan of the baked Mac and Cheese, it was delicious, comes baked in a crock served nice and hot.  Great hang out for apps and drinks with 3 levels to hang out in! Classic atmosphere, lots of history in this old building. Great downtown location.

If you've barely travelled anywhere.  Lived in the same town your whole life.  Only place you've ever vacationed was an amusement park or Disneyworld.  Best restaurant you like to eat at is McDonald's, this is the place for you.   If you have more experience with anything better than what was mentioned, avoid this place, it's nothing more than one step up from Chuckle Cheese.

Refined environment. BBQ shrimp are DELICIOUS. Warning: skip the bread pudding. It was lukewarm, the sauce was cold. The waitress said they couldn't heat it because it was a cream sauce. The best bread pudding is at a restaurant called The French Market Restaurant and Bar. It's only a mile away in Decatur.

We ate here a couple of months ago.... had a burrito with their homemade salsa.  I've never had a breakfast burrito I didn't care for until I ate this one.  It was so salty, neither me or my husband could eat it (and my husband likes salt!).  When I mentioned it to the waitress, she said she had several other customers say the same thing...  She then went back to the kitchen to inquire about it and then informed us that this is how it is supposed to taste, so it must just be our taste buds.  She was nice about it, so we don't blame her.  The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because their banana pancakes were pretty tasty.  Just wish they would have handled our complaint differently.

Honestly one of my top picks for breakfast, the people who work here and the owner/manager are just outstanding fantastic folks! The food is great, pretty much no matter what you order. Their ice coffees will get you where you need to go without being overpowering. Best bacon in the city.

I was visiting in town and decided to stop in for lunch. I noted upon entering the Resturant was full and everyone was enjoying their meal.  We were a party of three. We were seated very quickly. Our drink orders were taken and brought back quickly. I ordered Big Mikes BLT. My husband ordered Bacon Mushroom Swiss Burger and our guest ordered  a Western Omelet. My food was good it was served with onion rings which looked better than they tasted, they were somewhat soggy but the BLT was Great. My husbands burger was delicious it was served with fresh fries which were also good. We each had a salad that was just ok. Nothing much but lettuce. Our guest said her omelet was very good but I noted her toast was somewhat burnt. Our drinks were replenished quickly and are waiter was excellent. All staff were busy and friendly. Will eat here again for breakfast. Breakfast is served all day. A little pricy.

The places has changed owners several months back and its mediocre.  The coffee was way to bitter and the owner was just not very friendly. He was mad about everything and my curry chicken was so wet it made the bread soogy. It was just not a good experience and not worth the effort.

I used to really enjoy this place...before the high class makeover. Now they're just too good for their own good. 

We stopped by today for brunch on our way to McCall. I ordered some coffee (drip) and a slice of quiche. The coffee handed to me was luke-warm. The quiche was not even luke-warm...yet they asked me if I wanted it "heated"..."Yes, please."

To top it off, we changed our mind and ended up on the outdoor patio in spite of the fact that we ordered our food to go. They made a point to tell us "the patio is for full service customers." OK, I guess the 10% tip I left them for handing me a box wasn't good enough for the patio?

Still, I'll give them 2 stars for their location and patio. You'll just have to endure the food to get to the good stuff.

This was one of our stops during the Eat St Pete food tour.  Wow!!!  The food is so freaking fresh!    The spicy tuna basically melted in my mouth.

And HEATHER is amazing!  I loved her energy and how well she explained the history of the restaurant, paintings and where the fresh food is flown in from.

We live in the area and plan on coming back many more times!

Visiting our favorite Tucson Airbnb and this came up on Yelp.  It was wife's birthday and she wanted to give it a try.  Glad we did!  She had the chicken salad on sourdough and I had the bbq with slaw sandwich which is grilled.  .  Bread is made on site as are most of the ingredients.  Also the kettle chips.  
Do yourself a big favor.  Stop reading this review, get in your car , go there, enjoy.  Your mouth will thank you!

The customer service was good. The restaurant is clean. The portions that you receive for the price that you are charged does not work.  The portions are small. Also, the food lacks seasoning for it to be considered a "soul food" restaurant.

Love the decor and food at this place. From the French toast to the eggs everything rocked. Staff is friendly and served the food quickly. I was shocked when I got the bill and saw how cheap it was. Definitely a Tucson gem.

Tony's has a new location and we wanted to try it.  Meet friends there Tuesday afternoon around 4:30, got seated right away.  Our server Meka was prompt in getting our drinks orders. There is a new menu and I really like it.  Not too wordy and overloaded.  They kept many of the favorite entrees.  I had the shrimp scampi,  had about 10 nice sized shrimp on a bed of linguini.  It eased delicious,  linguini cooked just right and shrimp tender.  Had a salad and steak fries as my side.  Salad wad loaded with dressing.  Hubby had the 12 oz pepperloin with baked potato and salad.  He said the steak was good.  We'll be back.
I have never enjoyed the food here and there's always problems with my order. Not sure what all the hype is about.

I came to visit family for the holidays. I always make sure I stop into Eegee's everytime I am there. I love their sandwiches and of course the ranch fries. I look forward coming here even if it's only once a year.

Food is always excellent tasting and very well presented. Service has always been very good. Two guys always stand out for us: Branden has been our server or assisted on numerous occasions and has always treated us outstanding being courteous and polite. Juan though slightly robotic in his mannerisms has always been extremely helpful getting us anything we need with no hesitation and very quick to clear off tables.

It was no where near as good as we were expecting. It was really cool that we could order ahead of time to save time. However, the fries were tasteless, the milk shakes were so thin, they treated like chocolate milk. ..with a root beer after taste. ...was very odd. I posted the bbq bacon chicken burger. Super greasy. Not to mention the order was Ali wrong.  I just wanted bbq sauce, bacon and crispy chicken. I got bbq sauce, pickles, cheese, unions and grilled chicken. 

I think we will go to five guys next time.

In a word, delicious. Fantastic view, nice wine list.
The seared scallops were insanely good, as was the calamari and the conch fritters ( which I selfishly ate for lunch and still had plenty to share) all of the sandwiches looked amazing and according to my fellow diners they were. Best of all though, I swear the key lime pie was THE BEST I've had in my entire life and I've had lots of pie.
Such a beautiful elegantly themed Thai restaurant. One of the best in the Nashville/Antioch area.
Tried PANA for the first time today and WOW, they are GREAT!!!  They're not heavy and greasy like some donut shops. Definitely deserve 5 stars, if not more!!!  Will be back for sure!

Tried ordering craft beers but server had no clue about beer . Told us the beer menu was old and some beers weren't available. Took forever to get first round . We got our appetizers but had no silverware. Wedge salad was good . Wings were good . Don't order the Italian flat bread , the picture is a lie . There were very very few toppings and for the price . I was offended. Food was ok . Service was poor . Don't believe pictures on yelp , they are professionally doctored.
If you want to listen to a 50 year old bum sexually harassing his employees this is where you should go.  Ask for Billy, he'll talk down to any women in there.

We went on a Sunday morning for breakfast. Our waiter was Mario, he was great and always had our tea filled. Carne Machaca burrito was delicious and my partner had Carne Asada burrito it too was very tasty. Their salsa is flavorful with a kick which I love. Would be nice if their burritos came with side of beans and rice (burrito by itself is not very presentable) also wouldn't hurt to put sauce and cheese on burrito (not just tortilla). Overall we were pleased so we will be back.

Right to it: The Yelp Indy International Supper Club rolled in 26 deep for a full dinner on a Wednesday night at 7. Over in the other corner was a party of 10. I was blown away by Peter & Co.'s service.

This was my first sit down, full meal at Saigon. Expectations: High. Reality: Really High. 

This place is exactly why I travel. Nearly every city in America probably has something similar -- a strip mall tucked away in a unsuspecting area -- that is thriving with authenticity. Especially here, the Banh Mi & Pho! 

Now... that's not all they have... their menu is, well, how do I say it, um... HUGE!

From lemongrass beef wraps to catfish in a clay pot. I went with the finest soup & sandwich of my life: bbq pork banh mi & Pho Special of flank steak, beef brisket, beef meatballs and tripe in classic Pho fashion. 

My first visit I thought I was eating bbq beef banh mi, I was incorrect -- it's some stellar bbq pork that is spot on.

The bean sprout & fresh basil side plate with the pho was a supreme touch. 

The service was pretty remarkable considering he's serving a party of 26 in a restaurant that seats about 40 at most. Um, the Yelp Supper Club came through -- big time here. At the other end of the table, I salivated, and salivated, for the Vietnamese Coffee that Jessica  & Rodney were having. My lord, I have to return midday before my coffee cut off time of 3pm. 

And then, something historic happened. There it was, the banh mi bbq pork (re: photo)... it sat there with it's open profile of pork, cilantro, cucumber, carrots & jalapeno on a french roll; she just couldn't resist. She, whom is anti-pork as my Inner Rabbi, my LP, took her first banh mi bite, and I have a Sakijewa golden dollar on it that she'll return for more!

As will I!

Note: Amazingly classy touch of the sides of beer six packs cut out and taped above each booth in a row to display what beers are offered (which includes 3 Viet beers!)
Great lunch on the patio here today, delicious chicken tortas and salads.  Excellent service too.  There is clearly a first-rate chef in the kitchen.

Walked in for dinner with my girlfriend on a whim. I had read up on Maynard's here on Yelp, so I knew to avoid sitting on the patio. Apparently this wasn't even an issue as all the tables had been booked and the only available space was at the bar. This suited me just fine since a not-so-secret restaurant tip is that sitting at the bar almost always guarantees good service.

True to that truism, the bartender treated us great. Mixed up an Old Fashioned for me and seemed proud to do it right. I wish I had known about their reputation for good cocktails as I'd love to try more of them. I guess I'll have to go back soon.

My girlfriend got the bouillabaisse which was pretty tasty and she seemed to really enjoy it (I've had better but I'm not holding that against them or anything).

I got the cassoulet which was easily one of the richest things I have ever eaten. It's one of those dishes that is so good you know you'll be burping it up all night with a pang of regret but you cannot stop eating it because it's just so unbelievably rich and delicious. The only thing I didn't like about it was the house-made sausage that came with it. It was like a light liver sausage that I'm sure would have pleased a palate more accustomed to it, but I could have done without it.

All told, the food rated between very good and excellent, the drinks were well done, we were treated well by the bartender, and I really enjoyed the ambiance and architecture. I will certainly return.

Oh, Billy Bob's, I really wanted you to be more than three stars.

When I went here for lunch today, I was pretty excited.  I had been looking forward to checking this place out since it had opened a few months ago.  I like BBQ and sandwiches (although I'm no BBQ aficionado) and I went in with an open mind.

As soon as I walked in, my friend and I were greeted by the manager and were immediately seated.  We then met our server who was extremely friendly, attentive, and helpful.

For an app we ordered the fried pickles which came with ranch dressing and another dipping sauce.  They were really good and got me excited for the meal.

I ordered the hamburger, only because I wasn't in the mood for a huge meal and my friend ordered the brisket.  I got an order of mac and cheese as my side.  When my burger came, it was dressed pretty basically with lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles.  The burgers aren't cooked to order, and the one I had was pretty dry and over cooked.  It wasn't juicy at all and I didn't even finish it.  The mac and cheese was good, but it wasn't overly spectacular.  My friend ordered potato salad with the brisket, which I tried, and could tell that it was likely store bought (which isn't horrible, but I've had better).

All in all, the place was a solid three stars.  The staff was amazing, the atmosphere is nice and the food came quickly.  I was sad to see that there weren't more people in here.  I really am rooting for this place, especially because I think the Westbank needs an "authentic" BBQ place.

We ordered the Creole Trio and a 1/2 oyster 1/2 shrimp po boy to split. The trio had red beans and rice, gumbo, and jambalaya. The gumbo was my favorite. It was loaded with sausage. The jambalaya was flavorful, but the rice was too mushy. I liked the beans, but prefer them creamier. That is a personal preference so I don't hold that against them. 

The po boy had enough shrimp, but only three small fried oysters. I know the price of oysters has gone up. The first oyster po boy we had during our trip was also lacking in the oyster department AND they added a $2 up charge. At least Desire did not have an up charge. 

Our server was quick and friendly. 

They have decent beers on tap. 

It was a quick place to stop and was pretty good. 3 1/2 stars.

Came to check out mole y abuela with my family, we had an amazing experience. Abby and Tayla were super helpful with recommending cocktails for us. Would definitely recommend checking out this spot for a late afternoon drink! P.S get mango white claw.

Very tasty Sichuan place near Trenton. Their specialty is Sichuan style fried soft-shell crab. It comes to the table wrapped in foil along with veggies and herbs. Underneath the foil is some wax or other material that they light on fire with a lighter to finish it off so it is at peak taste when the foil is pulled back and the amazing aromas greet you. And then when you bite in deep, the taste is full and juicy.
Everyone is very nice and the drinks are very good!! Would recommend there nachos and salmon salad

Loved this burger place! We came here shortly after opening and the staff were very friendly. We ordered the nachos which were amazing and easily fed the three of us. For entrees my mom and sister split a salad and shared the slider combo. The salad was fresh and crisp and the sliders were cooked perfectly. I had the backyard burger and it was also delicious and cooked to my request. They have plenty of different burgers and other items to choose from so we will definitely be back to try it all!

Rarely do I ever regret eating. Out of five people eating, nobody was very excited about the food they received. On a positive note the bloody Mary was excellent.
Brunch, is not super difficult to cook. Maybe the dishwasher was the only one in the kitchen, and he had to prepare all the meals. If that's the case hi 5 dish guy.
I've had my share of vietnamese food as my close friend is vietnamese, this place gives me some of those vibes. We order here frequently since it's in walking distance. Our orders are always spot on.

The sushi here is pretty good... I can't remember exactly what I ordered since in addition to our sushi rolls we also down about 6 bottles of wine. Needless to say I had a great time here and thankfully I did take a picture of my rolls to help piece together the blurry evening. The servers were friendly and very attentive in the beginning of our meal, towards the end the service slowed down and we found ourselves sitting around waiting for our checks to come back. 

Jackson's doubles as a night club at night. I have never had a bad time here and I tend to find an older crowd here, which is refreshing in comparison to the 18 and up crowd at some other bars in the area. 

Jackson's also offers a pretty good brunch on the weekends. It's all you can eat stations for about $22-$35 a person (I can't remember exactly) and does not include drinks.  They have everything from sushi to carving stations to a chocolate fountain. My favorite part of dinning here during the day is sitting outside since the restaurant is located right on the water. This is a great place for a more upscale brunch. I think Jackson's could be a #1 brunch spot if they offered an 'all you can drink special' with brunch since this seems to be a very popular option right now.

I love spicy foods, and this place is satisfied my hunger for spiciness  I always ordered thai fried rice with extra chopped chilies with fish sauce!! I never tried their chinese and American menu, so I can't make any comments. Pork Larb is the other menu to try!
Great place for breakfast! Really creative biscuits...and it's almost all biscuits...options from the simple to the eclectic.

Great food, service and reasonable prices. Had the poblano burger. Usually I think the toppings make the burger. The toppings were very good but this burger was awesome! I would have been happy with just a burger patty. Fries were great too. Add to that cold beer and outdoor seating on the second floor overlooking downtown Boise and you've got a winner.

Poutine with mezcal is the way to start. Be sure to save room for the pork shoulder -- so tender you could eat it without teeth. The wooden finish and hanging lights provide a casual formal elegance. Best meal I've had all year.

Best Vietnamese on the NorthWest side.  I love everything here.  Especially, the spring rolls.  The grilled pork rolls are great.  And the beef  lemongrass rolls, are not what you think, but a very different style and texture that settles and melts in your mouth.

Great atmosphere and food!  Best tacos in Nashville and a large variety. Fish tacos and a veggie bowls we shared was delicious and fresh.  Their margaritas were delicious. We stayed inside for brunch but they have a large covered outside too. If you want a quick stop get cafe treats quickly. Friendly staff and very clean.

We found this place by CHANCE... if your looking for a great seafood awesome view and environment I recommend this place.  Our server josh was surprisingly very attentive and anticipated our needs..   absolutely impressed with the food environment service and location..

Great vegan food, but too expensive for vegetables. Interesting menu items,  the wild mushroom tostada is very good, but $19 for a tostada is a bit ridiculous . Small restaurant so make a reservation and don't expect a lot of privacy when dining. Dressy casual attire, nice for a special occasion.  I think the food is very good vegan food, but it's a splurge spot in Montecito.

Delicious!!! Best food we've had in Reno!  Great service...friendly, fast and so courteous!  The tri-tip arugula salad was perfect!  The meat was so tender..just melt in your mouth!!!  Definitely will come back again next time we're in Reno!!!

New Orleans, Louisiana ---

In my quest for a breakfast diner with counter-seating (a "Run-A-Way Bill" Favorite), I discovered the "Please-U-Restaurant" on St. Charles (tourist zone) ...

"Please-U-Restaurant" (since 1946) is a TOTAL disappointment ...

No activity, only basic-of-basic service, and an owner that sits in the corner and does not reply to a "good morning" (but just walks by), and REALLY REALLY REALLY bad "sausage n' biscuits" ...

wasn't even "sausage-flavored" ... bland white gravy with a "few" pieces of a frozen sausage patty (very few tasteless pieces) ...

When in NOLA I recommend stickin' with the coffee cafes & their food selections (hint: HiVolt) ...

day 041 "DUSA 2017" (Discover USA) 

"Run-A-Way Bill" was here! 

#RunAwayBill #DUSA2017 

03.04.17


UPDATE:
son on "non-sociable" owner "just" called me with this opening line after reading my Yelp review:

"how dare you harass my dad!"

my reply was, I only said "good morning to him"

...  son then went into such a non-stop verbal attack on me for "harassing is 63 year old father" (that is mean calling his father "old" at 63 ... shame shame)

03.04.17

My mom and I where in town. The first thing on our list was to find a french restaurant and so we did. Found it on one of the gem guides. We get there and already we had issues with seating, the tables where wobbling all over, finally moved to the 3rd table and was fine but we had to move all our plates, drinks etc ourselves (red flag)... I don't know if it was our skin color or what, but we felt something...Waitress greets us and was like rushing us to order. We ordered Pate, coquille saint jacques, garlic custard, stuff shrimp, onion soup, and the mussel which were cold you can tell it was sitting for a little while... After we ate a table next to us order the same mussell dish, to our suprise it came with a small fork and a big bowl to toss the shell....and we got crap!!! The best french food we've had in a long time since living in Tahiti and we are american/french!!! Unfortunately some of the staff  perticularly Vanessa just ruined it for this great french restaurant, you folks needs to bring in professionals to wait. Our bus boy and food runner  should of been our waiter, not once did she even bother to ask how we were doing....

I have been a regular patron at the Brew Pub for quite a few years and am still a big fan!  IPAs, ESBs, etc are my favorites.  Great pub style food with a few twists are great! I love the quiz nights!!

Meh. A perfectly average night out in carmel. A good beer selection, and the pear and Gorgonzola melt was good. It would be more fun if I cared at all about soccer. The wait staff is inconsistently good, as is the availability of seating.

This is the place to see and be seen in Wayne. It's always a party when I walk in -- job interviews, grandparents, yoga moms, college students -- there's always talking and typing going on. There's not another place like this on the Main Line, I think. The sandwich/soup or salad combo is the best lunch around, the coffee is great, and the atmosphere is perfect. Plenty of outlets and tables. Come here to eat or just get a coffee and work, either is perfectly ok.

All you can eat sushi - something I've avoided until now. If, like me, you've worried about the quality of all you can eat, you don't have to worry anymore!

Zen on Calgary Trail is a great spot for lunch with friends or dinner out. The best part is that everything comes in small portions so you may feel like stepping out of your box (if you have one) and trying something new. 

Look over the easy to read menu (with pics!), mark your selections on your order form, and enjoy as it is promptly delivered to your table. 

Golden California is my fav... And I'll try anything there.... I plan on working my way through the menu in time...

Who's in for lunch? Great price, fast service, good selection = perfect lunch spot (opens at 11:30).

Sat at the bar. Prompt service, no complaints. Had a Yuengling for $5.25 and the New York strip cooked medium with the house salad and baked potato for $18.79.

Consistent decor and taste as other Logan's I have visited.

Recommend.

Love fords! Every burger ive had so far has not let me down, not even slightly. I visit regularly and always sit at the bar. They have sooooooo many beers from drafts to bottles something for everyone. They have different specials throughout the week. The decor is so innovative all the way from the door handles to the bathroom sinks! Bartenders are always cool. over all chill place.

I found this to be a pretty cool little bar & eatery right on the river walk with great city views and a short walk to the convention center.

Prices were decent considering the view.  I did not try the food, but saw numerous items being delivered to tables around me that seemed pretty good.  

Draft selection was decent, including a few local options to choose from.  They had a decent cocktail menu as well.

I've had ate in, taken out and used them for catering and they are always great. When you eat in they are friendly and accommodating, the staff really is so nice here. I have also had catering done and it was also delicious and professional. I will definitely be going back !

Service was good, atmosphere was OK but very dark. Food was mediocre,  very salty and very expensive for a lunch menu.  Not much food is given to you as well. Most likely I won't go back. Ralph's of south Philly in Philadelphia was a much much better place,  we like it there. The food was amazing and it was very affordable! Portions were bigger and the food was not salty!

Met at door by molly who has to be one of the few people who have personality and a smile. Mind you we left a near by British spot due to no greeting or acknowledgment.  They were able to put us on patio for the nice afternoon weather. Ordered a grapefruit mimosa and ipa she didnt know beer menu but i had her just pick.  Miranda picked dogfish and suggested hodge podge hash. We did a big kid breakfast also. Big kid breakfast was just as it was described basic egg,bacon,and toast. My hash was off the norm with sausage,and lots of peppers and onion with cilantro and sauce. The guy who brought it out noticed i ordered potatoes with hash so offered fruit and i apreciated the suggestion. He never brought the fruit. Hash was good and large portion.43.05 was total left 50.00 . Didnt get fruit so didnt do you 20 percent tip plus 50.00 was easy to not request change. Its a 4 out of 5. 0
Great service and great food!  Call Bitar's directly instead of ordering through yelp or grub hub. Free hummus on Monday's if you get their app.
Very cute cafe. I like studying here. The staff are super sweet and their coffee and pastries are actually good. Its worth spending your money here.

I have been living in NYC for the last 4 years, so I have admittedly become a bit of a bagel snob with the bevy of high quality options in the bagel capital of the US. With that being said, I was pretty impressed with the bagel quality at this spot in St Pete! Crispy on the outside and nicely toasted inside with ample thickness, it really would have no trouble fitting in on any NYC street corner. Also had a large iced coffee that was Texas-sized gigantic and well priced. Would love to return!

Let's start with the good things-I came on a Tuesday morning with absolutely no wait. We ordered right away and were happy to have our food within 10 minutes of ordering. We started our breakfast with the BONUTS and all the Yelp reviews were right, they're DELICIOUS and a must try! The cheesy grits that came with my meal were good and the biscuit was yummy too. The portions of food were good for me but I defiantly wouldn't take my powerlifting husband here, he would starve. The place is cute and clean and the staff were all warm and friendly! 

Now the not so good, the price you pay for what you get is outrageous. When you go to a breakfast spot you expect good coffee but unfortunately the people I was with said it was burnt, terrible, and undrinkable. Their cups were still full and left on the table when we walked out. 

Overall, the coffee and the cost will keep me from coming back.

The concierge at our hotel recommended this place for local BBQ and it didn't disappoint. There was a pretty long line but it moved at a decent pace. My boyfriend and I both had the pork place and were very impressed. I tried the moonshine mojito and it was really good. The bartender takes his time with the drinks and a lot of them featured fresh mint. 

The downsides were that the Mac and cheese was bland and a little cold and they don't have brisket at dinner time. I would still recommend checking it out!

Sat at the bar with the intention of getting a drink, listening to Jazz and heading elsewhere for dinner. The Cosmo was so good we ordered food. The food is actually tapas or small portions. Everything we ordered was excellent. Try the Banana Strudel with Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream, WOW!

I have been here twice now, the other to be fair was a few years ago.  This last visit decided on a Calzone, with a side salad.  overall the calzone insides were tasty, however I found the crust at the seam very thick at $14.99 i seemed to by buying dough .  In the end I would have to say the serving person took away from the whole event. We felt she was bothered by us being there, and we should give here a big tip anyways.  I am not sure I will make it back here there are a lot of other places to explore in this city.
