Went on a Friday afternoon, fast seating. I thought lighting was too dim for 130p. We ordered baked feta, lamb gyro, French fries, side salad. Everything hot and fresh but all just average nothing special.
Great shawarma! One of the best in the city. Service is good and authentic middle-eastern.

The quality of our four breakfasts was excellent. The two egg Benedicts was just right with crispy potatoes. The eggs and hash was great and the eggs down medium was just right with fruit cup. Sitting by the fish tank was a great experience. The service was outstanding. We would come again! NOTE: the bathrooms were very clean!

The super be dosa was the size of my 5 year old daughter! The food is delicious and good value. Their special chai was very unique and oddly reminded me a bit of Malaysian pulled milk tea. The tea alone was worth the trip. It's a bit hard to find at first m, but worth seeking out. Staff was kinda and attentive. If you like Dosa... And I do... This is definitely a place to check out! Nolensville Rd is an international cornucopia of delicious places to eat, and dosa hit definitely holds its own!

Currently staying here and I felt obligated to write this review after my last two experiences. The hotel is nice. Upon arrival, a man with a wizard like cape will greet you and gather your bags to escort you to check in. The hotel allowed us to check in early without question so that was nice. The room itself is basic and nothing to speak of. THe hotel is undergoing renovations so it has a few places that look undesirable.

The bellhop staff is great and very helpful, Especially, Ebanks. However, the front desk staff is just average. 

Now, to what sparked me to write this interview.. There are no vending machines or microwaves in this building. I am 8 months pregnant and those thins are essential. How can I not be able to buy snacks when I need them? All of he walking you do here, a vending machine is necessary as it is annoying as ____ to have to walk to local stores to get bottled water. Also, there is no microwave available for guests to use. This is major as NOLA is a prime place to eat and staying here, you would not be able to reheat any of the delicious food you purchase. Right now I'm looking at lobster Mac and cheese and stuffed red fish that I cannot eat because there is no microwave. Honestly, this is a major turn off for me and for that reason, I would never stay here again. Obviously, I'm pissed, but for 1200 dollars for two people , I need a microwave. Rant over!

Average food and below average service. Real potential to be great but very poor....from missed orders to extremely long wait times for food (over an hour from drinks order to food order) this is a place with a great location, but seriously lacking anything else....won't be back but should be, missed opportunity form the owners.
Their flat bread pizza's are great especially if you're looking for a big lunch or dinner. I usually get take out.

Traveling through town. Wanted to hit a none chain place and this peaked our interest. Me the wife and her dad stopped for lunch. I ordered the chicken sausage special side of Mac n cheese wife ordered the half pulls pork half tri tip sandwich with side of squash. Dad got the pulled pork sandwich with spicy slaw as the side. 

I feel like my chicken sausage was the week meal in the group, it was still good just not like a wow thing. 

I can be a picky person  and really pick the visit apart, but her is what you need to know. 

Service was great
Food was good
Environment was comfortable
Homemade rootbeer rocked. 
The place was clean

Food could have been hotter coming to the table.

3-4 star visit and I can definitely see a 5 star easily possible!

Thanks for the meal!
I had lunch delivered by one of our vendors and he brought us some Carnitas and am latino and i have to say they are juicy and very good highly recommend the carnitas.

My wife and I are on our honeymoon, and were craving crab legs. We spent a good bit on yelp trying to search for good places when she came across this place. Casual atmosphere, decent prices. We got a booth, and the side I sat on there was a big pillar and made it annoying to get in and out. Our server forgot my soda order, it was 9:00 PM And maybe six people total there. Aside from that the snow crab legs we ordered were amazing. So good! The fries were nuked and dried out. The potatoes were questionable so we passed. For three lbs between two of us and two sodas came out to $60. Great place for laid back dinner and great crab legs. Would go back for the legs for sure.

A good sunset happy hour! Mia our server ,was  thoughtful, Friendly and efficient. She made the night. We had a few beers and margaritas. The chard-boiled oysters and meat pies delicious! The shrimp cocktail was not local Shrimp so not great. The Shrimp scampi was ok. We will be back

Food wasn't bad but I didn't get a great chance to enjoy it because it took almost an hour for my BLT to come out. The server was very nice and helpful, but that long of a timeline for a sandwich seems excessive.

Oh my goodness this salad place is heaven! There are so many great ingredient offerings and unique, flavorful dressing offerings as well. I loved creating my own salad and putting in a bunch of different tasty toppings, and having them chop them all up to yummy bite sized pieces. These salads are huge and filling too- easy for those with big appetites to stay healthy! My favorite dressings were the lemon tahini and chile hatch ranch. I will have to try some more dressings next time!
The perfect answer for brunch any day! Family run, wholesome place with awesome brunch options, including rotating seasonal menu.

Stopped in tonight for my wife's and mine annual birthday dinner. We have been here several times before. Tonight's off menu surf and turf was exceptional. Service from Mary was excellent.  Fillets cooked to perfection. Salads, sides and desserts outstanding. Definitely a repeat. Fleming's has lost a customer.

OK I don't understand why the star ratings so far are so bad if everyone is saying they really liked the food. Maybe the ratings are from competitors?

So here is the REAL blow-by-blow breakdown of this place.

YES it is mobbed. That's because there is a HUGE HUGE HUGE pent-up demand for fast casual Mexican in Tampa, and people are flocking there. After all, let us review our options for fast Mexican food in Tampa Bay: 

1. Chipotle = Sodium-filled food, pre-cooked and later boiled in plastic bags. A digestive nightmare.

2. Tijuana Flats/Moe's = Can't really tell the difference between these crapholes; 
both are substandard Mex joints that would go out of business in California, Texas, etc.

3. Taco Bus = Tasteless food served in cardboard tortillas in a dirty restaurant.YUM!


But back to Lime Fresh:

Do not just show up. Place your order online before you head over there. When you get there, go to the back of the restaurant where the takeout cashier is. Pay for your food there, take it to a table, and eat. This took me 5 minutes. And watch everyone else wait in line for 30 minutes. I had the chicken soft tacos and my friend had the chicken cobb salad. Both were good. Both tasted fresher than any food at the above-mentioned places.
 
Lime Fresh is not the same as Moe's, Tijuana Flats or Chipotle. It is much much better. Is it the best Mexican food you have ever had? NO. Is it authentic Mexican, Cal-Mex, Tex-Mex, etc.? NO. Is it better than the fast food Mexican food in Texas, Arizona, California, etc.? NO. But is it better than Chipotle, Tijuana Flats, etc.?
YES!!!!!!!

The ingredients here are much fresher than at Chipotle and Tijuana Flats, you can taste it. (Well, let's face it, the food from Chipotle comes already cooked in plastic bags, which they later boil.) The execution with some of the meats at Lime Fresh is not there yet, but I am hopeful they will get better with that.

This place is automatically better than the above mentioned places JUST for the extensive salsa bar, which is standard in Cali, Ariz, Texas, etc. but most no one else in Tampa has. And the pico de gallo is pretty decent, as are the other salsas. The menu is extensive, the dining space is nice and huge, the online order process was seamless.

I would def. go back when it's off-peak hours.

A friend and I were walking around Fishtown looking for a spot to get a coffee and chat. So happy we came across this adorable place! The staff were incredibly warm. There were lots of options for treats ranging from cupcakes, cake slices, tarts, bars, cookies etc. So many yummy choices made it hard to choose! I had the Dolce De Leche tart and it was so rich and filling, plus the presentation was beautiful--they clearly put a lot of care into how all of their treats look as well as taste. They have espresso drinks and teas too. I got a small Matcha latte which was actually quite big, so that was a nice surprise. There is a small amount of seating inside but we were able to find a spot. The place is super bright and nicely decorated inside. All around a very cute, clean, welcoming place. Definitely will be back.

Sports Bar: we have gone here maybe 3x. the first time we went was because it was the only decent bar in the area. when we got there we were not greeted and it took maybe 20 minutes for someone to get our drink orders.i was pregnant at that time and i just ordered iced tea. what i got was not cold and not so good iced tea and it took them another 20 to give us our drinks. on the occasions that we are there the staff is not attentive and would rather chat in the bar area. at one time i was screamed at by a girl who was working the bar... i mean u have super slow service and ZERO customer service at all. if you have to go to this Boston Pizza and if you love their food, go to the family restaurant side.. the wait staff are nice and pleasant and they give average to good customer service depends on who you get. They do accept air miles so that's a positive. they should install accessible doors though for wheelchair users and strollers. a friend went there this weekend and just told us that he is never going back there... and yeah i would advise you to stay away from the bar side...stay far far away. they don't pay attention and they just stand there and chat with each other. the last time we were there the tables were filthy and there weren't very many customers there. there was us and another group playing pool and did i mention the not so clean plates and utensils???their patio?? not clean! common people do u need John Taffer to rescue you?  eeekkk....

Hands down! No more words, want to try some authentic northern Chinese food, Cate zone is the one! So happy there are more authentic Chinese in the area. 

Been here many times, always crowded, be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes to get a table. I'm not sure if they take reservations. And very noisy, definitely not a good for romantic dates.
My husband and I made the mistake of trying this bar.  Horrible service and unfriendly bartenders :(.  Odd that the manager allows this to happen.  Won't be back.

I came to Mahony's with my friends for Brunch one Saints Sunday. When we got there it was a little packed but it was to be expected because it was brunch time on Magazine and it was gameday. It didn't take us long to be seated. When we got there we walked in and took out seats. Our waiter was really cool. Beware super friendly and nice. I ordered a roast beef poboy. Yeah, interesting choice for brunch. But i didn't mind. I really wanted something hearty and it was a poboy spot so why not. I must say, the food was really delicious. I loved every bite of it. Not to mention, we had bottomless mimosas. That's literally one of my favorite things about brunch to be honest.

TE freaking AMO! I can without a doubt say I've never in my life tasted anything like it.... nor will i probably ever. 
It was so trendy and cute! It will be my first stop when I return back to Tampa for sure!

They did a GREAT job catering our Christmas dinner on Saturday night! Prime rib and salmon choices, all done to the right requested temperatures. Excellent side dishes, amazing desserts, and service was perfection. Restaurant all to ourselves, nicely decorated, and appropriate background music to add to the festive atmosphere. Priced just right too!

Wow! This place has it going on. NOICE! High end everything. Blantons on the shelf - thank you! You get what you pay for - enjoy your earnings here! Manager Kenny running house in there, everyone is always on their game; A+ team all around!

EVERYTIME I go through their drive thru it takes FOREVER!  Their food is almost worth with wait but don't go there if you're in a hurry or starving!  If you go inside it's a better experience. But again it's probably going to take you the same amount of time if you choose to go inside or through the drive thru.  Also should note, there is never anyone else in line at the drive thru, so how does it take SO LONG?!?!

I was able to call tonight and with 45 minutes notice was able to bring a party of 20 on a Saturday night. The food was very good especially given the variety of what people wanted. Courtney,our server was exceptional and always in good humor. I've liked fletchers but tonight's accommodation and food makes it my favorite in Belleville.

First time I have visited Maggiano's.  It was my cousin's birthday, and this is her favorite restaurant. 

As soon as we met the group at the bar, the pager sounded.  They led a group of eight to a table that barely fit six.  We refused to sit there, and were told we would have to wait for another table. We had reservations.

I went to the bar for a beer for my wait.  I was second in line at an empty bar.  After assuring me he would be just a second then skipping over me (cash in hand) to help two other patrons who just walked up, I finally got my beer fifteen minutes later.

For the price, I expect better service that we were offered that night.  The food was just average.  

I would not return, as there are far better Italian restaurants in town (Buca, Vito's, even.....dare I say it.... Olive Garden)

This would be our fourth year staying at this facility, and the atmosphere is pleasant and the staff poolside is great, however, beware of room service. We ordered 2 burgers from the menu and we're charged 3 service charges....unbelievable! Do not order food to your room for charges that even staff agreed was absurd.

This tiny coffee shop is a unique little treat on the Westbank.

If you pull up to the drive thru in the morning, you will see a long line; but not to worry, they handle their lines well. Even in the cold, the baristas meet you at your car to take your order. Inside the shop (if you have the time), you are surrounded by coffee drinking locals, local art, and great conversation.

Not the best place to go to study or work but it can be done after their morning rush.
Great taste of the Caribbean.... Nice hang out spot will definitely come back when am in town.... Happy hour is a blast

This Applebee's was a mess. It was a Saturday night and hardly busy, and I see why. We went for the dollar drinks and some appetizers. We were there for two hours and got three drinks -- not for lack of finishing them, but for lack of our server checking on us at all. By the time we got our third drink there were 3 sets of empty glasses on the table because she never took anything back. Dirty plates sat on our table from when we finished our food until when we left. We even turned the call server light on in hopes of getting her attention. That was a waste as she walked past three times without paying attention. When confronted, she told us she had been waiting the tables outside but we were sat by the window and could see that she had not been out there. We had been anticipating a fun night out and dollar drinks to celebrate a new job, but we were thoroughly let down.
Best McDonald's in the USA. Great Staff & Management. My family spends at least $100/ mo at this McDonald's location. Always courteous and accommodating when going thru drive-thru.

A Co-Worker recommended Frankie's Chef Salad for Lunch and I am so glad.  It is GREAT!.  The meat is thin sliced so you get the essence throughout the salad.  It even comes with carrot slices and celery slices, black olives and pepperoncini (sp). Their luncheon specials which are faxed to our office daily, come with chip and drink of your choice.  AND they deliver! ! !  A great idea for the "captive audience".

Considering the location they have a good variety of Korean food on their menu.  The grilled meat combos are a good way to get extra things such as japchae & stews.

The kalbi meat is very good since they butterfly the beef rib.  It's very tasty since it is not too sweet.

My husband and I are from out-of-town and we were in the mood for some good poutine. This place did not disappoint. He ordered the Smoked Meat Poutine and I got the Sticky Maple Bacon Poutine and they both were DELICIOUS. The fries were hot and crisp, the gravy was delectable, the curds were squeaky, and the meat was sublime. We each ordered the regular size and that was plenty because the plates were HUGE. We also shared the Maple Bourbon Corn Fritters and those were amazeballs!! On top of all of that, the service was awesome! It was a wonderful experience and I hope to come back one day.

Forgot to add a picture before and we DEVOURED everything. It was seriously amazing!! We got 2 sandwiches, the hot one and the one with the Mac and cheese. Both very good. Fried Brussels and cauli tots were out of this world. Highly recommend the Queso dipping sauce. AMAZING

I love this place. The queso gringo is awesome. It's a little pricey, so maybe save it for a night out instead of a "I don't feel like cooking" night. The decor is modern and spacious, the menu is inventive, and the food is made in house! There aren't a ton of options on the menu, but I heavily favor restaurants that have a small menu of things they do really well vs. a novel of a menu of food that's mediocre anyway
My husband and I went this past Wednesday and the food, service, and prices were great!! Will be back soon and often!

Only giving three stars because they forgot to give me an item I ordered and also messed up my order (I realized this before I left) and it was a very simple take out order. I didn't have time to go back so I was out money on the item I ordered. The employees were all so rushed so it's no wonder they forgot my item and messed up but also my fault for not realizing I guess... I'll still be back because the food is good but I'll just have to double check I get everything I order!
We sat outside on Memorial Day and it was wonderful. Service was prompt and the crowds were less. The food was wonderful.

Phenomenal food. Cooked and spiced very well. Highly recommend the hummus, batatas, and halabi kebab. Beautiful venue and friendly servers. Their mixed drinks have intermittently had either too much foam or ice, but always taste great. Would highly recommend if in the mood for Mediterranean or Middle Eastern

it's really hard to find a great bagel place in the area that you can just pick up a dozen bagels and cream cheese for some friends after a long night out but newtown bagel is it!

picked up a dozen bagels, so many different kinds which was awesome and also so many different kinds of cream cheese! i personally love their garlic & herb cream cheese, scallion is also delicious. this place is always poppin when i come in so if you have a big order, might be worth it to call ahead.

Underwhelming and overpriced. Pizza Fusion seems to have a lot of hype and a lot of potential but it is poorly executed. I would give them 2.5 stars... most people would round to 3, but I'm sticking to two because my experience wasn't really "A-OK."

Even with a Creative Loafing deal AND a nightly special, I feel like we really overpaid... $27 for a large Do-It-Yourself Pizza alone. How is that possible? This is how: they don't tell you on the menu that the base pizza is $12 (I looked for pricing and there was none). They do tell you that each topping is between $2 and $4 (or more), but you would expect that to be the full cost of the pizza since only those prices are listed, leaving ours at $15 but alas it was actually almost twice that much. Dang! The final product was good, but for that price I can get three equally good take out pizzas. When you add my small white pizza to the mix, our bill was ridiculously high. I do not recommend this place unless you have a CL voucher. They are priced high assuming you will have one. Here is the link: http://www.cldeals.com/products/valid-at-pizza-fusion-downtown-tampa-25-value-2

Want to know something else they don't tell you? The soda is not normal coke product. It's their supposedly organic version, which tastes like a flat diet coke with a whole cup of Truvia added to it... like a previous reviewer said, it's basically cough syrup. They really should tell us this when we order. My "diet coke" was so gross I cringed when I took the first sip and literally could not force myself to get it down. I have never felt that way about any other soda or drink for that matter. Trust me, I know what Truvia tastes like as I use daily it in my shakes and cooking... and I know it's better than aspartame... but this was WAY TOO MUCH TRUVIA! I was so turned off by this product. Yuck.

The service was pleasant but super slow/sparce and we watched as everyone was served before us. As for the food itself, it was alright but honestly not amazing. I wasn't blown away. Also, I ordered the wheat crust and got the regular one on my pizza... didn't make it an issue, but it added to the overall annoyances. 

I really wanted to like this place. I really did. But Pizza Fusion and I are not meant to be. I won't give them good reviews just because they offer gluten-free items.

Summary: okay food, kinda bad service, really bad value, overall a super MEH experience.
A cute spot with excellent ambience. Staff was very friendly and seating is ample enough for a small or big crowd.

Absurdly good for a chain.  The roasted cauliflower pizza currently sits atop my "favorite foods in the world" list.  We order takeout from here weekly and they almost never make me feel weird about it.  I would love a slightly more expansive salad menu, but other than that, no complaints whatsoever.  The beer is cheap.  Even my picky kids like this pizza.  Just go already.

Great place to stop and unwind before next flight . Amazing and knowledgeable staff, great selection of wines (considering it's in the  airport) and awesome food. The lamb meatballs were just delicious, and so was the brie and prosciutto sandwich. Also don't forget to sign up with the app and you get a free tasting!

We sat down unsure of what to expect but the end result was without question a terrific meal.  The staff was both welcoming and service oriented.  The meal was brilliantly prepared and  delivered.  A fantastic addition to many of the already great restaurants in the downtown St. Louis area.  Thank you for a fantastic dinner.

This rest stop deserves its great Yelp reputation!

First, it's cool-looking from the outside. This is rare for a rest stop.

Second, it's very clean-feeling inside.

Third, it has many, many things, including lots of great vegan options, such as:
    -yummy pasta and tomato sauce, which I got, at the Italian fast food area
   -Starbucks, which has soymilk available for all drinks, such as the coffee I got
   -bean burritos from Baja Fresh, which my friend got
   -Burger King, which is always awesome, b/c it has a veggie burger!
Just so so. Cold food and dry.  I had a number one.  There are too many great Mexican places in town to come back. But the location makes it popular.

This place is amazing! We went there for brunch and the corn grits and potatoes were so good! I also had the bottomless mimosas. Our server Angie was very attentive and made us feel like home. We met the manager Tasha who really made our experience in New Orleans one to remember! She provided the best customer service I have ever experienced in my life. Our host Angela and bartender Steve were also great! We will definitely be coming back on our next trip to New Orleans.

Had such a delicious breakfast this morning... Cant wait to come back!!!
Tried lots of new places on our visit to clearwater this trip and excited to make this place a regular visit when we are in town...
Yummo!

We stopped at Milk and Honey 7/8/19. The service was amazing they staff did a great job keeping everything moving despite how crowded the place was. Our waitress Laurie was extremely cordial and hospitable with great knowledgeable of the menu. She gave great recommendations on what to order.. the food came out fast and looked/ tasted amazing. Laurie was also nice enough to take time to write down places in Nashville my friend and I should check out. This restaurant had good service all around.. I will be returning!
Yummy breakfast all day menu and great lunch options for everyone meat eaters vegetarians and vegans alike. Great Pride menu specials as well

Shopping can be exhausting. It's so convenient to have s NOLA favorite in the mall to stop for a cafe au lait to give you just enough energy fir the rest of your shopping extravaganza! It's also a great spot for tired dads to plant themselves so they have enough strength to tote the bounty back home. I'm sure, instead of following g you around holding all your bags he'd be just as content, perhaps thankful enough to throw some more dough your way! We all know that he can't sit at a bar and wait, who would drive?

Cute, clean cafe with a limited but well curated selection of sweets/snacks and drinks with good amount of seatings. 

Our table got a slice of orange olive oil poppy seed cake, chocolate pretzel, orange/pineapple juice, tangerine juice, and coffee. 

Staff who helped us was excellent! 

Everything we ordered was tasty but what really stole the show was the orange olive oil poppyseed cake: so moist and just sweet enough, generous portion. Lots of poppyseed. I only wish the olive oil taste was stronger but it was still very enjoyable. Get this!

Got the Mac Daddy and the cheese bacon dish was to die for. They even take the bread from the center of the bread bowl and but garlic butter on it to have with the dish, must eat when in SB. They have really other good stuff like pizza bowls too

Loved this place. Found it on Yelp, stopped in for brunch. Sat right down. Waitress wasn't overly friendly, but was efficient and nice enough. The food was fresh and delicious. I had a breakfast croissant. Subbed bacon for ham- no problem at all. Had the breakfast potatoes. It was all really good. I know what you are thinking. "Sounds pretty basic, can't really mess that up" oh, but believe me, you can. People mess it up time and time again. There were some fresh greens and sliced tomatoes to add a little brightness too. Hubs ordered a grilled chicken sand which, cooked fresh to order- it looked really good. I heard no complaints. Coffee was good and refilled promptly. Honestly, this has been my best food experience in awhile!

I was looking through the YELP reviews trying to find something interesting to try.  I  stumbled onto "Chef Ron's Gumbo Stop".  I think my search was focused on corny names.  Anyhow, based on the good reviews, we stopped in on a Saturday evening.  Easily the best decision I made all week.

The food was awesome!

The "Stop"  is located in a strip mall just north of the I-10 Causeway cloverleaf.  There is a well lit sign on the east side of the cloverleaf.  If you are coming from I-10 you have a choice, You can make an illegal u-turn, dive into the right lane and pull up to the front of the restaurant.  The faint of heart can make a legal left turn, make the next two lefts and pull right up next to the strip mall .

This is a relatively small place.  Maybe 20 seats, a couple more at the bar. Decor stretches the boundaries of eclectic.....  We obviously missed the dinner rush, I think maybe 3 - 4 people were seated when we arrived.  We sat right next to the mermaid.  

Service was quick and friendly.  Someone I assume is Chef Ron was out a couple of times to check on us.  Nice, polite but not clingy - no war stories or life histories.  Interesting that he assumed we were from out of town (must be worldly demeanor and classic good looks).  When he found out we were from Destrehan, he commented that "he loved to get locals in".

Down to the food - nothing short of great.  All the reviews raving about the seafood gumbo is absolutely accurate. The turkey wrap was enormous and stuffed full of real turkey.  My real find was the potato salad.  This is the best potato salad I have had in New Orleans.   

$50 for 2 including drinks and tips.  I'm excited about going back and trying some of the other sides.
This place was great . Had the filet , and it was cooked perfect . Enjoyed every bite. The service was great, they were on top of everything and very friendly.

If I could give 0 Stars I would we were told 40 min wait and we waited 1 hour n 40min we even called after n hour were told 10 more min people that got there after me and my lady were being seated before us and we called again and were told we were next and they didn't seat us so we chose to leave will not be going back to this place they close at 3 pm and we waited till 2:30pm we got there at around 12:10.

Have come all the way from Oldsmar twice in past month, now, to enjoy the friendly service, really good tex Mex food, pleasant dog friendly patio, and terrific beers. Stephanie gave great service and even asked if our LABrador needed water or a dog bowl. 2 entree, chips & salsa, a flight, a pint, + tip was a reasonable $41.
This restaurant is in jeopardy of failing if locals and visitors don't support it. That would make us very sad, as it is a welcome addition to the static and (some) overpriced dining options of the past 4-5 years since we've been coming to Gulfport.

I really wanted to like this place. The bartender and the wait person were both terrific. The craft cocktails were delicious but it was all downhill after that. The wine list was quite limited and the food was uninspired. The wedge salads were fine but the rest of the food was uninteresting. Don't get the tempura vegetables. I ended up with soggy zucchini, breaded, fried and  cold. The whiskey shrimp were no more than cook shrimp on a piece of toast. All in all disappointing cuisine.

Food was fast and delicious. The Korean bbq wings were perfect flavor but could use more sauce. The honey buffalo was hot and wet. Zucchini planks for the starter was perfect. Angus sirloin sandwich was good. Not a lover of coleslaw but it works on the sandwich. Good location, easy to find.

Absolutely love this place!!!!!
I order from here pretty regularly lately.  Roughly $12.00 for 3 chicken skewers with rice and greek salad.  Great deal and super fresh and tasty!!!   I have tried a few other items but this is my favorite so far.  Delivery is super quick.  Service is excellent.  Highly recommended.  AAA+++

Pho was delicious. Jessica was great. 

She even waited late when I realized I'd forgotten my phone on the table. 

My friend and I will definitely recommend and visit again.

We have a family member that just wont give up on CDB's, so a year after our bad experience we booked another family dinner for 20 people. New management you say? We arrive on time and the host says that most of our party has already arrived, so we follow her lead. Turns out we were the first to arrive and they had given our section away to crashers, It was almost funny to see the hostess and servers disappear into hiding and leaving us standing there awkwardly looking over the people that had our table. Fair play to the female bartender that finally addressed us and offered to seat us at he bar. Since we had kids and a wheelchaired person, we left and walked into Gators to be seated instantly.

Literally so delicious. I got the blue crab au gratin to split as an appetizer with my boyfriend and it was absolutely to die for. Richie was helping us out most of the night and he has the best input for us. He was so incredibly helpful and we were happy to have him! The rest of the staff was extremely friendly as well, but we forgot to catch their names. The ambience was nice, you could show up dressed up fancy, but we also saw people dressed in jeans! Definitely recommend, delicious food, good vibes, and a friendly staff!

The menu here is great, it's diverse and has both warm and cold options (perfect for summer) food was pricey but tasted great! I had the gazpacho soup& the shrimp salad platter. The outdoor patio was nice & the service was great. I would go back!

This is a great restaurant around St. Pete beach. I wait more than 3 years to come back and I left last night with the same feeling of satisfaction  I tried its lunch and dinner menu , notnsire if it change but is fantastic. Last night was my sister 50's celebration and she enjoyed mussels in white wine souce as well as fish with a pistaccio crust... excellent both. I am
More " traditional" lobster bisque and herbs and citrus mahi...
The food value is according with its quality and you can decided according to your budget...
July/2018 update. We come
Back, this time with my husband.... we ordered Jimbo Shrimp and Calamari, with a glass of wine a Black Label Scoth. Food is very tasty

One of favorite places to stop in for breakfast or bunch in Tucson. The food is delicious! My gripe with Prep & Pastry is inconsistency with their service. It can sometimes be fantastic and other times be unbearably bad. I understand that they get very busy, however, waiting after being seated for 45+ minutes on multiple occasions to give an order without being noticed is almost inexcusable. Additionally, after the food is brought to you, don't expect to see your server again until you're paying; only a handful of times have they actually come back to check on the food. Please fix the service!

Best restaurant on the Main Line. Super friendly staff, all of the servers here are very hospitable, especially Steve. Be sure to ask the bartender, Tommy, about the different kinds of beer that they have to offer. His knowledge is incredible! My kids and family love it here, we can't wait to come back.

This place was absolutely delicious!!! There was 4 of us and we all ordered different things. All of us had a great meal. The flavors were amazing. They brought us the steaks ordered before they were cooked and gave us a little overview of the marbling and where they came from etc. The atmosphere was very casual but the flavors were high end for sure. The appetizer we had was the oxtail poutine it was the best! We had salmon, ribeyes and a sirloin. Sides were Brussels sprouts and mushrooms. All of it was great!!

If you like a "traditional" breakfast this is not the place. Check out​ the menu before going here. I'm sure there are those that love this place but it's not for me. On the menu,​ it clearly states no substitutes​​. Therefore, "you get what you get so don't throw a fit."

As a side note,​ I don't need to see all the political comments in a restaurant. I come to eat not read signs on the wall what they support politically or not.

They treat my Aspie with the utmost attention and carefulness. She is incredibly picky with her food. Everything is treated as a pleasure to serve her not a headache.

The pasta is delicious and I would recommend eating here for sure.

Was told the wait would be 20-25 minutes.  Ok, put our name down. 1 hour later we were finally seated. Ordered a pint beer at the bar during the "wait" , but told at the table that it didn't come in tthat size???
This isn't the first time we have had a issue at this restaurant with it taking FOREVER!

I go into Saboro at least once a week for a cafe con leche and am greeted by the friendliest manager that knows exactly how I like my coffee. The food is authentically Cuban and priced just right. The ropa vieja with white rice and yuca will hit the spot for any carnivores Latin food craving. Oh! Don't forget an order of sweet plantains, too. You will not be disappointed.
Great prices at happy hour!  2 for 1 beers.  Free chips and salsa...The best salsa on State Street!  Staff is very nice w/ no attitude!

My work has Fooda and Pita Chip was the restaurant they brought in for the day.  I ordered a salad bowl with falafel and chicken shawarma and it was amazing!  All of the food was so fresh. Their hot sauce and tahina are so damn good too. The hot sauce definitely had a kick to it but I love spicy stuff so I didn't mind. People more sensitive to heat may not like it.  I hope Fooda brings Pita Chip back to my work but I'm lucky it's not too far from my apartment.  I will definitely order again.

A friend of our recommended this restaurant.  We went around 8pm on Saturday.  The street the restaurant sits on is charming and quiet.  The dining area is not very quiet.  It seems to have an echo due to the concrete floors and high ceiling.  We ordered the Antipasto Misto for starters. It was ok.  My husband had Farfalle Alla Milanese, he seemed to like it.  I thought it was nasty!! It had an overwhelming odor of pancetta (bacon.) It was weighed down with fatty heavy sauce.  Almost like they rendered out the fat from the pancetta and the sausage and used every drop to make the sauce. YUK!  I had the Pollo Alla Gino-Vese, it was pretty good.  Slightly over cooked and salty but over all it was good.  Mine also came with a side of spaghetti (which I did not eat.  It tasted canned.) Our server was super sweet! lol She even commented on my husband's dish.  She said that she hates serving it because the smell gags her.  We had a nice time there.  We did not leave hungry and our bill was $68 and we had drinks.  Not horrible but not amazing! PS... bring a sweater because it is down right COLD in there!!

From the moment we walked in, it was an amazing evening at the inn. We were greeted immediately and warmly welcomed by a lovely hostess. We were given a table by the fire and welcomed again by our waiter. It was restaurant week, so we selected our options that were paired with a special wine. We each had something different and each was delicious, especially the gnocchi for the first course. The second and third courses were even better: flat iron steak, pork chops or salmon, followed by desserts. Altogether, excellent food served by outstanding, attentive staff! The manager, Maggie, gave us a tour afterwards and told us the history of the inn. Just a wonderful experience! We'll be back!

I'm loving Northwest Coffee even more now since they started serving eggs several days ago.

Plain eggs, eggs with cheese, eggs in a tortilla, eggs on a bagel, eggs on an English muffin... you get the picture.

They actually steam their eggs under one of their espresso machines! So, they come out extra light and fluffy, and the water expands them nicely. No butter or oils necessary! 

And, their eggs are locally-sourced from the River Hills Poultry Alliance. They're 'happy eggs', as they come from free-range chickens that are free of antibiotics and humanely raised. And yes, you CAN taste the difference.

They still make the meanest latte ever here, too! Try 'em.

Can't say enough great things about this place. Several times a year, my fellow Marines come to this place and have a great time. The "Black Sheep" of our particular units, we come together and enjoy some beverages and way better than expected food. Over the past few years, we've made some great memories here and I can honestly say that this place has the best burger I've tasted in a long time. The staff is always above average and takes care of us extremely well. We didn't get to meet the manager, but he also treated us much better than most establishments in the area. I'm not talking about a few guys either. We've shown up with a party of over 20 and they still were extremely accommodating and kept the premier service going. Almost didn't want to write this review because we like keeping it as our "hidden gem" of the area. I hope they make some more merchandise so we can represent when we're out of town!
Food is good but be aware it will take 30 mins for a simple take out order.  only one person taking orders during LUNCH!
I just can't understand how a steak restaurant does not have a baked potato option for a side.

It's like stepping back in time when customer service actually meant something.  The staff were super friendly and helpful.  All the food is homemade including all the breads.  I had the reuben and it was fantastic.
There's also grand piano in the dining room and they have someone playing which is cool.
Gumbeaux did not have any flavor. There was more rice than gumbeaux in my bowl. My salad was delicious.

We have been waiting (hoping) someone would open a great raw bar in SB for quite some time now. The Big Eye Raw Bar is Outstanding. Fresh fish. Delicious flavors. We had the spicy salmon and traditional poke bowls. Highly recommended.

It's weird: Much of what's going on with my life is a complete surprise to even myself.  I wasn't supposed to be in New Orleans or be staying with my friend whom I hit up last minute, but somehow we ended up here when I was already pretty shithoused, running with our umbrellas trying to beat the impending storm that never came.  The outside area upstairs is cool with a view of the Mississippi River (always makes me think of Tom Sawyer or one of those books).  However, there is only one dingy table outside AND, it's the target blasting area of some sort of restaurant ventilation so if you look cute, keep in mind that you will leave smelling like greasy french fries which makes you less cute.  

Drinks are like $10 each.  EXPENSIVE!  And small sized like but I was drunk already so no harm no foul.  Mojitos are better than margaritas.  It's a huge space inside but not many people upstairs.

Waited for 30 minutes to be seated, 15 more before our server stopped by to take our drink order and then she disappeared for 20 or so before taking our food orders, which took forever. All-in, over two hours before we had something to eat and it was basically fast food quality cuisine. It was almost comical how many things were wrong with our order when it finally arrived. In summary, mediocre  fast food without the speed and poor service.

 Additionally, bathrooms were disgusting. First and last trip to Buffalo Wild Wings.

Five stars for this location easily! Not sure why it took me so long to contribute to the reviews of this place, but better late than never. Everyone at this location is friendly and it's always sincere. Aside from having customer service that would shame some high end Philadelphia restaurants the food here is great. It is delivered efficiently, hot, and cooked properly. I personally am addicted to the spicy chicken sandwich and love to dip my fires in the Chick-fil-A Sauce. I also like that this location has family friendly nights: my favorite is taking my daughter to the annual father daughter date night around Valentine's. My little girl and I look forward to it - probably me more than her she is five and has no sense of time. I also really like their milk shakes and breakfast sandwich selections. Keep up the good work team Chick-fil-A, it isn't going unnoticed or unappreciated!

I was impressed with the flavor of the food, really good. We ordered some wings, that I have to said that for me are the best in the area. Also we ordered turkey, brisket and ribs, juicy and with a nice smoked flavor. I recommend this place, give it a try. You will not regret it.
Great spot to visit on a lazy Saturday or sunday. Great brunch and atmosphere. They have a DJ I believe Sunday's and menu has lots to choose from. We'll be back
All good tonight. Great food and service!!  Excellent follow up from restaurant staff. Thank you!

We had a very pleasant meeting in their extra room, the service was wonderful and the facility was perfect!  I have eaten in the Carson City Store several times and this one was much better!  Hats Off Guys ... A Great Job!  Thanks!

Food was fair, ribeye was cut wrong, service SUCKED! But Debbie was a help to make things right.  The waiter was not around much, when one in our party asked for desert, waiter said "we are out of most things" and walked away, he did not like to stay on the area, we were outside on patio. I will visit again, but will ask for Debbie, and will give her a proper tip. Also, this is another one of those restaurants that wants to push local beers, but craft brews rarely make lagers because they are harder to brew, so they have ales and IPA's but there are still a few of us who like lagers on draft, but I guess we are just SOL!
Well priced. Family atmosphere. Won't knock your socks off, but a decent casual dinner.

I want to give it a 4 but can't as Inconsistent.  Have been several times over past 3 years and has varied from really good to ok to bad.  Luckily I had been twice before bad or would not have gone back.  The night it was bad I happened to take 2 people who have never been I felt horrible for raving how good it was as they won't be back.  I ordered the same item I had 2 weeks prior and it was awful.  Most likely the inconsistency is in whoever is the chef that day?  Overall I would say it is good but I do agree with the other reviews that it is not as good as when it first opened and it is a weak wine pour. Great Atmosphere and outdoor tables.  The service is good and staff friendly.  Their French Onion soup may be one of best ever had and a great bloody mary.  My lunches have been better then dinners.  Worth a try.  
Large groups - go elsewhere they do discourage groups especially at lunch. Place is to small and not set up to accommodate anything other than a prefix menu for a party over 6.

Great view, great service and great food (at a great price)!! Their grouper sandwich is amazing. Also tried the Hogzilla and it was killer. Get a rum runner while you are there, they are addicting. We go here EVERY time we are in the area. Right on the intercoastal and you can watch boats go by. Just a great place.
Wonderful homemade food. Great wait staff. Very enjoyable experience. And the market attached allows you to enjoy those homemade goodies at home. Went back 2 days in a row I was so impressed!

I like the vibe this place is going for and they have a great looking menu! We ordered our lunches to go, but I liked the setting and there is tons of seating both inside and outside.  

Albacore Sandwich - pretty good, a little salty. I think they could've used better bread like pretzel wheat so it wouldn't get soggy to fast.  It started falling apart halfway through 

Arugula Salad - nice and refreshing.  It's a pretty simple salad so the dressing made the salad what it was.  I wish the portions were bigger since it was pretty expensive for something I could easily make at home.

The service wasn't my favorite part of the restaurant.  There wasn't a long line, but the cashiers seemed to rush us.  They didn't welcome us or say 'thank you' at all.  I don't know about you, but that leaves a pretty big impression on me especially when the food wasn't amazing.

I would go back to try their baked desserts though!!

I loved the atmosphere the most. Our serve was awesome and very accommodating. My favorite things was the turtle latte and the herb dip that comes with the popovers. Both exploded with flavor. And I'm all about flavor, which can be hard to do with breakfast type foods. The popovers were huge! I definitely recommend this place for brunch with friends.

Pizza was delicious!! We got the pollo prosciutto and it was fantastic!! We asked for the balsamic on the side and they followed my requests and also called when they arrived. We will definitely be ordering again!! They were fast, courteous and food was wonderful!!!

Just plain rude ass customer service. Oh and way too expensive and not worth stopping here. Walked in the door talk to the hostess two of them and I ended up turning right around and walked right out. Hope you have a better experience I will never returned

Ate there a couple weeks ago. My daughter had shrimp tacos and I had a shrimp boil.  Mine was ok, seemed overcooked and had absolutely no seasoning on it.  My wife had a very blank shrimp scampi, but they comp that meal and she got a friend scrimp basket to go.....so we paid for that instead of the scampi, unfortunately that was $20 for a total of ten scrimp.  2 dollars for cocktail size shrimp.  But at list the joint had a great view of the water!

New to the area during COVID 
The restaurant is dated but the food was delish!
Service was great and they practiced their cleanliness routine by wiping down menus and S& P
My husband and I were have a cheat day and shared the SOS and Texano Hash with 2 poached eggs.

Disappointed, from the very beginning the hostess was rude. Our waiter Carlos seemed rushed and not attentive at all, my sons food was last to come out and and it took forever and asking twice to get our check. The food was okay nothing spectacular. For the price you'd expect better food and service.

The good old dog was recommended to me... if you like blue cheese then this is your go to. There is a wide selection of beers, but I guess like anywhere else in Philly it's pricey for beer. I also went with a dessert that was dark chocolate, caramel, and sea salt... WOW that thing was good! It's a small portion, but worth the $6 in my opinion.

Delicious and all around fantastic experience!

Convenient location and easy parking, which is sometimes difficult in the area.

BYOB- I love bringing my own favorite reds and whites!

You can tell from the second the food is presented and with every bite that care & time was taken with every step. This place really gives you the feeling of comfy/cozy meal with family /friends, but with top-notch service... like having your own personal chef in your house. Mark (chef/owner) is great. The dishes are original enough that they are interesting, but stay true to the cuisine that the restaurant is based upon. 

Prepare to sit, relax and enjoy a fantastic dinner. I think my favorite aspect of this restaurant is the service. I never feel rushed. It drives me crazy when a server is delivering the next course when I'm not done the one before. Never the case here. I want to enjoy my company as much as I want to enjoy my dinner, which is the norm at Da Soli. 

Suggestions...

Apps: Grilled calamari, House-made sausage

Pasta: Gnudi Alla Genovese

Entrees: Short ribs! My husband LOVED the veal

Dessert: rissoto/rice pudding and home made ice creams

Love it!   Has the salmon for lunch and came back for dknner!   Great Scotch eggs, Irish tea and mixed drinks too. If you want to great live music..Make reservations!   The other side of the restaurant has unique decor.

We had the wings and they were OK. Sauce very oily and a little bland.  The salsa was full of cumin and bland.  The drinks were OK.  The Caesar dressing was watery and full of lemon.  Again fair but could be a little better.

First time to the new location in Carrollwood. Excellent customer service and they were very willing to accommodate our food changes. Very nice atmosphere with comfortable seating. The staff is very engaging and checked back frequently to make sure we had what we needed! We will definitely be back!
Food is really good. Selection of beers is above average. The vibe inside and out is really good and the place is usually very busy.

Presentation of the Place: The Bathrooms are nice. It reminds you of  an overpriced hotel that you can feel fancy in while taking a dump. The inside of the place reminds me of an amalgamation of the sets of Cheers, Sex in the City, and some French Noir.

The Food: 

Starter:

Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs

So, this is the first of many dishes were the common complaint is the lack of salt in the food. From the egg, filling, and crab itself, everything was void of salt or seasoning except for what was a little paprika. The textures are boring and 1 dimensional. For 8 dollars, you are getting 3 deviled eggs at the lowest effort of innovation and care. It is something with less flavor and passion than the ones you are partaking in during Thanksgiving at your grandmas.

Brussels Sprouts with Garlic Aioli and Grated Parmesan.

The Brussels sprouts are cooked exceptional well, which is rare. This is ruined, by the lack of salt and seasoning again. I assume this is due to the amount of Parmesan shaved on top of the dish. This gives the dish an overwhelming umami flavor, and it forces you to reach for the garlic aioli to counter it. After about 10 bites, you begin to realize how white you are because you are essentially eating cheese and mayo. 


Entrees:

Ratatouille with filet

No salt on the filet on top. No salt in the dish itself. What is on the Filet is a lot of balsamic vinegar, which is overpowering. The tomato paste hasn't been stewed long enough, so the dish is really acidic especially with the amount of balsamic vinegar being used.  

Quail and Boudin

This dish is weird. If you ever had a fever dream and was wondering man I wish I could eat that, this is what it taste like. The portion of boudin and quail you get is actual small for the price. Guess what the quail doesn't have on it? The fry on the quail isn't good and the breading breaks offs. The chicken gumbo taste so strange like they almost put soy sauce in it and also has notes of sour. The boudin is really good and is the oasis in this odd dish. 


Drinks:

1 Bottle of the Smith and Hook. Your standard Cabernet nothing flashy.
 
Service: 

I usually don't critique service. I understand that we all take breaks at work, but man no water refills, the restaurant isn't busy, and people from the pass are having to bring our food. This is happening while you and your bartender friend are talking the entire time. Not a good look hombre.  

Verdict: A Salty No

If you want to have a glass of wine with the girls or boys, while you look out at Poydras St. I guess this is the place for you. In my opinion, there are far better options location and culinary wise for you to go to.
So happy they were open! Always a treat when I come to the beach. I had the egg, bacon and cheese on a croissant and a latte. Everything was fantastic and the service was top notch. Thanks ladies!

Exceptional service from Daniella!! We went to sockeye for a birthday dinner. We arrived an hour early for happy hour and enjoyed the seasonal flight plus beef nachos with fresh jalapeños. We enjoyed Daniellas personalized service, food, and beer. The entrees were fantastic I had the house salad plus skewers of tiger shrimp the dressing (ranch and basil vinaigrette) was off the hook!! My guy had had the French dip with garlic fries (recommended by Daniella) she said it was the "best seller" and ya we know why! It was AWESOME!! The garlic fries are a must have!! Don't get the rice pilaf it was chewy sockeye is legit!! We are very happy with our visit here. Their Covid 19 is also in alignment with governors orders we had to wear masks when not at our table and the space was super clean. We will be back

I was looking forward to trying Blake's, so I stopped in with my parents for lunch. It wasn't prime time, but there was no one there, so that wasn't a great sign. I ordered a green chile lotaburger and onion rings.

I was really disappointed in the burger. I got a single patty and maybe I should've gotten a double. The patty was thin and dry, not much meat on the burger at all. The bun was huge, way too much bread. They were generous with the toppings, but a burger should feature the meat. The green chiles had a nice kick. And the onion rings were decent. Three burgers, two drinks, and two orders of rings was just over $20. Maybe a tad pricey considering the drinks and rings were size small, and my mom got the little (itsa) burger.

No issues with the service. It was okay, not especially friendly. No real response from the cashier when we mentioned it was our first time either. If I come back, I may try the breakfast burritos and hope they're better than the burger.

First off they have an awesome collection of indo fusion recipes - will be trying that next. The first trip was for regular indian food and it hit the spot! Absolutely delicious yummylicious excellent soul food! The chef is from Mumbai and his creations will make you nostalgic if you are from the city! Portion size is just right!
If i were here longer this would be my go to Indian place!
Workers are extremely friendly I go there every Wednesday after church.My coffee collata is always perfect I recommend this dunkin donuts if you are nearby
Service is impeccable. It's the loveliest restaurant in Conshohocken. The owner knows how to take care of his guests.

Whiskey selection is great.  Nice selection of craft beers.  Food is not bad. I've been here for dinner and it was packed. Service was kind of slow, I guess that's expected.  Also been here late night for drinks, bartender was knowledgeable and attentive. 

Back again for lunch. Seated right away even though place looked pretty full.  Food was hot and taste great. Can't say anything particularly stood out besides the whiskey selection.  I'd come back for lunch before dinner.

Pork sandwich was tasty but a little dry. Flavor was very unique. Prices are expected for this area. Our server Kaillie was awesome. The gal bringing out the food acted like she didn't want to be there. Everyone seemed to be fine.
An hour to get our order of Chicken fingers and fries and Sliders with fries and when it came the food was cold.

OUTSTANDING....Service is great, drinks are top notch and the food tastes amazing and they give you enough food for each dish to feed 3 small families.  
The decore of the resturant is inviting and yet classy.  We have sat in the resturant several times for dinner and lunch and had drinks and watched a game at the bar before.  Great tap list.

Try the fries they are really good.

Nice atmosphere.  The layout of the place hasn't changed much since it was Spence, but the bar is bigger and there is a small stage.

I ordered the Chipotle BBQ Wings.  Very good wings, went down smooth with a happy hour special Red Stripe.  This place is definitely worth checking out.

Ordered the Plantsgiving meal and it was delicious. Every part of the meal was done well. The pumpkin tamale for dessert was super yummy. I really appreciated that they made a entire plant based meal. Even though they are across town from me, I will be ordering from them again. Their staff is very friendly as well.
Awesome staff, dinner couldn't be more delicious  a pretty nice place, their wine  is also excellent, prices are fair for the quality and the quantity. Highly recommended!
Called to order takeout and I was placed on hold for about 5 mins. I could hear the women in the background just talking to people. After awhile more, I hung up and called Buckingham pizza.

What an absolute new treasure...in the Bywater/Marigny on Royal Street. Cozy, comfortable ...warm and inviting.  Opening the door, the aroma of freshly ground, brewing coffee caught my attention.  Crawford Malone the owner, greeted me and made me feel welcomed.  He answered all my questions regarding "each" enticing item. I wanted one of each!  LOL  I ordered the turkey, bacon, cheese, arugula lettuce with spicy Chipotle chutney on crunchy fresh ciabatta bread. The flavors were pefectly balanced... very filling and satifying....so delicious....really soooo delcious! The Croissant was Ooo La La ....closed my eyes and I was back in Paris. Perfection!  My Cold Brew was smooth, rich with coffee flavor.  Many selections to choose from....they grind and blend Petite Clouet Coffee.
The coffee condiment bar had Agave syrup, simple syrup, several choices of milk products and other types of sugar/sugar substitutes.
Everything in the cafe was absolutely top quality with affordable prices.  Outside seating, lots of seat choices inside, a very nice knowledable Barista, dog friendly and a fantastic location.....this Petite Clouet Cafe is not to be missed.
P.S.  Where is the picture of my sandwich?  Opened the wrapping...took one bite....could not stop eating to take the photo......sorry...next time.

First time eating here, we ordered the Gambini pizza and the steak and Gorgonzola both were so good! The Gambini pizza is my favorite. It had ricotta cheese, tomatoes, onions and balsamic glaze drizzled over... omg heaven! 

Can't wait to try more from here.

Ordered delivery through Uber Eats - arrived nice and hot, and right on time! Husband and I split the chicken shahi korma at "spicy" level (a kick, but definitely tolerable), chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and keema samosas. Came with basmati rice, too. 

Each item was so, so good. I split my keema samosa in half and tried the berry sauce on one side, and the spicy mint sauce on the other. Also drizzled some of the berry sauce on the shahi korma, hell yeah. 

We have leftovers for tomorrow that I'm already looking forward to. 

I hope to order from Sher-e-Punjab again soon, and visit in-person when it's safe.

One of the best family restaurant in our neighborhood.  Consistently good food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner with a wide variety of options.  We had breakfast today.  I tried to go with a healthy option today and had the scrambled eggs with turkey sausage, wheat toast, and sliced tomatoes.  They did it just right with the portion size, food quality, and service.  We love this place.

Fresh and fast.
Salad, soup and many pizza choices, all you can eat.
Outstanding chicken wings, cooked to perfection.
With drink, less than $10 per person
Delicious food, very friendly staff, good atmosphere. I had the Crazy Roll. So good!  I would highly recommend this place.

I'm from Santa Barbara, and this place has been a secret local spot for years. The garden patio in the back is the best place to spend a relaxing lunch. I bring everyone here, because it is always such a easy pleasing surprise. The food is simple yet fresh and tasty, there is always new wine to try and the fountains and succulents are inspiring. 

Tri-tip sandwich, egg salad BLT, all the soups or fresh market salads, and breakfast burrito with avocado are my favs...

It's a small operation and they can get pretty busy sometimes, so have some patience...
Food was AMAZING! and our server was too. If you ever come here I recommend the "Million Dollar Bacon"
They have been closed every time that I have stopped by. There is a sign on the door telling customers to go to Napa Sonoma. :(

Hubs and I chose this place because it popped up on a YELP list of best places to watch football. YELP is absolutely WRONG about this. Walked in at noon on NFL Sunday, and two of the three bar big screens were tuned to soccer, one of the ancillary screens is tuned to soccer, and one of the ancillary screens is tuned to women's collegiate volleyball. The few screens tuned to football were tuned to the Titans, and I totally get that in Nashville, but when our server asked what game we wanted because she was willing to change the screen from volleyball, she said they couldn't do it because they don't have Sunday Ticket. This absolutely disqualifies Burger Republic as a football watching bar. Also, just putting a bunch of screens up around the place doesn't qualify it as a sports bar. Sight lines are important. Food was solid. Service was acceptable. But don't go here thinking you're going to watch football.

This place is not bad but not great in my opinion.
The boba has ice chunks and bits. The pad Thai was the fishiest pad Thai I ever had lol but gets better when you add a lime or two, the pad see ew Wasnt that bad but I won't ever get it again, a lot of Thai restaurants don't know how to make authentic pad see ew so it's not just this place. I think 3/5 stars is fair for this place.

First time here and I will definitely be back again. Almost all of the pasta is made by hand, which you can definitely tell. The bread, the desert, just everything was great! Also, our server Anthony made our experience even greater. He went through the ENTIRE menu with us and described popular items and just details about the entrees. He was also very attentive, funny, and just a really nice person overall.
Terrible service waited 15 mins before a server even came over to take our drink order. Then additional 10 mins just to get our drinks. The place was not busy either.

I will NEVER come back to this place! Just went in and was turned away by the staff with 15 minutes to close, told the grill was turned off!! I ordered a turkey club, not sure what how you would need a grill for that?? Clearly, just looking to get out of there...just poor customer service overall.

Service was great but unfortunately the 'peanut butter smoothie' I asked for wasn't what I was hoping for. And I bought two. My son was in the hospital and I was out there from California to visit him. I asked if they had that on the menu and cashier recommended these. Forget the name of smoothie, but they were green. Anyway, just a heads up  Didn't have that pb banana taste we were looking for. I get it, Health bar.. but please be honest with customers about taste.

I went here for the first time for lunch with my bosses after one of them recommended it.  The atmosphere is very laid back and almost has a beach shack feel (if that makes sense).

The menu is average size and straightforward.  I got 3 grilled fish tacos ($4 each).  I am always hesitant at paying more than $3 per taco but since it was on the company's dime I figured why not.  I have to say I was impressed.  The fish was crispy from the grill despite having the chipotle remoulade on top (always a plus), and the fillets were nice and meaty with no bones.  The red cabbage was fresh and added a needed crunch. 

To me this place is the perfect spot for a quick lunch.  I would be hesitant to come here for dinner unless I was with friends doing something in the area because it doesnt stand out as a quiet dinner spot.  Theres nothing wrong that, but taquerias to me feels better suited as a communal experience.

I will be updating my review, but so far I'm really impressed. 

Enerjuicer has been open only a day or so, and offering free wheat grass shots all week for their opening. Looking at their menu, I was very impressed with the variety and especially with prices. Definitely not as pricey as my normal juice stop. I love that all the fresh fruits and veggies are on display also. I chose a regular sized "garden state" smoothie which was sweet and light. I can't wait to come back and try the juices, though. Less than 6 bucks as opposed to the normal 9/10 range? Maybe the bottles are alot smaller. We shall see. I'd also like to mention how friendly the staff was....super welcoming and informative, they seem very excited about their new business. I wish them luck and I will for sure be a repeat customer.

The steak tips were amazing but the onions weren't grilled at all. I've never been served fresh onions on this meal before. The potatoes tasted delicious but weren't warm enough to melt the butter. The servers were wonderful and kept up with our requests. By fast the best steak house meat wise that I've been to in Nashville.

Not a place to eat in (has only one or two areas to eat)... a very small place... but their food isn't bad at all. I ordered 40 wings and asked for them to be extra crispy... They were pretty mediocre, but not bad at all! This is one of these places when you're really craving some wings and they are close by.

Been here a few times now. Every single experience has been wonderful!

The food and service has been exceptional each time. This last visit we enjoyed live Italian style opera singing. It was very unexpected and fun, definitely not something you typically see at a restaurant chain. 

Every time we've come we couldn't leave less than a 20% tip, these waiters and waitresses are not just nice they are truly genuine. They aren't over the top, with a cheesy "hello and how may I help you's" only to scurry from the table as quickly as possible. They genuinely smile and make conversation, have impeccable timing and attentiveness even on a busy Friday night, and know how to make recommendations from the menu. Really wish we could note all their names individually to give them props. 

The food is fully flavorful, not just salty. The bread is warm a loaded with rosemary flavor, I always request balsamic with my dipping Olive oil. Each dish has a unique flavor profile not just your typical Italian style chain where the only options are salty cheesy or salty tomato. People have complained about portion size/cost ratio on other reviews but honestly, I have never left here anything less than STUFFED with left overs for lunch the next day. We typically spend $55-$60 on two specialty drinks, two appetizers, and two entrees (my choice usually being a seafood/lobster dish) at dinner, not shabby at all when you consider the customer service, atmosphere, quality, AND quantity at that price. 

If you suffered a bad experience here, I am strongly advising you give it a second/third shot and even mention your last experience to your waiter when you come in, I'm positive a place like this will make it up to you. This is probably my favorite restaurant of the moment. Totally worth the five star review I'm giving it.

I'll summarize with these categories: 
Food - Very good. 
Service - Very good but hurried. 
Atmosphere - DEAFENING noise. 

Our first visit was this Friday evening. I had heard rave reviews so we were anxious to try it out. We had reservations and were seated immediately. The place was absolutely jammed with people. The noise level was deafening. Having a conversation without raising your voice was impossible. The hustle and bustle of waitstaff going by every second does not make for a relaxing atmosphere. Too many tables jammed into this space. 

Our waitress was very good and attentive. However, we felt rushed. Probably because there were so many people waiting in the bar to be seated. 

The food was very good. Mussel appetizer was just ok. Good quantity of mussels, but some were still closed. The sauce was tasty but lacked chunks of tomatoes. My crabmeat & shrimp over pasta was one of the best I've ever had. Dessert was also very good. Portions for all were more than enough. 

If you want good food, visit Limocello. If you want a quiet evening or a relaxing atmosphere - STAY AWAY. Maybe weekdays are better. I'm sure they could do more to cut down on the noise. The ceilings are low, but the owner has placed acoustical tiles on the perimeter to reduce noise. Something else needs to be done. It's a shame because we couldn't wait to get out of there. I'm not sure I would go again.

My husband & I were visiting Indianapolis for the weekend & this restaurant was suggested to us by friends & it did not disappoint! The ceviche, cauliflower, Watermelon And Tomato Aguachile & corn empanadas were unreal! Nothing like we've tasted before. The little snacks they bring to every table were just as amazing! The best part of our night though was the service. Our waitress, Natalie C. Went above & beyond. Thank you so much for making our night so special!!

Super disappointed in the service at this Panera. I've had take-out orders that weren't correct, but I always blamed it on the DoorDash app - mishaps happen, right? 

But the in restaurant service is also seriously lacking. They got my order wrong even though I was right there, eye-to-eye, and, to be honest, I don't think they care enough to really listen to you and get it right.
Always great food and have a really good time there when I want drinks. Had catering for 30 people at work and had them do it. Everything hot and delicious. Kim in catering was great!
The BBQ was good. We stopped by before a concert at Bridgestone Arena.  The service was fast to meet the limited time that we had.  We did love the live music and drinks.
A-FREAKN-mazing fish tacos!!!! All th food was good! Almost makes me wanna go back again on our 2 day trip in Dunedin!!

For my Two Hundredth review I give "The Block".  Cute name cute inside cute little meat case with cute little chunks of meat.  The service was not so cute.  The server wished she was anywhere but here waiting on us.  I feel your pain it is hard to work for a living.  But if you are not a people person than maybe you need to sit in a cube somewhere and not waiting on people with your lousy attitude and pathetically slow to non existent service.  What saves this place from something less than 3 stars is the food was very good.  I had their steak sandwich..  It was very good.  Odd instead of one slice of steak it was pieces of steak placed on the bread.  I almost felt it was leftovers from the butcher shop.  But style or not the steak was very good.  It had a nice punch to it from the pepper they seasoned it with and the gardinaire it was served with.  The steak sandwich came with fries so I asked for some ketchup.  It came out in one of those little stainless steel cups that was about 25% full.  So after about 2 fries I needed more.  Good luck with that.  Refer to server section of the review. 

My son The Famous Chip K. was with me anid told me he had this server before and she was bad.  Oh well.  So go for the food not the service.  Really it is cute in a cute way

Since our experience was brunch, not the hotel itself, I hesitated to write this review. However, after reading the reviews of others, I feel our experience represents what others have said & felt so here goes. 

Christmas brunch: $75. We had no reservations & can now see why they weren't booked up.

Only soups were a gumbo & squash. Soup was tepid, soup "bar" messy. There was a large bread bar & I found a good yeasty roll. The gumbo was full of shrimp, sausage. (Later the waitress told me she could heat anything. That's nice but shouldn't be necessary.) The staff seemed overworked (we were initially led to the wrong table -- people were EATING there), but by & large tried really hard to accommodate. $75 included unlimited mimosas & my glass was never wanting. 

It's hard to explain the worn, tired, outdated, rather unkept appearance. Like where we were finally seated along the wall, there were bumps in the carpet from electrical or whatever, but dust had accumulated. I even made the comment that I smelled moth balls. Hubby pointed to the, rather outdated in my opinion, cloth decorations on the tables/buffets. Made sense to me. 

Hubby was delighted w/ the fresh oysters. Also the shrimp and crawfish. His omelette looked appetizing. Most desserts were to die for! The pralines were tasty but grainy and I've had better macaroons. My egg on artichoke was not properly cooked. The broccoli was hard, and too garlicky as was the cornbread stuffing. 

Pictures are worth. . .

I am so sorry to say that I was disappointed.... We went in after a doctor appointment at the Penn center and bought a reeces peanut butter cheesecake.....I am sorry but it tastes like it was on display for a while...not fresh nor creamy...I'm sorry to the owners but it really was not good...

We always enjoy eating at Pacific Counter especially in these difficult times.  Thank you for being open and continuing to serve the community. We really appreciate you. The food is always great. The rice bowls are huge and have great ingredients....and you must get the Dole Whip!!!
I eat at the Oregon Diner several times a month. It ls by far, the best diner in the area! Their menu offers a large variety and they bake their own goods on the premises.

Good food. Nice open atmosphere. We had a larger group for a late lunch and everyone was pleased with their order. I had the bacon cheese burger with fries and was quite pleased. The server was attentive to our large group and we didn't have to wait an unreasonable amount of time.

My husband and I normally go to the California Pizza Kitchen in MD but decided to venture to DE to do something different.  We always sit at the bar.  Today when we got to the bar this gentleman was busy pouring his friends drinks and wondering where the party was later that evening.  He didn't even approach us until 5 minutes later but when he did he felt irritated because he had to leave his conversation with his friends. He took our order but when our salads came out he didn't offer any cracked pepper or napkins.  I suggest to this location retrain your bartenders.

Loved my food, service, atmosphere there and drinks. Everything was great and fairly priced. I got wild berry crepes special and my friend got steak Benedict that he didn't like at all. 
The only thing I was shocked with is that bacon was   Hatfield paper thin bacon for $6. 
Service was extremely fast and accurate. 
I will definitely come back.
Fresh, healthy food made the way you want it. Customer service is outstanding. I eat here for lunch weekly. It's addictive.

CLOSED.    I loved this place.  They are pulling out of all Nashville area locations.  
So sad.

The absolute best Fish Tacos!! I moved to Tucson in July from the East Coast and was worried I would not find good Fish Tacos, I was definitely wrong! They have the best taste and the perfect mix of spices, not too spicy, but perfect. Thank you!

In a nutshell - lovely ambience. HORRIBLE food and service.
We went there couple days back while on vacation and fell in love with the ambience. Very relaxing,  setting a mood, the numerous lanterns and seating on cushions with low tables. Very Asian and Arabic at the same time. 

But the food was horrible. The 4 of us were unanimous about our opinion of the food. Tasteless , nothing special and the simplest mango lassi too was horrible. More over the server dumped mango juice into the lassi and gave us the glass and told us to mix it with the straw. We had to ask him to turn on the candle at our table too. (It was 8pm). We asked him about a dish that was mentioned on the menu posted outside the restaurant not on the card menu. He quickly said "yeah we can make it" and rushed to another table where there were non indians sitting. Throughout our stay there we observed him serving the non indians and caring a damn about any desis.

We told him that the lassi was no good and he said. "I don't know , I'll tell them inside" .... whatever that means...

We heard him send customers away saying he is short on service. That was true ,he was the only guy waiting 8 tables aprrox. BUT. Why did such a big restaurant have just one server... ? Poor fellow seemed like a nervous reck. 

So unless u want to take ur shoes off and just have a fun time criticizing the service and food do not go to this restaurant. Period.

This is a great little spot in Trolly Square. I go here for take out lunch when in the area. Food is delicious and servers are pleasant. A wonderful place to go for pricy night out in a contemporary atmosphere.
The fried chicken was not dry at all. Actually taste a good level of spice. Side of fries super crispy which I love. Also love the bubble tea. Tapioca actually chewy. Would definitely come again.
This restaurant had terrible service and terrible food I ordered honey bbq wings and the were VERY SPICY!!
