If you're looking for fun atmosphere to bowl, this is the place. It's cleaner than most bowlling alleys, has a full service bar, and their food isn't too shabby either. It's very family friendly...my 3 year old had a great time using the bumpers to earn herself some strikes!

And hubs and I were able to enjoy drinks/food at the same time. Friendly staff, central location, and much nicer experience than other bowling alleys.

GO DIGGS!!! ALL I CAN SAY IS WOW! This place is AMAZING! Very generous with the toppings. Super fast delivery and an excellent staff! We have only ordered twice but the fact we came back is an A++++ in my book! We love trying new places but every time I think pizza I'm comparing everyone to you.

We stopped by for lunch on Saturday. Our server was very helpful in describing the foods, which we were unfamilar with. Although it was very crowded, like all the restaurants in the French Quarter at noon, we got a table and good service. She didn't rush us, and it did not take too long to get our food. Unlike some of the comments below stating it was over priced, I found that to be the furthest from the truth. Seems to be everything was $12. The Po-Boys were HUGE! I shared one with my sister, and we could not finish it. My other sister ordered red beans and rice, which was very good, and another large portion, we all ended up sharing it. The burgers were also extremely large, at least 1/2 pound. The food was good, service was good, and they do not charge an automatic gratuity for 4 people. They have listed at the bottom of the bill a  gratuity calculation of 18% and 20% for your convenience. Perhaps it is for those people who stiff the server with a couple of bucks, or for people who cannot figure out what 20% of the cost is. I would recommend this restaurant.

I ate here for the first time when I visited Philly a couple weeks ago. It was my first BYOB experience and that was AWESOME! It's a really busy/crowded restaurant and we went for Brunch so there was no exception. Luckily my friend was able to call ahead to put our name in for a party of seven. We could track our spot on the waiting list through their text messaging system which was definitely convenient. By the time we made it to the restaurant there was only one party ahead of us. However, we still ended up waiting at least 45 minutes because it seems that there is limited seating for larger groups. 

When we finally got our table we immediately took our bottles out ready to get our drank on! The waitress opened our champagne bottle for us in the back and we ordered a couple juices to go with it. We also brought vodka, which went great with their delicious bloody mary mix. 

For brunch, they had a TON of veggie options which was amazing!! The variety was great! They also have a "Specials" Menu which had the potential to be really cool, but it seems like it's just the same specials and regular recipes that they usually make where they just change the names of the items to a new theme. The food still looked pretty good though. 

I ordered the Ultimate Mexi Scramble. I was really excited about this dish as the description made it look delicious. I really enjoyed the black bean grits that came with the dish. The scramble itself was pretty good, but also a little bit too liquidy. The portion of food was large which was great because we were all starving after having waited to get a table for so long. The rest of my friends at the table seemed to really enjoy their food. 

I enjoyed my experience at Sabrina's Cafe for the most part. I really liked the BYOB policy. the food wasn't AMAZING in my opinion, but it was still pretty darn good. The only thing that was frustrating was the wait to actually get a table. It may be worth it for the restaurant to consider taking reservations for parties larger than 6.
I love this coffee shop! I've been a customer since it opened! The staff is so friendly and helpful.
Mediocre quality food and service. They can do much better with the quality with a teeny bit off effort

One of my fav go to asian restaurants. Food is always ready fast. Place looks clean. Food are ok, I would give 3.5 stars, 0.5 for the milk tea/service. We order takeaway most of the time now due to covid-19, still not used to dine-in yet.

This is fast food no doubt, but I'll have to say the food is as good as any of the Italian franchises without the price.  Salads were cold and crispy, servings were generous with lots of meat.  Their hot breadsticks are to die for!  The store we visited was almost empty inside, but the drive through was loaded up.  The inside was spotless with every other table marked off for distance.  Lots of disinfectant being used on tables.  This is perfect takeout for a real meal, instead of a burger.  Hubby had a slice of pizza as his side and the crust was great.  I took it away from him when he said he had more food than he could eat!
Order a skillet, kids pancake, and breakfast burrito for delivery. Food was delicious and delivered with great quality. Will order again. :)

Food really went down hill, the last 3 meals I had were horrible :( It was so good before....I don't know what happened to this place... Won't be back or buy gift certificates for anyone anymore. I gave this review 3 stars because the server was fantastic!! Her name was Cori.. Otherwise I would of gave them 0 Stars.

Fabulous food, amazing drinks and friendly staff.  A very pleasant dinning dining experience for families, couples or when you are dining alone. 
Call ahead to reserve a table.

Easy to find and enough parking in the plaza. It has a good amount of choices for food but it's mainly seafood. So if you never been to Chickie's & Pete's and you're from out of state then you need to try the crab fries. They are the best fries in the city probably even the state just go and enjoy yourself.

Hidden gem!! Great, authentic Mexican food. Don't let the cheesy strip mall hinder you,(I was skeptical), but.. it was Packed! The service was terrific, even apologizing for the delay in the food, (which I didn't even think we were waiting that long). One of the "brothers " was opening the door for ppl in a downpour, asking tables (and us) if we needed anything. Great Customer service & food =&  .

Went at high noon on a workday before we headed to the airport. Waited 45 minutes for some of the very BEST BBQ we have ever had.
I had the 8 oz brisket sandwich, loaded tater tots and jambalaya. Brisket was tender, juicy, tasteful and plentiful. Tater tots were ok but the jambalaya was delicious!!
Wife had the smoked turkey sandwich that was very moist with a wonderful light smoked flavor.
Daughter-in-law had the pulled pork sandwich, loaded tater tots and beans. Very tasty pork! This coming from someone who has eaten plenty of pork of the past 20 years in NC. The beans, mixed variety, were seasoned nicely. Could have cooked them a few minutes longer though.
If you go at lunch expect to wait and share a bench table with other patrons. I do not recommend taking a toddler as there is no kids menu nor a place for them to sit.
We will be back the next time we are in St Louis!

Took the review down a star.

Beer: good variety but doesn't seem to have a good go-to stand-out fall-back like other area breweries have. Not bad beer by any stretch of the imagination but more meh than memorable, unfortunately.

Service: this is a pet peeve of mine- if you're serving these beers, be proud & smart & able to answer questions about the brewing etc! I have yet to see this here. The young girls can answer basic questions w/ canned responses but go blank beyond that. We sat with empty glasses at the bar for uncomfortably long (they were not busy at all) and by the time she reached us, decided to get our check instead of another round. 

Food: not served, but menu from neighboring sushi place provided.

Stopped in the other day for some coffee with a friend.  Nothing spectacular stood out to me about this place.  I feel like it is trying too hard to be one of those hip coffee shops, but its not quite there.  Again, nothing terrible or fantastic about the place, just okay.  I ended up getting the iced Black Thunder coffee.  It was good, but I have had better iced coffee at other local places.  If I was in the area and needed a caffeine fix I would probably go back, but wont go out of my way to go here.

This location is a little hard to get into due to the construction and general traffic around US-19 and Gulf to Bay. Its parking lot desperately needs to be repainted as there are parking spots on one side of the building that really isn't wide enough to hold parking plus the traffic of cars actually driving by.

The food is really good. I've had their chicken biscuit a number of times, and find it is better than many other fast food establishments. It is many times better than McDonald's and Burger King and is just as good, if not slightly better, than Chick-fil-A's.

Their hash browns are nicely seasoned, with some different herbs included, and are very good if they are fresh and hot. Once they've sat for more than a few minutes, they become soggy and unappetizing.

They have a huge variety of donuts and are constantly rotating different seasonal specials. The donuts are generally fresh although I've gotten a stale donut or two whenever I run by during the late evening.

The service is friendly, although it is slow! If I place an order inside, they will do three or four cars before finally handing me my order. I dislike that the emphasis is placed on people in the drive-thru, and wish they would have dedicated staff for both sides.
This place is amazing!!! Our waitress Brooke is amazing! Very attentive and she definitely caters to her guest! Will be back again! Thank you again for such great service!!

They lie about your pick up timing . The two lady at the reception is so freaking slow . They said 20 mins on phone an now I come in after 30 mins n still say 15 to 20 mins and they don't even know the orders. Never gonna go there again . They should better change the two ladies at the counter . I wouldn't even rate 1 star .

I've heard coworkers talk about Thai place for months. Told my wife I wouldn't go without her. Went for a date lunch. Covid was in full swing so seating was limited but wasn't a problem. They serve what seems to be like big calzones. They're claim to fame were the "sauces on the side." They were pretty tasty! I'll stop by for lunch again. If I have to make a suggestion maybe providing a sampler of the sides to purchase with the ol meat pocket.

We came for dinner during the weekend. The atmosphere was nice. The food was delicious. I had chicken tikka masala, along with some garlic naan. They were both delicious. I can't remember the name of the other dish we ordered, but it was basically seasoned cauliflower, onions, and potatoes. The cauliflower dish was good, but not as seasoned and flavorful as in other Indian restaurants I've been to. We enjoyed everything overall. Our waitress was polite and helpful. We will definitely return. A lot of people appeared to also pickup takeout orders from the restaurant, so that's always an option if you don't want to dine in.

This location has a very easy drive-thru (easy to navigate). However, it was pouring rain when my fiance and I ordered at the drive-thru. Because they did not have an awning or something to block the rain from coming down, I could BARELY hear the drive-thru operator through the speaker. I was straining super hard to hear (and my fiance is almost deaf in one ear so he DEFINITELY could not hear). 

We ordered the pretzel burger sandwich, 4 count of chicken nuggets with honey mustard, a medium Sprite, large fries, medium Diet Pepsi, 8 count of mozzarella sticks, and an order of chicken fries with barbecue sauce.

I see chicken tenders on the menu which is what my fiance wanted to order (although it said 2 count of chicken tenders but he wanted four) and the drive-thru operator said "Do you mean the nuggets? We don't have chicken tenders". And we were like "...No... the tenders..." and again she said that they didn't have those, so I was confused about that. (Unless she meant they didn't have any left in stock??) 

As for the parking lot: Once you collect your food from the drive-thru window, they only have parking spots available for handicap people to park, and you're only able to turn right out of the lot. If you wanted to eat in the parking lot, you'd have to basically do a square around the corner to come back into their parking lot again.

As for the food: My fiance liked the pretzel sandwich. They unfortunately did not give him any honey mustard like what he wanted for the chicken nuggets (so he ate those plain). I was pleasantly surprised to see how big a medium drink is (it's definitely like a large in my eyes!) I'm so used to diet drinks that it should taste fairly normal, but my Diet Pepsi tasted different this time, and not in a good way, I don't know... They forgot to give us marinara sauce (which is pictured in the promo for the sticks), so we ate them plain. Finally, my chicken fries were okay, they give more than what I was expecting in the box, but I just felt that they lacked flavor. They didn't taste like anything to be honest... I had a couple of my fiance's fries and those tasted good.

A small Mom and Pop shop, which are always a little more fresher and a little tastier than the big timers. This has to be one of the best sub sandwich places I have experienced in California. I live in Los Angeles so when I'm in Santa Barbara I always make it a must to come here. Must tries are the Turkey Breast and Tuna Melt subs, be sure to get the works.

The two stars I am giving Maurepas Foods are for the food and atmosphere, both of which are great. I have been to this restaurant many times since it opened, and have always had positive experiences, however last night myself and a group of friends sitting at the bar experienced appallingly rude service from the two bartenders. It's a shame because the food here is great and I live only blocks away, but there are plenty of other restaurants in this neighborhood and this city that have a combination of good food and good service. I'm quite confident that the people I was with, who live here and all own businesses in this neighborhood, feel the same way. If you are going to hire out of towners it might be a good idea to include the concept of southern hospitality as part of their training, or even just a crash course in basic politeness.

I'm going to be a straight up tourist about this! This is Panera, what what?! Ok, so I didn't eat here, but I did go through the drive through. My friends got salads to go for the plane ride. They seemed to be very pleased with their orders from Saint Louis Break Co. / Panera. I can't believe I went here, Panera is blowing up everywhere... I've only been to one Panera in New York and I didn't think much of it.. but I still think it's cool that I got to visit here. If you have friends in town you should definitely take them here. Saint Louis pride. 

Fast service at the drive through! Great for a meal on the go.

Loved it! I've been meaning to go here.  Their restaurant week menu/food was great! My drink was super.  Love the vibe in here so much.  I'm only not giving it five stars because our server not very personable in an "I'm just here to get paid" kind of way and was telling me about his ex, which was weird.
Just had the best panini of my life! -chicken bacon club

Great little place in the French quarters. Walked in during peak hours and found a spot where they shuck oysters. Great place to sit as the gentlemen  working the oysters offered great service. I ended up getting the shrimp poboy which was delicious. Very flavorful and filling. The bonus for me was when they offered me a sample of the oysters, shrimp and sausage they had freshly cooked!! Now that was a pleasant surprise and I enjoyed the company. It was my first time in New Orleans and it definitely set the tone for the hospitality. Give it a shot if you are in the area!

Giving it a 3 because i could barely read the menu it got so dark. Anytime i have to pull out the cell phone is a problem.

the waitress was good enough.  nothing spectacular there, but she was friendly.  the food was good.  had the lemon rosemary chicken.  Very juicy and very flavorful.  the potatoes were a little undercooked though.  And possibly the chicken too. the next morning lets say i was not feeling to well.  I would have checked the chicken for doneness if, oh i don't know, if i could SEE!!  

The photos form the early 1900's of U.City were an awesome touch.  Loved those.  

All in all, i will try again.

For a restaurant that I've walked out of once because of poor service, you may be surprised to hear that I like Champps a lot and go there regularly. Honestly I think it's more than just sports bar food as some have stated.  I actually like the nachos a lot whereas some seemed critical.  Some of the regular dinner dishes are very good too. Wings are very good.  Excellent beer selection.  A couple of the longer-term wait staff are really very good, friendly and engaging.  I agree that the host/hostess staff can be inattentive at times. There's also one particular female server there that is so disorganized that I can't have her serve us anymore.  Overall it's worth the chance of the infrequent mishap.
Super friendly staff and good drinks why go to star bucks when you can support the local community 1 block down the road

Wish I could give this more stars! Heard of this place from a friend and was excited to try since the owner, Nina Compton, competed on Top Chef.

Everything here looks good but we decided on the coconut french toast, chicken hash (special) and the truffle and poached eggs. So good. 

Decor is super cute too. They open at 10am and weren't quite ready to seat people / lack of communication but other than that a fantastic experience.

The food here is mostly good. On the occasion that they get my order wrong the manager usually offers something up in return (which I usually decline; but appreciate the gesture). My biggest complaint would have to be the fact that every time I go in, a solid 5-6 minutes passes before I'm ever acknowledged. Sometimes I have to initiate the conversation all together which kind of bugs me. I know my standards are higher having worked in customer service forever, but this should definitly be changed. Just FYI: People don't like being ignored when they are spending money.
This place is amazing. There is a wide assortment of pastries including incredible almond croissants and macarons. I can't wait to come back!

Great place!! Atmosphere is lively. Nice bar. Great service! Had the Mardi Rita, grilled oysters 2 ways, crab cakes and fried alligator. Everything is so good. Can't wait to do breakfast/brunch! Love this place
Tina was an amazing waitress, she took such good care of us. Food was good too.

This place was really good and it was a lot bigger than I thought it was.  We had reservations and were seated in the back right next to the kitchen as we watched them cook all the food.  The restaurant was busy and crowded and the service was nice and attentive.  One thing that we didn't enjoy too much (nothing against the restaurant itself) was this party of women across the room from us, and I swear one of the women had a laugh similar to a witch's cackle.  It was hard to enjoy our dinner when she was going off every 5 minutes.  No hard feelings for people enjoying their own dinners and having a good time but I wish they were more mindful of being inside around others.

We had the crispy Brussels sprouts to begin and they were roasted to perfection.  We shared the slow cooked oxtail ragout with a side of the baked jalapeno cheesy grits.  All of the food was so good.  The oxtail was tender and the grits were also so tasty.  I would come here again to try other items off of the menu for sure.

Excellent food, great customer service, nice location.
Hidden gem with authentic Cuban cuisine
The Naan was super dry. The chicken masala was mediocre. Definitely not recommended given the high rating it currently has. The delivery service was ok.

Delicious hand made pasta.  Decent sized portions.  Smaller place so definitely make an appointment if you're going on peak hours/weekends.  Wait staff is hit or miss--i feel like they get busy and forget to check back for drinks,  bills, etc and we frequently have to flag them down.

We found this little place for breakfast. We had traditional New Orleans fare including grits and mimosas. 

Portions were generous and everything was delicious. The place is small and can get crowded, but the wait staff is super friendly and attentive. I wasn't able to get exactly what I wanted as they were out but the waitress suggest something else that was wonderful. .

This is always a pleasure. The atmosphere is fantastic. Our waitress was a bit confused and we didn't all get the things we ordered, but she was so sweet and called everybody "lovey", that nobody even got upset about the orders being mixed up a bit. 
The bacon here is absolutely the best. Nice and crisp without being burned beyond recognition. The coffee is great and the omelettes rock. 
The biscuit and gravy are another story though. It's more like a slice of bread and the gravy was just odd. The whole thing did neither look nor taste like biscuits and gravy. So if that is a favorite dish of yours, don't order it.

The quality of the food is exceptional always consistent...especially the rice/beans.
The salsa bar is on point especially the Pico de Gallo.

The only drawback is the parking or the lack of it!

One of my top 5 places in Tucson! Located on the edge of 4th and University (street is currently under construction 5-5-12) it is a fantastic breakfast/lunch/dinner/late night choice for food and drinks.  Free Wi-Fi and a "hipster," vibe makes this a hotspot for students and others.  Prices are fair and the menu is extensive.  A new after midnight menu Thursday-Saturday is my favorite newest addition.

An OG diner with awesome food. My only problem was I couldn't decide what to order so our table looked like a buffet and we walked out with a ton of leftovers. Our server (I think Mary) was as sweet as could be. Owner was a great guy too. You can't go wrong for breakfast, lunch or dinner at Mama's!!

If you cannot find something on the menu that you like, then you must be a very, very picky eater.  When shopping at the outlet mall, I always stop here for lunch.  The diverse, ever changing menu is wonderful.

There are many beers and wines by the glass and the prices cannot be beat.  The menu is cutting edge for a nationwide chain, with many healthy choices.

I have to add the staff at the bar are seriously well trained and/or motivated...they never stop and they remain friendly.  Specifically Julie and Ashton.  They are amazing!

They have a mobile app and Rewards program which adds to the overall positive experience.
Their muscles was not that good.  But the lobster ravioli was incredible. And the waiter and other help was very good. Would definitely go back

Fantastic modern take on traditional Sonoran food.

Absolutely try the bone marrow, sooooo good!

Tortillas are amazing, they are clearly homemade.

I was a bit skeptical of this place from the moment it opened. One: the location seems odd to me but maybe it's because I rarely make my way to Marathon Motor village during the day time. Two: the theme. Many Nashville restaurants take advantage of garage-style doors and even have similar themes. The difference? They do it well. Garage coffee company felt more like I was there to get my oil changed than to get a solid cup of coffee. It felt like it was trying to cater a crowd that's non-existent in the Nashville coffee scene. 

I often tell people that I have two criteria for liking a coffee shop and it only needs to meet one of them. A) Have a great environment or B) serve a really good product. Garage does neither. Their coffee is  equivalent to a cup you may get at Starbucks, possibly even worse. Sorry, folks.

This restaurant review is really only about the Happy Hour.  Lately, that has been my MO.  In the summer I don't like to eat huge meals so Happy Hours work great.  It's really hard to judge a restaurant correctly this way.  So guys, just remember this was a Happy Hour review and doesn't reflect their true menu.  Went there Friday night with our friends.  It was the four of us all looking to share some delectables.  Unfortunately, it didn't quite make it for us.  We shared the Calamari which was fried but came dry without a sauce, no lemon.  It was tasty but I believe could have been better.  Also the smash burger.  I couldn't understand why they called it that.  Except that is a new term for a trend in burgers these days.  Since one is opening up in town with just that name (Smash Burger) on Grant and Swan.The burger was very plain and tasteless.  Also ordered the Mahi tacos which just got a so so for us.  The highlight was the fish and chips.  Actually, the fish was made to perfection.  Crispy, dry on the outside with a beautiful white fish inside.  I'd highly recommend that.  The fries were very plain and ordinary to say the least.  Ordered the salad on the happy hour and it was totally bland. I would come back just for the fish and disregard the chips. The service was fine.  We had a lovely, cheery server.  The place is trendy and quite lovely with the views of the mountains.  By the time we left the place was hopping mostly at the bar.  It is definitely worthwhile going to.  I love to see Restaurants do well here in Tucson. I will be back.  I'm not trying to bad mouth this place but  because I am an honest reviewer I might be coming off a little harsh.   I will be back and get the fish and try some other interesting dishes.  They do have an extensive selection of Happy Hour dishes.  Even more than other restaurants.  So certainly it is worth coming here and enjoying this trendy spot.
Very change resistant feel bland food the waiter telling each other the fuck off make for a wonderful atmosphere  one and done well not go back

chargrilled oysters---GET THEM NOW!! 

I am dreaming of them as I sit here clear across the country from Drago's
Very good food, fast and friendly service. One of the few decent breakfast places in the French Quarter. Great coffee as well! Worth the walk from anywhere in the area. You won't be disappointed!

The concept of Subway-style Mexican fast food has been around for well over a decade now, but I do remember that Qdoba was an early pioneer in that format.  

The Qdoba at Clay Terrace is situated toward the middle of the outdoor mall, near the Corner Bakery.  I've always found the service to be decent, and the food quality is on par with other quick-serve Mexican fast food restaurants of its kind.  Qdoba has made an effort in recent years to change their menu and have it keep pace with changing customer tastes and dining habits.  I usually stick with the tried & true menu items, like the Queso burrito.  It's not exactly calorie-friendly, but it's a crowd pleaser.
Did not eat here, but had a few drinks. It's a good bar to catch a game and feel a good sports bar vibe. Darts are always fun to if you know how to keep track of your own score.

By far one of my favorite places to grab sushi/hibachi in the city. Super inexpensive. Kind of a hole in the wall-- not a place you'd necessarily go unless you know about it. But honestly, I go here 2-3 times a week and it never gets old. It's pretty hard to find a place that has sushi AND hibachi that doesn't cost a fortune per person.. 

Anyways, I always get the same thing: crunchy roll + miso and my boyfriend gets hibachi steak & shrimp (which comes with fried rice, hibachi veggies, and miso).. The grand total generally comes out to be about $25. **if it's during their lunch special (which lasts until 4:00 on weekdays, it's about $19)... ENOUGH SAID.

I honestly have nothing bad to say about this place, they never ever disappoint. I highly recommend it!!
Very good, lots of unique dishes; would recommend the burger on pao de queijo with yucca fries, and the coxinha chicken-filled pastry
First time back here 20 years. It was delicious. Clams, muscles, pork tacos and chip and salsa of course. Delicious and spicy.
Great food great service!!  One of my favorite places to eat. Love going on Tuesdays bite and then going to the movies.

I wasn't really expecting to love Hablo Taco based on the mixed Yelp reviews, but I actually really liked it!

Upon arrival, I noted a very touristy vibe in here (daiquiri machines on the walls, over the top decor, etc).  I was a bit nervous about the food due to this, but the food was actually very very good.

I started with a sangria rita (2 of my favorite things mixed together).  It was a very large drink and for the size, I don't think that the $9 price tag was too bad.  We started with the sriracha guacamole (YUM) and the loaded queso (it had bacon in it) and both were very tasty.  For my meal I had the grilled avocado (filled with fresh ahi tuna and crema sauce) and the Mexican street corn.  The ahi tuna was SO incredibly fresh and the avocado was just perfect - highly recommend this dish.  The Mexican street corn was also very well done and quite scrumptious!  Everyone at my table was happy with their meals from tacos to salads.

Our server was very sweet and was prompt on refilling our chips and getting us anything we requested.   Honestly, I had a very good experience here and I look forward to coming back in the future.

The staff was very friendly as you walk in, the atmosphere is very inviting. Food was very delicious,  I had the Morning Meditation and the chickichanga with side of artisian toast. It was all extremely tasty! Will definitely be back when we visit Tucson again. How I wish we had a FW back home.

Friendly neighborhood bar located just south of Forest Park across I-64. Hadn't been in a while, but went recently for their Improv Comedy Night. I watched one act before heading downstairs to watch the Jets-Pats game. This place is a great little dive where the servers make you feel right at home. 

They've got cheap drinks and any and all St. Louis sports to watch. When it comes to food I'd highly recommend the fried chicken. Had it a while back and it was some of the best! If you're looking for a place to grab a decent bite to eat, not feel overwhelmed with crowds or noise and to just watch a game this is a great place to go.

We live a few miles from the toasted monkey. Have been there multiple times and have never been disappointed. The food has always been awesome.  breakfast is our favorite. And service has always been pleasant at the back and front of restaurant. I am really surprised with some of the review. Bathrooms on back can use some help.

The burgers aren't bad. The meat is quite flavourful, but seemed to seriously lack salt/pepper. The onion rings and fries were both so-so, nothing special. They didn't have dijon or brown mustard, which I found odd for a gourmet burger place. I'm also not so sure why they're using chopped iceburg lettuce on the burger since chopped lettuce creates a serious bun slippage problem. Overall, it's a good burger, but it could be so much better with a few changes. My wife did like the fact that the "Snack Burger" is perfect in size for her rather small appetite, and it's only $4 so that's a plus.

Best vegan food!  I am obsessed with their gyros!  So amazing and I love the coleslaw and French fries, and although I try to limit my fries (it is hard to do because they are the best!), I still get them.

Service is great too.
they started taking my order at 10:20 and said that they were already on lunch. even though all the breakfast menus were still out...

If you want something from this Starbucks you need to go through the drive-through. The wait times are extremely long. You go inside hoping to get your drink and as you watch them serve every car in the drive-through before they get to your order it is frustrating. I've given this place about six tries now but it has consistent customer service. I think I'll take a pass.
Lives up to the hype. Thank you. I do wish the portions were a little more "shareable" on some of the small plates.

Two people can eat for $20, if they don't order drinks. I love the veggie burger. The fries and onion rings are great, too. It's a nice outdoor setting, if the weather is fine. 101 Freeway is right there, so that can be a bit noisy.

The kids behind the counter are fast, efficient and helpful. Lots of smiles.

My only gripe is that some people allow their kids to run around, with noticeably little to no supervision. We were having a really nice lunch, until a little girl (definitely old enough to know better) wouldn't let up on chasing birds. Around and around she went, terrorizing the birds.  Mommy didn't even look up. 

The sandbox is a nice feature, and I noticed kids making new friends, which was sweet.

The ribeye is delicious and so are the sides that came with it.

It was cooked perfectly and service was excellent.

I recommend coming here. Although pricey, I would still come back.

The staff was so kind when I went the other morning. The food is also very delicious. Only problem was that I was surprised that the cinnamon roll wasn't as fresh as I expected for the early hour that I was there.
I'm strictly reviewing this place for their BBQ Shrimp since it's my first visit and this is what I had,,,, Awesome!

Close this review right now and start driving to The Shoppes at New Tampa.  Leave regret in your rearview mirror and don't EVER question your decision to drive the extra 17 minutes to Asian Buffet. 

Sure it's going to cost $1 more, but that's what it takes to avoid the deep sadness I'm feeling right now.  The differences between a $7.99 and $8.99 experience are astounding:

For starters, eating in a poorly planned cafeteria setting with power cords all over the walls and very misleading food images posted in the windows as you enter VS a modest exterior and an immediate eyeful of a buffet that punches you in the face with possibilities before you're brought to one of three separate dining areas.

Secondly, taking a first plate that already feels like you've settled for disappointment and shouda, woulda, coulda's VS a first plate that hasn't even scratched the surface of what looked delicious.

Third, did I mention how sad I am right now??

Fourth, 2 servers, 1 hibachi/sushi chef and 1 buffet attendant VS more staff than you can shake a stick at.  Don't get me wrong, this place has really nice servers but something has to make up for the stingy buffet tables they can't afford to even keep half full...

...and that's where I'll finish this up.  Compared to Asian Buffet, this place is a food desert and I had to fight through a scattered mess of fried or cheese covered insanity to find anything remotely Asian and/or healthy.  The move by places like this to cheapen their culinary culture to feed a bunch of fat Americans more calories than Asians will consume in a week is disgusting on so many levels.  I guess if you throw enough gawdy neon lights in a place and slap up a fish tank I'm supposed to be impressed by your exotic oriental heritage???

I'm over it.  The only thing Imperial here is the amount of failure they managed to pack into a single hour of my life!

Well we gave the Wing House another try and the wings were fabulous! A shot out to Olivia our server who I am sure made it happen. Thank you to Matthew the mgr. who stood there while I tried them to make sure they were good.

I go to this place pretty much every time I visit my parent in Gulfport and I am fan.I love the happy hour specials. If you are a local you get a card and you get happy hour all day everyday so having my parents live there always gives me a discount. The staff is very friendly, the drinks aren't expensive. It's a great place to sit down with friends and have some drinks and catch up. The upstairs section has a great view of the beach and it's definitely worth checking out!

Absolutely excellent. Wonderful service and amazing food. The chef is an artist with very innovative flavors. Had the falafel cakes, the artichokes, a spinach fettuccine pasta special that was literally one of the best pastas of my life and the cardamom waffles. Everything we tried struck the perfect balance between being light but still flavorful.

A lot of character. Food was good. Our family's order included roasted chicken, fried feast platter, fried green tomatoes. Portions were big, food flavorful, prices normal. Was convenient to our stay at the Gaylord Marriott.

Before Katrina I survived on August Moon's special fried rice from Prytania location bc it was tasty, they brought it to me and I would eat on it for days.  On an adventure to the WB with a friend, we decided to check it out before heading back to the EB.  Of course we were not let down.  We arrived still in time for the lunch special.  The special includes your choice of a fried yummy treat and soup.  I ordered the moo goo gai pan with crab rangoons and egg drop soup.  This combo is one of my personal faves.  I can eat it every day.  I have to say though, this isn't THE best Chinese food I've ever had, but it's freak'n pretty close.  And for the cost of this meal... $13.00!!!  Yup!

One thing I must mention that I wasn't pleased with was the service.  Our server needs to step up her game.  

Bc this place is new, it's much nicer then it's sister restaurant.  They Prytania location needs some updating with the decor fo sho.  I usually either pick up my order or have it delivered but still the atmosphere and decor is old school.
My favorite lunch spot on the Main Line!  A true gem.  BEST service - friendliest staff - scrumptious food!

My sweetie and I visited Harry's last week for happy hour and were not disappointed!  The service was excellent!  Our server was friendly, funny and attentive!  I had the loaded fries and they were da' bomb!  Great place to unwind after work or to meet friends for a drink and munchies!  We will definitely be back!

Very solid meal, hot chicken was as good as Hattie B's in Nashville. Garlic fries we're super drenched in garlic sauce tasted perfect.
As an added bonus they have a manager dude who is a Dopplegang for gus fring, the chicken guy from breaking bad.  Topped it off with a PBR, great meal!

Great location, Brunch buffet has a really good variety, and the mimosas were tasty and inexpensive ($4 with the Brunch buffet). On the bad side, they apparently allow dogs in the outdoor dining area (there was someone there with a large dog while I was dining) and the valet (whom I realize do not work for Jackson's Bistro) kept a $3 tip for himself without asking (I would have tipped him that much, but he just gave me $10 back from a twenty for a $7 valet fee. I don't support those tactics), was seen by another in my party driving recklessly in the garage, and when I picked up my vehicle both attendants left to retrieve cars and they left the lockbox open and with the key to the box in the lock, with people's car keys in the box.
Good local/sports bar.  Excellent wings!!  I suggest the hot and honey.  The rest of the menu is above average bar food.

I ordered potato soup and a Reuben sandwich. Food was less than mediocre. Hostess and waitress were rude. The restaurant was empty except for one other party. Over priced for the quality of food. Would not recommend.

Always great food, nice vibe and the wait staff is always friendly. 
If you don't like Hoaglin to Go, you will be in trouble finding a great place to eat in Indianapolis.

Now I understand why everyone says drive the extra few minutes to Fat City. it just missed the mark. Our server was super polite, and she actually saved the experience. The food was just ok, though. If you're a tourist, and haven't experienced the culinary wonders of New Orleans than this will suffice. More expensive and not nearly as good as the original. It's worth the 15 minute trip to Metairie.

Gyspie Elise is just one of the best life voice I heard. She is fantastic. 
Too bad she sings in this bar where you can not drink unless you wait 20 min (minimum) at the bar (when send you to another bar tender to make your cocktail), whereas it is not crowded. 
2 stars for the wait ... This is sad because cocktails were really good.

I grew up eating Korean foods.  I only did the take out and the bibimbap was amazingly superb.  The kuchujang sauce was just right for me.  Not too spicy with enough kick. The bowl was very filling or maybe I was to hungry.. Lol.  Nevertheless the veggies we're fresh and the bulgogi was super tender. Like I said earlier this is kick ass good stuff, right down to the perfectly cooked rice.  I like the fact that it came with miso soup.  The miso was also delicious. Good value for all this food. 
The Kim bap reminded me of what they call in South Korea "drug" Kim bap. It's called that because it's addicting and you can't stop eating it! 
Im going to have to come back and try the stone pot bibimbap and jop chae

Service was awesome.
Delicious tuna tartare & boiled shrimp.  Lovely outside dining.

When I was in Delaware for a leisure and business trip, I decided to take my friend to Buffalo Wild Wings for dinner because he has never been there before. It was a tremendous place with lots of TV's so we didn't miss a minute of all the NFL games, but the service was spotty as we ordered a traditional and boneless wings plate and it wasn't ready until 20-25 minutes later. BWW is a sit down restaurant and bar, but the wait time should be a little shorter. Overall, the food was not bad and we got what we paid for, I guess.
Love the vibe of this place & the coffee is delicious. You really get a neighborhood feeling & everyone is always so friendly. I look forward to trying the food.

Sunday Jazz Brunch
BBQ Shrimp
Bloody Mary

Based on a recommendation by a local store owner, we squeezed Mr. B's Bistro into our NOLA foodie sojourn.  It wasn't difficult really, as yelper Chris T. says, because I called the afternoon before and getting into Sunday Brunch was eezy peezy.  Definitely nothing like getting into Commander's Palace...(yea, I'm a little bitter about being turned away for not having a lunch reservation and making the $14 cab ride over)

The band for Sunday brunch was great; they took requests and were talented for what we've thus seen.  And though the layout of Mr. B's makes it seem like there are 'no good seats in the house', the band travels around sections of the restaurant.  What a treat! 

Now, the food and the cocktail were delicious.  Then, why did I give them 3 stars???!!!  The BBQ shrimp sauce was a little too salty for me and the shrimp a little overdone (peel and eat shrimp).  My boyfriend was impressed with it and it was his choice dish, so I could understand his tasty review.  However, my other thought was, I can't believe this costs $22/$28(?)!  Likewise, my little Bloody Mary was $6...we had a Bloody Mary twice the size at Bourbon House later that day (maybe not as well made).  

Mind you, I realized that we lucked out this weekend on being present during Restaurant Week and I'm sure I got sucked into believing the lower prices exist everywhere in NOLA...

But, Mr. B's was not worth the $$$ to me.  The service was just fine and the food as well...Perhaps, I'm not a believer of Dickie Brennan establishments...

Above and beyond any other juice company I have tried. Their bowls with raw coconut and honey on them are AMAZING. You can taste the difference between them and other juice companies and tho you have to walk inside the factory to get to their shop, it's well worth the price and the walk. They have a juice truck around town too.

My girlfriend and I were at Indeblue this Wednesday, and I am happy to say that this neo Indian (I like to call it food with a contemporary classicist flair) restaurant did not disappoint and impressed our hungry stomachs. I was compelled to make an instant comparison with Tashan on several levels.
What stood out immediately was the decor while we were being led into the restaurant...Indian motifs with a modern flair, again reminiscent of Tashan perhaps..but it certainly had its  unique appeal. The location of Indeblue in my mind will be key to its success. Tashan feels a tad far out for the likes of us that like to sip and hang around the Walnut/Chestnut to South St. types of locales.
The menu does not disappoint either- they have a great spread of appetizers, entrees, veggie options and naans. The cocktail list looked like a cheery collection of Inde-Bollywood style names and fun flavors. We got the Bollywood sparkler (?) and the Chai tea sangria. The chai tasted better than Bollywood sparkler (this tasted too bubbly/frizzy for me) - the sangria was light and had hints of chai and brandy- a great combo to get a pitcher of, though it didn't sound appetizing in its description.
The service was worthy of nothing. Well informed servers that were good with suggestions. Don't get me wrong.. I am perfectly capable of choosing my tikkas, naans and rasams but given that the menu had an obvious personal flair of the chefs cooking style, it always helps to see how keen the chef is on informing the staff on his/her offerings. 
To start we had the long hots and the crispy veg. chilli- to me a rendition of the stuffed long green chillies and the Indo-Chinese Hakka noodles. The paneer mozzarella combo in the green chillies were perfect-creamy, the chillies added bite and the tangy tomato sauce rounded the flavour off. The veg chilli had zucchinis in it (which I found interesting) but was a good subtle complement to the bold/spicy sauce (more gravy than sauce). The veggies had not lost their crunch despite the sauce on the noodles. To those familiar with Indo-Chinese food-the addition of the 3 side sauces (vinegar w/ green chillies, green chilli sauce and soy) completed my experience of eating this glamorized version of hakka noodles. spot on!!
For the main course, we had a meat and a veg option. Both were superb in their portion sizes, taste, flavour. We ordered the stuffed squash (this came with saffron rice) and osso bucco pork vindaloo. 
The meat dish came with bone in which was perfect, the meat was melt in your mouth worthy cooked. It was a great meat, potatoes and gravy dish that is typically comfort food for me.  The vindaloo gravy did not have the pungency of vinegar that I seek, but completed the dish just fine.  I can see how an overpowering amount of vinegar can turn customers away from this dish. The garlic naan was fresh, however I am not sure if it was made in a tandoor or sigri, and I could taste uncooked flour in some parts of the bread- I chose to overlook this. The stuffed squash in my girlfriend's words- it was creamy (perhaps slightly excessively so) but very tasty, very well cooked, could have had a hint bit more of spice but she enjoyed it overall. If this was a take on "malai kofta" it was certainly well executed.
Overall, I would go back and recommend it to others. Chef Rakesh Ramola certainly had the right idea with opening IndeBlue here in Philly. The prices could be comparable to Tashan, the food is just as good as Tashan's Chef Shende and Chef Senat. Where it beats Tashan is the location and the restaurant size. The location is always popping (regardless of weather or economic paucity), the place's size will make certain that it looks full even on days where only a few occupy the bar and tables- a definite draw for guests to peer in.

We were here on a Thursday evening. There was a crowd around the bar, but the rest of the place was empty. There was only one other booth occupied.
The beer selection was great. I had the poutine (meh... not enough gravy; I wouldn't order it again) and the chicken & goat cheese salad (really, really good).  
Service was super-friendly. The only downside was that we ate with our coats on, because it was COLD in there.

The only reason this restaurant is getting one star is because I do think they had a fantastic French silk pie!! But at this location the management staff is absolutely horrible and very unprofessional! I've never had this bad of an experience at village inn! We waited over an 45 mins for food. The pancakes came out burnt, the crêpe was very bland and the texture was horrible. Another member of our party had all you can eat fish sticks but couldn't receive a second order because we would have been waiting over an hour. I desperately wish I would have taken pictures to show how bad the food looked, however our party was so shocked and tried to show the management how this was unacceptable. They were obviously overwhelmed by the amount of people that were complaining. It seemed like every table in the restaurant wanted to talk to management.

My business partner and I went here to celebrate and ordered some incredible beer and a wonderful Brie appetizer.  Food was great, beer was fantastic and frankly this is the best this site has ever been. We are looking forward to coming back soon.

They forgot that they are in the service industry.  I stayed there for a 3-day business retreat that was being held at the hotel.  The décor is nice and what you would expect from a hotel of this class but the service didn't come close to matching.  

As a result of weather delays, I arrived a day late and missed the 1st morning of meetings so when I finally got to check-in, I was in a rush.  While standing in line at the front desk, I checked in on the phone app.  This meant I only had to show my ID and receive my card keys.  While checking in,  there was a notice that housekeeping services would only be every 4th day.  While I don't really care about having my room cleaned, I'm no slob and I only slept there, I did want my bed made daily (not sheets changed, just made) and I meant to mention it to the clerk.  Unfortunately, by the time I got to the desk, I forgot and no one brought it up. 

Later that afternoon, after my meetings concluded and I had a chance to shower, I called down to the front desk to request that my bed be made.  I was told, in no uncertain terms that they would not accommodate my request because of the Pandemic (of course there is no evidence of transmission from soft surfaces like cloth or why would they ask us to wear face coverings?)

The next day, while in meetings, I found out that one of my colleagues was getting daily service so that afternoon I called to speak to a manager.  He told me that it was too late in the day to get it done but he would have it done the next day.  Since it was mid-afternoon, I replied that was unacceptable, I had asked for the service the day before and was lied to that it wasn't available and I expected it today, he refused stating housekeeping had already assigned the rooms for the day.  After getting off the phone I stepped out of my room and ran into a housekeeper.  I asked her, she checked with her boss and amazingly, they were able to accommodate me.  

Not only did the desk manager not even try to accommodate me, but he also failed to have the service set up for the following day.  This was an epic service failure that I would expect from a mom and pop.  I've received better service from Best Westerns.  I would never stay here by choice.

Place has decent food, cold beer, plenty of TVs and the staff not hard to look at. 
But.......beware they will get you by padding the bill. Order 2 beers, they charge you fir 3 or 4. Add an extra 0 to your tip amount. Guess they hoping your drunk enough when the bill comes that you won't notice or just pay it anyway. If you go, always look at your bill and save your receipt. Better yet pay cash, or go someplace else.

I had been wanting to stop and try this place from the first time I saw it opened. Finally, I made time to go have lunch. I ordered the veggie crepe. I was impressed with the flavor of the crepe as well as the abundance of veggies. I was not happy with the service. For a new establishment the person at the register was not very friendly or helpful.  I felt like it was a bother for her to wait on me. Maybe a bad day for her, but lasting impression on me.

Very satisfied with my food.    I had the chicken avocado wrap with ranch dressing.   Best ranch I've had in a while.    Hubby had a burger.   It was a nice size and cooked they way he requested.   Overall a very nice lunch experience.   Will definitely come back.   Atmosphere is nice and cozy.

This coffee shop is such a find! I stopped in for an iced latte which was the best I've had, but I also had to try their Affogato which is espresso over vanilla ice cream. Delicious! 
Ask Joe the owner about his special drinks, because there are far too many to include on his blackboard. Will need to make this a new favorite stop!

I usually do not go to bars, but we decided to give this one a try! Our waitress Lillian gave her recommendations and gave us great service! She was very knowledgeable about the menu, talkative, and attentive. Had a nice small dinner with no complains.

I love Seasons! Everything are so goodd BUT service needs more work! Ordered an Ice green tea with mixed jelly and small shaved coffee to go and took almost 30mins. My shaved ice was ready but waiting to get notice by the counter if I didnt bother to have my order followed up, could have taken forever.

It's so hard to rate these individual places at sparkman wharf since it's really just the food your reviewing. 

There was a little bit of a wait to put my order in, but the young lady behind the register was very polite. She helped me decide which oysters to go with. I don't like mine too fishy or too big, so I'm glad the ones she recommended were small and delicious.

Once you place your order there is a bit of a wait to get tour food. This isn't a bad thing because you know your food is fresh and the oysters come directly out of the shell. However, they are a bit pricey I feel and I don't think the quality is worth the price. 

Overall, if you want something small and on a date night at sparkman wharf I say why not?
We were here for a Christmas Eve dinner after picking up family from airport.  Wonderful food, waiter and atmosphere.  Parking was easily accessible.

I wanted to like this place so bad, but I can't :(
Our service was sub par. You can't do substitutions, which made me a little disappointed because I would've preferred hash browns instead of pancakes but as our waitress said: " That just isn't allowed.." okay fine that's alright. But then I witnessed one of the servers touch and flip over someone's pancakes that just came out ready with her bare hands before taking them to her guests.. I AM VERY CONFUSED. Especially during Covid this made no sense to me and seemed very unsanitary. Additionally the floor was extremely slippery & I almost fell walking to and from the restroom. I'm not sure guys. The food was tasty but service says so much & this just wasn't it.

Stopped by on the way home from dinner.  Nice looking space and welcome addition to the historic 'hood.  Great drinks.  Friendly and attentive bar staff gave us a peek at the menu, which looks small but appealing.  Looking forward to becoming a regular.

Best Sushi in Nola proper. High quality fresh fish. Good service. Also delivers, but I opt for cooked food instead of sushi for delivery for obvious reasons. I love hole in the wall joints and this is a top notch one, no frills just good eats. Habachi isn't cooked at the table so don't come lol king for a show, sushi presentation is decent but it's the quality and price that keeps me coming back. Try off menu items like the hamachi Kama for a treat and don't forget to order fresh wasabi for your sushi(once you've had the ground root you can forget about that horseradish stuff).

My first experience here was just grabbing a slice of pepperoni during Mardi Gras.  It was so good that I just couldn't wait to go back there.  When I finally did they gave me a free order of garlic knots just to try out with my slice of pepperoni pizza.  Since then Epic has been a staple on my list of go to-pizza places.  Their pizza really is that good.  The garlic knots themselves are delectable and my wife fell in love with them.   They're also directly next door to I-tap, probably the best draft beer bar in St. Louis.  

That said...the service at Epic has dropped with each subsequent service.  We've always explained that we were planning to eat at I-tap and this initially was not a problem.  They would always bring it right over to us.  Now we've been dealing with an older male, not sure of his name, who is very gruff and short.  He seems annoyed just by your presence in the establishment, especially once you mention I-tap.  However usually a woman, in glasses, brings over our garlic knots, which we get out first.  Then she also delivers our pizza to us.  By contrast she is very friendly and polite.  

With all that said...my wife and I decided to hit up I-tap and Epic this past Sunday evening.  There was a younger, short haired blonde girl working at the time we walked in.  We thought we were in for a refresher from the usual grumpy service we'd received of late from Epic.  We received almost exactly the opposite.  We explained at first that we would be eating it at I-Tap and asked to get our garlic knots out first.  She stated to us "that they go in at the same time so I'm not sure they will make it out beforehand."  This has never been a problem in the past and we've always gotten them out at least 5-10 minutes before our pizza.  We went along with it though, thinking things may not be different than in the past.

Well things were very different.  She brought over our large pepperoni pizza and the garlic knots, and smugly stated "that the pizza wound up coming out first anyways."  Which I find impossible that a pizza can cook faster than it takes to throw the garlic bites into a fryer.  The garlic knots have absolutely zero garlic butter on them at all.  We are talking bone dry.  So my wife had to get up to go over there and ask for a side of the garlic butter.  

I could maybe understand any of this if Epic was busy.  However there was one other family in the restaurant that already had their food, so it's not like they were getting bogged down with orders.  

Let me state that I get that it must be frustrating to have a place like I-tap next door so nobody purchases their beer.  Let's look at the facts though..they aren't even offering any good beer!  They offer up the crappy Inbev special of Bud selections!  Why should I even entertain the idea of drinking that beer?  

Secondly...my wife and I tip at least a full 20% share every time.  Not that this means you have to give me great service, but at least be courteous as I'm giving this to you before you even have provided any service to me as the customer.  If they really wanted to they honestly could ask us to come pick up the pizza in x-amount of minutes and we would be glad to do so.  I don't think they should expect the same tip for this service, but if they are truly annoyed to be doing business as they currently do...they could switch to this model. 

I honestly do love Epic's pizza, but this sort of service may have done it in for me.
Great place to stop for a beer and something to eat, while waiting for a train back to CC.  The Pork Gui lettuce wraps are excellent!

This place was goood. I was in Nashville for a friend's bachelorette. Since planning meals for six girls and a gay guy in a new city across the country is a hit or miss situation, I took to Yelp and open table, chose places, and crossed my fingers and toes. I did good and got bridesmaid points by choosing The Old School. We talked about the damn meal for the rest of the trip. Some of us probably dreamed about it. I know I did.

We went for brunch and everyone was very impressed. That says a lot since we have a variety of nice brunch options at home. We ordered so much we could barely move. Everything was amazing. The best way to put it is this: you've never had eggs and bacon in your life until you've had freshly harvested and slaughtered eggs and bacon. The food is just different. The ingredients are all fresh from their farm and the texture is amazing. The donuts are fluffy pieces of heaven to die for. It's ok to have beer with breakfast because they make beermosas. Vacation carbs don't count. Order the pastry board.

It randomly snowed that morning so we couldn't see the animals that are fated to go into the menu. The outside atmosphere is so cute. The building is so rustic, the grounds are very pretty and quaint, with old schoolhouse picnic benches surrounded by gardens from which the vegetables and herbs are harvested from. Just with that experience alone, you immediately forget that you ate Wilbur's delicious cousin. Probably won't be back soon, but I definitely recommend this place to anyone in Nashville.

I've heard nothing but great things about this restaurant from friends, coworkers and family. So I decided to take my parents there this morning for breakfast since they are in from out of town for the holidays. We were seated within seconds of coming in. The hostess was friendly and took us to our seats. We were greeted with in seconds after sitting down by our waitress (Mandy). She was very kind, bubbly, and a absolute pleasure. Probably one of the best waitresses I have ever had. She asked us if we had ever been here before and when we said "no", she told us a bit about the place, drinks and the menu. We ordered the hazelnut coffee which was awesome. She brought us water to go along with it (we didn't even have to ask, it was like she knew). She was very familiar with the menu and answered any and all questions. I had the featured item of the month the banana bread french toast with eggs and bacon. It was absolutely heaven in my mouth. My mom had the crab cake Benedict and ranch potatoes which was also great and my dad had the GIANT blueberry pancake with eggs and turkey sausage, yum yum! Our food was hot, tasty, and very fresh and good. I know I will definitely be back and my parents too everytime they come to visit. I would give this place a 9 out of 10. The service was great, food was awesome, the restaurant itself was very nicely decorated and felt warm and inviting. The only down fall was the parking lot. It seemed a bit small for the volume of traffic coming in and out, but I know that's not their fault. We will definitely be back!!! Very happy customers!

Holy crap! What a wonderful culinary experience. The biscuits r outta this world and the wait is almost NONEXISTENT! We had 7 people, came in during peak hours, and we had almost no wait time after we ordered. AWESOME!

This place is awesome.

I had the Fish Mohito Patacone sandwich, and it was one of the best sandwiches I've had in a while. It was fish between two fried plantains with cheese, arugula, and some delicious sauces. You could also get a chicken or beef patacones. I also had the chicken soup, which was also very good. It was like a chicken corn chowder soup. 

The service is very quick and the staff is incredibly nice, attentive, and you can tell they really care about the quality of their food and restaurant. 

I plan on going back again and would definitely recommend to a friend.

Its the worst experience I have had at a hookah bar. Even thought he hookah was good the service was horrible.  The crazy amount of tip that they make u pay even though they don't deserve it n they don't even know how to handle their customers. They crazy rule they have that they only accept two cards per table. I mean for a party of 9 not everyone carries cash n our bill was huge so he should accommodate. We had to ask them for water or coal each time n when we got the 7 course meal they kept bringing our courses together like they wanted to kick us out. Never go back here again!!!

Carne asada. That is all. 
 
Ambiance - More of an upscale restaurant with plenty of seating. 
 
 Service - Efficient and friendly especially since we were very indecisive. 
 
 Food - Had some of the appetizers but the carne asada was hands down so so good. Tender and flavorful with enough to share between two people. 
 
Overall, more of an expensive place to eat, but it's good food if you're looking for a nice date night.

Came here with a buddy on a very busy night and were able to find two seats at the bar. The hostess warned us about a potentially long wait for food but we decided to stick it out. As soon as we sat down we were greeted by the bartender, Cerbi. As a bartender and server she was perfect. Attentive but not overbearing. She would chat with us when we wanted and leave us alone when we didn't. Professionally one of the best fine dining bartenders I've encountered. We started with some delicious pints of local ale, Barrio Blonde. Then we asked our bartender for some app suggestions. Within 15 maybe 20 minutes we had our appetizers. THE BEST PORK BELLY EVER! You must order this dish! When our apps arrived we order our entrees and got those about 20 minutes after finishing app completion.  We tried the house special pork saltimbocca and the alaskan halibut. Both were very nice! I was craving scallops all night but my friend wasn't into scallops so I'll have to come back by myself for those as they looked amazing! Finally we finished with the cannoli dessert! This was incredible! I don't even like desserts but this was devine! I dunked them all up in my Irish coffee! So good! Can't wait to come back! You need to "treat yo self" and have dinner here. I love eating at the bar but the dining room looked lovely as well. Great date spot I assume especially with it being in the resort with a great view.

I'm shocked I haven't written about the Institute, because I've been here tons of times.  

There's a lot to like about this bar:  It's close to work (for me).  It's got a chill atmosphere and is never too crowded.  The beer list is good.  The happy hour is every day of the week and features $2 off drafts and half priced apps.  Most importantly, the Institute is always improving.  The bar has expanded along with the number of draft lines, and the kitchen has always been experimenting and getting better ever since they started serving food.

I also finally had dinner here, and the burger is delicious.  I'm pretty judgmental when it comes to cheese burgers, and the Institute was impressive.  It was perfectly cooked to order, the meat was juicy and flavorful, and the toppings and bun are good quality.  All of these are essential for a great burger.

I'll continue to hit up this joint and look forward to seeing how they improve.  Maybe Quizzo?

This place is an adorable house in Greenwood that specializes in wine and Italian-esque food. In the summer, you can sit outside, under a gazebo, if you're lucky to score seats. The service is slightly slow, but perfect if you're just wanting to sit back, drink wine, and eat food. 

We ordered the goat cheese and caramelized onion pizza with the baked brie as an appetizer. The appetizer came out fairly quickly, but our pizza order apparently got lost. The server informed us and gave us a free appetizer while we waited, which was awesome. The brie was amazing, but I love brie so I might be biased. It came with a blackberry jam, which complimented the cheese nicely. The pizza was just okay. I wouldn't order it again, but I'm curious to try other things from the menu. Overall, good first impression of this place. I'd love to come back to drink more wine and try some other foods.

I finally got to try Seoul Fried Chicken the other night, and I think my mind is blown. I went for the five-piece combo with original chicken, slaw as my salad, and the corn fritter as my side (as opposed to fries). The chicken was crunchy and extremely juicy, while the slaw was fresh and had lots of hearty carrot in it. I loved the corn fritter, which was served in a milky, sweet liquid. I did not find the chicken too greasy, and the price point was great. The place is rather small with most people doing take out. You might have a hard time finding a seat if you want to dine in during the lunch or supper rush.

I just went here again for the third time for my Mom's birthday. Of course, it was another great experience. The waiter was very nice and very down to eart. The atmosphere is very quiet, romantic, and intimate. It's pretty dark in there, but we didn't mind. Everyone enjoyed their food and drinks. My mom and I took part in the devour downtown menue which was an excellent deal, 3 courses for $30 bucks. My mom had filet and I had the seafood fetuccine which was really good but I did pick out the scallops. I've tried scallops at many different restaurants and just can't get over the texture so this isn't to speak to the quality of the scallops at this restaurant. My mom let me have some of her filet and it was incredible, tender, melt in your mouth steak. Fantastic new england clam chowder which is a soup I don't even like and won't eat unless I'm at 14 west. This is without a doubt my favorite local place. I've never had a bad meal. This was the first time I didn't order the lobster mac and cheese, but for the record, that dish is incredible and an appetizer which I usually order as my entree. Yes, it is pricey, but check out restaurant.com for gift certificates on the cheap. Also, I noted on my open table reservation that it was my mom's birthday and both the hostess and waiter wished her a happy birthday. It's nice touches like that that really show the true class of a restaurant and that they really care about their patrons. Park at mall parking right next door, it should only cost 1.50 for up to three hours.

Loved the toasted ravioli appetizer. The meat in it was superior quality as opposed to what you would find off the shelf or other places. Great filet. Probably would not order the carnivore potatoes again. Stephanie was great!

I was shopping in Green hill and wanted mediterranean food. I saw Kalamata's restaurant and pull in. I'll give this restaurant a five star it's small plane,excellent wait staff. Food to savior. I ordered Lentil soup, today's special which was my Mahi-Mahi made to order(When I order fish I asked for it to be a little less cooked) (there is nothing worse than over cooked fish ) Greek salad and a garlic knot. I asked for hot sauce for my soup. I'm addicted to spice. Kalamata make their own. It was so very good. If ever in green Hills area give this restaurant a try. You will savior the taste all day.

The food was sub par and their delivery service was so atrocious I never even bothered with them again.  You would think that an establishment right next to a major University would know the apartments and townhomes on campus for delivery purposes.  

The delivery guy was not only completely unprofessional both on the phone and in person, he refused to drive around and find my townhouse, and 'required' me to meet him in person on campus--I walked nearly as far to meet him that I could have almost made it to the damned restaurant in the first place.  To top it off, he demanded a tip and was angry when he believed I didn't tip him enough.

Never. Again.

I'd give it zero stars, but have to give one...prices are cheap(ish) at least.

Best breakfast in Tampa Bay! Two fried Eggs, back bacon (cut in-house), authentic English sausages & baked beacons, black pudding, fried tomato & English loaf toast. 

Wash down with a cup of English tea followed by an in-house brewed pint & the English Premier League on the projector screen. Available 10am Saturday & 11am Sundays (opening times) to 1pm. 

One of the highlights of my week, simply amazing.

Beautiful quick fresh food, this place is a refreshing change in the community. Kids eat free on the weekends and the variety is wonderful. Walking in reminds me of a place you would see in nyc or Miami, thank goodness someone in north North Pinellas is thinking progressively about our food options definitely 5 stars, employees are very nice attentive and food quality is great.

Wow, just wow. We had an appetizer of Spanish Octopus. It was tender and melted in the mouth. Cooked to perfection. For our dinner we split the Wolffish Check special. It was amazing. They split it on 2 plates for us. Little things that make a difference. Finally for dessert we had the cannoli. Being from NY I'm a bit of a cannoli snub and this one was amazing.
My mom and I really enjoyed our visit here. Food was yummy and staff very friendly. The band was great!

Casey our waitress from last night was AMAZING. She made our night. The venue and atmosphere are great, but she went above and beyond to be super nice and helpful. She was WAAAYYY better than the other waitress that waited on us, so much so that we had our tab transferred to her and will certainly sit at her section if she's working next time we go there. Thanks Casey!!

This place has great food but management is TERRIBLE!! They are very unprofessional and treat their employees badly hence why they are understaffed . They stole my husbands tips and we had to contact the BBB to get his money. I would NEVER give them my money again until they have better management.

Food was decent but nothing to brag about. I liked the balcony on the second floor. You can look down on all the foot traffic but I never made it to the rooftop bar. The waiter was too slow in bringing the check and we sat with a table full of dirty dishes just waiting DoD him to bring the check for at least 30 min. I guess he was in the weeds that night.

Update,  the guy that is always there that runs the place was killing it today.  He was the only one in there handling order taking, preparation, and delivery by him self.  He did it all cool, calm, and collected.  Way to go DJ's!
My girlfriend and I got take out from here last weekend.  It was reasonably priced but the food was underwhelming.  There are better Indian options but the Green Chile will do in a pinch.

It was pretty empty when I arrived so I had some reservations.  However, the waiter/bartender was very prompt and attentive.  I ordered the ribeye and it was good.  I wouldn't say it was the best I ever tasted but it was cooked to the appropriate temperature and had a good flavor.  I ordered the calamari appetizer and it was very good.  

The singer was Mandy Cook and she was fantastic.  I had to order both albums off Itunes after leaving.  

My experience was positive so I'll probably try the hotel next time I come to Nashville.

This is the worst tasted indian food.. they charge whole lot of money for nothing...went to celebrate my wife's birthday on Wednesday dinner. It was buffet dinner night.   They didn't have Manchurian for Manchurian dish...the taste was pathetic. Anyone who know what real indian food is, they will should avoid this place.

Went 4 weeks from grand opening and was super busy-got our food fast and was good 
Went today and took 30 minutes to get our food and wasn't super busy
Very disappointed- family of 5 
Seemed to be in charge a Hispanic/Japanese lady seemed to not care when I asked what is your typical delivery time-30 minutes is quite some time to wait

This is the second time I have been here and will be back again. Sushi prices are very reasonable and the fish is very fresh! The service is great because each table actually had a buzzer if you need service. How often have you been to places where it takes forever to find someone because you just want a refill on water. Haha. Drink wise at the time they also had a two for one special.

A surprisingly good little gem on the north side of town. I've been here both for brunch and dinner, although I can say that the dinner was the better of the two meals.
I got the lamb dish for dinner and was in no way. disappointed. I practically licked the plate clean. Also, if we could have, we would have taken home every stitch of table bread in that place. So good yummy!

It was a great little find on a simple summer getaway. Thanks yelp app!

We ordered a half dozen donuts, a bagel w/egg & cheese, another with cream cheese, a corned beef & cheese sandwich and I believe a coconut mocha frozen drink (can't really remember). Overall everything was good and the staff really knows how to handle a crowd as the line moved fairly quickly.

While I can't say anything in particular was outstanding, I can say it's a solid place to get your morning started!

2021 / 97
Shortn'Sweetseries

Food was awesome! Plus I have some food allergies and they made me a smoothie minus any mangos and bananas and it still tasted great! The guy behind the counter was so very nice! So enthusiastic!!! I'll definitely be going back!

I absolutely love this place.  I only drank AB products up until two years ago because my father worked there.  Upon his retirement, I have discovered a new love, Schlafly Pale Ale.  The Bottleworks is a great place to go and hang out and have a few fresh drafts.  I've eaten here numerous times and think they do a really good job on their food as well.  It seems to be a very laid back, almost yuppy type menu and vibe.  Thumbs up to Schlafly.

this was our last meal in Nashville before we came back to Ny. it did not disappoint. I didn't get to try a burger since I was still full from breakfast. I did have side orders of fries (yums) and mac&cheese (double yum) it's also cool the waiters there also sing/play guitar on stage. it was a great last stop and very close to our hotel. great place to go after exploring the orpyland hotel with the gardens & not wanting to spend $$$$ to eat there.

ONE OF THE FASTEST AND BEST COSTUMER SERVICE! I love the food here. It was so delicious. It was my first time trying fried alligator and suggest you to try it from here! You will come back for more. I didn't wait for more  than 10 min for my food And it was a busy night for them. 1000/10. One of my favorite places to go eat! I suggest you to definitely try it

Last night we celebrated our Nephew and his new wife here. The service was impeccable. The food will have you coming back for more!!! We ordered two pizzas, the meatballs, calamari, lamb skewers and the octopus. Omg, thank you universe, freaking divine flavors and seasoned perfectly. This is a restaurant that has an open kitchen and absolutely zero need for S&P on the tables. 

In addition to the quality of product, we felt really special when the champagne toast arrived. We toasted the newlyweds and chatted the night away, drunk off of laughter and full bellies. Mind you, we still ordered and devoured the tiramisu and cheesecake.

You can tell that a lot of thoughtfulness went into the planning of this tapas style menu and kudos to the chef who created these recipes! As an added bonus, Johnny Weir was in town and enjoying himself and seeing his beautiful coifed hairdo while hearing laughter and convo bouncing off the ceilings, made for a delightful and entertaining evening. 

Make sure to make reservations! We will definitely be back whenever we find ourselves in the Wilmington, De area.

In these trying times where we can't look at each at each other except than through masks my friend and I were pondering where to go for lunch. We were both thinking pizza. At the same time we said remember Shakey's pizza? He said you know? It's now Boulevard Pizza, so we called and ordered a combo pizza. The staff was amazing. The service was amazing.
