The atmosphere was amazing but the best part was the incredible delicious pizza. Never have I ever had a better pizza. It was so nostalgic. It felt almost like the OLD NORMAL. Thank you Boulevard Pizza. Keep
Up the good work!!!

I had heard great things about Good Dog, and after seeing the triple D episode, I was really excited about trying it out. A group of friends and I stopped in on a Sunday afternoon, when the place was pretty empty (one or two other tables aside from ours). I loved the dog pictures on the wall!

We were seated directly under the air conditioner and were freezing, so we very politely asked the waitress if it was possible to turn it down. She glared at us and said, "That's the bartender's job, not mine." My friend then asked, "Oh, would you mind asking him to turn it down then?" She got really sassy and said, "Well, first of all, the bartender is a SHE. And fine" before she stomped off. I am all about gender equality and not making assumptions, but there is no reason to be so nasty about an innocent (and frankly, grammatically correct) error. I work in a hospital and am mistakenly called a nurse all the time, but I don't go around berating everyone for it. Maybe this waitress was having a bad day? But seriously, if you're at work, then act like it. 

Our food also took almost 45 minutes to come out (we were still shivering this whole time, by the way, because whatever the bartender did to turn down the AC did not work), and when it did, it wasn't mind-blowing. Maybe I had expectations that were too high, but our burgers and po boys were good but not amazing. The aioli for the fries was also pretty bland, though the fries themselves were pretty decent. 

Then I had to use the restroom at one point, and I got up to ask the waitress if it was in the back. She just stared at me like I was dumb and said, "Mhm." 

Honestly, I'm really disappointed. I was hoping to find a place I could keep coming back to for a good burger and a fun atmosphere. Even though Good Dog does have character, my experience there was pretty awful. I don't think anyone should have to put up with a hostile waitress for decent food - there are plenty of amazing restaurants in Philly that have a nice staff and delicious food for a reasonable price.

This is a great lunch spot, especially if you're looking to break away from your normal routine.  The food is delicious and the service is great!  It's a good value too.  You can continue spending good money on fast food, or you can spend the same amount and get quality food.  This is quality.  The do dinner too.

Our experience was amazing! We had a party of 10 and called ahead and were accommodated within the hour. The entire experience was A+. The staff was amazing, the drinks were delightful and the food was to die for!! We sampled a bit of everything and it was all delicious. Definitely coming back and will be recommend this place to friends.

Delicious and somewhat nutritious!  My wife and I both liked the atmosphere and the menu choices.  It's not like any other restaurant I have experienced.  The food choices are so unique and priced so fairly, it just creates a new category.  It's like fast food, in that it's fast, but it's like fine dining in that it's so fresh and flavorful.  We were both extremely happy with our meals.  Definitely will become a regular destination for us.

Sat at the bar, this time. Ordered steaks, sides, salads, no alcohol.
Two of us. Place was crowded.  Nearly every single seat at the bar was taken by a man with a logo on his shirt and a wedding ring on his finger..  
i'm guessing these were truck drivers away from home, eating at the bar, alone...

We were in the mood for steak and were trying to decide where to go.  Son was feeling thrifty and went through the different restaurants locally, for steak..  He settled on this restaurant because i told him i had eaten here before and the meat was good.

Got to the bar at 7:15. Didn't get dinner until about 7:40-7:45..
Got out at 9pm.
The wait time for food was long. 
Wedge salad came out and the lettuce was dead.. it had been dead for a couple of days, I'm guessing.
I ordered my steak MR. It came out seared on the outside and raw on the inside.  The grilled asparagus were cooked perfectly.  I wasn't charged for the extra bleu cheese dressing I requested for the dead lettuce.
Friend ordered rib eye with mac & cheese and a side of grilled shrimp and rice.  He didn't say anything bad about his dinner except that his mac & cheese was off.
When I tasted it, I gathered that they cooked up the pasta and threw some canned cheese sauce on it and called it a day...... terrible.
I got the little tiny bucket of dessert.. Brownie with a tablespoon of vanilla ice cream on top.
It was delicious...  so the asparagus and the brownie was delicious.  
The steak?  I brought it home. I'm going to cook it up with eggs, in the morning.
They offered to recook it for me, but it took so long to get dinner and dessert, I couldn't bare to think I would have to sit there another 20 minutes for my steak to cook more..
So with that.. I have tried this restaurant two times.
That's good enough for me.
I don't recommend it.
Another awesome meal at Sugarfire!  The brisket is my favorite but haven't had anything I wouldn't order again!

Sitting in this restaurant right now. Just canceled the food order after waiting over an hour after ordering. This cannot be the busiest this place has ever been.  The chargrilled oysters we had were good. However, when after that you try to deliver the incorrect food to our table 3 tines, it's a problem. Simple orders, salad, gumbo, entree.  No excuse for a supposed established place.  Two stars only because the chargrillled oysters were good.

We came here on a Sunday with three of our friends. When we went inside to check the wait time, the hostess took my name and asked for my phone number, I was expecting a phone call when our table was ready, but they actually sent text messages with a link to an app that allows you to see where your place in line is which we thought was pretty cool.
The inside is really nice and clean. We were seated at a round table next to a fireplace with a huge skylight right over our table.
We decided to share an order of the OMG french toast as an appetizer. It came with three pieces of dipped whole wheat french toast topped with dollops of pumpkin cinnamon mascarpone, toasted pecans, caramel drizzle, and bacon. To be completely honest, I did not think that this french toast sounded appetizing at all - but I could not have been more wrong about it! The mascarpone was such a great flavor on the french toast, and the bacon added an unexpected smokiness to it.
I ordered the bandito burrito (tortilla with three scrambled eggs, onions, peppers, chorizo - it comes covered in cheese with a small cup with sour cream, and I opted for no salsa. It comes with a side of home fries and fruit). I really enjoyed the breakfast burrito, it was HUGE - I didn't think there was anything "special" about it per se, but it was done really well and I would be happy to order it again.
My husband ordered the big easy benedict (corn bread topped with avocado, creole seasoned onions, peppers, and chorizo, with poached eggs, and a cajun hollandaise. Maybe the reason I feel the way I do about the burrito I ordered is because I tried the big easy benedict - truly the best eggs benedict I have ever had. It is packed with flavor, and the corn bread pairs so perfectly with the flavor profile.
Our friends ordered the wilbur skillet (bacon, potatoes, avocado, diced tomatoes, cheese, and eggs your way), grande huevos rancheros (diced potatoes, chipotle peppers, chorizo, onions, black beans, cilantro, avocado, cheese, salsa, sour cream, and eggs your way), and the tuscany omelette (roasted red peppers, spinach, sausage, and mozzarella).
I didn't try their orders, but they all seemed to enjoy everything.
The reason I didn't give The Turning Point five stars was for a few reasons - we were told our wait would be around 45 minutes and it was over an hour and 3 of the five egg orders were incorrect. They had switched the egg orders on the huevos rancheros and the wilbur skillet (which we didn't realize until later that day), and my husband's poached eggs were very overcooked - they were basically hard boiled without the shell. 
Those things aside we will definitely be returning and I can't wait to try the corn bread french toast and their specialty hot chocolates!

I came here first during Sushi Smackdown (which was such a fun event--why can't I review that?) I liked it so much that I came back to this establishment once more--and that won't be my last time. I enjoy their creative sushi rolls (The Marilyn Monroll and the Bubblefish roll are favorites). They have a great tea selection which I really enjoy.

Welcome trippers! Make sure you stop and stretch your legs and arms from driving hours on the road. They have coffees, teas, coffee lattes, snacks, and yes, restrooms! Clean too! Oh, and most rest areas offer massage chairs, just like this one.

Great service. However the food is not great. It is eatable. The rice used for sushi and roll and everything was too cold and my sticky enough. The rice wasn't fresh. Other than that, everything else was okay.
Food was very good. Atmosphere a bit relaxed and service just okay. Solid value for the meal though and great salad bar!

Walked in with 3 others in my party. Place wasn't busy at all maybe two other tables and now I see why. Food was not fresh even though we were the only ones there. Did take a long time to get it so maybe it just sat under a heat lamp and wasn't microwaved like we believed it to be. 2 out if the 4 of us got very sick

Best place in public market!  Quick, healthy and affordable lunches. Amazing pastries, artisan kombucha, and their energy bars are AMAZING! I drive all the way across town a couple times a week to enjoy this place.  They also have GREAT vegan options.

It's a pizza place.  That said, get the Al Fresco Panini, and thank me later.  Fair warning, you will be bathed in olive oil while eating.  Sweet delicious olive oil that tastes of grilled eggplant, roasted red pepper and ultra thin sliced prosciutto... but you will wear it on your face and hands.

Pizza's good too.  One of the best in this area.  But trust me, go for the panini.

We just moved in the neighborhood and tried this place. We were greeted with a smile and friendly conversation. We were recommended awesome local beers, and appetizers. We got brucetta that literally made me smile when I took a bite. We also got bacon wrapped jalapeños in some sauce that was just amazing. I have told several people about this place already and how wonderful my experience was. Our meals were just as amazing as the apps... I will be coming in often and unfortunately for me it's going to get expensive even with a great happy hour and daily specials. Also they have a discount for military, police others.

Had to stay here for a work conference, figuring it would be sensational.... Was I ever surprised!  Checked in to what appeared to be a beautiful lobby.  Had to walk quite a distance to the elevator to take me to the 3rd floor.  They did offer assistance with the trek.  However, when I got to my room, I was taken back by the odor when I 1st entered.  It was very musty, moldy smelling, but I didn't see anything obvious....at first.  I unpacked, noted the smell never improved.  Kicked off my shoes and went to steam my clothes for the morning.  Unfortunately, before I ever made it to the bathroom, my feet were wet.  The carpet was very wet, below the thermostat.  There was no a/c vent or duct work above it, but there was an obvious darker area to the carpet.  At that point, I noted the room temp was set at 68 degrees, and it didn't appear that I could change it.  Even with the cool temp, I seemed to have been in a sauna... So sweaty!  The humidity in the room must have been at 90-95%.  So I checked out other things, and found a pot of artificial flowers on the desk....supposedly white, but covered with mold spots.  I didn't call or go to the office to find a different room.  After speaking with other coworkers, their rooms had the same smell.  Fortunately for them, they were missing the wet carpet.  Let's just say, my sleep time, felt more like a frigid sauna, if there could be such a thing.  You want to experience this... Stay in room 335.
Great bar and amazing food. Love it here. Definitely recommend the spinach dip. Vibes are great

Went with a group of 5 adults. Service was great and food was fabulous with a great selection. We all ordered something different and everyone was exceptionally pleased. Kudos to everyone that made our meal great! Definitely going back!

I was looking for an authentic italian place in the new city and this place did not disappoint! Very cozy inside and the staff is extremely welcoming! Stop giving your money to box italian and come get the real thing. Ask for Erin!! She's so nice!

Outstanding! The food is delish. Prices are a bit high but you get what you pay for. It's a tight squeeze for seating call and make a reservation. A wonderful place for fine dining a celebration for every bite.

Arrived a few minutes before 2:00. Hostess/waitress didn't seem happy to see us. After she sat us with menus, she came back about 5 minutes later (2:04). I asked if they had any lunch specials because we got the dinner menu, she said (In a nasty tone) that lunch stops at 2:00, I said it is now 5 after and we got here before 2:00, she shrugged her shoulders and walked away. I noticed that the clock over the register is set about 15 minutes fast. If you go through that much trouble to stop serving lunch... Why serve it at all?

To be fair I started writing this review while waiting for my food and had given them 1 star. The food is a solid 4 plus.. But points deducted for bad customer service.

What a great place to have brunch!

We hit this place up with friends on the Saturday before Easter. Even though it was busy, there was ample space to sit and dine in peace. I didn't feel like I was rubbing elbows with strangers, like I often do at restaurants. 

On top of that, I was so pleased with the inventive and delicious mimosas! Strawberry and pepper! Grapefruit and winter spices! Flavorful balanced twists on a classic drink. We sampled them all, and you should too.

For food, we mostly stuck to the taco menu, though my husband departed and got the johnny cakes and fried chicken (which he enjoyed). Here's where the restaurant fell down a little bit. The tacos were composed almost exclusively of meat. Each taco had a generous serving of delicious meat, but only a sparse serving of other toppings, be it a single wedge of avocado, or a lone thin slice of jalapeno. I get it - it's BUTCHERtown Hall. It's about the meat. But even the bell of the ball needs a date to the dance. Of course the meat was delicious, but all of the tacos could have been enhanced by more toppings.

There were also problems with plating practices. If three people at the table order lamb tacos, a single plate of three lamb tacos comes to the table. Since everyone had ordered a smorgasbord of different tacos, keeping tabs on who got what taco was difficult, both for us and for our waitress. Three of our tacos didn't come out and we had to inquire about them. 

Still an overall enjoyable experience. Go to Butchertown Hall for an easy quiet brunch and order some incredible mimosas and meat centric dishes. Write down who had what.

The parish is my favorite place in Tucson. Steak salad and a glass of wine yes! I had a little birthday party here a while back and even though my friends were being annoying we were all coming and going they handled us with grace. Love the late night menu and great full bar.

SOOOOOOOOO GOOD!  We waited a little to get our tables even though we had reservations but the manager was very apologetic and ended up taking care of us. ABSOLUTELY WORTH THE WAIT! I'm very picky about Italian food because nobody beats mom's Italian cooking but this definitely tops the charts! Can't wait to go back next time I visit Philly.

Here's my long overdue for my 2 visits here... Overall, I love Timpano's- they have my favorite mussels in the area and I love their Grand Mimosas. We have been here only for brunch, so I can't talk about dinner, but besides the mussels, the food is good, not mind-blowing- we had salads and a burger. However, I would go back again and again for those mussels and I am curious to try dinner. Service was great both times we were there. I would give them 3.5 stars, but since that's not an option, it's going to 3.

Unfortunately they have two whoppers for five dollars but they don't have the two impossible burgers for six dollars deal anymore. So I ordered one impossible burger for $6.51. It was well prepared very tasty. It's so tasty I kept checking if it was regular whopper. But it wasn't. How do I know? It was not greasy.
Cashier heard me well and I heard them well even though there was a lot of traffic. Very polite people and employees. Very busy crossing.

Definitely one of BEST restaurants in New Orleans.  Nina pulled this off and then some. The food is off the chain fab!  And, the cocktails are as balanced as they come. Abigail rocks and makes this place.  Try her Mai Tai. Best in town!
Always incredible service friendly atmosphere and owner -and delicious food. The muscles margarita are my favorite.

If I ever end up on death row outside a state with no WC...... Six cheeseburgers, fries and a cream soda will be my last meal.

WC is the first stop after landing at IND and the last stop before gassing up the rental car for the return trip back to the A-T- L.

For the complainers it is what it is.  Sure service might be slow at times but the hot little sliders with melted cheese more than makes up for it.

I had heard great things about this place so went here for our anniversary. I was not impressed with the food or location. It was cramped and loud, but our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. I got the pulled pork ravioli and didn't like it at all. We won't be going back.

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Brandon. My husband and I order take out at least once a week. The Red Dragon and Volcano rolls are the best. We started using mobile meals and have had great service here!

This is a nice local pizza place. They definitely serve a hearty "football pizza" that gets the job done. Good selection of quality toppings, they typically go a little heavy on the cheese for me, but you may dig it. 

Staff is always super cool and in a great mood. Keep up the good work y'all!

The Pisces Sushi experience is an exceptional value , Creative cuisine , casual atmosphere . 
Try Pisces on busy night or a slow night , you won't be disappointed

My coworkers and I came for lunch and were very impressed! Our company was selected as the Company of the Month; the lunch buffet was both quality cuisine and excellent value! I enjoyed a lovely soup, two small sandwiches, a delicious, fresh salad, and delightful dessert. Sierra was very attentive to our table - conversational and kind too. We will definitely return!

Tonight my family and I had a pleasant dinner at LaScala. We have dined here several times before so we are familiar with them.  It is open and can be noisy but I don't find it troublesome. We have tried many things on the menu and I have yet to get food I did not like. My husband loves the Stuffed Long hots, I like the Portobello (w/ crab) and Italian Wedding Soup. For an informal meal, get together with friends, BYOB, I recommend this place.

Smelled great. Looks great!
Slow service. 
Food was average. BLT does not get cherry tomato on it!!
I would wait a while to go back!

For a quick sandwich shop potbelly deserves 5 full stars ! The bread tastes freshly baked and gets deliciously crunchy and chewy after it goes thru the toaster . The set up is Quiznos style where you order the style wich and they get the meat and cheese then put it thru the toaster on a conveyor belt and another staff member does the veggies and dressings . I got an Italian and they were nice enough to add balsamic dressing on it for me even though it is for salads primarily . The hot peppers are a must ! They are fresh fresh fresh and not too spicy just delicious . Everything tastes high quality and for the regular sandwich with chips it was only 6$ and change . A great spot for a killer simple sub .

The charbroiled oysters are delicious! My girlfriend recommended Drago's for these delicacies! We were not disappointed, fresh and perfectly grilled. The melted butter is great for dip for the bread. We also tried the lunch menu choices of a cup of gumbo and Mediterranean crab salad. If I'm in NOLA, I'd go back for the charbroiled oysters!
This is Tampa's best Thai restaurant. Always fresh and tasty. The ultimate comfort food. If you haven't tried this you are missing out.
The best Hibachi on planet earth. Period. We're absolute fans and have (like many I'm sure) been to countless similar restaurants over the years. This is our absolute favorite, hands down.
Great food and great beer.  We were visiting from out of state.  We will now make this a stop every time we are in the area.
Excellent chicken and sides. Served hot and it's pretty quick after you order.  Waited about 25 minutes outside before ordering.

Our first attempt to eat here resulted in us walking out after 10 minutes without service or acknowledgment. (Midday Monday)

We decided to give it another try (Friday night). 
The mozzarella sticks were overcooked but still edible. The fried mushrooms were overcooked and hard. They were also pretty spicy which was never mentioned by our server. 

The ribs/wings platter with a side of mac n cheese was good according to my boyfriend. 
I got the patty melt burger with fries.  The fries were overcooked. The burger was just ok. 

The salads however are quite large and delicious! I would definitely go back for a salad! 

Our waitress told us that the mushrooms were removed from our bill - as we didn't eat them - however upon receiving out bill....the mushrooms were still there. 

*side note* this food ran right through me :/

Liked the service and the cocktail. However, I will NEVER recommend this eatery to anyone. Why, you ask?  I do not like to be exploited. $27.00 for 4 bites of duck breast(granted it was delicious) with no sides is a poor value and unacceptable.

When I expressed my disappointment to the Manager, he could have cared less. The server, however, comped us a free dessert. I had already told her, prior to this complaint/suggestion, that her tip was going to be a FAT one due to her excellent service.

The Sail Pavilion serves as a great place to watch the sunset with a view of the water and harbor of downtown Tampa! Sail Pavilion can be a great stop for anyone biking, running, or walking the Tampa Bay Riverwalk.  This place is dog friendly with plenty of dog water bowls available so bring your furry friends! However, the service is terribly slow. Drink prices are a bit pricey at $5-7 per beer and $8-12 per mixed drink. They have a wide variety of tropical drinks including: the blue crush, pina colada, strawberry daquiri, rum runner, coco loco, mud slide, margarita, sex on the beach, mai tai, and mojito. I had the burger and shrimp wontons and they were both awful. They only have 1 waiter and 2 bartenders for the whole place.  I got tired of waiting and went up to the bar and that took over 10 minutes in a 4 deep line just to get a drink.  They need a better menu and more staff on the weekends. Especially if there is an event at the Convention Center. Sail Pavilion has food trucks almost every Friday and is a local crowd favorite gathering spot for residents of Downtown and Habour Island. Boaters can dock their boat at the marina in front of the restaurant, take a boat tour from the marina, rent water bikes, rent boats, and soak in pretty views of the boats in the marina, Jackson's Waterfront Bistro, Harbour Island, Davis Island, the Hillsborough River, and even Bayshore!

I've lived in Reno for two years and just found kimmies, I wish I'd of found it sooner.The service was Excellent the food was phenomanal all around I'd have to say best breakfast in Reno. Pegs used to be the favorite but kimmies is the best the biscuits and gravy was the best I've had the sausage was incredible please if you haven't been to kimmies treat yourself and enjoy an excellent meal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

First time in my life that I've been to a restaurant where you can bring in your own bottle of champagne to make mimosas! The food and staff were great! I'd love to go back the next time I'm in Philly.

We had no reservations but we're told it was a 20 minute wait. No problem . We went to the bar and when two seats opened up at the bar fairly quickly we decided we would at the bar instead. Food was absolutely amazing but bartender was horrible. No personality and no customer service skills. He had a friend sitting at the bar to whom he was giving drinks to "on the house". We asked him for extra shrimp bbq sauce and he said he couldn't do that. Never checked on us for refills on drinks.  The food however was fantastic just don't bother sitting at the bar. Rib eye and pork chops were out of this world.

I was surprised to hear that this place had closed. Too cool for Edmonton. It's also a difficult balance for a cafe between making a place feel cosy enough to spend hours there, and having people actually buy 1 drink and spending hours there.

Amazing place for breakfast. Found it while walking in the area one morning. Has great big floor to ceiling windows to look at the street and square. Great food, price and very friendly staff. Can't ask for anything more. It filled up quickly, come early.

Haven't had Dewey's Pizza in forever! I was back in the area and decided to pick up one to go. It was just as good as I remembered. I called in a order as I was driving into town and gave the a time I would pick it up. I walked in and it was hot and ready. So yummy!

I had the best customer service experience here. Waiter (I believe his name was either Cody or Corey) was so kind and brought my 2 year-old son sticky rice while we waited for our food. (For those with toddlers, you understand that means the world) He checked on us constantly - our drinks never got empty. Food was great - complimentary edamame sealed the deal on our great experience. Plus, kids eat free on Sundays. Will be back again!

I've visited Granite City on a number of occasions and today was just ok. I had the buffalo chicken wrap with fries and a mango margarita.

The Buffalo Chicken Wrap had Crispy Chicken, Buffalo Sauce, Celery, and ranch dressing (I swapped that for the Bleu Cheese Dressing that it typically comes with) Tomatoes, and Lettuce.  The buffalo sauce was a bit overpowering for my taste. The next time I'll probably just ask for that on the side. I also got the natural cut fries with it and they were bland. They were hot and crisp, but didn't really have a flavor profile. 

The margarita was good. I would get that again. It was a nice balance of alcohol and sweetness.

Things to know:
1. This location is in the mall so you will most likely park underground and have to pay a small fee for parking (unless you happen to snag one of the few street level parking spots).
2. Remember your elevator or escalator so you don't lose your car.

Pepe's is an excellent place to get delicious Mexican food and great Margueritas. The food tastes like authentic family recipes. The prices are affordable and moderately priced. The Delgado family has been operating restaurants in this area for many years.
Great bar, awesome staff and nice beer selection. And the food choices are among the best in south Philly. Plenty of friendly faces, such an awesome neighborhood bar.

This is one of my favorite places to go when I'm in St. Louis.  A pleasant surprise is that they remodeled the bar area since the last time I was there.  It looks very good.  I was there with a couple of buddies and we ordered the 50 wing plate with the standard Sybergs sauce.  We ordered the wings extra crispy since the crew I was with were wing experts  and our experience has taught us to be careful with undercooked wings.  Of course we've never had that problem here and the cook made them to perfection.  Between the three of us we devoured the entire plate.  I ordered a dinner salad which was much larger than I thought, so I wound up wasting it.  Overall it was a very good experience in the food was good as expected.  I would greatly recommend that you

Local veggies, and meat- this place is a dream come true!!! 
They even have high fructose corn syrup free catchup! 

Our burgers were great and the Qunoa- kale salad was the best I ever had! 

 We are super grateful

I saw it on Tock and checked Yelp. What? 5 star in STL????
Went there with my girls and we all love it!!!! Every thing is amazing! Best Japanese restaurant in this area. Every dish we ordered worth. I would highly recommend the shared pot of rice (hard to remember the name) because it's so authentic! All sashimi are sooo fresh. Will defiantly come back soon.

I've now come twice for lunch and find the food is very good. Being a person who sticks with what he likes, I found the Hot Chicken sandwich as delicious the 2nd time as the first. I have brought different people and two of them swear by the chicken sandwich with ghost pepper cheese. The fries are done well, and I wouldn't recommend the upgrade to fries fried in duck fat. They weren't bad at all, but I personally didn't find them worth the additional cost. 

They wait staff was friendly and helpful.

Somewhere in the span of time, going out to lunch jumped from 10 bucks to 20, but that's probably more of an age indicator. The Little Lamb is priced competitively with all nicer lunch choices. 

I'll go here again.
Love the renovation and the menu upgrade! Great service and amazing Carnitas Chilaquiles! I will be back with a posse.

Mambos was an awesome experience.  We were on the 3rd level dining.  Our waitress was Patrica and she was an amazing waitress.  She was very friendly, funny and a genuine person.  The food and drinks that were suggested was true Cajun southern hospitality.  Definitely return to mambos.

Where to start? Ok, first off I gave them 5 stars simply because Yelp does not allow me to give more. This could easily be a 10 stars place.

Tried it today for the first time, we got the Gamberi di Buffalo (shrimp in hot sauce with blue cheese and celery) as an appetizer. The shrimps were cooked perfectly with just the right amount of breading, nice and spicy but without disabling your taste buds for hours. A wonderful appetizer.

As the main entree we opted for the 3 Cheese Pizza (they use REAL gorgonzola cheese and not some crumbled concoction of blue cheese and God knows what else like most other places do, if they even offer something in the likes). The pizza was excellent, ultra thin like a real pizza is supposed to be (very italian style), nicely cooked with a nice crisp crust and a blackened out bottom (it's not burned, just the way a pizza is meant to be if cooked at the right temperature). No overpowering flavors, the cheeses perfectly blend in with each other making it one of the most mouth watering pie in the area.

Needless to say the whole pie (large) was consumed at the table, no leftovers for my dinner with this one, and trust me....it is difficult not to finish their Pizza. 

Delicate yet bold in flavor, and does not leave you with that bloated feeling after consuming it.

Overal was a wonderful experience, my taste buds are still dancing with joy. 

Definitely a keeper and won't be long before we go back for another pizza and to try some of the other entree they provide on their well assorted menu.

Staff was friendly, service was fast and spot on.

Oh did I mention their bread? A new take on the usually boring garlic knots offered by pizza parlors. And a successful take shall I say, nicely flavored, soft and moist to the point I could just go there and eat that for lunch and be satisfied.

Great little gem of a place.

I like whole foods, but not this one. Many of the products that I HAVE to go to Whole Foods for (vegan stuff, frozen burritos, quick dinners from the deli) do not exist at the Metairie location. 

I stopped in last night because I had a lull between classes, and found myself becoming frustrated with the lack of appetizing items on their hot bar OR their deli area.

The staff are excellent and will wander around the store with me while we both try to figure out what the hell a weirdo ingredient is and where to find it. I like this kind of customer service. The guy who works in the vitamin aisle is brilliant as well. He will explain what each product does and try to get you the best product for your bucks. 

TIP: park in the side lot! Nobody is ever parked there, and it's not a death trap like the main parking lot. I hate hitting pedestrians, it ruins my day.

If you have never had a deep dish Chicago pizza this is the place to go. It was delicious.  We arrived just about 1 pm and it was still busy with a lunch crowd. Our group of 7 had a 10 minute wait which was not bad. Our server Jayden was very attentive. Their menu had 3 types of pizza. Chicago style, thin crust or extra thin crust. We decided the Chicago was the best choice. 3 of us split a small which is 6 slices and plenty for each. If you are limited on time it takes about 45 minutes for the deep dish! Beer selection was good. No room for dessert. Would definitely recommend.

Attempted to eat at Hook & Reel. Called to verify they were open and asked to be put on waiting list. Was informed to put myself on waiting list via Yelp app when we were on our way. This is what I did. Arrived at location and was informed that wait time was double what Yelp indicated because restaurant only running at 50% capacity because of COVID. Therefore a 45-60 minute wait on a Saturday night at 7 pm and I could wait outside in 100 degree heat. No chairs outside. We left and ate somewhere else. Irritated that they could not give me more adequate information over the phone. They are not the only restaurant that has such a problem. I guess I will have to ask every detail that I really want to know when I make the effort to call first.

Tried this place for the first time tonight through a delivery app. It arrived burnt and cold. The bottom  was black and the cheese was super dark like it had been sitting under a heating lamp for hours. I couldn't even eat it. Also paid for a drink and didn't get it. That's partially my drivers fault for not checking. Overall a bad experience and I won't be eating here again

Ok words can't even explain how good the Bahn Mi sandwich with pork was. Perfectly marinated pork and the bread was so soft and warm it was amazing. You have got to get here quick and be ready for your taste buds to scream. I also had the traditional Vietnamese coffee which was so delicious. I will probably be back tomorrow. Sadly it's right down the street from my house and work.

After a show at the Fox Theatre, we headed over to Maynards for a late night bite with another couple.  For a Friday night, we were seated quickly by a very attentive hostess who set our table herself. The atmosphere is warm and comfortable and a  DJ was playing a nice selection of music in the patio that you could hear inside. Two of us got the burger, which was cooked perfectly, and served with a heaping portion of tasty fries.  My wife had the PEI mussels in a delicate wine broth with ample sour dough bread to savor the juice. The portions were filling, so we skipped dessert! There were plenty of other things on the menu to like. Someone else had the mushroom polenta, which she enjoyed. I'm keeping it on the list for the next time were downtown.

Well, the burger was good, the beer prices were reasonable, but the cleanliness was a little questionable - small space - cramped - but friendly staff.  If you have trouble climbing stairs  = do not come here.  3rd floor had a pool table, dart board and an odd urine like smell.  Be warned, there will be a wait.

I went there yesterday with my sis and a friend, first time going there and I must say that I am looking forward to another visit. The menu selection was filled with very mouth-watering dishes.  We had 2 appetizers, I forgot the name of the first one but it was fried plantains with chicken and cheese on top (not bad) then we had the Jamaician Jerk wings (pretty good/spicy)

Service; awesome!
atmosphere: very island-ish and comfortable/cozzy
Recommend? Yes!!

I didn't get a alcoholic drink but i will next time! Not too much details this review but I will soon to update when I go back next time!

Hands down the best pizza in Cherry Hill. Food is always amazing and the service is top notch. Staff is always friendly and welcoming whenever I walk in the door. I come in about once a month. Come here for good pizza.
Couldn't tell you about the food or the drinks the service is SO bad! We sat at the bar with NO ONE hardly in the place and couldn't get anyway to come say hi let alone serve us! Ridiculous
really great environment and excellent menu! cash only though. i haven't gone wrong with anything I've gotten here.

I truly love Bruegger's. I eat breakfast there at least once a week because I go to school close by. The bagels are everything I would want them to be. If you haven't already, TRY THE CHIPOTLE TURKEY. It slapppss tbh. I think about that one sandwich often and if I wasn't sooo mf broke I would eat one everyday. Everyone who I have made eat a chipotle turkey falls in love. It really is the one of the best sandwiches ever.
What seems like a typical coffee shop is a transporting gem to the streets of Marseilles. The aromas of croissants, cafè, and bread warms the heart, the service only enhances the experience

I am not a huge pizza person so when my group of friends decided that this is where we were going for dinner I wasn't that excited... but I'm here to tell you that I was surprised. 

We ordered a family style house salad and it was perfect. I loved that we could share it amongst four people pretty evenly. We then ordered a large BBQ chicken pizza and OMG was I wrong to not be excited. 

This pizza had so many layers of flavors. It was by far the most delicious BBQ chicken pizza I've ever had. The cheese and sauce and chicken were all to die for. I'm pretty sure I had two slices and let's be honest, that should be illegal. Lol 

But needless to say it has made its way on my crave list and I will be back.

Visiting the area, I went to this place after reading all the positive reviews and Chef Ron's lived up to them. The menu is only one page and the focus allows Chef Ron (who buzzes between the kitchen and dining room) to make everything outstanding. The gumbo is incredible, the best I've had in NOLA and there is lots of great gumbo here. Service was also good although the dining staff is small and stretched a little thin. There is a small parking lot, but the back lot of the Holiday Inn next door is a very short walk.

Came here with friends and my hubby. Tried the cheese and chicken penne, and the 7oz. Steak. Hubby orders his steak medium-well but it came out well done. Our waitress was very considerate and stayed and asked how is the steak and helped us replaced it for the corrected temperature steak free of charge. The manager served the corrected steak himself.

This place was amazing, I was looking for Char boiled Oysters and some boiled seafood. The Char Boiled Oysters were so delicious I ended up ordering more, the crawfish seemed small so I recommend ordering a boat of them. You can tell the seafood is fresh they boil and cook it as Soon as you walk in and the whole restaurant smells like fresh boiled seafood. My waiter was really friendly and had great energy, his energy alone made the experience even better. It was reasonable price for the seafood, I highly recommend checking them out I'll return whenever I find myself back in New Orleans.

Was given a DISGUSTING dirty cloth napkin in which my silverware was wrapped up in. Had HORRIBLE service!!! Food had to be sent back not prepared the way it was ordered. The food once corrected was edible. $12.00 for biscuits and gravy a lil pricey for my wallet.

Yea!!!!!  Super nice and friendly staff.... sitting at the bar was an absolute pleasure...awesome customized drinks.... Real..actual, delicious and fresh oysters on the half shell!  Beautifully prepared mussels for a special appetizer... modestly priced and  well selected wines by the glass.....Likey likey!  We will be back!

I come to the drive-thru at this White Castle from time to time to get lunch for my employees at work. On this Monday I got a crave case (30 sliders) + 5 orders of fries. Usually they are decently fast and I'm in and out. On Monday they were a little slow. After I paid I sat for about 10 minutes waiting for the crave case. Of course I'll be back though!

While I'm not a beer drinker (I'm allergic) I hear that the beer selection is fantastic and the seasonals they brew are great.  I personally think the nachos are awesome and totally worth the drive to get.  I enjoy the atmosphere and the food menu is always delicious, worth checking out if your in West Chester, Media or South Jersey.

So this took the place of Phil's Grill and I have to say, I really miss Phil's. I just recently moved back and gave this a try. I ordered my burger medium rare and my wife ordered her's medium, but I got medium and she got medium rare. I'm not sure if the server mixed them up when entering the order, or if it was the fault of the kitchen, but it doesn't really matter since neither of us got the temperature we ordered. 

I ordered the Who Dat Burger and I was left wondering what BBQ sauce they use. It must be incredibly expensive since there was such a minuscule amount of it on my burger. Wife got a basic bunless burger and she was relatively happy with it.

Regarding the service, I don't remember it being stellar, but I also can't remember anything negative. 

I'll probably visit again eventually, but I don't think it will ever be my go-to burger place the way Phil's was.
Best brunch find in Philly! If there is a long wait and you have a small group keep an ear out for if Bar seats are available, quick and great service!!!

If I were eating my last meal on Earth, raw oysters would definitely be one of the appetizers.  When my wife finally nagged me to make the 5 1/2 hour drive to New Orleans, Drago's immediately became a must stop during our culinary eating weekend.  My wife and I are BIG fans of the raw oysters but we had to stop at Drago's to try their much beloved chargrilled oysters.  We arrived at this location at 7 p.m. on Friday night and were quickly seated without any wait. As we walked by the open kitchen, where we saw the oysters getting shucked and grilled, our mouths began to water like a rabid canine.  

We ordered a dozen chargrilled oysters and a dozen of the raw oysters. I also ordered the grilled drum (similar to redfish) but the oysters were the reason we came.  The raw and chargrilled oysters arrived and we quickly noticed these oysters must have been hormone fed because they were gigantic.  The chargrilled oysters are as good as other reviewers say they are and lived up to our expectations.  

HOWEVER, we still loved the raw oysters more. That's because when you cook an oyster, you basically kill the natural flavors and they become whatever ingredient you put on them. In this case, they tasted like garlic, butter and wood fired smoke.  The sweet/salty brine and plumpness were gone from the chargrilled oysters. To us, it's like taking a piece of toro and chargrilling it.  Some things are meant to be eaten raw.  Thankfully, we were also able to enjoy the fantastic raw oysters.

As a footnote, the grilled drum was very good and would be a formidable star, if not for the brighter oyster star in this universe.

Went to a cheap movie ($5) and ordered food. It was a bit weird eating in the dark, but it was pretty tasty bar food. The chicken wrap was grilled on the outside, and had a nice crunch with the lettuce inside. Plus you can have tots for an extra $1.50... Gotta love tator tots.

Came back with some friends for some bar food and I LOVE THIS PLACE. They have a set menu but their menu specials that change monthly are amazing! We got the filet tips which were amazing and the wings are always great. I recommend this place for anyone in the area for some delicious bar food and great vibes

Meh.
They were out of "Republic of Tea" Ginger Peach - so I had the Mango Ceylon (you gotta check out Repulic of Tea's website - good stuff). 

They seem to have remodeled a bit and things look brighter and there is less crowding at the front of the store during the lunch "crush".  Also now they give you a buzzer so you can get a table and site while you wait for your mediocre salads, sandwiches and salty soups.

Sorry - but the food is not that great, to me.  Soups are all very salty.
Beet salad had great toppings but the base was raw kale and arugula - did not thrill me.  Next time I will see if they will make it with some romaine in there.

Good news!  You can choose an apple instead of chip or a baguette.  (Guess what I got.)

Too caloric for a "healthy" choice fast food.
Yet, still, my company gets LOTS and lots of lunches catered from here.
LOVE this place! One of my favorites for dumplings in the city. Pork soup dumplings are a must here. Casual, bright setting with lots of windows.

We used to go there when they first opened. We've moved since then, but went back the other night. Fabulous dinner, service and if that was not enough, I got a gift card (for a different restaurant!)  from my daughter and future son in law for Father's Day. Somehow, it fell out of the card. We realized it when we got home, called and they were closed. Messaged them on FB and they answered me immediatley and promised to look for it when they opened. Next morning, I got a message they found it!!!! Manny and his staff went way above customer service for me. I will be back and tell everyone I know about this!!! Class Act!!!

The staff is very friendly. There's not a ton of seating. There is a 45 minute seating limit, so this place isn't really student friendly. It's mainly for a quick conversation with a friend or a business meeting. Besides that, I enjoyed my coffee and the tea latte I had later in the week.  Neither of those drinks really tasted like the flavors I asked for, but I feel like that's true for every coffee shop. Overall, it's a nice place to go for a short time. I'm sure whatever you order will taste good. And it's always a good thing to shop local, so I encourage you to give them a visit.

We used to drive to the Northside location before we discovered one close by - it was that good. This location is less good. Very clean environment, good Vietnamese fare but the service could use some help. When putting in an order for pickup I tried to give her my husbands name so he could pick it up. Was told 'no just tell us what you ordered when you pickup'. So he did and what do you know, someone else had already picked up that order. They asked to speak to me to verify what I ordered and rattled off something very different from what I ordered. I repeated what I ordered and she tried to tell me that was NOT what I told her earlier. I asked why they don't just take names she told me their way was much better and could my husband wait another 10 minutes so they could remake the order? 
So more than average patience is required!

I used to be a loyal Bully's patron. Visiting this location and the Northwest locations more times than I can count over the past 15 years, but they have lost me as a customer. Their restaurants are filthy. Disgustingly filthy. And they have progressively gotten dirtier and dirtier over the past few years. The bathrooms are horrendous and I don't mean after a busy night. I mean ongoing filth. As if the management doesn't want to check on the status of the bathrooms because it is beneath them. If their bathrooms and restaurants aren't clean what does the back of the house look like? The mere thought of it made me decide never to return.

Dear Bully's manager and owner, this is not a frat house. Clean up! Or specifically to the owner, maybe you need to clean house when it comes to your management too! 

No wonder you have had to close so many locations.

This review covers the Den, not the main music venue. Decent little hole in the wall. Nearly all taps dedicated to local craft beers. Small but tasty menu. The jambalaya was excellent. Only ding I have is that on both visits the kitchen was out of certain items.

The boyfriend had a hankering for prime rib and neither of us wanted to travel far or pay the big bucks. Believe it or not, Outback is his favorite go-to for a reliable prime rib... and while that was just across the street we decided to try out Charlie Brown's since we had yet to do so since moving to the area.

I will start off by saying the decor is nice and cozy and our waiter was attentive but that's where the positives end.

The food was a complete miss.

We started with the happy hour nachos appetizer. It should be noted that not only was the appetizer half price, but it was HALF THE PORTION. Err... nice try, guys. Anyway... it was pretty gross. Chili from a can, tasteless cheese and guacamole that was almost soupy. It was also served on a plate that was far too small for the portion so we ended up with nachos everywhere.

I figured the salad bar was a safe bet but I quickly discovered I was mistaken. While the options were vast, the lettuce was old and very, very watery to the point I had to grab a napkin and pat it dry before I built my salad. I skipped over the mayonnaise-based salads as they aren't really my bag. I liked that they had a few bread options but unfortunately they weren't very fresh.

My boyfriend, as he intended, ordered the prime rib and was appalled. He's sort of a prime rib aficionado and thought it was a crime they charge as much as they do for such low quality meat. It's the extreme rare occasion I see him not enjoy prime rib (or any hunk of beef, for that matter) so that pretty much sealed the deal that we won't be returning to Charlie Brown's.
Great Wings and Cheep Beer.  Staff is friendly, not a bad spot.
Great food, great service and great value!! Peruvian cuisine is something you really need to  experience. It has a purity of flavor that is a true delight.

Not going to lie, I was a little hesitant about going here. But man am I glad I did! Their happy hour is a hidden treasure. From what I saw it goes from 3-7 &10-12 and it's 1/2 off drafts and long neck bottles. We got there around 10 on a Friday night and there was plenty of seating. We were served right away and the waitress was so friendly. First, I was shocked by how many beers they actually offer. They had about 5 different IPAs just on tap. Then, I was even more shocked by the prices! Since it was happy hour, our beers were only $2.50! I haven't been able to get a nice IPA in Nashville for less than $6. After several beers we got a little hungry and checked out the late night food menu. It was impressive. Reasonably priced bar food at its finest. I ordered the Queso chips and was not disappointed. Homemade queso, sour cream, and salsa. I mean, it was nothing fancy but for a dive bar it was pretty delicious. Overall, our tab had 5 beers and Queso chips...the total was about $19. I mean, come on! You can't find a better deal than that in Nashville. Sure, it's a dive bar in a quieter area, but hey, if you're in the area and looking to for cheap drinks, Jonny's is the place to go. Be warned, people are allowed to smoke inside so it does get to be a little much.
UNBELIEVABLE!!! I LOVE THIS PLACE !! quaint , romantic, live music , good is amazing !!! fresh ! new fav place !!!

The sub zero vodka bar is by far my favorite bar in the city. Their selection of vodka is incomparable with over 500 brands in house. Their drinks are usually kick ass, with some being very strong, but they're all worth a try. I usually try to drink something new every time I'm there due to the impossible number of drink combinations and I'm never let down. I would highly recommend the vodka bar, and even if vodka isn't your forte, the same people also own the Gamlin Whiskey house down the block and if has an extensive drink list as well.

OMG, you must try this place! I dropped in for lunch not frequenting Clayton often so I didn't realize the restaurant is brand new. They were very busy at 11:30, but worked the crowd like pros. The food was refreshingly tasteful and quite filling for lunch. I tried the Koran corn with cheese and breaded mushroom bao sandwich. Both will be ordered again! The Bao buns are freshly made-reminds me of a large kolache bun. When you walk in, you write down your order, pay then sit. The bartender gave me a tip that if you plan to sit at the bar you can order and pay him to 'skip the line'. All the employees were extremely friendly. A manager checked on me twice and the owner stopped by to say hello as well. My entire dining experience, just a 'quick lunch break', was absolutely fantastic! I chatted with the bartenders a bit about their drink menu and am looking forward to scheduling a happy hour event at this lovely venue. The restaurant has a small footprint with a modern yet cozy atmosphere. I've dined at most restaurants in Clayton-this one has made my favorites list! They serve breakfast and lunch so if you are going for lunch on a work break, I suggest going early. It's tasty and unique. I'm sure this place will be packed and become a popular lunch favorite as more people try it.

The sandbar was a delicious restaurant! The food was phenomenal! Portion sizes were huge but were great for leftovers. 

We missed  happy hour but the happy hour looked awesome with buy one drink, get one for a quarter. 

The atmosphere had a good vibe and it is located in the heart of Santa Barbra so after dinner you are a close walk to anything!

The food, service, and ambience were all fantastic. I highly recomend this restaurant. Justice was gracious and was spot-on with our order. The chargrilled oysters are a must-have on the appetizer menu. The chargrilled lobster was also enjoyable.

Loved, loved, loved this place! Food, atmosphere and staff on NYE was more than we could have asked for. Our experience would not have been the same without Ron, he was so friendly and did all he could to make our night memorable! Thank you Ron!
fantastic food great atmosphere perfect for Family Dining the bar is really fun a lot of cool cocktails. Would definitely come back

Paneras are about the same anywhere you go, but this one deserves  5 stars because of the staff.  My mom is gluten free so finding things she can eat is always a challenge.  Girl who waited on us was very attentive to get need.

Place was clean and very friendly.

Nice atmosphere. Absolutely delicious food. The wedge salad is so simple and yet SO amazing. Really everything we had there was fabulous and left me wanting to come back ASAP. Parking was a little tricky as it was a busy night when we went, but I still was able to find a spot.

This is one of my all time favorite place to eat in St. Louis. The service is always exceptional and the food delicious. The one time the service was slower than normal I wasn't charged for the meal with zero prompting on my part. The location is extremely convenient too since I often want to eat lunch or early dinner after shopping.
Excellent tacos and chorizo queso. Favorite tacos were pescado tacos and pineapple shrimp tacos. And don't forget the jalapeño mashed potatoes! Service was great too, can't wait to come back.

We decided to stop in one Sunday for brunch Don't expect to be seated immediately, we waited for about half an hour outside before we got a table. Seating is community-style, which was great as we are very friendly people and there were just two of us. 

I could see how this may not be good for groups due to the community seating. That being said, I loved that we got to make friends with the couple of ladies sitting next to us.

We ordered the bologna scone (no longer available), ancient grain porridge, and potato & celeriac latke. The scone was excellent and delightfully surprising with the bits of salty bologna. The porridge was very good and I would wait in line again just for that. The latke was unique and lighter than a traditional normal all potato latke, and the onion marmalade was tasty.

The vibe was relaxed and friendly, but service was relatively slow and pretty loud. The building it is in is very unique and has tall ceilings and that may have been what caused the higher volume. 

All in all, this is my favorite $30 brunch in the city- a little pricey but a great place to eat and hang out, something that is not common at other brunch places.

For some reason, I decided to give this place another try.  Bad idea.   We came in for brunch and everything was horrible aside from the waitress.  The Buffalo popcorn chicken was cold but I don't think it would have been any better hot. Pancakes were awful. We literally left 80℅ of our food on the table. I should have learned my lesson last time, but this will be my last trip to Gulliftys.

The charbroiled oysters are the reason I came and they did not disappoint. For my entree I had the red fish stuffed with crab meat and it was excellent as well. All in all a great experience and I would definitely come again!

We love this place! The people there are awesome and super friendly.  The food is always good and it's a great place to bring kids.

Can't resist the donuts...  lol.

Their menu options for biryani are vast. Havent seen so many options of biryani even in india.

We ordered garlic naan, paneer butter masala, brinjal pulao, chicken biryani. All the items were delicious! 

The biryani is the best i had in the US! They serve bottled water, even better. 

The seating inside is huge and can accomodate large groups as well. 

Also try their indian desserts cakes such as black forest, pineapple. Yum!

Worst service in Reno. Took twenty minutes to take my order, and took them another twenty to make it. no napkins....ever, food was good but there's nothing special about this place. If anything take the drive thru but steer away from this place.and this was over 3 visits.also was watching the associates while waiting for so long, and they touch their hair and face and wipe nose with wrist.disgusting!I tried to give this place a second and third chance but it just got worse with every visit.

id give them 0 stars if i could. this place has problems. dont go here unless you want to wait 45 minutes for your food. as i looked around not a single table had food. we saw the sign for new management and thought it would improve. nope. same terribleness. the food is mediocre to ok but cant be enjoyed properly after observing salty wait staff and poor management. stay home or go somewhere else.

The brisket is the best in the area. Menu is very extensive for a BBQ restaurant. $1 cold draft beer is a bargain. Staff was friendly and efficient. Clean local's style atmosphere. This will be a regular stop for me.

Was able to get to Burger Study again finally and if anything it has gotten even better! There were four of us this time and again, everyone loved everything they got. I stuck to the Southern Classic because I am been thinking about that burger since the last time I was there and it was cooked perfectly medium rare. The other 3 people got the special Juicy Lucy and all 3 were super happy with their choices. The tatter tots were also cooked perfectly crisp and were the perfect side.

I wish I could remember our serves name, but she was the best! Perfect amount of attention and we never wanted for anything. Plus she was so sweet! It was a special occasion for me and she made it all the better!

We used their website to order takeout on a weeknight. It was easy, and the pickup-time was exactly right. The pizza is very good and slightly boring. The cornmeal crust was great, but we think it is actually a surface crust superimposed on an underlying normal pizza crust. One big Southside fed two big eaters for dinner, and lunch the next day. I will come back here until I get bored or Imo's ups their game.

Came here on a Tuesday evening. It was probably about a third full. The servers were nice and friendly. I was given a paper bag with warm bread in it. The bread was soft and tasty. 
I had been craving a creamy Cajun pasta ever since I left New Orleans. The Cajun shrimp Alfredo pasta was exactly what I needed. It was spicy but not overwhelming. A little more salty than I would have liked. The next time I come here, I'll probably get some oysters!

Really like this place. I've been twice, one time on a BBQ bar crawl and once for fun. The first time around I got a pulled pork sandwich that was good, not great, but good. The second time, I had the brisket plate which was honestly some of the best brisket I've ever had. The meat was sweet and flavorful and melts in your mouth. Be sure to get there at lunch time because that's the only time it's available. Also, my group tried the BBQ nachos, which were potato chips with all the typical nacho fix-ins and shredded meat. Overall, the place is a winner.

This place is okay with one exception...a bartender named Kendra. She has the personality of a dead fish in the middle of the red tide. Get rid of her and I'd recommend. Until then....three stars. Craig

I LOVE BOULEVARD PIZZA!!!!  It is the only pizza we enjoy on a regular basis!  It's family owned, the owner, Tony is so friendly and always makes a point to go around saying hello!!  It is a wonderful place to have Birthday parties for any age with lots of machines and games for the kiddos!!

We wanted sushi and decided to check this place out since they offered order pick up. I ordered Crunch Munch Sushi and Maru Sushi, while my friend ordered Bibim Bap.

The Bibum Bap looked amazing. I tried a little and tasted pretty good. 

I ordered Crunch Munch Sushi which was delicious and the Maru Sushi.... which was not as delicious. 

The service was great as far as pick-up goes. We walked in, a guy came to the front and handed us our order and the transaction was pretty quickly.

First time here. I loved the house salad my boyfriend and I split as an app. Could have eaten that for my meal. My pesto wrap was pretty good also. His BBQ wrap wasn't as good.  Glad we signed in on Yelp. Wait turned into 90 minutes for some while we stood there. There was very little room to stand and we felt squished into people eating which wasn't great. Server was mousy but she did an ok job even being so quiet.

Idk if they got a new cook or what but a couple months ago the food was absolutely amazing . Went recently and it was terrible. Rude waitress, gave her a 2 dollar tip because that's all she deserved. Everyone else was just sitting around laughing and joking like they weren't at work. 

Only good thing is we were seated quickly‍

Went there twice this weekend, so I've got a review for the bar on Friday night and for Sunday brunch with a few out of town guests.  

Friday night at the bar: Weird vibe, but reasonable drink prices.

Sunday brunch: We took a quick cruise around Rittenhouse (we were staying at the Sofitel) and saw: Parc was too crowded, Rouge was too expensive and if I had mentioned Ruby Tuesdays or a breakfast buffet at Chez Colette, I probably would have gotten a smack upside the head by my friends.  I would have deserved it too.

Square 1682 seemed like a good choice - close proximity to hotel, empty enough so that we had ample time before we had to catch our trains, liquor license.

The Good:
-Excellent bloody marys.  Spicy and with enough hair of the dog.  Much better than the ones we had the day earlier at Jones.
-The free range braised short rib sandwich was delicious.  I had serious food envy because I only got a bite of it from a friend.

The OK:
-The concept of making your own fritatta (pick cheese, herbs, veggies and meat) could be fun, but seemed daunting when hung over.  The fritatta tasted fine, but I was expecting to look like Morning Glory -- puffy, golden and enormous.  This was like a flatter, slightly undercooked version.

The not so great:
Service - friendly, but it took forever to get water refilled and it was tough to get someone to stop so we could ask for ketchup (I know, but come on, if you're serving home fries, expect to be asked for ketchup).
-The grilled chicken sandwich.  To quote my friend, "Why is it so black?  And why is it so small?"  The chicken was way overdone, dry and the basil aioli or pesto whatever they put on it proved to be just some very bright green coloring that didn't help make the sandwich any less dry.  Also, the housemade chips on the side were good but so oversalted that you could really only eat a few.

It was $25 each for an entree and a bloody mary, with tax and tip.  All in all, it's exactly what I could have gotten at any hotel restaurant in nearly any somewhat metropolitan city.  Eh.

It's not Square 1682's fault, but why is it so easy to find awesome brunch with a free bloody mary or mimosa for under $20 in NYC and nearly impossible here?
It's a chain ... But the food was hot fresh and fast .  The server was prompt and polite.  Stop by for decent onion rings.

What a great place!  I felt like I wasn't in Tampa!  Very cool food menu.  I had the fig/goat cheese flatbread that was excellent!  There are plenty of wine flights to choose from, & wines by the glass/bottle.  The service was great as well!  My only complaint (and the reason for the 4 stars) was that the red wines I ordered seemed to be served too cold!  They were almost as cold as whites should be served, which took away from the flavors of the wines!

I thought this place was great based off of one visit for dinner with my buddy. We ordered nachos as an appetizer - delicious. I got a house salad as my side - well done and good value. And finally a fish sandwich with cheese - wonderfully done with breading that was NOT too thick and very tasty. Overall I was very pleased with the food (obviously most important), the service, the value (my meal was $16 w/o tip), and ambience. I will definitely be back!

Great brewery! My favorite is Witberry bear, if you like wheat beer like I do. White sangria is another one of my favorites! 

Beer garden outside is a plus for those warm days! 
I definitely recommend this place if you are in the area! 

Food wise, I like their grilled salmon salad. Jaeger Schnitzel is also good! 

You can reserve a spot in advance or they have a sit-yourself type of area, with first come first serve. :)

Love this place! Definitely found my new Poke spot in Philly. Quick/Fresh/Healthy. Super simple setup with a friendly staff. I did the create your own - regular size. 

More than enough food to feel full for the price of $9.67.

I'll back soon enough =D

My husband and so love to eat here - particularly for lunch. Others have figured it out as well because it is always packed! 30 minute wait at noon today so we sat at the bar. Their lunch menu is HUGE and CHEAP!  Service was fast, even with the bar being busy. The bread and olive oil is always warm and fresh. We both had different soups. Lobster bisque was flavorful, although not necessarily the best I've had. Husband loved the steak chili. He had a side salad and we shared two sides - deviled eggs and sweet potato fries. Everything tasted great. We've eaten here many times - dinner is great, but the lunch value is what keeps bringing us back!

Saw the sign for Chef Ron's Gumbo Stop on our way to our hotel. When our room wasn't ready, I asked for a recommendation - the response to which was a trendy spot in the French Quarter (a little pricier and too far for my taste). So I consulted my "Around Me" app to see what restaurants were in the vicinity. Chef Ron's popped up with Yelp reviews of 4.5 stars. 4.5 stars plus gumbo plus amazing reviews. This was a no brainer.

Parking is very tight, but there is some parking on an adjacent street. The restaurant is very divey - all atmosphere. The staff is friendly and helpful. They serve local beers in addition to your standard national brands, and they have a nice wine selection - much more than you'd expect from a place that seats no more than 30.

The food.... oh my goodness.... the food was phenomenal. If you go to Louisiana for the food, Chef Ron's is the place to go. We started with a couple of appetizers: Boudin Balls and BBQ Shrimp Quesadillas. The Boudin Balls were the best I've had in Louisiana: deep fried pork and rice balls, served with a spicy mayo. The grilled shrimp quesadillas featured shrimp perfectly seasoned with beer and spices atop melted cheese in a grilled tortilla. Our main course featured - of course - gumbo. I had the Mumbo Gumbo, a creole treat of crawfish, shrimp, crabmeat, okra, tomato, chicken and sausage with rice in a spicy broth. My husband had the Yumbo Mumbo Gumbo, which was the same gumbo topped with fried shrimp. Both dishes were out of this world and the best we've eaten in these parts.

I rarely give 5 stars, but Chef Ron's was the complete package: location, atmosphere and food! If you head to New Orleans and want some authentic local cuisine, head to Metairie to Chef Ron's. It's right off of the Rt. 10 Causeway and is definitely worth the trip. By the way, I'll be advising the front desk of our hotel to start recommending them!

I waited for 5 minutes before I got my drink, I watched my waitress talk while my drink sat next to her. By the time we finally ordered, the food came out really fast and was really good. But I then waited another 10 minutes while I watched my waitress talk while we were ready to go...I did like the atmosphere and the food, I did not like the service.

Went on a hot sunday afternoon in the summer. The place was busy waited only 5 minutes for a table to empty up and then got sat. Almost everyone around my family and I either got the worlds smallest sundae or the worlds smallest cone. I decided to get the creat your own sundae with butter pecan ice cream, as well as espresso bean ice cream both of which are excellent. Price seems to be the same as any other ice cream place as well. I will have to come back and try there ice cream cock tails and see if they are as good as baileys chocolate bar. All the servers there seemed overwhelmed but they all smiled and kept moving so kudos to them. I will be back to this place.

Haven't had a chance to personally try their food or drinks, but I can say this:

A group of us were suppose to meet after work  for happy hour. Some of them got out earlier than others, and made their way over to Red Owl first. When they got in, they were stared down, like they didn't belong. Some TRIED to make their way to the "rooftop" as we had read online, but was immediately stopped by a rude waitress.. "WOAH WOAH WOAH... WHERE ARE YOUUUU GOING???"was how the waitress spoke.. REALLY? My coworkers fone rang, which was from another person we were suppose to meet, so she picked up her call.. The waitress just huffed and puffed and smirked and every god damn remark that you DO NOT DO TO A PAYING CUSTOMER!!!  

We all got a call, change of location.. Where we served., happily.

Seriously the best! I have only been for the lunch buffet but uh really cannot beat it. Great variety, nice atmosphere, consistent food. I could literally drink the Tikka Masala sauce like it was soup it is so good. Also, a great place to take first timers due to the variety and options at lunch.
We love this place!!! The service is exceptional. Food is delicious and authentic. Great place for the whole family with kids or for adults. The atmosphere is magical. Highly recommend!

This place isn't like every other place-step out of the usual restaurant an have some amazing good food - brought my dog here- he loved it-very animal friendly - haven't had a shawarma YOU absolutely need 1

Food (roast beef sandwich) was outstanding, but service wasn't the greatest. The meal was delivered fairly quickly, but the server (bartender) lacked the character I most appreciate about dining in New Orleans.

This place is as good as it gets. The staff are extremely friendly, they have an open kitchen and the cooks look like they are all having fun and enjoying their work. We have visited them twice in their opening week. The first time we went for dinner. We ordered the Award Winning Pork Roll Burger which comes with a fried egg, cooper american cheese, and siracha mayo on a potato roll. Jason took his first bite, and when I asked if I could try it he immediately told me "No!" and blocked his plate off. (he did let me get a bite in though) The flavors just explode in your mouth. I ordered the taco special they were having. That came with slow roasted pork tacos with red cabbage, siracha mayo, fresh slices of mango on top and finished with cilantro. They were delicious and the pork was extremely tender. The last thing we ordered was the Blue Duck Fries. If you aren't a duck lover already, these will certainly turn you into one. They start with fresh cut potatoes that they slice in the back. Drop them in the oil and when they are finished and crispy the toss them in duck fat. Cover with Smoked Gouda  Cheese sauce and shredded duck. I also suggest you sitting at the counter to eat. It is like dinner and a show while you sit. The kitchen staff is entertaining and you can tell that they are concerned about your meal as you are eating it. They want to make sure that you are having the time of your life there, and you can tell they are. They invite you to join into their showcase. This place is by far one of the best places to eat in NE Philly. If you weren't there for their opening week, you missed out BIG TIME. 

We went for Brunch on Sunday morning which is from 10-4. We both ordered Chicken and Waffles. The Belgian waffles were fluffy and crispy. The chicken was moist and crispy. The smoked paprika give it such a different flavor that you don't want to stop eating.

This place was extremely busy for brunch on a Sunday.... we ended up waiting an hour to be sat. At the hour mark I almost suggested going somewhere else to eat but then the manager brought out samples of the "white trash hash browns". That made the wait a little more bearable. The food was good but wasn't as hot I it should have been. I would definitely not recommend waiting over an hour for the food from this place.
Food was delicious! Service great! Loved the ambiance! Especially loved the coffee. Short walk from hotel.
It was fine enough except the screaming child. Not a fan of any establishment that has a sign emblazoned on their front door saying ALL AGES WELCOME! I'll stick to the DT location!
Just attended a shower at Barone's and the service and food were excellent.  The salmon and salad were out of this world.  Diego was our server and couldn't have been more attentive.  I'll be back!
Wow! Great food. No line. Had the raw oysters and gator sausage po boy, phenomenal! Super friendly staff!!

I am a huge fan of this place! Whether you're celebrating a special occasion, or just in the mood for some cake, The Cake Bake will suit all of your needs. I have been multiple times, and I have always had the best experience.

Although the price is on the high end, the atmosphere, the food, and the service is well worth all of it. The staff is very friendly, and they work to make sure you are seated in a timely manner despite all their busyness. The shop is very well lit with beautiful lights, and decor. Christmas time is my favorite!

The CAKE! The Cake Bake shop is known for their delicious cakes and other goodies. The cakes are absolutely beautiful and they taste just the same. I highly recommend this place.
They are not friendly and they would rather joke around than help the customer. Its sad.

Unbelievable Easter Bread. I had stopped eating Easter bread all together after my grandmother passed away because it was always dry and generally not good. A friend of mine was snacking on some from carangis one day and made me try a piece and WOW!! Now it's what I bring to everyone's house for the holiday.

Not to mention- their pizza w long hot peppers is another favorite of mine.

Best Kept Secret Bakery in Philly By Far!

The falafel is fantastic. Perfectly crunchy and great flavor. And you can get five huge falafel for just $2.50!! You can't beat that! It was quite busy when I came in, I would suggest they improve their assembly line so they can serve customers quicker. Took almost 15 minute to get a side order of falafel. But otherwise Great value, great food, nice people, you can't go wrong!
Sir Veza's is a great option after a kickball game or night out on the town.  The interior is amazing and the food's pretty good, too.  Nice to have a change of pace from the same-old, same-old.

I really wanted to like this place, but there were just too many negatives for me to feel it was worth it. I went in on a Thursday night with a very forgiving attitude (I know the place is new) but I kept hitting roadblocks during our meal. 

++++++++++Service+++++++++++++

Service-wise, my partner and I entered what seemed to be a dead restaurant, the lights were way too dim and the lone bartender and waitress were waiting on no one. I chalked it up to being early-ish (around 6) on a weekday night. The entire time we were there only one other couple came in and they only ordered appetizers and drinks. Despite being pretty lonely everything still took way too long. This was not the biggest problem. 

We sat ourselves and as we looked at the menus the waitress warned us that not everything on the menu was available. So we looked it over while we waited for her to check in. It took a while before she returned to inform us that all items were, in fact, available. So we ordered, and she informed me that the burger that I ordered (the Frenchie- a mushroom burger that I'll get to later), came with hamburger meat. I was very okay with this situation. When the food came out she informed me that the Frenchie no longer included meat. Had she come out to tell me this beforehand I might have ordered something else, instead I had to choose between seeing if I could send my burger back, or just grinning and bearing it. I took the burger as it was. 

When we finally finished and paid we had to wait for the bartender to take our tab. The place was so dead that the waitress and someone else (maybe the owner? or a cook?) were taking their dinner above the bar. Overall a pretty negative experience.
The one final mixed bag in our experience was the payment situation. Craft's credit card system failed early in the night and we had to use the ATM across the street to withdraw cash and pay. Even though that wasn't a great situation (and not their fault) they did offer to pay for the withdrawal fee, which was nice. 

+++++Food++++++++++++

In terms of food, it feels like Craft is trying to be memorable rather than making quality food.
