The menu features a variety of cheeses and quality meats, from pancetta in the wedge salad to fried brie as a starter, but I can't help but think that they should focus less on drawing in people with fancy ingredients, and more on getting them to stay with actual tasty food. 

We ordered 2 burgers, the Frenchie (beer battered fried portabello, brie, caramelized onion, au jus) and the Main Burger (dry aged beef, smoked gouda, and smoked bacon) as well as the Poutine as a starter. 

The Poutine ($9) had great cheese curds but their great taste was drowned out by a weird taste in the Guinness gravy, and pretty mediocre fries. This  recipe definitely feels like it needs to be reworked. 

The Frenchie ($12) had the aforementioned ordering issues but otherwise was pretty underwhelming. I enjoy just mushroom burgers and I have had great breaded mushroom and cheese burgers. This, however, lacked good breading, was very watery (at one point my bun was very unappetizing and mush-like), and the entire burger lacked any flavor. The Brie and caramelized onions added very little flavor and I just wanted to salt everything. 

The Main Burger ($11) was better, but not by much. It had just four ingredients, cheese, meat, bacon, and bread, yet it still missed the mark. The meat was cooked way past medium despite our request, and it made the meat dry. The cheese was completely unmelted and added virtually nothing to the taste, we tried the cheese on its own and it was quite good, but it was drowned out by the dryness of the burger. In addition to this, the fries that came with both burgers were inconsistently salted, every fry was either bland or oversalted and they tasted like they were made of two batches, one new, one old. 

Overall nothing we ordered was worth the price we paid and unless they improve their quality of food I wouldn't recommend or return to Craft Manayunk.

We went to Reno for a weekend getaway from Las Vegas to see a little snow. My fellow wanted to go to this spot so we headed over around 5:00 on Friday. We were told by the hostesses that we could sit anywhere at the bar but we would need to go through them if we wanted to sit at a table. There weren't two seats together at the bar, so we went back to the hostess station to grab a table, as empty tables were plentiful. The hostesses immediately asked if we were going to eat. We shrugged and said we wanted to have a few beers....not sure about food (hadn't even looked at a menu) and were told that tables were only available to people who were eating. Are you kidding me? I have worked in restaurants for years. You have an empty house and you just turned away paying customers? This establishment obviously has a management problem. We went down the street, ran up a bar tab over $100 and tipped our server well. I wouldn't go back there for anything. There is a reason this place is in Reno and not Las Vegas. That nonsense would never fly here.

I must have bad luck because every time I have gone to this place (which I'm up to number 3 now, 4 if you consider the time I did take out), the quality of Pizza is pretty embarrassing considering they advertise as having real Chicago style pizza. I consider the thin crust to be one step up from a Tostinos if not identical. Also so far I've had pretty aloof and rude wait staff including this obnoxious bartender who, while waiting for my pizza to be finished for take out, insulted me multiple times with very off and rude comments. I'm actually pretty ashamed that this place is my neighborhood pizza joint. Hopefully they work on these issues so I can be a regular for them!

Un believable! I was on a quest to find the best fancy cupcakes in town for my birthday celebration and boy were these on point! We had gone to a Farmers Market Moonlight Event right next door to this place a few weeks ago and it made us take notice. I ordered 2 dozen cupcakes from the premium cupcake selection. These cupcakes were  most delicious tasting and beautifully prepared. The cake portion of the cupcake was extremely delicate and tasty, no tunneling from over mixing, just right! Just got comparison sake, I bought a few cupcakes from Rouses bakery case and there was no comparison. The premium cupcakes are $4 a piece so they aren't cheap, but worth every bit and penny!

Loved it!

Great location and food. The whole fish special was more than I could handle: amazing taste, hearty, perfectly prepped cauliflower... what a meal. 

Apps of bacon wrapped dates, mussels in a tangy sauce, well prepared and not heavily battered fresh calamari, and a few other small plates served our group well. Wine list long though prices not friendly, oh well.
Nice place with a very friendly staff! Not a big wine drinker but the atmosphere alone is worth the stop!

OMG! My tastebuds were dancing the Charleston the entire meal! We did small plates to sample more variety. Wow! Clean, fresh and complex flavors. 
We had a flatbread, crab cakes ( vegan) kung pao cauliflower, a zucchini, cashew cheese, heirloom tomato form of a Caprice salad. Amazing dessert. The chef is a genius! 
Can't wait to eat there again. 
It is a little bit pricey, but is a vegan treat that anyone can enjoy!
odd!! Beautiful space, rude service Crap drinks its a shame some other bar isn't in this space even a McDonald's would be better

I went here on Saturday Night. Crowded but wife and I had a seat at the bar and bartender's were beautiful and very nice. Had an awesome appetizer the cheesesteak rolls which were almost enough to fill you up with just that. Wife had meatballs stuffed with olives which were also fantastic. Had the special which was a BLT which was best I've ever had. Wife had salad that she loved also. Been here a couple times before but was during the day but then it food was also great. Great beer selection and am definitely going back. Great place. Highly recommend it!
So amazing. Chef Chris is very nice. Orders Pan Seared Duck, it could be the best duck I've ever had.
Was a little disappointed that the chicken pho is made with beef broth, but really enjoyed the chicken fried rice.

They don't make the cheapest donut or the fastest donut, so if you want that, Duck Donuts isn't for you. 

But if you want the best donut you ever had, no doubt partially because you got to pick the topping and drizzle on it, Ducks is for you. 

They somehow combined the fast casual model (I.e. the Chipotle ordering style) with donuts perfectly. The donut alone, even without toppings, is delicious. It's a cake donut that is perfectly warm, soft, and sweet, but not overbearing. I don't have the worlds biggest sweet tooth so I consistently get the cinnamon sugar donut which is heaven on earth. But they have tons of toppings and recommended suggestions too. 

If a donut is as much of an occasional treat for you as it is for me, you might as well make it worth it. Duck Donuts is that place for me.

Deliciously prepared fresh food.
Dining with 8 for lunch and everything came out hot and in a timely manner.  Well organized.  Save room for ice cream!

REALLY! I expected good food and even better service from your Manager Matt - not the case. When a customer has an issue one should expect your manager to come and speak to you personally - never happened . Obviously his customers are not his top priority. I will take my company business elsewhere..

An interesting concept to be a regular bbq place and a vegan bbq place. Prices are fair, the menu is eclectic, the staff is local serving local goods.

The food is phenomenal. Get the tri-tip. And they have wholesome pulled pork, which can be hit or miss with a bbq joint. Plenty of room to eat in, quick service to take out.

Go.
One of the best burgers I've ever had. We ordered French breakfast burger which was truly amazing.
Got macaroni and cheese in a bowl and I only enjoyed the bread we got sour dough bread so it was ok but the macaroni tasted really bad and lacked flavor .. Won't be back next time I'm in isla vista

I had 15 minuts to spear  this morning on my way to play golf near by so instead of stopping at the wawa I decided to stop here as soon as I walk in I was welcomed by a friendly host that led me to my seat. 4 short minuts after I order my breakfast it was served to me very good breakfast I'm glad I stop by instead of wawa definitely will come back again.

I've been frequenting the Good Egg on Speedway/Kolb for many years so, yes, I'm a fan. Out of dozens and dozens of meals that I've enjoyed, very few have undercut my expectations. The menu features an artisan variety of omelets, eggs Benedicts, pancakes and oatmeal. The chefs at the Good Egg have a great deal of imagination as well as expertise. For the health conscious, the caloric value of each meal is clearly displayed on the menu and there are plenty of heart healthy items available. I don't drink coffee, but I'm told friends who frequently accommodate me that it is excellent. I've also heard from more than one person that the bacon is the best in town. Seriously! My hiking buddy comes to the Good Egg with me just for the bacon! My personal favorites on the menu are the Sunrise Benedict with turkey ham, grilled tomato and avocado- and the Castroville omelet with artichoke hearts, tomato, mushrooms, onions and spinach. Many breakfast items come with a choice of seasoned home style potatoes or hash browns. Both are worth trying. If you get a pancake, you don't need to get a stack. One gourmet pancake will fill you up! You can order a pancake in whole wheat if you wish, or with real maple syrup. There are all kinds of combinations to choose from.  

The staff is quite capable and friendly and the service is professional and personable. If you visit often enough, you will get to know the wait staff and they will get to know you as well. If you have a favorite booth or chair, they will try to accommodate you. On weekends, due to the popularity of the Good Egg, there may be a short wait to get seated, but it is worth the wait. During warm weather, the patio is a great place to eat al fresco. 

The Good Egg has the best breakfast on the east side and I've tried them all.

The Bricks is a chill place that vibrates at a very self-aware and authentic frequency. As a vegetarian the food was accommodating and pretty good. I had the Veggie Cuban and the Vegan and Sara rice bowl. Both were flavorful and filling. For a drink I had their Espresso Lemonade....genius!!
The ambiance is to die for, as is the creativity. Service had no issues either. 
The Bricks is a place that once you step inside (or outside, they do have a lil' patio) you cant help but be true to who you are, it's perfect for everyone.

Don't get pulled in by the name. Should have realized something was up when I was able to get a table for 7 45 minutes beforehand. Then we walk in to a completely empty restaurant and she tells us it will be 10 minutes to set us up a table because they just had a big party leave. Really?  We didn't see anyone in site when we arrived. The service is slow, the food Is mediocre at best and the waitress only became cheerful when she brought the bill. The best thing I can say is the music was Opry reruns and the bar had football game on.

Really nice place , after small waiting time we where seated at the rooftop , service was polite and fast , the recommendations where awesome - we took oyster sample platter , 4 type of shrimp - and another sampler with calamari , shrimp and fish - great stuff and great staff , we where there with our kids, high chairs and all available - we will return

This Mexican restaurant is decent at best. It is a tiny spot in the Fishtown area, but was able to accommodate a large group of 15 in a side room area. I do love the fact that the place is byob also, so you can save a little cash from buying drinks. They will also make margaritas for you if you bring your own tequila. Our waiter was patient with our large group and was able to accommodate our large group.

The food wasn't bad I felt. The nachos were stacked with toppings, but the chicken was a bit dry. I ordered Cancun tacos as my entree. They were ok, but needed more of that spicy sauce and more than a tiny piece of tilapia. At least the prices weren't high there. Not bad, I would go again if I wanna save on drinking.

The food and service were excellent. We got the seafood pho and it was great! The small size was big enough for us for dinner. Everyone was very friendly. The atmosphere was lacking but that is the only downside.

I had wanted to visit this Cafe for months and when I got off work early Friday afternoon, I figured it was the perfect time to drop in. 

First impressions were great - I loved the decor and the atmosphere. There was ample seating inside the bright and airy cafe. I chose to sit outside as it was the first lovely day of summer and they had almost a dozen tables outside to pick from. 

I understand they have a great menu but I just had a chai latte. It was the perfect drink for Friday afternoon, sitting on the patio. And the staff were lovely!

I'll be back to check out more of this cute and local cafe!

I have been coming here since they first opened. I had tried their cookies, breakfast pastry, lunch, and bread. Everything is delicious. The pastry is flaky, bread is amazing, and lunch is wonderful, if you can find a table. Unfortunately, their cakes are hit or miss. We bought some cupcakes once, and the kids wouldn't eat them b/c they were very hard. We got some again a few months later thinking it was a mistake, but again, the cupcakes were so hard which didn't justify how expensive they were. Then for 3 years in a row, we've purchase a birthday cake for my BD. The first cake was hard and the icing tasted oily. It wasn't very pleasant. My spouse bought me another cake the 2nd year and it was great. So this year we got one again, vanilla with butter cream. The cake was bread-y, it's more like the consistency of banana bread instead of light and fluffy, and the cream again tasted oily. I am very picky about my dessert, and I have to say a Wegman's cake tastes better than Alice. I still love Alice for everything else they have. Love the pastry, and esp. the lunch. Just that I wouldn't get cupcakes or cakes there again, that's why I took a star off.

Oh, if you go there for lunch, do take consideration that the wait staff also have to help out at the counter. So be patient and they'll definitely get to you. Every waiter/waitress we had always wear a smile, even when they are very busy. We've been there multiple times, esp. in the summer b/c you can find tables outside. Just enjoy a leisurely long lunch and the food is totally worth it!

I love this place.  Privately owned and amazing staff.  Every drink I've order was great.   My kids love the Frozen Hot Chocolate....  I know, don't let the name throw you off.  It's very tasty.  I promise you will not be disappointed.

Massive selection of beers with an extremely knowledgeable staff to go along with it. 

Very friendly staff and great cheap food.

This place is so popular it doesn't need my 5-star review, but here it is anyway.  Great food, great beer, great staff.  The food: the cuban, the spicy cuban, the chimichurri shrimp sandwich, the brisket sandwich. The beer: best place in Indy to try something you haven't had.  The service: always friendly.  Sitting at the bar, you hear bartenders asking servers, "What can I help you with?"  How do you foster that?  Most restaurants can't. To Kevin and all your staff, good show.  Keep it up.

I used the Brew Bus for my birthday celebration and these people could not be more pleasant to work with. They are incredibly friendly and flexible and a breeze to work with. They are quick to get back to you whether via phone or email, their prices are incredibly reasonable for what you're getting, and the beer on board was tasty! I would highly recommend the Tampa Bay Brew Bus to anyone I know, and I will definitely use them again in the future.
I've been here 100+ times and always have the same experience. It is full flavored inexpensive Malaysian food that is served fast and friendly in a modern setting. It is pretty damn near perfect.
Crawfish boil! Extremely friendly staff. They saw us standing up with our kids and brought us chairs. Delicious, cold beer. Great outdoor space

Because I live out of my car, and am a coffee junkie, I normally frequent coffee shops with green awnings, white letters, and a siren adorning their paper cups.  I do this out of necessity.

When I have more time to linger, and require something more "real" and less franchise, I stop by Monon Coffee Company.  

I love the self-serve "honor system" coffee station.  It's also a great place to grab some delicious Rene's baked goods.

If you just need a little treat, try one of the walnut bites.

Went for my daughters birthday for brunch. Horrible customer service. Took forever to even get water. I was excited because I heard the burgers were fantastic. They were "ok". Bloody Mary was 1/2 way decent. My daughter didn't even touch her burger and wanted to take it home. Asked for a "to go" and she brings me 2 tiny containers. I laughed and said not even 1/4 of that will fit. She tells me to cut it up. So I said she didn't even touch it and you do t have a way for me to transport it home, so you can take it off the bill. No interest in giving it a 2nd chance. At least not this location.
Very good FroYo, very good indeed. The flavor was a bit more intense than I am used to, and I inhaled my Chocolate Turtle w granola. Damn good.

This my favorite breakfast place in Tucson. The best omelettes bursting with flavor and perfectly cooked eggs, never over done. Add a cappuccino and share a strawberry French toast with a friend, you'll love it!  If you're really hungry order J'ai Faim! (I'm Hungry!) and you'll walk away with a happy smile on our tummy :)
The service is always good and the atmosphere is chill, comfy, and dog friendly on the patio.

Popped in here for the first time today for a very late lunch. Win.

Template: Cafe on the left, beer lover's paradise on the right. I'm not a beer drinker so I can only judge on the food - which was superb.

Ham and brie on a croissant could be a win, or a fail... here it is definitely win. Flaky fresh perfect croissant + thinly sliced ham + brie = delicious. Add sides of a small pile of nuts, a handful of fresh red grapes and an apple sliced and then drenched in honey? Oh, yes please.

The build out is excellent - heck, I remember when the joint was a dog grooming place and a junky furniture shop - huge step up from there. Side room has a small stage for music acts, and I'm told the happy hour can be SRO. Chatted with the bartender and food prep guys for a while - great neighborhood place. Wish it was here back when I lived in Seminole Heights. Yeah, a definite great addition to the 'hood.
We had the savory bread pudding and the carrot, ginger, scallion and egg waffle.  Both unusual and delicious.  Very filling.  Service from the whole staff was excellent !

Breakfast today. Very nice. 

Unique artwork on the walls.

Food is all from scratch.

We will be back.

Didn't try the food but the location and the vibe here is amazing. Jesse Byers plays every Saturday and is extremely talented! He is also hot. Come on the weekend and have a drink and relax. This is the right place for it!

When the meal came it was excellent.  Getting there was a little tough.  When we first arrived we were told we had a 20 minute wait.  No big deal, we'll get a drink.  After sitting at the bar for 10 minutes and no service we were called to our table.

At the table, my wife tried to order 4 different beers off the menu and each was out of stock.  She finally asked what do you have?  And ordered one which then took 15 minutes to arrive.

If the service was better and faster this would be a good place

We came in for dinner while traveling. We've been to many, many Mexican restaurants and have lived in the southwest for many years. This restaurant was wonderful. They have some meals that are relatively spicy and some that are very mild flavored depending on what you like. The service is amazing too!  I strongly recommend giving this place a try! You won't regret it!!

The food was pretty good and our waitress was nice but the hostess at the front had a bad attitude and was just pretty rude to our party. The three stars is because of her attitude and my food was a little cold. Other than that, I recommend this restaurant.
Love it!  Great drinks with fresh ingredients and guac to start and then you can eat just as much as you like - order a few tacos or as money as you like.  Try the cauliflower taco.
I've only had take out from here but each time everything was delicious! It's close to iWAXu where I work so it's very convenient for me!

I'm thinking that this establishment should just stick to beer. I came here tonight with a friend after having high hopes and we were both so disappointed in the food! 

We ordered the pretzel with beer cheese for an appetizer. The pretzel, while large, was extremely greasy and the beer cheese was SO mild - almost no flavor whatsoever.  The mustard that also accompanied the pretzel was overly salty, so neither dipping sauce was really that desirable.  I just opted for the flavorless beer cheese (better then a mouthful of salt, right?) Also, I'm not sure if it was the kitchen or server, but they forgot to bring it out first and gave it to us in the middle of our dinner.  Not a deal breaker, but it took a good 25 minutes for it to come out. 

For dinner I got the WOB COB salad. It sounded great on the menu! When I received it, I immediately noticed there was barely any lettuce! My friend also noticed the same issue with her salad. (See photo.) I basically had a bowl with bacon, mozarella, eggs, chicken and a few salad leaves. I actually ended up asking for a side of lettuce for my salad and had to mix it in. Very weird! Also, as I was eating it, I kept picking out chunks of frozen peppers.  I'm wondering if it's pre-made in the back. 

While this place has a cute ambiance and a fun crowd, the food was really lackluster. I think I would come back for a drink with friends, but the food really disappointed me. Maybe there is a better dish on the menu, but I'm skeptical.

Very sold happy hour! $2 beers and $3 wine and 1/2 off apps! Can't beat that! We have the fried green tomatoes which were awesome, and the buffalo oysters, also delicious. We ordered shrimp po boys and the oyster po boy, both were fantastic and the service was fantastic. The debris fries were only thing not good, the beef was really weird, almost sweet. We switched these out for the crawfish etoufee fries which were

We were pleasantly surprised with this pho place in a strip mall along route 70. The service was a bit slow, but the food was quite good. I was happy that there a lot of vegetarian options on the menu. The vermicelli with vegetarian spring roll was delicious. 

The place has a nice decor and the staff were friendly and attentive.

One note of caution: skip the bubble tea. It just wasn't good. Get the iced coffee instead.

My supper was good. My waiter was EXCELLENT! My napkin was dirty. Did someone forget to wash it before using it again? My corn contained way too much pepper. And know that this restaurant tends to have a higher level of noise than other restaurants.

A hidden gem in Edmonton! Live music on the weekends in the evening as well as at brunch on Sunday morning. The blueberry pancakes and banana bread French toast are to die for! 

Don't expect anything fancy but this unique Cafe is sure to be a hit. It accommodates both large and small groups.
It's kind of a cool place to hang out. Large with an expansive patio space for the nice weather days. The food is mediocre. Happy hour deals are okay, but overall the place is just okay.

There was so much sodium in our meals. I had ravioli with spaghetti-O sauce. My friend had the chicken special. We left with my friend staggering and with a headache. Very bad! Cute girl was terrific, very sweet.
The service, environment and food was great! The happy hour is a great deal, 1/2 price drafts, rolls and apps. Danny was very friendly and attentive.

The food is good (I especially like the kale salad and fancy BLT), the prices are high but not surprising considering its location (right next to Independence Mall), but what I especially appreciate are the consistently friendly, attentive, and helpful attitudes of the waitstaff (my personal favorite was when one offered me a to-go cup for a second glass of their fabulous fresh-squeezed orange juice).

I stopped in for lunch the other day and enjoyed the meal but wasn't blown away. The lemon rice soup was good although quite bland and star hire than I am used to tasting with this soup. I did appreciate the slice of lemon that they added on the side. The stuffed grape leaves were quite good but the saganaki was bland and undercooked despite the rave reviews from so many others. Unfortunately, it was also what I had been looking forward to the most but the cheese wasn't particularly cooked and was rubbery without any of the gooeyness one expects. On a side note and not the reason for the rating but I was disappointed to not even get a single O-pah when it was lit on fire. Either way, the meal was decent. I have heard great things about Spiro's and would definitely return to try their entrees in hopes of a better experience next time. If I do and have a better experience then I will certainly add an updated score and review.

The staff is always friendly and helpful, the food is delicious, and even though it's always packed, tables turn over quickly- it's never hard to find a table. Our faves are the pork belly slider, cali style fries, cinnamon roll, and vietnamese iced coffee. Pro-tip: the lemonade is tart, not sugary. It's still good, but expect some bite from it.

Went here for a friend's birthday last night and it was a great experience. We made a reservation last minute and were still able to get accommodated. The staff was very welcoming and our server was attentive and ensured that we have a good experience. It felt good to sit outside in the fresh air and take in the place. The only somewhat annoying part for me was the trains constantly passing through, does take away if you are mid conversation (but I am sure this is not a make it or break it factor). 

The food was great, different concept than I am used to. Most of the items have a sweeter touch to them with glaze and sauce on. I tried the hangar steak and the meat was cooked just right, but the sweet glaze was not my favorite. Came with a side of fries, can never go wrong with that. I know next time to order without glaze. I did not really try any of the drinks, but my friends did and everyone seemed to enjoy them. 

We will definitely be back again, probably during the day time to enjoy brunch.

From the moment we walked in Rincon Beach Club we were greeted by warmth and hospitality. After visiting numerous venues we accidentally came across Rincon Beach Club through Yelp. Right after dinner we drove there and knew that this was the place for us. We scheduled an appointment and after the first meeting we were in love! Every venue we had visited made us feel like an "appointment" but Carol and Marc made us feel like we were at home. It was all the little things...The way they had a box of desserts as a gift for us (and their desserts are BOMB), or the way they dressed up the venue for a mock wedding for us that brought me to tears. This couple is really such an inspiration because they are doing what they love. Every step of the way they strive to make your event so special. It's because of this passion they have helped us make our wedding a reality. 

Guests could not stop talking about how great the food was and so many people told me they had 2-3 plates of food. All our desserts were gone at the end of the night! I love this catering company from the bottom of my heart! They host events at their venue and are also able to cater to the venue of your choice.

Highly recommend them!
Taco tuesdays had a great deal! Their nachos are really yummy. Kid friendly too!  Prices were good and atmosphere was pleasant. Came with a few friends and the kids.

My Yelp friends Coty and Paul asked me to join them one evening at Mei's World Pizza and Salads along Bearss Avenue, near Bruce B Downs, in the USF area. I wasn't quite sure what to expect, as the name of this place seems to imply a pizza shop, and yet Coty told me that they serve very good Taiwanese food. Hmmmm, well, she has never failed me with her selection of restaurants, and so I was game to give this place a try.

Sure enough, this little restaurant on the north side of Bearss Avenue looks like a pizza / sandwich shop from the outside, but inside, the place was packed with college students in the know, as well as folks looking for good Thai food. 

The first thing you should know is that nothing on the regular Thai menu is priced over $10. That includes rice bowls, noodle bowls and platters, traditional Thai appetizers, and a great mix of entrées. Secondly, they DO serve pizza......and apparently you can have them put Thai or Chinese / American food on top of your pizza. Finally, if you are so inclined, they do serve pig's feet, chicken feet, chicken lips, chicken butt, and a whole lot of things that will never go into my mouth. Sorry, but I just can't picture a chicken walking around on a pair of crutches because someone wanted to eat chicken feet! Nope, it's not gonna happen.

Coty ordered a number of very tasty dishes for the three of us to share, and so we enjoyed Mei's pan-fried pork buns, pepper-seasoned fried chicken (no feet, please!), hand-cut Zha Jiang noodles in a black bean sauce, and a sliced, boneless pork chop served with a tea egg. The egg was awesome, so we ordered some more of them. Mei, is of course the owner, and she & Coty got in to a very fun discussion about Coty's upcoming trip to Taiwan as well as her experiences with enjoying Taiwanese food in New York City.

I really enjoyed my meal, but was glad that I went there with people who were more experienced in ordering this cuisine. The wait staff at Mei's was super-friendly, and very helpful about making recommendations about the menu.

I liked this place a lot, and will gladly go back when I'm in the neighborhood.

It's Devour Indy time! Friends and I decided to stop by Livery for the first time. We decided to order off of their Devour Indy  menu. I had the Chicken Empanadas, Pork Tenderloin, and Churros for dessert. Everything came out quickly. Our server was attentive, always refilling our waters, making sure everything was alright. The Pork Tenderloin was very tender and cooked very well. I tried my friend's ceviche and it was good as well. I think they did a very well job with the empanada-sauce pairings. I would love to come back in the summer for their patio seating! Of course, while enjoying some margaritas and good good.

I had the Cubana sandwich. It said it has Chorizo in it but it really was a cheap hotdog. The bread was stale and crumbly. The whole thing tasted like cheap processed food. I can't see how they got a 4 star rating I rate it 1 star.

Food: 4 stars
Service: 3 stars
Location: 4 stars
Ambiance: 3.5 stars
Price: 4 stars

Recommendations:  The Good Dog Burger is excellent.  Its one of the top 5 burgers I've had in Philadelphia (see TOP 5 BURGERS LIST).  The highlight of the meal are the french fries which are served as a combination of Sweet Potatoes and Yukon Gold Potatoes.  The beer selection on tap are unique and fun to try.  My fiance got the Fried Tomato BLT which she loved as well.

My only critique is that service can be a little bit more personal and that the ambiance is a little too dark for my taste in a pub style restaurant/bar.  They have so many great pictures of dogs on their walls; I wish they would feature them a little bit better.

Overall: 4 stars
A great place to get dinner and drinks and kick off your night with a little pre-party.

Food is good but should be called the messy crab remember to wear the gloves and the bib. The place a little pricey. The food was good but would rather be served instead of cafeteria type of ordering. At the prices they have they can afford a waitress or a waiter!

Ridiculously good food with reasonable pricing; unique coffee concoctions, and an extremely laid back atmosphere with a friendly staff. Small menu that covers all bases (I don't particularly like being overwhelmed with choices), and an incredible liquor selection! As a bonus, they apparently have their own unique blend of Angel's Envy Bourbon.

About to dig in to Monday night's Church of Nintendo event that they have here; check it all out!

I really like this Qdoda. The staff are exceptionally friendly and the line always moves quickly. The food is fresh and I can't get enough of that guac (seriously, I'd eat it every day if I could). 

At the top of my list when I need to pick up a quick lunch.

5 star service. 

Came with a small group, no reservation, an hour and a half before Villanova played in the Final Four. The place was packed and we were told we'd wait for half an hour, and then were seated in five minutes. The place was packed and loud, but the service was amazing. I didn't get the name of our server but she was from SoCal and deserves a huge raise and a hug! 

The food isn't bad. I had just appetizers. the chicken quesadilla is really good. The nachos are not good--it's the cheese they use. My friends enjoyed their sandwiches and I had a bite of the salmon sandwich. Good, not great. 

The drinks were very good. I cracked and tried their newest drink called "the process." It had ginger ale and tasted sweet and I could drink it all day, it's so dangerously good. I also liked the Angry Orchard Rose Cider. 

Come for the service, the location on Lancaster, and for the bar/TV setup on game night. I'll be back.
good beer & an amazing wild mushroom salad .. yum

On the plus side the Chili Releno was quite good and my wife enjoyed her chicken quesadia.  On the down side I thought the margarita was terrible.  Too sweet.  Service was excellent.  We will be back.  I'll just stick with the Negro Modelo on draft!

If i could give a negative number i would. The service was AWFUL!!!! My boyfriend ordered a burger only
to be told later they didn't have anymore. So he had to order the steak. Then the table directly next to us ordered a burger. A little while later both got their orders. He got his steak and the lady next to us got the burger. REALLY???! Thought there wasn't anymore burgers? Oh and did i mention my boyfriend is a man of color and the lady next to us is was white. Hmmmmm go figure. We will NEVER return to the establishment. 10 thumbs down as far as I'm concerned.

Very popular place to eat and socialize. We personally like the happy hour appetizers and nice variety of reduced price drinks. Although quite busy, we found attentive waitstaff taking care of our requests but they seemed stretched pretty thin and rushed too (Wednesday around 6pm). We enjoyed our experience nonetheless and recommend it.

In my line of work I spend a great deal of time going to conferences all over the United States. I have had the opportunity to experience a number of schmancy hotels but this Ritz Carlton is by far my favorite.

If you were looking for a great place to host conferences, etc. The Ritz Carlton will work with you to help make the experience affordable and memorable. From the menus, to the venues. From the courtyard to the ballrooms. Everything is perfection.

I think what I find most humorous in having worked with this hotel on conference business is that my conference attendees commented most often about how much they loved the gardenia candle in the lobby. I have to admit, though. It is a pretty damn awesome candle.

In the conference managers at the hotel are top notch! I can't say enough about how great they are! I only wish I could host every conference here.
It's located in the Monaco and it's a high end restaurant but honestly not worth the wait considering the establishments within walking distance.

What won me over here was the bacon. So. Freaking. Good.

Other than that, you can expect all of the usual diner trappings.... for better and for worse.

I've gone back a few times now and haven't had a bad experience yet.

One of my favorite breakfast places. Great food and service plus you get a ton of food... I usually take half home for a second meal. Definitely try a skillet as they are phenomenal and the pancakes are delicious!!!!
Excellent food and service.   Excellent food value for the price as well.  Had the breakfast sandwich and fruit.  Yummy I would go back!!!

I absolutely love Mr. B's! I only go for one thing because they do it the best. Their BBQ shrimp is absolutely to die for. Don't skip out on this if you're a shrimp fan. Don't let the name deter you, it's not "barbecue." It's spicy and delicious and a bit messy (don't wear white). Make sure you make a reservation.

Couldn't tell you how the food was. Late night on January 20 we went in for dinner.  We were told to sit anywhere at the bar. Several booths were empty but none cleaned. No recognition from any staff. After 20 minutes we went to another area for seating.  We were seated after 15 minutes and given menus.  After another 20 minutes of no recognition from staff we finally left.

A hidden gem.  Slow cooked as authentic you can get for fast service.  I want to come back and try everything.  The voodoo chix is Not too spicy but plenty of options to give it some kick.  I'm glad this new option is available in West Nashville where I feel we are starting to get into a rutt. Hats of to the owners! Thanx for bing original!

The ambience of this restaurant is very romantic. The lights are all dimmed, which affords you a beautiful view of the city at night if you have an evening reservation. I was there celebrating a birthday, and the staff was very informative on the menu as well as providing a special experience. We ordered the pressed appetizer, and the waitress informed us in advance on portion sizes for appetizers and main courses, which I really liked. The pressed appetizer is really delicious and topped with arugula that is dressed in lemon and parmesan.  We also ordered a bottle of Malbec wine, which we got to taste first. This is a really good red wine we paired with the bone-in ribeye and pork chop. We ordered both to be cooked medium, and it did not disappoint. The meat was juicy, and well seasoned despite what some of the other reviews claim. It may have been my experience, but they were delicious. For sides we ordered mac and cheese, grits, and brussel sprouts. The mac and cheese is a small portion, but perfectly enough for two people. All of our food was amazing, and this is a great place to celebrate huge milestones in a serene and upscale ambiance!

Food = 7.6/10
Service = 4/10
Bathrooms = 3/10
Brunch = 8.1/10

Rip it. 

Fun, good group spot, don't expect it to be quick but expect it to be good.

I'd like to update that I went back to Miller's not too long ago with my husband, 3YO & 1 YO. This time our server was clearly under the influence of drugs. To the point she couldn't take our order & was eventually escorted out. Her speech was slurred, she could barely walk and as she tried to communicate with us her eyes began closing as she slumped over our table nodding out. I had to get a bar tender to come help. It was awful. I don't know why we tried going here again but this time we certainly will not be going back. Ever.

The fried pickles and jalapeños I really enjoyed but, they come with more fried okra than pickles and jalapeños these days.  Show stopper was the impossible burger! As long as you go into it knowing this is a plant-based burger, than it tastes just like a hamburger without the greasy aftermath.  I will definitely try the impossible burger again. I was not disappointed!

Pretty awesome! Food was good (Had the Crawfish boil With the side of Potatoes, Corn and the Sausage was Delicious!!). Good prices good service & Great Location! Right in middle of it all!! :)
Will definitely be Back!!

My friend and I are in town for a week and Mai Thai's late night happy hour was the top of my list of places to try. 

We arrived around 9:10 (it started at 9PM) and sat at the bar. The bar itself was empty when we arrived but there was a couple of large groups behind us and the solo bartender was very slammed. He was friendly but said immediately that it was not a typical Tuesday. 

We put in an order for drinks (they are BOGO free during happy hour) and food (a variety of dishes for discounted prices)

My friend had 2 Siam Mules. I had an Apocalypso Now and something with "Sunshine" in the title. The drinks were super delicious and unique. 

For food, we tried the Tempura Portobello Mushrooms, the nachos, the ramen, a firecracker roll and a mountain roll. The portions were ENORMOUS and much bigger than we were expecting. We ended up taking most of the ramen and sushi home. 

All of the food was quite delicious except the sushi which was good but had a little too much sauce for our liking. The ramen was my favorite. 

My rating is largely because of the service. While the servers and bartenders were friendly when you had their attention, GETTING their attention was quite difficult. It was a bit loud, they moved quickly past us, and they rarely made eye contact, all of which made it very hard to get service, another drink, etc.

The most frustrating part of the evening was that when our bill came, we were overcharged. We had 4 drinks total, but there were 5 listed on the bill. We were charged for 3, and 2 were 0.00. When we tried to point the discrepancy out, the bartender and server both argued with us that they were right and that we weren't overcharged. But we for sure were. So we overpaid by $9 because our Uber showed up as we were trying to sort it out and it just wasn't worth making the driver wait. 


So yeah, food was good, drinks were really good, service was mediocre at best. Maybe we just hit it on an off night but the way they handled the bill discrepancy was ridiculous and kind of ruined it for us.
The staff here are very friendly and welcoming. The lunch menu is worth the trip once in a while. Check out the lunch menu deep dish pizza and soup. Good food, great service, great location.

I was craving BBQ and Sugarfire absolutely hit the spot. The cafeteria-style serving makes for a fun experience. The staff was so friendly and they weren't annoyed by my questions about the sides. Speaking of sides, they have a ton of options for both sides and meat/fish. The pulled pork was absolutely delicious as were the ribs and the French fries. I was really excited that they had Brussels sprouts, but ultimately was kind of disappointed. They were kind of undercooked and didn't have a whole lot of flavor.  We also were there at the end of the night and couldn't help but feel like the staff was ready for us to leave before we finished eating. That being said, I would definitely recommend Sugarfire to satisfy any BBQ craving!

Had a reeeeeely nice lunch here after a small garden wedding at the Santa Barbara Courthouse.  Party of about 14-15.  They really accommodated us, printed up custom menus with couples' names, which was a super nice touch.  We  had "family style" apps, and the food, ordered off the menu, came out quickly.  They were also able to provide a wedding cake that we were all so happy with.  House wines and ability to order cocktails really added to the event.  Had scoped this place out about a month ago with friends, and made everyone order something different so we could get a good overview of the food.  The preview was great, food and cocktails really hit the mark; and yesterday's event was even better.  Shout out to the server (who we had both times)!  Didn't get your name, but wish you nothing but the best with the coming birth of the baby! Thank you to the whole staff!  P.S. Sat on the patio, which was awesome! fountain and all - and thank goodness for good weather (although we did have a backup plan!)

The first one in Edmonton, so we had to check it out. It was JUST like the ones we visiting in the States so this review started out as 4 stars with the food and vibe feeling right on par with our expectation. 
The biggest downside for us was the wait. We did read the reviews ahead of time and expected about an hour wait, the part that kind of threw us off was the hour wait and then a secondary line to go into after we handed in our buzzer...more waiting. Of course then there is the wait for food. When we did get in we noticed a huge empty section. I will say I am glad they took our phone number and we were free to wander the mall while we waited so we didn't have to stay super close and we could check on Yelp what number we were at in the wait. Since the mall was closing when we went there was no where to go but wait. They should really put in more benches around that area of the mall now that so many people are there waiting. 
Mind you our server was super and very lovely - kept us posted on food time and entertained us with some quotes and trivia. We love that Forest Gump is constantly playing on the tvs, our table wasn't facing one so that was a bit of a bummer but there was plenty of paraphernalia to look at and talk about. 
We always order shrimp here(Shrimpers Heaven to be specific), you have to get the coconut shrimp it is amazing! But this time we had a fairly big and Hungry group so we also ordered the southern fried chicken, Jenny's catch with lobster butter sauce, the Run Across America sampler platter, and one other fish dish. These other dishes were all super tasty! I would highly recommend any of them. But we definitely didn't have any leftovers from our hungry crew of 5.

We went here on a whim, because we needed to go to Target nearby and we were in the mood for Italian. On a Monday night (this was New Years Day), they were surprisingly busy. We were told the wait would be 10 minutes. Not too long of a wait; I figured I could distract my toddler for 10 minutes until we got seated and the bread basket was put in front of him.

The wait seemed a lot longer than 10 minutes. I wish I took note of the actual wait length.

I was also surprised to see that about 1/3 of the tables were empty despite the wait time.

We were seated and we ordered an appetizer and my son's meal right away. After we got our appetizer (buratta mozzarella with tomatoes, basil and onions) and our salads, we ordered our dinners (both pasta/seafood dishes). We dug into the bread basket and immediately asked for more, because my son likes to eat carbs by the fistful, and frankly I'll do just about anything to keep him happy towards the end of his day while we're trying to dine out.

Welp, things were ok until then. It took quite a long time to get our second bread basket. My son started flipping out so I took him out of the restaurant so we didn't disturb other patrons. (I realize this has nothing to do with the actual restaurant but it's still relevant.)

Right before I took my screaming son out, I told my boyfriend to ask the waitress to pack up our food to go so we could get out of there ASAP. Well, maybe a half an hour later we got our food and our check so we could leave. They kindly threw in extra salads.

We got home and I was so excited to dig into the real dinner (after putting the monster to bed). Dinner was good, but by no means was it great. I got the seafood alfredo, and my boyfriend got shrimp/scallop a la vodka. Neither of our dishes had enough sauce; both sauces seemed runny and just pooled at the bottom of our takeout containers.

Between the meh pasta dishes, the fact that my son's kid's ravioli had 5 ravioli in it (for $7, I believe...), and the incredibly slow service, we will not be going back.

The only thing I order here is the bourbon glazed salmon, they do have sweet potato fries which is nice. If you are in a diet it's easy to eat here. Lots of low calorie options. Steamed veggies are good, bathroom smells weird but the food is decent.

I went here for a group birthday party during restaurant week. The restaurant is nicely sized, large enough to be left alone, small enough to have a conversation. I also liked the view of the kitchen.

The Restaurant Week menu had a few vegan appetizers, plus a salad, and a vegan entree, but no vegan desserts. The server did bring out a fruit plate for me. I had the crispy cauliflower and lemon hummus as my meal. Both were well seasoned and I thought the portions were fare. Although some of my fellow diners thought their entree portions were small, everyone left nicely satisfied. Also the birthday desserts were a cute surprise.

The service was okay. Although we were asked several times how we were enjoying our meal, we were constantly waving the waitress down to get drink refills. I'd chalk it up to the restaurant not being used to a group of our size or our server being new. 

All in all, I'd recommend the restaurant, especially when considered with the awesome hotel.

I ordered DoorDash from here on the last night of my trip to New Orleans. After days of eating Cajun cuisine I was craving some veggies, broth and noodles, what I consider to be comfort food. I splurged and got enough for early dinner and a late night meal. Let me tell you THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!!!!!

The pho broth is flavorful and came with so much beef and meatballs. The bean sprouts were super clean and crunchy. The broth was still hot and the rare brisket were sliced thin and cooked quickly in the hot soup. 

The dry noodle dish came loaded with fresh veggies. The egg roll I decided to add was so flavorful and the outside was still nice and crunchy. Loved the sauce that came on the side, perfect compliment to the noodles and veggies. 

Spring rolls were simply delicious also. All the foods were very well packaged. No leakage, plenty of silverware and napkins.

Happy Hour 4-7PM (Monday thru Friday) 

1/2 Price apps ... general bar fare.  I'm HUGE fan of the steak tacos.   Free chips is you remember to ask for them...ARE GREAT!  Drinks are free is you're gaming.  The gaming is 5 cent minimum but it's spacer than the penny machines on the casino floor. Must better wine than you get in the main casino-unless your at the high roller slots/tables.  Music every night.  On the times I've been there it's a man and guitar which sets the right mood for a happy hour not a rock concert. 

The bartender and wait staff are very friendly (Not on a first name basis with any of them).  

It's a dimly light round bar with loungey banquettes around the perimeter.  The dim light works for the space especially if you need a break from the very neon casino floor.
Cool atmosphere. I've only been for brunch though. And was a little disappointed considering the price. It didn't live up to the expectations set prior to going.
The pizza we got, tomato and sausage, is crazy delicious! The tomatoes are unbelievably fresh. Quality ingredients at a great price. Really friendly employees! I'm a Super satisfied customer.

Drinks, food and service are amazing here! Who'd a thought... we walked and weren't really feeling the atmosphere but we gave it a shot anyway and much to our surprise... LOVED IT!  Must try the Pecan pie!

We were hungry after hiking and stopped here on the way home. So good! We had the pulled pork nachos, fresh nachos and salsa, potato skins, kids cheese quesadilla and a cheeseburger. Everyone ate everything - including the kids! You know that doesn't happen often. Good cold beer on tap. Nice remodel and very clean. Server even noticed a fork wasn't perfectly clean and removed it without anyone else noticing. I did - thank you. Most don't notice important details like this. Also, we used the Yelp check in bonus for a free dessert.  Get the chocolate cake - homemade and worthy of 5 stars itself!!! If we're ever back in Beech Grove we'll stop again.

I stopped in for a late lunch after wandering around Society Hill.  I ordered the Cobb salad and a chipotle chicken wrap to go. Both were excellent. Nice folks, reasonable prices, and tasty food. What more could you ask for!?

I thought my husband ordered too much food.  I just wanted a quality latte and fruit.  I'm so glad he ordered- the savoy crepe was heavenly, flaky croissant, creamy grits, and the chicken (not over cooked) skillet was also delicious. We nearly cleaned our plates!

2nd visit - worker not a morning person I guess. I patiently waited for him to flip the closed sign. No warm greeting  the latte was slightly over steamed. Disappointed.

We have eaten here many times and had several different items on the menu including specials. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating. Didn't visit before new owners since we are new to area keep up the good work like this place very much.

My husband and I dropped in for breakfast and had mixed feelings about this place. Both of our omelettes were pretty good. The peasant potatoes were delicious but the turkey sausage was incredibly bland. I wish I would've just gotten an extra side of potatoes instead. The pricing of ala carte items also seems off. $4.29 for a glass of orange juice is absolutely absurd. Overall, we spent $36, before tip, for a mediocre breakfast.

I really love this place! It's a little bit on the smaller side, so if you are planning to come here for dinner on a Friday or Saturday night I would suggest making reservations so you don't have a long wait.  They have a really good beer list and really good wines as well.  I have tried many different items off the food menu and they only thing I can say I didn't enjoy was the polenta fries ( although in stone rose's defense I had never had polenta before and I think I just don't like polenta in general ). However, I would definitely recommend the seasonal flatbread, mussels, cheese plate, short ribs over Mac and cheese, crab cakes, and they have these Parmesan truffle fries that are AWESOME.  Good atmosphere, good and friendly service, great food-what more can I say??

Been here many times. Only complaint would be that one time we had a reservation and had to wait about 20 minutes for our table, but it happens. I've sat in both the front room and the back room. While both have wonderful muralscapes in them, the back room is definitely better. It is not near the bathroom for one, and in the winter, the front room gets a draft whenever anyone enters or leaves the restaurant.

The food is excellent, of course I had to try the Branzino when I was once there. But my favorite is the veal marsala. One of the best in town! It is a BYO.

This place can get busy, but I continue to go due to the wonderful food and prompt services. Get menu selection, prompt friendly service, and the food comes at a timely manor. 
The steak is always juices and tender
The Crab and Fish are fresh
and the clams are seasoned perfectly. 
All time favorite place

We stumbled upon this place as we walked state street. Looking for a place to have lunch. The menu looked good so we walked in for a seat. The staff kind of shy?! Almost seemed not intrested? After ordering our server warmed up. I would suggest trying the hot sandwiches. The bread toasted to perfection and nice flavors in the sauces. Casual family friendly environment with good sized portion. We would try again if we are ever in the area.

Black Sheep is decent place to go if you're in the Ritenhouse area, but wanna get away from Rittenhouse.  

The food is okay, I think it's kind of pricey for what it is.

Went in last night w/ some friends to have some beers and watch the Phils game.  I wound up having the Rueben sandwich.  Very tasty, nice alternative to a burger.

I'd say nothing special about this place, but i like that it lacks the pretentiousness that is prominent in the area
The Ciopinno is fantastic. The decor and the beer also out of this world. Was not super impressed with the service. But everything else is on point.
Best food in town.. love the teas!  Servers are very attentive and quick!
Fast and friendly service. The only thing I didn't like is kind of small in space but really amazing food

I can't recommend this Red Lobster. We made a reservation thru Open Table only to be told the reservation only gave us priority seating. We left after waiting 90 minutes and being told our wait would be another 45 at least. The manager was rude to us when we inquired why do they take reservations through Open Table if they weren't going to honor them. The manager said they never honored reservations. We left eventually never having been seated.

Absolutely the best breakfast!  Everything has a fresh and flavorful taste.  Portion sizes are perfect.  The most delicious espresso.  There's something for everyone...  whether you want low cars, sweet, traditional or something new.   Simply perfect

Great pizza, better salads, and a decent wine/beer list. As a St. Louis native who has traveled extensively, I can say I like all pizza. New York, Chigago, St. Louis, Sicilian, its all good and Deweys is right up there. I don't generally endorse chain restaurants, but this is a good one.

I must have accidentally deleted my original review from a few years ago. Anyway, I gave it 4 Stars because it was pretty good. They used freshly brewed tea, and the drinks were usually on point. Then came the change of ownership. I have been back several times in the past 6 months, but never again. The last couple times I went, they didn't even bother to turn on half the lights, even though it was during business hours. There are usually only one or two employees, and even though the place is empty, nobody greets me when I walk in. They are usually sitting at a side table and look annoyed that I interrupted whatever they were doing on their laptops. The quality of their drinks have gone down as well. The tea always tastes watery and has no flavor. I even asked for no ice one time, and it still tasted like tinted water!  I mentioned it to the guy working, he said it was because they switched brands of tea or something like that. I asked if they could make something else, but he said "it would probably be the same, but I can remake it if you really want me to". I did. So he did. And it did. Still taste exactly like tinted water that is. Well, that was the last straw. Literally. The good news is that there are more boba places popping up in Tucson, so there is no need to cry over spilled boba.

After a reservation misunderstanding Brittany went above and beyond to ensure we still had a wonderful dining experience. My friends and I all highly recommend the entire menu as we tried a majority of it.
I am always craving their iced lavender latte!! I wish they were closer, I'd get my coffee here everyday instead of Starbucks!!

This place has great donuts.  The bacon, maple glazed donut is awesome.  They also have a square donut with almonds and raisins, oh and its glazed as well.  

The other day I went in and they made a fresh pot of coffee for my wife and I.  The coffee was great and their customer service was outstanding.

I am now a regular. :-)

I'd give 4.5 stars if I could. This is a lovely space in a neighborhood that is reviving. Lovely warm colors, Edison lamps, and decor. Nice specialty cocktail list with something for everyone. I have had the pretzels (the honey Harissa dipping sauce is terrific), two different flatbreads, two different soups, and the schwarma. I think they excel at the starters and especially the cold fruit soups-one was mango Masala, the other apricot yogurt. Both amazing. Waitstaff is affable and timely, and nice mix of neighborhood folks, hipsters and everywhere in between. This is between my girlfriend's place in Tower Grove East and mine in Lafayette Square, so I envision many more visits. Easy access from Jefferson south off 44. This is worth a visit. Oh, they have a game night on Tuesday-have not been to that yet.

This place is such a gem hidden in St Pete! We came in bc of the good reviews and we loved it! Such a clean, calm ambiance. The girl taking care of us was very attentive and nice. The food was amazing!! Great spot for breakfast or brunch. Definitely recommend this place to all.
Never disappointed. French toast are the most thickest and fluffiest I ever had. I never finish a meal because they give you more than enough!
Love this places. It's a chill local spot with great beer on tap and surprisingly amazing food.
It's the best pizza in town thin crust quality toppings I personally like the cornmeal that's put on the bottom.  I love the rojo's potatoes the salad bar is very good fresh ingredients

Staff and atmosphere were great!

The food was just ok. I was not impressed. I ordered the eggs, grits, and biscuits and gravy. Everything needed to be seasoned. The gravy just wasn't good.

We recently ordered Scotty's on the Door Dash app and were absolutely impressed with their service! The quality of food was just as good as sitting at one of their restaurant tables... the packaging was some of the best we have ever gotten from ordering through Door Dash... and the delivery time was MUCH shorter than anticipated!

Thanks Scotty's!!
Here last week and the service was prompt. Pretty typical and nothing out of the ordinary about this Dunkin... Could definitely stand to be cleaner though, the interior has the crustiest vibe.

MACHACA CON HUEVOS.  Order this - go home happy (and full for the rest of the day).  The pork just melted in your mouth.  You can't eat like this every day but for a cheat day...heck yeah!

This is a no frills cafe with excellent food (and super nice staff!).
Ordered a "Bloody Maria" . A bloody mary w a shot of tequila.  They charged me $20 PER DRINK!!!!!Service and food is AMAZING! But $40 for two mediocre drinks is unreasonable!

Overall,food and drinks are good. Decor and ambiance was nice. The plan was to go to the Movie Tavern, but after a list of sold outs movies, we decided to give this place a try. Was definitely worth the money. I recommend this place to anyone in the area.

We decided to come here since it was one of the closest Indian restaurants to the KOP mall, and I wish we traveled a few more minutes to go elsewhere. 

The two stars is only because the food was half decent. We had the chana saag and paneer makhani with plain naan. We asked for medium spiciness, but it was actually not that spicy at all. Overall the food was sub-par.

The service we had was quite horrible, most likely because they had two parties going on, but still, it was a nightmare. We walked in and waited about 5 minutes at the counter until we even saw someone who worked at the restaurant. They seated us with menus and no one came back over for about 10 minutes. We ordered our food and they gave us some water. Another person comes over and repeats our order, to make sure the other person got it right, I guess. The food comes out 20 minutes later and somehow it was the wrong food! They gave us lamb saag instead of chana saag. They took it back and left the paneer makhani and rice. At this point we were not given silverware or serving utensils yet so we couldn't even begin eating. They came out with the chana saag 5 minutes later... and we had to ask for silverware. At this point the paneer was room temperature. Another waiter came over and asked us is everything was okay and filled our waters. We asked for the check and it came 10 minutes later. Overall, really bad service and no apologizes were really given.

Will we be coming back? No.

It's a John Besh joint, so I expected a lot, and it delivered. More casual than some of his other spots, total French Bistro vibe. The service was exceptional, and the food predictably good, especially the fresh oysters. On the loud side, for those who are concerned about such things...

I'm a huge fan of this place!  I've been here about 15 times over the past couple of years and really love it.  Good atmosphere and the food is great.  One of the best chicken vindaloo's I've had anywhere.  Really looking forward to trying the new one opening in Glen Mills.  Oh and do yourself a favor and get a King Fisher beer...its solid and an underrated beer.

Honestly they have the best hash browns around. Maybe it's because I'm not a hash brown type of lady, but all I know is that they were full of flavor and I wish I had more on my plate! I ordered the two egg platter, which everything was delicious, including the sausage & eggs which sometimes are iffy anywhere you go. My fiance ordered some pancakes on the side and boy did I love them! I was so stuffed after eating here. We got our food to go, because the line was super long and we didn't want to wait around for our table with our 10 month old. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the French Quarter. It's cute, priced decently and YUMMY!

Came here monday night since they had indoor dining. Got here got seated quickly. Place was about half full and servers was really working hard. We ended up ordering the bbq platter and corn dogs for the kids. Platter was good. Ribs were nice and tender. Chicken and brisket was ok. Then they gave us grilled cheese when the kids order corn dogs. The guy who dropped the food looked mad when we said we ordered the corn dogs. Our waiter came back and apologized for the mistake which was nice. Once we started eating we wanted refills on waters but it took him a while to come back. Also waiting for the check took a min too.

I am very confused about the low reviews.

Let me paint this perspective.

A place that sells Chicken as late as 3am (during college class time)
BYOB
Plays music
Is located downtown

WIN WIN WIN.

Now I will admit they have a very limited menu and they can be a little pricey but the taste and quality of the food is second to none.

Give them a shot and get back to me
Können Sie empfehlen Medikamente für Furz und Durchfall? Ich Furz wie eine große Trompete. Vollen Klang, wie ein Kaiser Furz. Mein Durchfall fließt wie ein Fluss!

Recently visited Bottos for a family birthday dinner.  The food was excellent. I had the Prima Vera risotto and it was amazing.  The atmosphere was warm and inviting and service was out of this world.  Our server, Kate, seemed like she could read our minds and was always there with whatever we needed. She even made a fuss out of the birthday "boy".  The only slight complaint was that my draft beer could have been a bit colder. Definitely recommend!

Had brunch and it was AMAZING!! Definitely get the red velvet waffle and Singapore Stirfry...absolutely delicious. Ask for Megan, she is an incredible server. Very attentive, professional, all around wonderful!

I went in and ordered a chicken Caesar salad to go and was not very pleased. I should have ordered the dressing on the side but i did not think they would put THAT much dressing on the salad. It was completely drenched and soggy and i opened it just a few minutes after getting it so it wasn't sitting for long. I couldn't eat it because the dressing was just taking over the whole salad and it did not taste good.

Cool interior, hip and understated. Not exactly 100% Pizza Napoletana, but more like a hybrid between American style pizza and pizza Napoletana. The oven is a mix of gas flame and wood burning, making the pizza crispy but also giving it a nice smoky char. Ingredients are top notch.

Been here about 5 times now. This place is a hit and miss every time. One day we asked the bartender to change the channel to the Alabama game and he told my buddy it wasn't a priority and he would get to it. Another time was sitting there for about 15 minutes before we were seen and all we wanted was a late dinner. So by the time they seen us, they just stopped serving dinner and they wouldn't make us any food. Another time it took forever for our waitress to see us again, so I just went to the bar and ordered our beer. Other times is ok. Some waitresses are great and fast, others are slow and kind of ruin it. So just be prepared that it's a 50/50 here.

Tasty pizza! A bit pricey, though. The Southside Clasico is my favorite, and I love how they provide a whole clove of roasted garlic with the garlic bread. I always try to save some to put on my pizza. 

I have been here multiple times with a variety 
 of sevice. I have walked out of this location before because no one ever came to wait my table. Usually, the service is okay.
Have been pleased on both visits. Attentive service and great food. Atmosphere is nice.

I've always passed by Pizzarella Grille whether it be when I am going to Rita's or The Bagel Factory. I have always thought about wanting to go, but never actually went. However, after reading the glowing "Review of the Day" on Yelp for Pizzarella Grille, I finally decided to check it out.

I walked in today and was given a nice Hello by a man who appeared to be the owner or manager. While they didn't have any large overhead menu boards, they did have some small paper menus, which were very easy to see. 

I ended up going with the chicken fresco served over fresh noodles! The chicken fresco was delicious with a nice, tender inside while the outside was fairly crispy, but not overly crispy. The noodles were very soft, but full of flavor especially due to the homemade cream sauce. Even better, it can with a nicely sized, side-salad that was absolutely delicious! The lettuce was of nice quality and had fresh toppings including tomatoes and carrots! It even came with a couple of Italian rolls. All of that was only $15, which was really great. 

Inside the restaurant is very nice, especially for just a simple takeout style place. There is a large-TV and comfortable booths! They also have a nice soda machine with a wide variety of drinks. 

Altogether,  this is a great place to get fresh, quality pizza, salads and sides!

Meh, we tried 2 types of cakes a vanilla confetti which was dry and the icing was too fatty.  The chocolate cake was meh at best. 
We tried 3 cupcakes can't remember 2 but the tiramisu was awesome! The only one I would eat again and I don't even like tiramisu! 
The latte was good. 
Overall it's a skip for me! I want really well made cake

I came early in the morning looking for a muffaletta and gumbo, but arrived too early. They were only serving breakfast. I was really disappointed but decided to make the best of it and at least get a good New Orleans breakfast. It's connected to a hotel, so the prices were higher than other breakfast places.

My waitress was very nice and quick without being hurried. 

I got the breakfast jambalaya. YUM! I was not disappointed! Rich and a good portion. I could have shared with someone. 

I will definitely be back!

I've been dying to go for a year or two now. So as you can imagine, there was a lot of hype building up in my mind throughout the wait. I finally made it out to Tria on a Tuesday night a few weeks ago and was blown away. The location is surprisingly large (though still small, of course), by the way, so even though there are no reservations, it wasn't hard to get a spot.

Food: 5 stars. Impeccable flavor combinations and execution. One highlight was the flourless chocolate espresso torte. I would get that again-- so dense and chocolatey that it was hard to finish! 

Wine/beer: 5 stars. Large selection of both types of alcohol. Good variety of wine overall and I was also happy to spot a vineyard from Long Island that I had visited two weeks beforehand. The beer was heavy on Belgian-style brews, but I was delighted with the list all the same. 

Service: like 6 stars, no lie. The waitress found out it was our first time there, so she paid us extra attention and walked us through the menu with her recommendations. Excellent service, I can't say that enough.

Hands down one of the best meals we've had in a while. We left so happy and so perfectly full. Our reservation was for 6:30, but we had some time to kill so we arrived a little bit early and the hostess was able to seat us right away. Our meal kicked off with the most delicious chive biscuits with honey and bacon butter... I mean c'mon. Next we shared the conch croquettes-- they were very good, but didn't knock us off our feet. Next came the cold smoked tuna with avocado and crispy bananas-- really tasty, light and flavorful. What sold the deal for us was the goat curry-- it was truly melt in your mouth and absolutely packed with unbelievable flavor. The manager stopped by after our meal and we asked for his dessert favorites. He suggested the coconut panna cotta with guava and strawberry. It was the perfect sweet finish to end the meal, but not over stuff. Highly, highly suggest if you're in the New Orleans area!

The food was pretty much your average, chain, bar quality stuff. The menu is a bit daunting as there are considerable choices. I did the philly style with a bison burger. It was pretty tasty but not good enough for me to want to eat here regularly.
Cant go wrong with this place ! Food is delicious quite large proportion for a great price. Kudos to the friendly staff

So... this was an interesting dining experience. For the locals, it's obviously the place to go. For new people, you feel very much out of place, or at least we did, from first walking in the door. Lol literally from the time we walked in the door. Apparently we went in through the side door, we didn't know (not labeled as such) and waited to be seated....and waited....and waited..... It wasn't like they didn't have waitresses either. One was on her cellphone and the other was getting her flirt on (neither of which I'm against but can you seat people first). One "hangry" fit later we're turning to leave when a waitress came over to seat us.

Once (eventually) seated the wings were pretty great and so was the dessert. Pretty decent food, ok prices, but not the best of service. Next time, at least acknowledge the people asking to be sat THEN go back to your phone

I went there with a group of 6 people.  Our reservations were for 8:30.  We weren't seated until 9-9:15, so that was annoying.  What is the point of reservations?

The food was very good.  We started with a cheese plate.  My girlfriend and I decided to do "small plates" instead of large entrees.  We both started with a salad.  She got a red romaine caesar salad.  It was very good, but the anchovies added too much salt.  I got a frisee salad with pork belly and a poached egg.  It was delicious.  I love pork belly.  I love runny eggs.

Then we each got a seafood dish.  I got the Diver Scallops with mushrooms.  The dish was awesome.  She got the shrimp.  The shrimp came out with the heads on.  The presentation was nice.  Shrimp were very large, but they also had the heads on, so it was a bit of smoke and mirrors in terms of size.

All in all, everything we had was high quality.

Downside:

our waitress was good, but the service in general was unsophisticated.  The staff was very young.  I wouldnt be surprised if some were in high school.  It wasn't bad service.  I understand it is a function of being in the suburbs.  They won't get the professional staff that they would get in the city.

All in all, it was a good experience, although pretty expensive.

So after Sunday mass, I wanted to take my mom for brunch. We decided we both want Bun Bo Hue. Bun Bo Hue is a noodle soup, something similar as a Pho but more spicy in the broth and the noodle are not flat like Pho noodle, its more like spaghetti noodle.The broth are made from pork and beef bones, lemongrass, annatto and shrimp paste. For proteins, you get sliced brisket, slice of minced chicken, pig feet and blood cubes. The noodle soup comes with a separate plate of tangle of herbs just as basil, bean sprout, shredded cabbage and lime. I order the Tea Thai and mom had the coffee drink. Our food and drinks was on point and very tasty. Mom approved! The place can be very loud with people. The whole time we had to literally had to speak up to each other bc the table behind us and across from us were so loud. Next time I might just call for take out. Less two star are for how I was not finished with my food but my mom were and the waitress just starts to clean up my table while I'm still eating. When I got to the counter to pay, the cashier didn't know how much to charge me. She had to step inside the kitchen to ask someone and came back with $29. There were no written receipts for my table. Glad I took a shot of my menu to figure out what I am being charged. The extra $1 must be for either tax and extra lime I requested or something.

This was the final hotel at the end of our week long Northeast journey and it was a great way to end it.  We found this hotel through Priceline for a great price!  The rooms are very large and the beds were comfortable!  The bathrooms were nice with a nice amount of toiletry samples.  This hotel is located in great proximity to many things downtown.  It was a great pick!  I only wish we were staying longer. I would highly recommend staying here!

This spot is what I call an actual hidden gem. The Mediterranean food here is amazing and probably the best in the city in my opinion. 

I usually just get the gyro plate and the Lebanese tea! Service was good and prices are cheap compared to a lot of other places! The meat that comes with it is amazing and their tzatziki sauce is what tops it off. I definitely recommend stopping here for lunch if you're in the area!

A week or so back the internet in my neighborhood went down midday, with an 8PM estimate for repair. As a remote worker, I was in a real bind. I went down to Florida Avenue, and was absolutely thrilled with the experience. 

I walked in with my backpack, explained my situation to the hostess, and she quickly found me the quietest spot she could find for me to sit and work. 

My server Sam was awesome as well. When I explained that I was there mainly to work, but that I'd be ordering, she was super cool about it. She would come over regularly, check on me super quietly so as not to disturb me. She made sure I never went thirsty. She noticed when I had my headset on and just kind of gave me a quick silent "OK?" To make sure I was good. 

After work I was happy to be able to hang out for a while for some food & drink. Beer is awesome as always, and I am absolutely IN LOVE with the Buffalo cauliflower. 

I'm so happy Florida Ave. is in our area.
The food was very good and very nice portion size.  The place was a bit too noisy for me but others might like it
I love their fries. The service was good. I had the jumbo crab cake sandwich and it was good but it wasn't made the way I like to get crab cakes.

BBQ and vegan in the same name?  Really?  I don't know about the vegan side of the menu, but the macncheese is not the usual BBQ joint giant cheesy flavored dish. This macncheese was a bit lackluster with a hint of under-cooked flour in the sauce.  I don't recommend it. The tri tip was ok. Relatively tender for tri tip, but I really miss brisket on the menu. The tri pit is cooked medium, with a light flavor of pecan wood. The bun for the sandwich is toasted and works well with the meat. 
The selection of Chivers sauce is good, but Chivers sauce is mediocre to poor.  Lots of ketchup with a few spices thrown in. 
I will come back to try the ribs and pulled pork, but maybe I'll bring my own sauce.
