Sweet Lord! Tonight (Wednesday Night) we rolled up at about 9:15-9:30. We are not locals so it was hard for us to find a place for a late dinner that was outside of the f. quarters. We walked in and were kindly greeted with southern charm! We were the only ones there which was nice, we got great service and fresh cooked food! 
We ordered a few different things on the menu to try based on the Yelp reviews... See below:

:: Fried Shrimp + Fries * Yummy, and flavorful!
:: Catfish w/ Jambalaya Cheese Fries * Freakin' Yum!! 
:: 1 Boiled Crab - $2 (Never had this before, so it took patience to pull apart, but it was yummy) Came w/ a spicy piece of corn, a small red potato and a piece of hot sausage.
:: Cokes + Rootbeer * May I suggest a water tho! 

Overall it was a great time, food came out quickly and the hostess was super friendly! We took a lot of food to go as well! We loved the outdoor ambiance too even though we sat inside this time! Must check this place out before heading home of you are on vacation!

We went there after a movie the other night.  The fillings weren't bad, but the crepes were way undercooked - just warmed up enough to hold them together.  One of our party got very sick a couple of hours afterward.  It took her 2 days to get over it.  Virtually raw eggs in undercooked crepe?  It seems possible.
Breakfast food was good. Went with four other people and three of them didn't like the food. Their Mac salad was horrible, fries over done, and bland

Our daughter goes to SIUE and this place is always a must when we bring her back to school or pick her up. It is always delicious and so consistent. We are from the Chicago area where there is good pizza choices but nothing compares to Dewey's, we love it!!!!

This is my favorite bakery in philly! I always get the Napoleon in this place. The cream taste so fresh and they have have all the new bakery goods to try out! The staff are friendly. Highly recommend

I stopped here on the way in from Mardi Gras festivities. Great ambiance if you want to watch games and drink but that's about it. You'll likely wait to get seated then wait longer for your food. I had the green tomatoes BLT. Never again. A PO boy is all about the bread. I ditched mine and ate it like a salad because it was toasted too hard and not the best. I couldn't even tAste the pimento and I'm a fried green tomato connisour: this didn't impress. My debris fries were dry and not NOLA worthy. I hear the place open less than year ago. Let's hope it improves its food. There's potential for sure because it's upscale diverse and friendly. My server was good guy. Tried his best.
Our trusty brunch place. Portions are big, prices are great! Staff are always friendly. Paul is wonderful.

We stopped by here for happy hour. They had $0.75 raw oysters served by the half dozen. I also tried the fried oyster salad with avocado--that was definitely my favorite. I've never had fried oysters with so much flavor before. Their fry batter is the best! We also tried a cup of the seafood gumbo, which was equally flavorful and delicious. The atmosphere here was fun and lively, not too stuffy. I'd definitely recommend stopping in here for a snack before a late dinner!

I came here with a few girlfriends for dinner and the service was a joke. Our server was rude for no reason... I mean, he set our water carafe on my breadplate. Wtf!? Weird. The only bad service we've experienced in New Orleans. This city is awesome.

Super excited to have a good sushi place out here. Complimentary clear soup is a nice touch. Great selection of raw and cooked rolls. Kid friendly and my daughter loves their steak off the hibachi. Their fried  green tea ice cream is worth every calorie.

Open three years?!?  How have we kissed this place!!?  OMG. DEFINITELY A NEW FAVORITE. We've hit a lot of the new trendy places but damn this food is good.  Each dish we've had has been truly a masterpiece. And we just found out they have brunch in the Weekend's too!  We WILL be back.

This could have been a solid five stars, if the atmosphere were a bit more exciting. It's not BAD, really, it's just kind of.... BRIGHT, and the color scheme's a little blech. If they could darken the colors and dim the lights a bit, maybe light some (more?) candles... that'd go a long way in an otherwise meh atmosphere. (And for some reason, the flat-screens showing sports over the bar just seemed a bit out of place and distracting, though I'm sure they get a bar crowd at times.)  Has the potential to be a total hipster spot; maybe that's why the atmosphere not all dark and brooding-- they want to keep it unpretentious? 

Anyhow-- the food was fantastic. Drinks were... okay (let me take that 5 star comment back... maybe more like 4.5). My house-made white sangria was tasty, but E's mojito was a bit overly-limed and underly-minted.

We ordered a bunch of small plates- garlic shrimp and 'sexy' grits on the suggestion of a nearby diner (DELICIOUS); bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with goat cheese (SO GOOD); crab empanadas (tasty); something with goat cheese and tomato sauce that was good, but nothing to write home about ... and veggie cakes (yummy; reminded me of crab cakes) There were a LOT more items on the menu that we considered... We even thought of ordering another plate or two (hey, don't judge.. they're SMALL plates) but the waiter recommended that we stick with the above and then order more if we were still hungry (as it was, they had to combine our table with the next, empty one-- again, don't judge! The tables are small, and between water glasses, other beverage glasses, bread plates and bread basket, it was already quite full!) It was a good suggestion... the plates were small but not quite as tiny as other tapas dishes I've had elsewhere and though we were super hungry when we arrived, we were pleasantly full when we left (not always the case with tapas.)

Overall, a great addition to the S. Grand dining scene. We'll definitely be back.

Kinda reminded me of home in NJ except the prices were much lower. I had the big old chili dog I saw pictured on Yelp. I also had the soup called hamburger soup. It and the HUGE chili dog were BOSS!!!!!! If you are ever seeing a Buc's game save your appetite for after the game and come here!!!!
Amazing subs and the best part is they are open late and the staff is very nice. Blows all other sandwich shops out of the water!!!!!

I'm disappointed beyond belief.  Two things I wish I didn't lie about in person- a bad haircut and a terrible piece of lamb.  I've come back to Athens on 86th TWICE in an effort to rekindle the magic that happened with the off the menu lamb filet (see earlier review) I enjoyed on my first dinner.  That option hasn't been available since and the suggested alternatives have been either overcooked or baked like a cafeteria Salisbury steak.  I filled up on rice because that was the only edible food on my $30 plate.  The second star comes from a place of kindness; our waiter was very polite to my daughter.  

I won't go back.

So I never had their pizza... but I don't care! I had their wings and it's super delicious! May be because I love garlic and onions? It's not the run of the mill, sauce laden wings. It's actually carefully thought out flavored wings with real ingredients that add texture and burst of flavors that you can't get at your local wing joint. I would talk about service and atmosphere but really I don't care. When I'm here for wings, I'm in heaven.

The best crawfish I have had in New Orleans! We ordered 7 pounds and finished all! I highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends who would like to have crawfish in New Orleans---and catfish--- they offered us to try some slices and it tastes so good!

My experience was great! I went on a Wednesday night and there was a decent crowd. Service was not the best but they only had one server working the floor. She did the best she could. I had the fried chicken with white gravy and beef tenderloin with a hollandaise sauce. Both were cooked perfectly and the fried chicken was to die for. For sides I had mashed sweet potatoes, roasted cauliflower salad, and yellow squash and zucchini casserole with TN white cheddar. I went with a group so I chose the casserole while the other 2 chose sweet potatoes and cauliflower salad. I loved the casserole and the other 2 sides were ok, not bad but just not my thing. I would have loved to try the arugula salad with melon and goat cheese! The portions were huge for 3 people and for 15 bucks a person, a good price. Definitely will go back!

Amazing food!!! From catering to take out to dine in the meat has always been delicious! The 8oz filet mignon sandwich is amazing for dine in and the twice baked potato is fantastic! I've had bbq from Texas to Tennessee and Robert's has some of the best out of all of them!

Another fantastic recommendation from some friends that visit NOLA often. This was unfortunately last on our list as the wifey and I were a bit sketchy on a tiki bar located in the French Quarter... but hey! This works... it was a great break from the French Quarter even if it was only for a few stiff drinks. Wifey played it safe with the Mai Tai and I went with the Zombie. Damn, both were creepers and definitely made are walk back to the hotel an adventure. Surf music, tiki decor, laid back staff... what else could you ask for? A perfect spot for a drink!

We went on the lunch cruise and weren't expecting much in the way of food.  These types of operations typically sell the tour and the food is just an afterthought.  

WHAT A SURPRISE!  Everything was awesome, the southern fried chicken was moist and not greasy (better than Willie Mae's Scotch House), the mac n' cheese, red beans and rice, creamed spinach, and bread pudding were all fantastic.

Food this good and a great view cruisin' down the Mississippi, you can't beat it.
I absolutely love this place. The chicken burritos are my favorite. The service is great.

This place is amazing they have everything a Vegan could possibly want! From tofu to
Seitan , vegan cheese , vegan wine! On top of it the customer service is great. It's nice and clean and the music and atmosphere is great! The large window brings all the natural light making it an even greater place to eat. I loved it and i will be back
Spent a fine afternoon with my son enjoying natural wines and delicious food. Super-nice staff. Especially recommend the Chef's Choice cheese plate. Cheese and chorizo were fantastic!

You wonder where is all the Reno people after 6:00 pm. Let me tell you: they are here, at the zeppelin!!!
This place is fun, friendly and great place to hang out for couples, ladies night out! 
We, 3 moms trying to get away from our husbands and kids, are having a night out at the zeppelin. It is wendsday! And full house!! That is how popular it is!!
The drink is so good, so does the food!! 
 We will be back soon!!

I gotta say I'm very disappointed... I felt like I had just bough sushi from the supermarket or the frozen section ..for the ratings that this place has it was THE WORST place I've eaten sushi at, I should of stuck to something else!!!!!!!!!!

Excellent service.
The food was delicious (we ordered kebabs, falafel, and shawarma)
Would definitely eat here again when back in town.

This is a cute place with indoor and outdoor seating.  Outdoors tends to fill up faster.  Service is attentive and friendly.  I love getting a cheese plate (choose 3 cheeses for $10).  I especially like the cotswold and my girlfriend loves the goat cheese.  The wine selection is good, as you would expect.  I've had the beef sliders and chicken sliders, which are both delicious, but there's not a lot on the entree menu that I'd like to try.  So for that reason, it's not a place I would recommend for dinner all the time, but for some wine and cheese and a nice date, it can't be beat.

I came here to meet up some friends. They love this place and I thought I would give it a go. The bartender was amazing and super helpful in choosing a beer for me. I tried the Pork Bahn Mi. I have to say that for some crazy reason this sandwich has become a major trend in most restaurants. The Bahn Mi at Twenty Tap is probably one of my favorites. I love how they serve it with dill pickles on the side and the french fries are perfect. I can't wait to go again and try the Poutine. The menu is varied so it offers something for everyone and is not over pretentious. They also offer Vegan options which I think are awesome. If you're looking for a new spot to try I suggest this one!!!
great food, diner atmosphere...i like it. keep it up. Solid location and friendly staff. I recommend their chicken salad, it has red peppers in it (first time) and also the cuban! really good.

5 stars all the way around from the customer service, the wait to the food! Our party of 8 was seated immediately. We had just come into town for the weekend for the Raider game. We requested separate checks and we were accommodated without hesitation. Not sure how it is in Louisiana but in California often times they don't like to do separate checks especially with parties of 8 or more due to them automatically adding 18% gratuity on large parties. 
On to the food! Each couple ordered an appetizer to include a couple of orders of Charbroiled  Oysters and fried alligator nuggets. There are no words for those Oysters, they were out of this world. The alligator was also amazing! For my entree I ordered the shrimp and grits and was completely satisfied. I made everyone at the table taste it. Delicious! 
I really wish I could remember our waiters name, he truly deserves recognition for his excellent customer service. Despite the gratuity not being automatically added because of the separate checks we were sure to show our appreciation for our waiter when it came time to pay. Next time in NOLA we will go back to Drago's for sure!!

It was our first time at Tavern, and it was a beyond incredible experience. We were on a 45 minute wait and went to the back bar and got some drinks through Amy. She was the prime example of professionalism and kindness. She was getting her butt kicked and still gave incredible service, such a rare quality!! We then got sat at our table with Lindsey. We had a group of six and I feel like we never had to wait for anything, she had a great personality and went above and beyond for us. This has been such a pleasant experience!! We will definitely be back!!!

Amazing service and food! I had the corn fritters and steak frites which was cooked to perfection!  If you are looking for an amazing local restaurant that probably gets overlooked due to being in a tourist area look no further than the Red Owl.  It was that good!

Okay, LAWD JESUS where to start where to start..

It was a family members birthday and we decided to go to islands! We were a group of 15 and they were pretty accommodating, so that was nice.

As we waited to be seated, some of us were at the bar ordering drinks before dinner. I ordered 2 DBAs, and a tequila soda with lime. Got the check.. and WHAT the actual F?  $37.00?!?!? I tipped 3 dollars for a total of 40 dollars for 3 drinks! Oh hellll to the no. 

I also noticed on a sign that DBA is on happy hour for 3.50 each..so IF I am correct. 2 DBAs = $7.00. So I'm guessing my tequila soda was 30 dollars. Fair enough. ‍

When the bartender finally came around, I asked why my three drinks came out to $37.00 he said, "I'm not sure actually." Gave me and itemized receipt with the "correct," amount of now 27 dollars. Which technically is still 9 dollars per drink..still not right... I look a little closer and.. they had charged me extra tequila! 7 dollars more to be exact. Asked the bartender again.. and again he says he doesn't know why. He then figures it out, hands me a receipt for 18.00 which seems right. Perfect. 

We sit down, food comes out fast, which is great. My girlfriend sitting next to me asks me if my burger tastes weird, I said no but she asked me to try hers. The bun on her burger didn't taste right, so she requested a new one. Waiter asked what was wrong with it, and immediately got her a new plate of food. Another waiter came up and asked her what was wrong with it, and she apologizes and says her food will be out shortly. THEN a manager comes out, asks her AGAIN what was wrong with her food, she then replies, if you must know, "the bun tastes a little plastic-y," which then the manager replies, "DOES ANY ONE ELSES TASTE LIKE PLASTIC?" Way to embarrass her! Funny enough, she owns a food business in the Santa Barbara area. I just found that so Incredibly rude. 

This was a Friday, it's now a Tuesday and my refund is not in my account. I honestly don't care to deal with it, or go back. I'll just walk over to habit down the block if I'm ever craving a burger.

Earlier today I had my cycling group stop here for a "refueling" after a long ride.  I only got an iced coffee which was fine, but nothing earth-shattering.  However, many others got food.  This included empanadas, Cuban sandwiches, cafe con leche, rice, & beans.  Over & over I heard everyone say the food was top notch & some of the best, & well priced.  I got kudos for picking this place, & now the restaurant gets kudos for making some quality food.

Just left this place. Late night menu was very limited. We ordered a slice of pepperoni, a glass of wine, and mixed drink. The pizza tasted like it had been cooked earlier in the evening. It wasn't terrible but we have definitely had better. We didn't want to stop anywhere else so we decided we would bite the bullet and order another slice. Well low and behold they were sold out for the night. So disappointed!! We ended up at Five Points where we should have went in the first place. Pizza was delicious, as usual.

I save my five (stars). This is worth every point of 5 stars and then some. We started with the chai sangria, then moved on to another round-who would have thought to put chai and sangria together. She had the beef with blue cheese fondu cooked medium rare. I loved my olive dish- although I forgot what it was called. We finished with tiramisu...amazing tiramisu.
The bagels with cream cheese are amazing!!! My favorite is the veggie cream cheese, although sometimes it could use more veggies. For the most part service is good.

Food was decent, good flavor. But the service was terrible. We asked for more water, they gave us attitudes. We had sole combo for four/five people. The meats came out last and they gave us one person's worth of meat. The service was so slow, we left and forgot that we were suppose to get ice cream. I was standing by the counter to pay my bill. The lady made me wait at the counter for a good 5 minutes. To get her stuff done. But all I had to do was sign my credit card slip. I would never go there again!

This is the best place to eat in northeast Philly.

So there's that...

Great sushi. Small portions, but the prices fit the portion. Great ambience. Surprised that this place is never crowded when I'm there, but it's nice to get seated so quickly. Service is fantastic!! They have non-sushi items on the menu as well, but I would stick to sushi if you go since that's what they do best. The miso soup is great!
Love this place, great food and great alternative diner vibe. Even better during the day when it's not crowded!!

Tonight's meal here was a winner.
I came here with a group of 8 and the waiting staff were great communicating with us. Service was very friendly and accommodating. 

The only complaint I have for the night was the wait for the entrees, but you know what, the wait was well worth it so just be prepared to be patient and keep yourself occupied.

Boyfriend and I got the Jamaican Jerk Chicken & Shrimp with Mango. All parts of the dish tasted amazing and even better was eaten together. My favorite part was the chili sauce that came with the jerk chicken.

Dessert: we got coconut pineapple cake and it was a mix of delicate and moist. It was all just so flavorful and a great way to end the meal.
Great food and beer! I was amazed and impressed by the beer selection and the truffle fries were delicious. Not blown away by the fish tacos but were still good. I will definitely return

Arnold's is the absolute best place in Nashville for southern food. Everything is cooked just right and tastes amazing. You cannot go wrong with Arnold's. You can kiss the Loveless Cafe and Cracker Barrel goodbye! My favorites at Arnold's are the roast beef, macaroni and cheese, green beans, carrots and spicy chocolate pie. Arnold's is a family owned and operated,restaurant and is the food is served cafeteria style. Don't let the small building and the long line out the door turn you away, as the wait through the line goes fast!
Great place for Sunday Brunch. The Lemon Ricotta Blueberry Pancakes are to die for! A little pricey but totally worth it!

I always get delivery so I forget to check in and write a review. 

First of all, we always get one cheese pizza because it's one of the best in town. It's the only pizza in town that the whole family can agree on. 

Salads are another must-have. I know salads aren't really something to comment on but they do it right. They make a Greek salad that even my 5 year old LOVES. 

Tater tots and fried mozzarella are typical bar food and pretty good. Sandwiches are also above average. 

Like so many others have said, the main great thing about this place is the people. Very down to earth and make the atmosphere of no anchovies a place you just wanna hang out. Not pretentious or trendy. 

They have been doing what they do for a while and they're good at it.

My friend and I spent a day in Indianapolis. Food was great (fish tacos and shrimp tacos are excellent) and so were the drinks (the best shandy I've ever had) we ordered! The service was awesome. Will definitely come back here the next time we're in town.

Where to begin? Maybe with the 50 min it took to get the "15-20 min" to-go order? Or the med burger that came out well. Or maybe the bacon burger that was about on the level of of Wendy's. 
Needless to say we won't be back.

When I asked the front desk lady at the hotel I was staying at for a great lunch place, she recommended me Mr. B's bistro, emphasizing their BBQed shrimp. Of course I was hyped, more so because this was my first ever meal in New Orleans.  The shrimp itself was outstanding. I don't think I've ever had such fat, juicy mouthwatering shrimp in my life (drooling as I'm writing this review). All  the shrimps were gigantic as if they were on steroids. 

I had to look at the menu twice (or three times) to make sure $1.50 martini and Bloody Mary wasn't a typo. It wasn't!!! Not a big fan of either one, but I couldn't pass on such a deal. It was only my first meal in NOLA and I was already in love. Before I even ordered my food. 

Catfish fingers are literally meant to be eaten with fingers only. I tried to use a fork, and it just fell apart. And you have to hold it so lightly so you don't break it to pieces. It was delicious though not too special. Coconut beer shrimp was ok. Mr. B's BBQed shrimp was the winner, as expected, and I wish I'd ordered a full portion for myself, instead of sharing between me and one other person. I don't like messy food, meaning, having to peel and work for the food I eat, but I didn't mind working for this one at all. Licking the sauce off of my fingers was the best part. 

Also, I am not ashamed to admit that I asked for the complimentary bread 4 times. So good!

Unexpected amazing food . The Kebab seemed like it was a mix of lamb and quality beef . Extremely fresh salad, the hummus was perfect . 
The service was super friendly. This place deserves a better decore , but overall , I loved this place .

Holy Heaven on Earth. 

Not only is this probably one of the most picturesque restaurants in Philly (situated right on Kelly Drive), it's also pet friendly with tons of outdoor seating and excellent shade in the summer months. Great parking available, both at the In Riva lot and the lot across the street (in the Fall there's a pop-up Farmer's Market every weekend). 

Excellent selection of draft beers. They usually have Stone IPA on draft, which can be hard to find in East Falls or Manayunk. They rotate their selection regularly, so it's like a fun surprise every time. 

The pizzas are probably what most folks rave about. You can watch the cook make it from scratch. The dough is earthy, flaky, and fresh-baked. Tough to beat. 

Try the whipped ricotta appetizer.

Two words: NEVER again.

The best thing about Sakura is the service; our waitress was very friendly and pretty attentive.

Unfortunately, the worst thing is the food. I could not believe how packed the place was after tasting my sushi. I mean, yeah-- the prices at Sakura seemed a little lower than its competitors, but the fish quality was disproportionately lower. At best, it was so-so, i.e. barely edible. The place was noticeably warm when we walked in --be wary of warm sushi houses (never turns out well) -- so we only "started" with two orders of spicy tuna and salmon (to test the waters). I was disappointed, especially after seeing such high marks on Yelp. Maybe if you order specialty rolls slathered in sauce and mayo, you won't be able to differentiate Sakura's fish from good quality fish... but I usually prefer more traditional sushi (sashimi and nigiri). 

Considering the (few) options available in Indy, however, I won't return.

This place  is a serious ripoff especially post-hurricane Katrina.  The quality does  not match the ridiculous prices and the woman that owns it is not concerned about the customer in anyway, only her big profit. She should not be in the restaurant business. Bring your money elsewhere there are much better places to get this same type of food that is much higher quality and for a lot less money. Do yourself a favor & go to other restaurants around the area instead.  I don't want to give it any stars but yelp forces you too put at least one.

When you walk in for your first time, you receive those famous bread sticks and dip them in their marinara sauce hoping to get a dollop on your wonderful appetizer. You then realize how watery the sauce is and forcefully start dipping and scooping the sauce, hoping to get more to satisfy your taste. It is then that your entree arrives and you begin to start noticing that you're eating more bread than your actual meal and get so full from it than what you had ordered.

Moral of the story: you stuff yourself on free bread over your meal, every time.

I read a review in the Tampa paper. We live in Inverness but had a destination in San Antonio to go to so decided to drive to Spring Hill to try E Sushi. The food was excellent, so was the service. Long way from home but worth stopping by if in the area.

Not the best pizza ive ever had (ive had ALOT of pizza) but it was pretty good. Food arrived as promptly as it was hot and fresh, staff was attentive and menu was reasonably priced. We kept it simple with a large cheese pizza and the house beer that I believe was named the "Dewbrew", maybe. Anyways pizza was super hot and you could tell the ingredients were fresh. Im not a beer fan normally but I really enjoyed their DewBrew. It was a week nite and late dinner time. A children's bday party was going on at the tables next to us but they were polite and not at all bothersome since I didn't expect much ambiance wise from a pizza place. I would say its worth trying this place put and I plan to return and try a specialty pizza myself.

The wife and I stopped in on a Sunday morning to continue our breakfast/brunch tour of Indy. We LOVE rockstone pizza and live right by Sahms Place, but unfortunately neither of those are open at 8am (although Sahms does do brunch later in the day)

We arrived about 8 and were seated immediately. As quickly as we could order it, coffee was at the table. We debated a while, but both settled on pancakes. I went with my token choice of bacon in the cakes and added a poached egg. 

I'm going to start with the egg: 100% perfectly poached. The cakes...tasted weird. They didn't taste bad, but they wouldn't make me want to come back. 

After eating I saw some egg dishes come out with sides of bread and remembers the yelp reviews talking about homemade bread. I think your best bet here is probably eggs with bread. 

Unfortunately, we had great service but I can't award more than 3 stars based on those mediocre pancakes. But, we promised ourselves we would try them again and eat eggs and homemade bread.

Terrible service!  We had a reservation at 8:45 and couldn't get seated until around 9:10.  Once there, we waited 45 minutes for chips and guacamole to come - it never did.  We ended just getting up and leaving.  Avoid this place!

Every severely overpriced order is severely charred & gumbo taste like the paste u ate in kindergarten.  When contacting Mgmt we were blown off & told to complain to the Grubhub vendor!  I'm like "excuse me -Grubhub was not on that grill. They attempt to mimic many of Carrabbas/Olive Garden dishes, but they can't mimic the customer care & quality from their kitchen.
Great food and great service. Excellent on a Sunday after mass. Nice selection of food.

I had the Turkey Avocado Sandwich. The toasted 11-grain wheat bread was to die for. I come just for that.
Hot, oven-roasted turkey, Swiss cheese, avocado, romaine lettuce, tomato and mayo on their yummy 11-grain wheat bread. We got it with a fruit cup.
Tina is the best! What a professional and bubbly personality. She took the time to make sure our order was right and sent us on our way with well wishes. Thank you Tina!

I both went to the cafe and ordered takeout.  I loved their food- best grits in New Orleans that accompanied my breakfast melt which was delicious.  The service was so lovely.  Excellent coffee, fresh bread and fresh fruit.  Our lovely waiter also gave us coffee to go as a nice surprise.

Had so much fun getting cocktails here with my sister while she was in town. The drinks were very well thought out and made with care. I don't remember the bartenders name but she was super sweet and asked us what movie we would like to watch on the TV since there weren't many customers around. Can't wait to come back and get dinner ! Super cute decor and great location
So much fun!  I just wish I knew how to bet on the horses!!!  Cool place!  Watched the Super Bowl at the bar..... It changes colors!  :-)

Every Sunday, my family drives to Santa Barbara for the beach, the sun, and the surf. But one of the best parts about our beach day is ordering food from Padaro Beach Grill. I can't say enough how this restaurant brings me and my family pure joy. The food is fantastic, of the best quality, yet not overpriced. My kids love the burgers, my wife is a huge fan of the veggie burger, and the fried Baja fish tacos topped with the smoked tarter sauce are MY favorite. We always order online and the order is ready when they say it will be. They always offer condiments at pick-up, which is a nice touch, and there's always a smile to go along with the food. 

Some people say it's the little things in life that make life worthwhile- when it comes to this phenomenal little restaurant tucked next to the ocean, I'd say that's an observation proven true.

Came here for a Christmas Dinner gathering for a mid-size group. Quality of service was extremely sub par. Unprepared to provide great service, but yet the price tag was 5 star quality. Requested to have my steak well done and was told "We are only cooking them medium" Half of the party ate and was done before the other half's food arrived to the table.

I like to go to this place for breakfast. Their western croissant is great, if you order a medium coffee, the combo is only a dollar, so the total for breakfast is around 5 bucks. I personally think the food has better quality than dunkin donut if you are looking for a fast breakfast. Their coffee is OK, the dark roast tastes like medium.
One of the best places in Mainline. It's a must go place. The food and service is amazing. Don't forget to try the desserts (pyramid dessert) which is really good.
Tried this place twice for breakfast. Very disappointing. Looks dingy and the food does not taste good at all.

Always a great experience here! Absolutely love their Fiery Honey sauce, we add it to everything. We always get kind and professional service during each visit and the food is so so good! They have my favorite chicken wings in the area and I would also highly recommend their burgers

Filthy windows, dirty floor, dirty bathrooms, disgustingly old couch that I would be afraid to sit on. Employees are rude, slow and more interested in themselves then their customers. Don't even think about going in with a baby stroller. The "too cool" customers won't even move their chairs so that you can get to a seat! I can't understand why anyone would think this place is acceptable!
I had the most amazing experience with my friends here. We celebrated my friends wedding celebration and they recommended me to try this. I highly recommend this spot.
Wonderful customer service. Friendly employees. Yummy food. Our family of 4 all enjoyed their meals. Everything is handmade and delicious.

The pho here is one size only, and it tasted a bit bland. For the price, I don't think it's worth it. It cost $12.95+ for pho. We ordered only pho, so I cannot comment on any of the other food here. 

I think it was their first day of opening today, so the workers here were a little lost when we were ordering. However, they did keep coming to our table to refill our cups and ask how we were doing or if we need anything. Friendly service for sure.

It's worth checking out. I would come back again to try their other food. Parking was also easy since there is a lot.

I had the luck of taking my wife to this location shortly after it opened. We were delayed a day on our honeymoon due to snow - and I surprised her by taking her here. Everything we had that day was delectable. In the dozens of times we have returned since, the flavor and quality has never wavered. Every single item is perfect and tastes sublime. I tend to prefer their bars, especially if I can catch the pecan option. My wife loves the cakes and has a predilection for the chocolate peanut butter mousse pie. Overall, everything is delicious, the service is superior, and the aesthetic is decidedly "pink." Be ready to pay the high but fair price for this delectable treat.

This place is one of my top three favorite burger joints in Nashville. THERE, I said it.

While it feels a little like a chain restaurant to me (it's not really: there are currently two and they are adding one more out in the 'burbs) the food is fantastic. But mostly: TRUFFLE TOTS. Order them, eat them all, crave them, come back for more. Don't forget to dip them in the garlic aioli. If you don't take this route, I highly recommend the tatortot fondue. Or hey, why not get both. Tots on tots on tots.

Their unique burgers include a jalapeno popper burger (cream cheese, fried jalapeno, buffalo sauce) and the taco truck burger, and two of their other burgers have won prestigious awards including Zagat's 50 Burgers in 50 States (The Tennessee burger) and World Food Champion Highest Rated Burger (The 96 burger). They have other stuff on the menu, but there is really no need to even look. Get a burger, it's a burger place.

They also have alcohol infused (or not) milkshakes, which are pretty tasty, but I usually stick with beer here, as their selection is usually pretty good. And also, I never have enough room in my stomach for a milkshake AND burgers AND tots.

Go here. You won't regret it.

SO-SO IN SOBRO

Small cozy place with far more than 20 taps. 

Sizable beer selection, but don't bring a big thirst unless you bring a big wallet. The place is kind of pricey, especially for SoBro (not your highest rent district). 

Maybe we were there at shift change, but the staff outnumbered the customers... and they were more concerned with talking among themselves than mixing it up with or waiting on customers. 

We had heard the place WOW us. They did, but not necessarily in a good way. However, we've agreed to give them another try sometime. Everybody deserves a second chance, right?

One of our favorite bars, but they close at 1am! 

I believe we had the Sunset on 2nd drink in the souvenir glass ($16 / refills $11).  

The bands were great. We watched Broseph on Friday and Tom Yankton on Saturday. We paid a $6 cover charge on Friday and no cover on Saturday. 

We didn't realize they served food. 

Overall a great time!

I really wanted to like this place, it's so convenient. There's not much ambience. The menu is large and the food sounds amazing. It wasn't great...my husband ordered the mahi mahi tacos. They were sad looking. Colorless and flavorless. He did say the corn side was good. I had a burger and other than a good bun it also lacked flavor. The fries were just ok. Our friends had a steak and another burger. We all were disappointed. The food definitely did not live up to the descriptions on the menu. The plating of the food needs work also. I really hope this place gets a new chef because we need a good restaurant in the village.
Went here with my wife for my birthday cake substitute (love donuts). Donuts tasted fresh and overall the cake donuts were good. We were happy with our decision to try this place.

What a disappointment. I've not been in a while and never for lunch before and never again for sure. A friend suggested it because it's close to where I work. I scoffed having been before and being aware of the prices, at least for dinner. She said it was going to be her treat and the lunch prices aren't that bad. She was wrong... I ordered the $15.00 SLOW ROASTED PRIME RIB DIP. I think it had been slow roasted for at least a week. I've never had prime rib that gray, dry and flavorless. And speaking of flavorless there was absolutely ZERO seasoning on the cardboard called prime rib or in the jus. The 3 bites I ate had to be salted individually. As I had no desire to embarrass my generous friend I did not say anything, not even when she mentioned that she was not very thrilled with her meal either. I thanked her for lunch and took my to go box directly to the trash can when I was back at work. I will say that the Tartar sauce and their garlic aioli were the highlights of the meal. Dipped fries in both.

Based on reviews I was expecting an amazing experience, but I was rather disappointed in the quality of the sushi. First, the restaurant is lying to you about having a "Kobe beef" sushi roll. We all know there are only 8 restaurants in the US that actually sell certified Kobe. So, they fact they choose to lie about serving real Kobe beef is disappointing to see. Second, all of the special rolls I tried were just overpowered by sauce that was smothered over the rolls. Waaaay too much. Let the fish shine, no need to hide it drenched in sauce. Lastly, the seaweed salad was downright dreadful. It tasted sour, foul and just dreadful. The doughnut dessert was amazing, but left dissatisfied and disappointed.
Great Place!! Food is very fresh and delicious, the restaurant is bright and well done, and the service is fantastic.

not a big fan of ichicoro. i know that this is everyone's favorite ramen in st pete / tampa area, but i was honestly underwhelmed.

things we ordered:
CHASYU bun: pork belly bun. actually the star of the meal. i would highly recommend ordering this! 
SHOYU ramen: not a big fan. its probably ok for people that haven't had much authentic ramen much, but coming from SF / NYC, i found this to be mildly disappointing. didnt like that there was no option to order a tonkatsu ramen (which is the standard pork broth ramen) and instead i could only get a chicken broth or mushroom broth.
JAPANESE CURRY DONBURI: eh. it was underwhelming as well.

came for the atmosphere, did not stay for the food. i would not come if you've had authentic ramen elsewhere, but come if you want to try it! 

PROTIP: happy hour ALL DAY on sunday.

Best steak I've enjoyed from a steak house man the front of the grill can make a cow wanna eat it own steak so like great cuts and priced ok but when it comes to good cut steak grilled just right who can put a price stop see for yourself

Essene is a great place to shop, especially compared to the crowded and overpriced Whole Foods around the corner. I mainly come here to buy Yogi tea. They have every flavor imaginable and the tea is a tad cheaper than other stores around. I've also gotten good produce here and a lot of my cooking/snacking essentials. I like to give food (like dried fruit and unique snacks) as gifts - yes, I know I'm a little strange - to friends and family, and Essene always has the perfect item for this. They also carry PiperWai deodorant (from Shark Tank!!), which is hard to find in Philly.

I have yet to try the cafe food in the back dining area, but it always looks and smells amazing - will have to try it out in the near future!

It's fun just walking around the store, even if you don't end up purchasing anything.
The atmosphere is cute but the desserts are completely over-priced. One croissant  was $4.32!  This place should really consider lowering prices if they want people to come back.

I arrived at 9 pm closing and they ushered me in with a smile.  I ordered a wonderful Tostado Salad - it was delicious.
I really appreciate the smile and warm welcome at closing time by all the staff and serving me !

Best pizza in the world. I grew up eating Grotto as kid, especially down in Rehoboth. Every Time I'm in Delaware it's my first stop. Large pepperoni with extra cheese! You won't be disappointed if you love pizza.
Chill little spot with a boho artist feel.  Stopped in for a quick coffee. Not bad! Customer service was great!

Saigon restaurant is one of the best restaurant in Indiana, I had it as my 3rd most favorite place for dinner.  great service with fantastic foods. I never missed my chance to have dinner here when I'm in Indianapolis.

A decent romantic date spot with State St. prices and subpar service. We went here with a group and were very out of place. This is a small restaurant suited for groups no larger than 4. My food was good, but several others in our group complained of cold, inedible food. When they complained, the waiter offered to heat it back up, but did not offer a discount or apology. as

The only reason this is a two star review is because the woman behind the counter was SO nice. Otherwise, this would be a one star review. 

We had a voucher (worth $24) because we were staying next door at the Nestle Inn. We each ordered the breakfast sandwiches on wheat bread and mochas. Choice of "sides" was vanilla yogurt or banana, so we ordered one of each. 

My breakfast sandwich consisted of very dry wheat bread (butter? Please???), some kind of steamed (?) whipped egg patty filled with chopped ham, and some semi-melted cheddar. (The way the sandwich is described on the menu, I was imagining something closer to an Egg McMuffin, with a fried egg and a slice of ham.) Oh, and a whole, unpeeled and un-apeeling banana. Jean's breakfast was the same, except she had a little bowl of overly sweet vanilla yogurt. The mochas, while lovely to look at, were extremely sweet. The sweetness overwhelmed any other flavor in the drink. 

The plate my breakfast was served on was chipped in three or four places. Seriously? I understand plates get chipped at restaurants, and I can overlook one or even two chips. But this plate was chipped on three of four sides (square plate). Tacky, even for a coffee shop. 

Yes, the woman behind the counter was super friendly. She let us stand there for five minutes trying to decide what to order and was helpful explaining what was available for "brunch". If this was a review just for service it would be four or five stars. But it's for the food and the food AND coffee was not good. We won't be back. It's a shame, great location and so much potential.
AJ's is my daily stop. The seafood and butcher departments are top notch with high quality sources and responsibly grown foods. Small shop but carries almost all we need.  Love the pasta Thursday's!

A hidden treasure and the uber attentive Trevor was a great waiter. Very accommodating and fun! Cute date place, uncrowded, but intimate. A must try! Love the appetizers, the lilac creme brulee and their specialty cocktails are fun, and not super sweet. 

C'mon, walk off State Street to the next street over and check out Intermezzo! Someone called it "expensive," it's not. Moderate prices and GREAT service!

I plan on going back, even if desert disappointed me.

The Gretchen sandwich ($7.50) is awesome - egg, bacon, cheese on a tasty buttered toasted bread. I added the provided tomato as well. Also? I ordered sausage and potatoes and proceeded to pile those on as well, plus some of the salsa the potatoes came with. Win! 

The potatoes are alright ($3 small, $4 large). They have some garlic and other items with them but I like my potatoes with more seasoning and increased browning. The sausage ($3) is a thick sausage , not your tiny link or patty. My friend got the black bean patty and portobello patty. Both are tasty! 

Tip: thinking about the portobello sandwich? It's $8.50. Or just order the portobello patty for $3.50. It just means you don't get the bread and couple toppings, but heck of a deal!

Finally, dessert...our lovely waiter asked if we wanted some pie. Sure! Chocolate peanut butter pie is the best!! But...sweet merciful Odin. It was $5 and a tiny slice. Very rich, ganache chocolate with some good whipped cream on the side. The problem? THIS IS NOT PIE. Sure, some pies are not fluffy or gooey, like Derby pie or pecan pie. But pies in general are gooey awesomeness - like apple, chocolate, coconut, etc. This "pie" is more of a cheesecake texture. I loved my visit, but honestly the fake pie was a huge downer. Where can I find homemade delicious pie in this city?!?!

Otherwise, surprisingly reasonably priced for broad ripple and tasty. Can't wait to try the other menu items!

This place use to be great but now with their new menu, it has all changed. The chicken is horribly dry and I am pretty positive i got food poisoning. I ate the salmon tacos and that same night, I was extremely ill. I'm very upset they took off some of my favorite foods off the menu. Not only that, but the restrooms are messy with paper on the ground and the cups for water aren't always the cleanest. I wish they were the old cafe. I won't eat here again.

The food was incredibly delicious! One of the best restaurants I've had the pleasure of eating at in quite some time. I ordered the Midtown (Chicken Sandwich) and would highly recommend it to any meatatarian! In addition, the staff is very friendly, ready to help and really make Redwood the great place it is. To top it all off; they also offer a veteran and first responder discount as well!
Food was very flavorful and the service was good.  Food came out fast!  The butter chicken is a must try.  Restrooms and the building could have used a little TCL.

On our stay on 12/1 things went well. We were in the same room as before (2016) and it's a comfortable room but the mattresses need replacing really bad!  As I mentioned before this place is due for some major renovations!  Last update must have been 10 years ago or more!

~~~~~~~~~

Nice rooms and what you would expect from Embassy Suites.  It's about time to do a 'refresh' on this property and make it look like 2017 (not 2007). Big rooms with nice beds and great views from the 20th floor!  Furnishings are nice but outdated and the TVs could be bigger. There are fingerprints from previous guest on the wood furniture and microwave. I'm a Hilton Honers member and only stay at Hilton properties. It is what it is cuz it's only for one night!
Our bartender Kitty is awesome. She is super friendly and knowledgeable. I will come back just for her.
I have gone several times yet today the fish and shrimp tacos was less than impressive. Tasteless and cold.
Really love this place. I go by myself 99% of the time and always get sat with fun families and great hibachi chefs. Really great food and so much for the price
Great drinks and food! Open late. Check out the Beer Garden. The service is amazing and very attentive!
Great food excellent service. Draft beer nice and cold. Great live music on Friday night. Bob the bartender is awesome. The wait staff very professional and polite. Establishment very clean.

We spent last Saturday afternoon watching the Cardinal game, the Masters, and the beginning of the Blues game. Great place to watch sports with so many TVs to choose from. At least 6 big screens and many more flat screens you can't miss a single minute of action. We started with several appetizers, Calamari, Pretzels, and  Ying-Yang shrimp were very tasty. The entrees included salads (steak and wedge) and the crab cake sandwich which was delicious. Great experience with a fantastic wait staff. We will certainly be back for more good times. Almost forgot to mention the awesome desserts, the ladies had the gooey butter cake martini and key lime martini and then we topped it all off with the BlackFinn hot chocolate ( i will be getting this as an entree next time it was so good!!)

I've stopped in here for lunch a few times now and can officially say it is my favorite lunch stop in the Lindbergh/Tesson Ferry area. The service is great, it's never too crowded, and the food is excellent. I haven't tried their pizza yet but I'm sure I will soon. Every sandwich I've ordered is delicious and well portioned. Sure it's a little more expensive than $5, but if you want a deli feel and great food I highly recommend it. P.S. Pasta salad side rocks.

The service is always good, the servers have a good attitude, and the food is consistent, great-tasting and fresh.
We're also super impressed with the safety measures you've been taking at this location. Great job Islands SB, you guys are really doing great.

Without a doubt, one of the best...Everything was just delicious..
loved the atmosphere, wait staff very attentive, no complaints...
Very nice place. Slightly upscale without the price hike. Quality food. Good for brunch or date night or just a family dinner.

Delicious tastes and great portions. Unquestionably the best breakfast in town. I've never had such unique tastes in three different breakfast dishes. The endless drip coffee was the best and I'll be coming back again.

We loved this place. Their prices are extremely reasonable and they have a great happy hour! They have a large selection of seating inside and outside with TVs for watching sporting events. I ordered a flight of beer and enjoyed each of my selections. Our table ordered many appetizers and enjoyed all of them. We also had great service.

Just ordered delivery from this place and I wasn't impressed.  I got the white meat chicken tenders, the chicken was satisfyingly crispy, but it was not hot on delivery.  Also, the sauces were not great (Buffalo Bleu, XXX Hot, and Parm. Pesto).  The Pesto was the best of the lot, but I have a problem paying .50 per sauce (none are included in the 8+ dollars you spend on the chicken).  Not mention, the sauces weren't even full, the Pesto was only half full.  All and all, it was decent chicken, but the value isn't there and there are a myriad of other delivery places in the area that deliver a better product.

Don't expect much. Saw an ad for $7.99 dinner buffet at the hotel next door, and went here for dinner with my family because it was the closest dining option. The Kettle chain was founded in 1968, and this location looked like it hadn't been renovated since it opened. If I could describe it in one sentence, it would probably be: "Luby's after it's been on meth for a year." It's pretty sad looking. As for the dinner buffet, you are better off going to Wack Arnold's. 

For starters, there was a very meager selection of food. Mystery meatloaf, baked chicken, sausage and bell peppers, or spaghetti casserole. There was a very sad looking "salad bar," which is basically a giant bowl of iceberg lettuce, with old looking cherry tomatoes and dressings which look like they had been sitting there for a week. There were two employees working, and both of them had brought their children to work. As a result, no one came by to ask us if our drinks needed to be refilled or if we wanted our check. 

When we were ready to leave, we stood around waiting to pay for about 5 minutes. Also the advertised buffet price on the flyer is out of date; it is now $8.49 a person. The waitress started berating the manager when we pointed that out to her. Seems like a change in management is sorely needed. 

Bottom line: Unless your only other dining option is eating a body part, I would stay far away.

Such a wonderful oasis in a busy metropolitan area. I breathe a sigh of relief from the moment I enter the lobby. High security for my safety and excellent post-COVID procedures in place. I love children...who belong to other parents, lol. The adult environment here is a nice change to the family hotels where children run and yell through the hallways on their way to and from the pool.  There are children here but since it is an adult-oriented hotel, they are much better behaved. The bed is extremely comfy as is my room with a sweeping view of Tampa Bay.  I sat for hours in my ringside chair watching the lightning from the afternoon summer storms over the bay. It was fascinating to experience. I highly recommend this upscale sophisticated adult environment. The hotel is very beautiful and the breakfast has also been first rate. The staff excels at customer service. There is a wonderful pool, surrounded by beautiful palm trees and lush tropical plants for privacy, so good for families too.

I was expecting a more artisanal style of fair.  Tucson boast some amazing foodie establishments. This fell a little short.  I tried a sandwich and a baked good; and it felt just average. Service was a bit slow and the inside felt cramped.  I would give this 3 stars in any other town.

Just visited this place on a Friday afternoon and was pleasantly surprised with the amount of space in the cafe. There's a parkade so you don't have to worry about parking, and the inside is quite spacious - if anything, I think they could definitely fit more tables and chairs in. 

We ordered the breakfast sandwiches - the good morning and the veggie one. We also ordered the breakfast bowl on the side, as I found the portions on the smaller side. 

I think the buns for the sandwiches here totally make the sandwich - they taste super fresh and have a hint of sweetness to them. They came regular on the good morning, and pressed on the veggie sandwich - so good both ways. I really enjoyed the egg on the good morning as they were fluffy and light, and the veggie one was great with the hummus. 

The bowl was good as well, with the egg cooked perfectly. I don't think I would've been full if I only had the bowl, so I'm glad I got a sandwich of my own and shared the bowl. 

Overall, I would recommend this place for a cute light brunch visit with a clean, quiet environment. Can't wait to return for more of those buns soon!

I have been to Harry's many time over several years.  3 couples went for a Saturday dinner.  Most of them were ok with their meals, not thrilled.  Myself, very disappointed.  Snapper soup, watery, flavorless and a very small portion in a wide bowl that made it cool quickly.  Never again.  My selection off the very limited menu was a fettuccini and shrimp dish.  Pasty, globbed together pasta in a decent sauce with very large and flavorful shrimp.  Had it been less mushy it would have been good.  Others at the table shared lobster mashed and garic mashed potatoes.  Both were very lacking in fthe flavor you would expect.   Overall a so-so experience for a costly meal. Service was excellent, I must say.

Yes I am a fan of the food and the staff at DJ's, but what drives me crazy every time I go there is that I have to reapeat my order at least 3 times.  Once to the person who initially takes it, once to the second person on the hot dog line who then repeats it to the cook again, and then at least once to who ever is working the register.  Why they don't have you order and pay at the register and then work your way back to the front door is beyond me.  The cashier could staple a reciept with your order to the bag and then tell you what your number is, kind of like that other hot dog/italian beef place in Chicago that does pretty well, Portillo's.
Like I said, the food and the staff are both great, and that's why I'm awarding them 4 stars, but if DJ's can't become more efficient, then I'm knocking them back to 3.

We came for the Sunday jazz brunch, and it was OK. The physical restaurant is quite nice and the tables are well set. But the food was uneven and the service indifferent (cold potatoes, forgotten coffee order). Also, don't expect much jazz. The band started 30 min after we sat down and played in our room for about 15 minutes before moving on to another part of this large, multi-room restaurant. Overall, a bit of a tourist trap. Best part of our meal: the Drum fish which is part of their "classic" brunch.

I attended a shower at Barone's Tuscan Grill. The room was beautiful but the service was terrible. They had too many people crammed into a small room. I asked for a soft drink and it was never served. I asked the people sitting next to me if they even served soda. Apparently, you have to serve yourself. My Chicken Marsala was served last and I barely had any mashed potatoes on my plate. The last straw for me was seeing the Mother of the Bride serving coffee to her guests. What kind of place does that? I won't be recommending Barone's to any of my friends or family.

Suggestion for management 
Clear signage should be displayed outside stating your policies. The staff out front who check I.D. Can tell folks as well. If there had been any notice that no sitting at the bar and playing video poker after 9:30 pm was allowed, we would not have entered. We specifically asked our last bartender downstairs where we had been drinking and playing video games where we could go to continue to do so but get some nachos. He suggested we visit you.

One of the best breakfasts I have ever had at a restaurant. Reminds me of Root Down in Denver... Service was outstanding, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality of food that you get. House-made sausage is delicious. I had biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs and crispy potatoes, with sausage. Coffee was delicious. In short, you won't be disappointed.

This place is delicious! The food is different without a pretentious flare of being different. They used to have one of the best chicken tacos in town and took it off the menu. Wtf? That was one of our main reasons for, well every return visit, after our first experience! Come on Americanos we need that taco!
The bartenders are awesome!

A tour guide (Paige) recommended this place and she hit it spot on!  We had the sliders, bacon ranch waffle fries, house salad and topped it off with a jelly donut.  Oh.my.  

The wait to order was short, the wait for the food (they call your name) was average, but so well worth it!  

The sliders - try the chicken!  It's friend chicken, a little spicy slaw and the softest bun!  I don't usually eat chicken, but I had to try a bite... and then another!  Amazing flavors that meld into yummy goodness!  

The bacon ranch waffle fries - bacon was crispy, the pickled jalapeños are so good, the cheese sauce with the ranch - wow!  We couldn't stop even though we were full! 

The house salad is well-portioned and full of almonds!  The house ranch makes this salad!  

The jelly donut - the jelly tasted like fresh strawberries!  The donut is very dense and thick and more cake-like.  Delicious!  

Our family of three ordered the slider 3-pack, waffles fries, salad and one donut and between us we didn't even finish it all - after a a day of site seeing!  Plenty of food for us!  

Need an adult beverage with your burger/sliders?  The "brew" here is coffee.  But we were told "go next door and buy a beer.  We are BYOB."

Good food once you get it. Plan on a long, long wait. 20 minutes for one appetizer. We ordered 4 appetizers and they came out 10 minutes apart. Sunday afternoon in the bar a few couples, not busy at all, yet have to wait for everything. Don't order the Southern Fried chicken, not worth $17.99! Two thin slices of chicken breast with tasteless batter! And tasteless mashed potatoes. No apologies from anyone, no manager ever asked how anything was.
Love Frida's but perhaps they have more business than they can handle. Ordered takeout for 12, arrived at 12:20 and it wasn't ready. Hmmmm don't be in a rush if you order from Frida's..

People have been talking about this place's burger and so I decided to give it a try with a my gf and a few friends. I was definitely NOT  impressed by any means, the service was ridiculously slow and they weren't even that busy! In fact, the table next to us complained that they hadn't gotten their food and had been sitting there for quite a while. We were ready for the check and the server hadn't come around to check on us in about 30 minutes! I will never go back to this place due to their lack of service and the food wasn't that great to top it off; I much rather go to a place where I know I will get great service and a great meal. SB has amazing restaurants and this definitely isn't one of them.

This cafe was so warm and welcoming it felt like a shelter from all of the flooding madness of the world.

Or course, all of the roads were flooded, and I had already spent three hours trying to get from East Norriton to University City, so that may have contributed to the feeling.

Stopping in at the Cafe at the Mills totally turned my morning around.  After hours in the car in bumper to bumper traffic we walked into a small, friendly cafe in the Sherman Mills complex near the Ballet and Ground Zero.   

We were welcomed with genuine warmth and were thrilled to see a variety of breakfast and lunch choices, with many vegan options.
The menu included vegan sausage and bacon, bagel sandwiches, a hummus and avocado sandwich, and a variety of vegan pastries.

I went for vegetarian chicken-salad on whole wheat bread.  The sandwich was hearty and well-seasoned, with fresh lettuce and tomato, and came with a side of veggie-chips.

We setup our laptops and enjoyed our traffic-induced brunch.  Far from being disturbed by a couple of laptops taking up one of his four tables, the proprietor brought us two delicious vegan scones to try on the house.  The scones were made with cashew butter and raisins, and were  ludicrously moist and tasty.

I definitely plan to return to the Cafe at the Mills without further diluvian prompting, and I'd recommend you give it a try as well.  

Really nice people, with yummy food.
I tore myself away from my favorite Bento Box to find another new favorite: Chicken Curry on Brown Rice. Made with a perfectly balanced blend of spices.  A meal in a bowl.

Quaker Steak is nothing special, but has an interesting "car" theme that adds some fun.  The food is typical bar food, including chicken wings, burgers, fries, etc.  Chances are good you will find something you will like and be happy with it.

Quaker Steak often has live music, car show, bike shows and the like  -- it's an interesting place that hosts some fun events.

Very nice!  Awesome beer.  Good menu.  Cool atmosphere.  I don't even know if I can complain about this, but our food came out so fast we didn't have a chance to finish our apps!  I would recommend asking for a flight :)
It's literally the best decision you'll make all day.

The sandwiches are great and the sauce is on the sweet and tangy side. The brisket is great but a touch fatty for my taste. The margs and beers are great and the location has a outdoor patio in a cool part of town.
Kind of sad. I loved this place but the food has taken a turn. It is still a cool place and great for wine, just beware if you were craving the fig jam and prosciutto that it is not the same.

We have lived in this area since 1998 and have never eaten here.  We were going to try a new Italian restaurant in the same shopping center as Joe's, but they decided to be closed so we thought we'd give Joe's a try.

We were amazed at the selections on the menu but since we weren't dying of hunger we stayed away from the steam pot entrees and decided to order the Crabcake Dinner, a Pasta-Laya, and a calamari appetizer.  Other reviews call this place pricey and I would agree with that.  I would also advise not ordering anything on the menu that is not crab or lobster in a pot because this location is very good at producing those items.
  
The calamari was hot and crispy but it is served with a marinara sauce.  We asked for and got some cocktail sauce which seemed to complement it better.

The Pasta-Laya was a very large entree.  The sausage and shrimp were very well-seasoned and flavorful but it just didn't have much "jambalaya-ness" to it.

The Crabcake Dinner was a major disappointment.  The skin-in fries were excellent.  The creamy cole slaw was the restaurant-standard stuff.  It was good and NOT watery.  The crabcakes were a disaster.  Having eaten crabcakes in a lot of restaurants, these were not crabcakes in the traditional sense.  It was more like crab stuffing you would put in a Thanksgiving turkey but in no way were they cakes. The very nice manager said this was supposed to be 75% crab, but the entree was a medium brown color from the bread crumbs and peppers and very little white crab meat was apparent.  I wanted to try these to get an idea of how their crab tasted but without much crab present, it was impossible to tell.

The manager comped the crabcakes and gave us a coupon for a free appetizer on our next visit.  We told her that wasn't necessary since I had eaten half of it, but she insisted.

As we left, we noticed that there was a condensation leak from the air duct directly above our table.  The drops were splashing us.

We may give Joe's one more try.

Small business serving great food!  They are always busy but can get your food to you pretty fast. They have some dining tables but we have usually gotten our food to go.  Delicious and reasonable priced.

Awesome brunch spot! Got the chicken and waffles and it was the best I've had in a while. Also had some delicious iced coffee that they serve in a chilled metal cup. Very tasty and refreshing. Ambience of the restaurant was chill and the service was pretty fast. Highly recommend
It waa close to the ROW and had good beer and food.  There were 4 of us and we were seated immediately which hadn't been the case in any if the restaurants we visited that weekend.

Dilly bars and Buster Bars were freezer burned on two occasions.   These are the boxed treats you get from their freezer to enjoy at home.  The Manager offered to replace on next visit when I called to let them know.  We never got back to get them replaced.  

Soft serve ice cream there is hit or miss.  Sometimes it's real creamy and among the best soft serve out there.  Other times it's grainy and taste is weird.   They often have kids working there that could care less and don't pay attention.  They either give you something other than you asked for or they give a small portion.   Sometimes I swear a small and medium look the same.  When you are paying top dollar for an ice cream of your choice, it should be to your liking and expectations.   

We actually avoid going here now.  It's a shame, but the management just doesn't  seem to keep an eye on the product served and the customer service.   This is not a place we can rely on for consistent, quality product and service.  Bummer!

We tried Brunchies for the 1st time today and will definitely be back! Our server, Danielle, was great. My husband got a Mexican omelet meal with delicious rice & beans and I got the pancakes w/choc chips, bananas, & walnuts with a side of crispy bacon. We were both torn on what to order because the menu is full of so many yummy options.
Only good thing is the pre-mixed frozen drinks.  Food is blah, but looking down on 7th can be entertaining...

There was a lot of hype leading up to my meal at the new Jose Garces hotspot, and man-oh-man, it did not disappoint! Great location next to the river, and although I didn't sit outside, there appeared to be a fantastic outdoor seating section with a modern and stylish atmosphere. We tried everything from pizza to eggs. Each entree was more delicious than the last! Definitely worth checking out if you're in the neighborhood. Another menu and restaurant that the Garces Group knocked out of the park!
Great shrimp and grits and good service. This hidden cafe in the middle of the FQ is a nice getaway from the chaos. Food is definitely reasonably priced and the quality is good.

The music was good but the food was NOT good and there were fruit fly/gnat things flying all near our food. So gross! Our waitress was very unfriendly. We hardly ever write bad reviews but it was just such an unpleasant experience. We won't come back here

Ordered delivery from our hotel room.  75 minutes for delivery from 5 miles away.  The pizza was not warm when it arrived.  

Thin style crust.  It looked greasy (aka New York Style).  Lots of bacon.  14 and 18" have 8 slices.

The highlight was the Garlic Knots.  Every pizza chain should offer these.  They make breadsticks cower in shame.

I as told it was a good place BUT we found that it wasn't so great. We were seated quickly and water was quick to the table. Our order came out quick but was completely wrong. The waiter was not attentive to our needs and our food became cold before he could fix the order. They expected us to eat cold food and made no attempt to make it right. I won't come here again. Poor service.  Poor food.

I don't know any other place where you can buy mac & cheese at 7am on a Saturday morning. Hellooooo hangover cure! 

I'm always a fan of Paneras that have a drive through window--even though it encourages me to be lazy. This Panera was like any other...good bread, good food, and good service. The mac & cheese isn't mind blowing, but it's still pretty good if you salt and pepper it to taste. Panera is known for baking their bread fresh every morning. So if you want to get something really awesome, go for a bagel or sandwich.

Loved this place!! Great food, good service. The quality of seafood was exceptionally good considering we live in Indiana. From LA, I know what good crawfish is supposed to be. I also know how hard it is to get good crawfish in Indy- outside of have it flown in during crawfish season. Which is in February. Not July. We had raw oysters to start with. Great. Then got the bag loaded with red baby potatoes, corn, spicy sausage, shrimp and crawfish! Really really good. We will be going back. Soon.
This is by far my favorite place in Tucson. The food is old school Louisiana grub and the atmosphere guys right along with it. Pricey but totally worth it

Absolutely horrible service. Got off my overnight shift hoping for a burger and stood 5 min (only one there) and no one came to the window so I went to the second one and no one came to me after 5 minutes so I backed up to the first window wondering just in case and no one came to that one either. All I heard at each window was the girls having drama between them and yelling. Pulled out and went home.

I have to say this place surprised me I might've judged the book by its cover it is next to a strip club. But the first time we went was January 1 for dinner which was really good and then we came again on football Sunday when the Buca were playing and we still got great service and great food. 
I think my absolute favorite thing here is their chili it's amazing and it's got a nice heat to it. They also have a burger on a croissant with egg that's just delicious. We tried a bunch of stuff because they were four of us we've had their chicken and chicken biscuits everything we had was good the only thing that I didn't like that we got was there shrimp and grits kind of plain. 
Their service was definitely five star and the prices are reasonable we will definitely be back.

Franklin's is a neat place that has plenty of tv's, some room to cut a rug and two bars serving up the drinks.  This used to be a local watering hole for us but since we moved to the burbs we feel a nostalgic pull if we ever find our way to East Falls.  They have good drink specials and the prices are good so long as you're drinking what is on special if you catch my drift.  Food is fairly standard, cool outside deck area too bad smokers make it unbearable to breathe.  Be sure to pay attention to the 1 way streets because you can drive for 5 minutes and be close to Franklins but never get to the parking lot.
This place is nice. I don't know why they have such low stars. This is the only place that I've gone to that always have there fries hot Everytime

Came here after fishing with my brother. The bagels are definitely good but maybe we came too late in the day. They definitely tasted like they've been sitting out a while. I'll definitely ask for less cream cheese next time. It was probably half an inch thick of cream cheese - a bit too much for me!

Sat at the bar with a friend. No complaints about the service. Everyone working there was friendly and efficient. I got the fish tacos and my friend got a burger. We also ordered a side of guacamole and chips. My main criticism is of the food. Everything was just bland, bland and bland. It's not that anything was really bad, it just lacked flavor. Maybe we're just spoiled by other good restaurants in Santa Barbara. It's probably a fun place for kids but we will not be going back.
Has the collar greens and it was canned goods! Which is unacceptable in a black owned business!!!

I am a HUGE fan. Their beers are great. They also have a large selection of ciders and seltzers, which is super nice considering it is mainly a beer place. Their flights are a little pricey, but the waiters have great recommendations based on your palate. The food is also delicious. They have a PB & J burger that is out of this world!!!! I highly recommend it. The wings are also wonderful.

Food was good, but I think a bit overhyped. Not really worth the wait, as the food was not AMAZING. The service was good, Meg was awesome. But the chicken and waffles was a bit disappointing. The grilled chicken bowl was the best thing we got.

Went in on a Wednesday at 6:45 - had checked Opentable on the way over and there was plenty of availability for our party of 3, so didn't feel the need to make a reservation. Walked in and the three hostesses seemed bemused when we asked if they had a table for 3 - very unpleasantly told us the wait would be 45-60 minutes. Very surprising given that there was abundant Opentable availability. Left and went to Winnie's instead. Parking was also difficult. Overall probably would not return, hostesses were quite unfriendly and made us feel unwelcome. I've hosted for four years and it's really not that hard to smile or say something remotely pleasant.
Amazing! Food, drinks, service, view! All of it was perfect. Highly recommend and will be back again!

Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant! Had a reservation and was 15 mins early and was seated right away! Server came almost instantly and took our order for our drinks, also did the oil and cheese for us and told us about all the new items on the menu. He obviously was very passionate and knew what he was talking about.  I was given another drink before I was done with the other one, which you never see at any restaurant. 
      We started with the Calamari which is the best that I've ever had. It was crisp on outside and soft on inside and not heavily breaded. Came with their homemade marinara which is the bomb.
    For dinner I ordered the Veal Parmesan for the first time there and for the price was definitely worth it.  Expensive, but portion size was huge. The breading was not too heavy, and the veal was very tender. Also came with a side of pasta which is always amazing.
    For dessert, since it was my birthday they brought out Vera's Lemon cookies with candles, the cookies were delicious.  I also ordered the Créeme Brûlée which was phenomenal! Very light and so delicious, it was phenomenal.
     Overall I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants an amazing Italian dinner.

Delicious food with every visit. Unique foods and plenty of appetizers. Be sure to grab a koagie (Korean hoagie with loads of BBQ and a sweet sauce). It's best to eat here during lunch time, it's a nice quiet environment, perfect for chowing down. The waiters are incredibly friendly and thoughtful. But if you are hungry and it's late night also go here they're open incredibly late. It's the best place to be to grab a beer and awesome wings. It's a win, win.

Eat-A-Pita is consistent.  Open until 3 am every single of the week.  When you think of pita, don't think of a tiny flatbread...think big - like Chipotle tortilla with an extra pocket.

Pay $6.99 or so plus tax and state what kind of meat you want (gyro, chicken, deli meat, etc).  Then, while your meat is on the grill, state which toppings you want - and don't miss out on any.  

Spring mix, romaine, spinach, avocado, iceberg, tomatoes, olives, cucumbers, green peppers, jalapenos, onions, cheddar cheese, feta cheese, siced cheese, mushrooms, cranberries, etc.  

Then, you get the sauces on there - hummus, balsamic, hot sauce, salad dressing, Tzatiki sauce!  After that whole salad in a pita thing, the chicken is folded in on top.

So you can read that you will not go hungry.  This place is great.  Plus, one late night, I was walking with some friends and had to go to the bathroom.  Like, right now.  Eat-A-Pita was really nice about letting me run in to use their bathroom.

Just want to say how amazed I was when I arrived at this restaurant and the door was opened for me. Also I was ready to be a big critic and pick at everything but truthfully saying from the beginning it was all good! The manager, Emellio Anderson was the most courteous person from start to finish! He promised that the steak would be great and it was better than great! Thank you Emellio for the best steak house staff in Tucson! My steak melted in my mouth! And the service was right-on! Portions are great value! Thanks & I will be back!

Been coming here for years (even when they had a location out in Chesterfield), particularly before games.  Nice atmosphere although could use some cleaning.  The Caesar salad is the best anywhere!  Classic old bar atmosphere.

While on spring vacation we discover this place. Decided to stay there since we didn't wanted to walk any more, we where so happy we did we tried pizza,calzone,garlic cheese bread.everything was excellent including service we decided we would be back before we go back home.

I've been wanting to come here for a long time, so finally had time to bring my family of 4 in for dinner. Came in around 8:30pm and it wasn't real busy and was a great atmosphere. Placed our drink and appetizers orders. It took a long while for the appetizers. Ordered the loaded tots and pot stickers. So when they finally came out, the tots were not hot, barely warm.
