Tasted good for being "barely warm". At that time we put our dinner order in and I ordered a second drink. 3 P.J. burgers and I ordered the Steak. After sitting and waiting a very long time again, our dinner finally game out. The family ordered the burgers and said they were good. I got the steak. The steak was good although over cooked as I ordered it medium rare. My mashed potatoes were room temperature and hard to eat. So as I'm almost finished my steak, the waitress finally brought my draft beer (which I forgot I already ordered a long time ago) which wasn't that cold. As we are finishing our meal, the waitress never cleaned up our appetizers plates and our table was overflowing with dishes. So I picked up the finished dishes and put them on a table next to ours. At this time the place is empty and the waitress was busy talking to someone at the bar. When she finally came back and cleaned up some of the dishes, we ordered desert, Molton Chocolate Cake thinking it wouldn't take long. I should have known better. We sat and sat waiting. I observed the waitress who was at the bar talking, so I went over to cancel the desert because it was almost 10:30pm already. She saw me and quickly dashed into the back. So I went back to sit down. After about 5 minutes she brings out the desert which was good and warm. I made sure to get my check right away because I was so frustrated with the service. After spending $100 for dinner with the family, we all agreed that we would not come back because of the service. It's a shame because the food we ordered was good. It shouldn't take over 2 hours for a meal on a Wednesday night when the place isn't even busy.

In town visiting a friend, and she suggested this spot! And I am forever grateful!! "The Hen" was highly recommended and I see why. GET IT. I ordered extra sauce, but wasn't needed. One cup lasted the entire meal, and I'm a heavy dipper. I should've gotten the red sauce as my second sauce for some variety. I'll probably pay Sauce on the Side another visit before leaving town.

I have been dining at Mr. B's for the past 12 years, and try to get there whenever I am in New Orleans. A bit more elegant than the Brennan owned Bourbon House, Mr. B's is decorated with warm dark woods and comes equipped with a small bar area which is where my party and I ate. It has become a little bit of a tradition for us to come to Mr. B's to chill out, pig out and have a few drinks. 

Gary and Rich were our bartenders and they set us up at the bar with some Abita beers, bloody Mary's (a crowd pleaser), and easy conversation.  Now, on to the food. For starters I had a bowl of their Gumbo Ya Ya which comes with chicken and andoullie sausage. The flavoring is delicious. My only complaint is that I wish there was a bit more rice served with it, but that is personal preference. My friend had a special oyster and pea soup, which he enjoyed but noted it was lacking the oyster flavor he was hoping for. My other friend had a greens salad, which he seemed to enjoy. Moving on, for my lunch entree, I had the shrimp and grits. The shrimp was wrapped in bacon and they were salty, plump and juicy. They were very tasty. The surprising star on the plate, however were the grits. They were insanely good. I could just eat a plate of them and be perfectly happy. The consistency and buttery taste was absolutely heavenly. I had to defend my plate from my friends attempts at stealing them. Likewise, my friends BBQ shrimp was also fantastic. Rich sauce and plump shrimp are well worth the effort in peeling them open. I swear I thought my friend was going to chomp down on his plate he enjoyed the sauce so much---buttery, spicy, perfection. My other friend had a petit fillet that was wonderfully prepared accompanied by some eggs which I did not try. For dessert we split an addicting bread pudding that was sweet with cinnamon and raisins and soppy yet firm. Man it was good. I also had a special coffee called a "Bob" which had Kahlua in it and it really hit the spot. 

It should be mentioned while we were eating at the bar there were a lot of people enjoying the Sunday Jazz brunch that was being held at the time were were there. Having some live Jazz music while eating such good food, enjoying some delicious drinks and watching some sports is a real treat, especially because the Jazz trio that was playing was quite good. As usual, Mr. B's just always delivers for me and I plan to return as soon as I am back in New Orleans.

I created a Yelp account specifically so I could write this review because I was just so disappointed in Buena Onda. I ordered nachos expecting, well, nachos, and what I got was a plate of greasy tortilla chips with dried cheese crusted all over them. That's it. I was really excited to try a new place, but I immediately regretted my decision. Basically, I paid $5 for a plate of inedible chips (it was the children's size), and sure enough I couldn't even eat them. They didn't even come with salsa to temper the dried bits of what looked like Kraft singles that were, at one point, microwaved on top. I knew having a reliable taco place in Fairmount was too good to be true.

I'm adding this to my list of reviews only because I've been here and yes, this is the original Hooters.  Big effing deal.  The tables ares still dingy and greasy, the wings are still steroid induced and veiny.  I generally stick to the grilled cheese and the curly fries when I come here and that was good, as usual.  

As a chic saying this, the girls are little prettier than Connecticut, but I guess that's to be expected considering where I am.  

So, one star for being the original, and one more for the grilled cheesy goodness.

I was at the convention center and decided to head over to Reading Terminal market for lunch.  I decided to try By George and got the eggplant parmesan and garlic bread.  The eggplant was very good and cheesy with a nice sauce.  The garlic bread was dry and I could only have 2 bites before I gave up.

Love this place. We usually get the same thing bc it's so good. The ground pork app (Prah Hok Kateeh) frog legs (Nkahp-Ch'in) and most favorite pork with pumpkin (Cha La Pauh with pork). Small little place but big dishes and flavor.
Delicious duck wings... and wings for that matter. Wide selection of beer options, friendly staff, food was solidly good the few times we visited while in town.

We started off with drinks (excellent bartender) and then had a salad with bread. The salad was really good and the bread  great also, could have made a meal out of just that. My wife & I split a 10 filet mignon, med. It was done perfectly & was melt in your mouth delicious.  Our waitress Justine (I believe) was awesome also, she was there when we needed her, attentive & super polite. This place has it together and knows what customer service is all about .  A BIG thumbs up to management for a fantastic meal and a great experience all around.  We will def. be back shortly with friends & family !!!

I should have read the reviews first! I wasted $20 on this place, by ordering two crepes that were disgusting. There were no other customers that should have been a hint, just two workers sitting in the booth talking stories. They were friendly, but the food was the worst crepes I have ever tasted, the person that was with me never had one before and said he'll never have one again. Here I was telling him how great they are, but not at this place. I don't understand how they stay in business.  The strawberries were sour, no powered surger as stated on the menu. Overkill on the chocolate it was like soup, making the crepe rubbery.

We've been on the lookout for a decent Thai place ever since moving here, and this place was alright. The pad see ew tasted sweeter than what I'm used to, but nonetheless, I wasn't too put off by it. I would say, however, that the flavors were a bit one dimensional due to the sweetness overpowering the other flavors. But I was pleasantly surprised by their spice levels and would say they go a bit spicier than most restaurants in DE. That said, the spicy levels of our food were perfect. I think 3.5/5 is a better number for my rating.
This is my favorite location I've been to! All of them have great calzones. Large portions and decently priced.

Went to here today for a quick lunch with my 5 year old. I had the basil fried rice with chicken which was really good. I ordered the chicken lo mein for her from the kids menu. Unfortunately she didn't like it which was surprising because she loves lo mein. I tried it and understood why she didn't like it.  The noodles were over cooked and slimy. I asked if we could swap her meal for the kids fried rice instead. The waitress said sure no problem and went back to the kitchen with the plate. A few mins later she returns with the noodles saying they can't comp the meal and that I would have to pay  for an additional kids meal. I told her no thanks and just ended up sharing my basil rice with my daughter. Poor customer service and for that reason I will never return. Too bad because I was looking forward to trying the hibachi.
They are so amazing here! Eric is the best! He is such a good bartender and an even better bar man!

Loved this place. The som tam was so good we got two. The broccoli was also excellent. The crab was great though I found the batter a tad salty (also true of the shrimp). But oddly enough the other standout (apart from the som tam) was the cake - an heirloom cornmeal strawberry cake with a yogurt gelato which was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. Go, go, go.

I've been wanting to go here, but I've been resisting for some reason.  I had a BOGO coupon so I figured what the heck.  Well, I love it!  The pizzas are made fresh in front of you, and with the exception of the cheese and one-topping, they are all one price.  

When you walk in you get to choose your pizza type, and if you build your own you get to advance to the toppings station which is mind blowing!  Tons of amazing, fresh meat and veggie toppings for every taste.  If i have lots of veggies available, I don't even need meat, and trust me, there are plenty to choose from!  You can also pick your sauce, and I recommend the spicy red sauce.  VERY spicy, but super flavorful and satisfying.  

Once built the pizzas are slung into a fire oven and they come out AMAZING AND HOT!  So crispy and perfectly cooked from crust to center.  They have lots of salads, and some desserts near the checkout to go with your pizza, and I assume they are personal sized (oh boy that's embarrassing if they're not), but they have boxes out for leftovers.  

I went on Friday after work, and it was dead...I was the only customer there, but I bet they are slammed at lunch.  I can easily see this becoming a once-a-week staple for me.

So this is the second time we have eaten here in Nashville. My son's 18th Birthday Party. They did a great job allowing us to bring in a large birthday cake and serving it to use. The salad bar is huge!!!!! The assortment is amazing. The different meats are individually seasoned and all have different flavors. It is $100 for 3 people, but worth every penny! We will be back! If you don't get full, it's your own fault!

Great place to get St. Louis style BBQ, came here for dinner and ordered  1/2 rack rib combo with two sides (jambalaya and mac and cheese) and a soda. I was stuffed afterwards and I have never had such good ribs. So much that I brought a full rack home to Michigan. It is also cool they have their own brand soda as well.

I was really excited for this location of Le Buzz to open because it was so close to me. The ambience is nice and it's light and bright with an outdoor patio.

I've gotten the Taos sandwich (chicken with pepperjack, arugula, and aioli on focaccia) twice now and haven't been disappointed - everything well cooked and seasoned. My husband has really enjoyed their LA sandwich (chicken, bacon, provolone). 

I recommend their honey lavender latte which I've had both hot and iced - it's exactly what it sounds like and very tasty. 

I am knocking off one star because their service can be a little hit or miss, and that could be because this is a new location but I've had similar experiences at the Tanque Verde location. Mistakes have been made on orders a couple of times now and I've heard the same experience from friends. But overall, not bad enough to stop me from coming back!

Hands down our favorite breakfast joint. The atmosphere is awesome and the servers are always friendly and helpful. Very popular place so expect to wait a little while depending on when you go. We went at 830am last Sunday and had a wait! Very much well worth the wait

I visited for the first time last night (May 18 2019) with my parents. The appetizers were excellent (Verne's hot sauce is a new favorite of mine), and the only issues with the entrees were that the sandwiches my parents ordered (roast pork and meatball Parmesan) were served on sliced bread rather than long rolls. I had no issue with my chicken Marsala, and I appreciate the attention to my request for no mushrooms.

I'd definitely return.

Really good food!! So I was going to order the veggie omelet with potatoes and toast. The chef must have read my mind and brought out the veggie omelet for free. Delicious!! So I ordered potatoes and a waffle, both were good even though I needed the potatoes to be fried hard, they did and they were great. My SO ordered the bananas foster French toast and is still trying to duplicate the taste,  to no avail. Guess we have to go back!

My friends and I were going to go to Biscuit Love, but decided we wanted a more diverse menu. Every one of us enjoyed our meals, from Biscuits, Juices, Smoothies, Bowls, etc. Great atmosphere and decent prices. Happy that we went here over going to Biscuit Love.

The beers and cocktails were awesome. 15 minute wait on a Saturday is not bad at all but was able to sit at the bar and have a beer while we waited. 

Had the Steak Philly sandwich and was really good. Service was very good. Definitely be recommending to friends

From CA. stopped by The Outlets at Sparks. Food here was awesome. We ordered bruschetta trio, calzones, and pizza. Servings are big. I order personal calzone and only had two slices. Serve IPA beer.  If I'm ever in Reno, I would definitely stop by!  
Ps server was friendly! Very patient with us (we didn't know what to get).

Good food and good atmosphere.  Beer on tap selection was very good.  I guess I went in with a very high expectation for this, obviously.  My buddy and I had the burgers which were good.  It was pretty quiet for a Monday night as expected.  I'd go check out again to try  more of the menu.

I haven't written a review on Yelp for more than a year because if a place has adequate chatter, my two-cents aren't really going to matter. However, I was impressed enough by La Indita to contribute my thoughts.
We were clued into this place by a purple-haired cashier at the Whole Foods on Speedway. I wasn't exactly going to take his recommendation, but then we stumbled across it while visiting the annual 4th Avenue Street Fair. 
My husband is really into mole, but since each mole is unique he asked for a taste first. He was obliged with a generous small bowl of it (and decided he liked it enough to order). I got a combination plate with chile relleno, potato taco, and a spinach and pecan enchilada. I normally can't resist chile relleno, but I LOVED the spinach and pecan enchilada which was like nothing I've ever eaten before. I am positive the spinach used was fresh, not frozen, because it had just the teensiest bit of grit in it. We liked La Indita enough that we dined there twice during a five-day stay in Tucson. That's saying a lot. If you order the daily specials, it is a tremendous bargain. 
La Indita was started by a woman from Michoacan who is still working even though she is well into her 80s. One of our granddaughters was our waitress and we enjoyed talking with her and learning about their family business. As is my custom, I asked about their culinary philosophy. I know that, among other things, they make their tortillas from scratch.
I would have liked more time to work my way through more of the menu!

Came here because the pictures of the deep dish pizza look pretty good. The lettuce in the Caesar salad was old and kind of soggy. The anchovies on the Caesar salad weren't that fresh. The deep dish pizza I got was cold. Undercooked. Real disappointment I won't be back.

This place was awesome! We had the Big Easy
Breakfast and it was scrumptious!! A great find! Quaint and full of local flavor!

My family and I stopped for lunch. the staff was friendly and prompt with the drinks, but i feel that the entrees were slow coming out of the kitchen. 
I feel that my daughter got much better value in her kids steak tips than I with my roadhouse burger. 
My only real complaint is that all 3 of my families entrees tasted strongly of the natural gas that they were grilled with. The more that i think about it they do not deserve 4of 5 stars ,but i will not mark them down only because i have almost 20 years of good memories from their cool springs and hickory hollow locations. AHHH the good ole days... 
Oh well, can't go back to the past but i will go back to Logan's

Service is no good. I waited at the food line for a bit as employees walked back and forth. Finally the manager had to come and get my food. When I went to the register to pay, again I waited while the cashier leaned  against a wall and played on her phone. The manager again had to come up and ask her to help me. Food was good but bad service can ruin an experience. The managers need to get their employees Better trained.
Tompkins is a great date night restaurant.   Menu is a little eclectic which can be good if that's what you're looking for.  Quality of food and drinks is incredible.

This is still a really new place and they definitely have some kinks to work out with service and keeping the buffet stocked.  It was taking upwards of 20 minutes for items that had run out on the buffet to get restocked so certainly that is an area for improvement.  The service was also very inconsistent and it took quite a while to get a drink refill.  The food was very well spiced and at a generally higher level of spice than the other area Indian food restaurants in the area.  

Overall I enjoyed the food but for the moment I would advise to order off of the menu if you are in any kind of hurry.

I'm not sure why this place doesn't have more stars - it's such a great spot in Pitman. It is a little pricey for take out, however, I was thoroughly impressed with the amount of quality ingredients in my Pitmanite tacos and tortilla soup. The food was fresh and delicious - like something I'd whip up in my own kitchen rather than a take out joint. I appreciate the efforts and passion it takes to cook like this and I will be frequenting this restaurant often! Even though it wasn't the best Mexican I've ever had - it's definitely the better option in this county.

We was excited to try this place. Overall their milk teas are fine, sometimes they don't have stuff available but I get it and it is fine. But their food & customer service is a different story. We ordered two rice bowls and waited for thirty minutes. Nobody checked on us or said anything, not even eye contact. And when we finally got our food the rice was SOAKED in oil. Not edible at all. We asked to return the food and I can hear people yelling about this in the back kitchen. They refused to refund us and said " we don't have a manager/ owner". What can I say? I will not recommended this place at all.
I'm very picky when it comes to anything raw or new. This sushi place was really good and I tried the tuna as recommended. Great environment and friendly waiter

I have been dying to go to this place, since we moved to the area. What a disappointment, the food was ok but nothing special, especially for the price. The atmosphere was cold and sterile.  The service was great too bad the food and atmosphere were not as good as the service. Will not go back.
This place is amazing!!!  Food is FANTASTIC!   WIFI!  It has a wonderful ora about it!   The food is like nothing you can get anywhere else.  I'm a customer for LIFE!

This is the spot I always stop on my way back from Philly. Busy no matter the time which makes me feel better. Good food choices, relaxing and clean. This last time ran into some Frat and ended up talking for over a hour. What other rest stop allows you to do that?

I've been comparing all of Indy's sushi restaurants to my favorite, Naked Tchopstix in Broad Ripple (see my review) for many years now. This is the first one that has surpassed it on several levels.

Sakura's sushi is fresh. VERY fresh. Much more fresh than any of the other sushi restaurants I've been to, both in Indiana and outside the state. The miso soup is the best I've had.

It is also VERY reasonably priced. My (ex) husband and I got saki, wine, miso soup, edamame and a spread of sushi for $50, whereas the same meal at Naked Tchopstix would have been at least $70.

The restaurant and the kitchen (we peeked) are also clean. Big thumbs up for that.

The waitresses - actually, the entire staff - are efficient and friendly. I don't know what it is about the places I frequent, but oftentimes the staff is rude or dismissive. Not the case here at all! 

The bad news:

The ambiance in Sakura leaves a little to be desired. It's a little cramped, a lot wooden and everything just looks like it's in need of an update. The autographs that line the walls are fun to check out, though.

There isn't a huge selection of creative rolls, which is one of my favorite things about NT. The ones Sakura has are very good, but not very innovative. Very small gripe. We'll definitely be back!

This restaurant is the quintessential nod to California Cuisine--serving everything from a wide variety of salads and pizzas to burgers, hot and cold sandwiches and pasta dishes. If you think your favorite ingredients belong on pizza, they probably can get there at California Pizza Kitchen. Some local favorite toppings include barbecued chicken and goat cheese. And by all means,don't forget to save room for dessert so you can sample their New York Style Cheese cake or sit pretty in front of a standard but scrumptious hot fudge sundae. 

No matter what your palette is craving in the pizza department, you can find it here. 

Some words of warning, though...substitutions on pre-made pizzas and some pre-prepared dishes as I remember from a few orders are a little more than their kitchen staff can handle, so if you order a menu item rather than create your own be fully prepared to like it as large scale changes may not be possible. 

And certainly be sure not to stuff yourself as full as any stuffed crust pizza that they might order, as you might consider taking in the carefully crafted, colorful decor that is such a dazzling surprise for their diners rather than a made dash to the dark caverns of their albeit clean and large public restroom.

Can't say I'd go back. I hold very high standards and today maybe only one was met. Our server, Leah, was very nice. Unfortunately that's where it ends. Our order was wrong/misunderstood and with that we waited more than 40 minutes for all of us to eat. The food was, you know, bar food.  I do have to say I find it hard to believe and disappointing that restaurants actually still serve kraft Mac & cheese. All in all I am quite surprised that after the wrong food came out and me sending something back that management never stop by. I was happy to pay for all of our food as we did eat it. Just a little acknowledgment would have been nice.

With all the competition from Indian and other cuisines I've thought for a while that the neighborhood Chinese Restaurants would have to up their games to thrive. Well this one has and then some.  They feature Thai, Chinese and Japanese food.  The Penang Curry I had was simply outstanding,  and the table next to us was raving about the sushi.

Come here and decide for yourself.  You will not be dissapointed.

This restaurant was really good. We came at a good time, we sat right down and the people behind us were told 30 mins. The food was fantastic. Got the Belgian fries as a starter then the Chimichanga for dinner. It was so much food I couldn't finish half of it. Our waitress was quick and attentive, we would definitely come back. The atmosphere is worth it too.

Had a Lovely experience here. I enjoyed almost everything that was served here. When we were seated by the hostess we were explained the table rule of once seated you have the table for an hour and thirty minutes. Which might have been relevant if we weren't the only people in the restaurant. The waitress was very helpful and informed us everything on the menu was tapas so we probably wanted two plates per person and then go from there. We ordered the blue cheese stuffed bacon wrapped dates and the pork belly, ...they were both decadent and delicious. We also ordered the lamb sliders they were good but not in any way unique for a lamb burger. We also had the fries with feta and gremolata...a little lack luster here due to the gremolata being just parsley....the music was nice and all of food was brought out when ready. The food was overall very impressive I had a lovely experience and definitely return.

Visiting here from Spokane and this was our first stop! Food was great and so were the drinks! The hostess Dani was such a sweetheart and gave us some great recommendations to do around town! Definitely would check this place out.

Steak was "ok". Had Wagyu steaks at $118 each. It's a different steak. Not worth it IMO. I like the typical steak.  Staff was ok but we had to wait 1 hour and 45 minutes for our food "because we had a very large table order". That was a LONG wait.  Initially when we got there, our reservation put us at a table with stools so we asked if we could have a booth instead.  There were 3-4 empty booths.  After waiting 10 minutes, the waitress came back and accommodated us but not before lecturing us about "if you wanted a booth, you should have requested a booth. Next time, when you make a reservation, request a booth"... Well, news flash, there won't be a next time.

Come for the food, come back because if the servers. My fiancé and I stopped in here when we were looking to move to Tampa. The server asked what brought us to town and we told her that we were moving here, she responded with the driest "why?!" I've ever heard. She the proceeded to spend the next two hours telling us about all the great things about Tampa, picking out which cocktails, appetizers and desserts we needed to try and making us laugh. Every time we've been back has been an equally enjoyable experience. The food is fantastic too.

Honestly, I don't have enough good things to say about this place. Poke Bowl shops can be a little confusing (how many proteins? how many toppings? etc). The staff here will walk you through the whole process with a smile. I've tried poke bowls with both the noodles and the rice, although I find the rice far superior for picking up the delicious sauce. There are a variety of proteins- including veggie and non-raw options and LOTS of toppings. If you get decision paralysis, they also have some pre-designed options to make life easier. There's a sushi burrito as well, if you're dying to try one of those. Honestly, this is one of the only fairly priced, healthy, fast, and GOOD options in St Pete right now.
Also, Dole Whip.

Cute place, nice staff, great pastries. It was my first name having a Napoleon (flaky with vanilla cream in the middle), and it was amazing. My standards for it are probably too high now. The seating areas are cute and comfortable. I got the 15% discount when I told the cashier I would write a Yelp review. My Napoleon and green tea ended up being $8ish total. Definitely recommend!

A+ for quality of drinks and food, service and ambiance. Their menu is expansive though I admittedly always get the same thing. Bacon, egg and cheese sandwich on a bagel is dynamite, best in the neighborhood. Iced americano is exceptional, also. Thank you for the kind service.

I love this place! The staff is always awesome and so laid back! They make it a great place to go if you want to be surrounded by good vibes! Another plus... they make the BEST Grateful Dead! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Tried this place out over the weekend and was really impressed. I had the King Brat (cheddar stuffed sausage wrapped in bacon- need I say more?) It was delicious and a good size. My fiancé got the pork platter and said everything was really good except he was expecting more food for the price ($16) The beers were good and there was a good selection. My only advice would be to note on the menu if the beers are only available during certain months! And also some things are a little pricey but all in all a great experience.

Tender smoked meats , long lines, difficulty getting seated. Unusual though tasty side dishes... mostly high fat options.... wished for some balance there... local sodas, neither Coke nor Pepsi products.

This is a great restaurant for good ole' southern cooking, their catfish and roast beef are out of this world! If you want to experience some real southern food I recommend the collard greens! But their mac & cheese and mashed potatoes are also delicious!  Just check the hours before you go!

My friends live next door to the Institute and that's really the only reason why we go here. We know the owner, the bartenders, the DJs, and the doorman so it's always comfortable and friendly. It's a very chill bar and whenever we go, we know that we will run into other friends or sit at one of the tables by the window and motion for other neighbors to come in and have a drink with us. It's a true locals bar and on nights when there's really nothing to do, we'll come here and  it's like having the whole bar to yourselves. The prices are right, the selection is good and they even have a whiskey bar upstairs which is also conveniently located next to the dance floor. Come out for Solid Good Times every Saturday!

Very tasty.  Definitely one of the best sandwich shops in the immediate West Chester area.  Some of the sandwiches are hit or miss but they make a solid pie and have good wings.  

What really surprised me though is how good the homemade soups are especially the chicken pot pie.  It might be a little on the salty side for some palates but there soups are surprisingly good and something you almost never find at a basic sandwich shop.   

The only thing that is lacking is some of the young girls on the phone tend to screw up what your are ordering.   Make sure they read back to you what you ordered for a pick-up or delivery order before you hang up.
